markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) NO REFERENCE MARKS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 0.1 MILE NORTHWEST OF THE INTERSECTION OF HIGHWAY 2 AND CALLE VIGO IN MAYAGUEZ AND ON THE ROOF OF THE DARLINGTON HOTEL.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DARLINGTON 1966, SET IN A HOLE CUT IN THE TAR AND GRAVEL ROOF, ABOUT 2 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE AND THE MARK AND HOLE COVERED WITH TAR.  A NAIL WAS PLACED DIRECTLY OVER THE STATION MARK TO MAKE THE SPOT EASIER TO FIND IN THE FUTURE.  IT IS 7.15 FEET EAST OF THE WEST CORNER OF THE ROOF, 5.7 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE NORTHWEST EDGE OF THE ROOF AND 4.5 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF THE ROOF.
markers.setting: SET IN A LARGE STRUCTURE WITH DEEP FOUNDATIONS
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY RLDA SURVEYING AND MAPPING 2010 (RLD) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 7.6 MI (12.2 KM) SOUTHWEST OF COLLORES, 7.2 MI (11.6 KM) NORTHWEST OF COROZAL, 6.1 MI (9.8 KM) SOUTHWEST OF UTUADO AND 1.7 MI (2.7 KM) NORTHWEST OF ADJUNTAS, PUERTO RICO.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF PR-135 AND PR-123 1.5 MI (2.4 KM) NORTHWEST OF ADJUNTAS, GO NORTH ON PR-123 FOR 0.3 MI (0.5 KM) TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  THE STATION IS 22.68 M (74.4 FT) SOUTH OF A WOOD POWER POLE, 7.76 M (25.5 FT) WEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF PR-123, 2.94 M (9.6 FT) SOUTHWEST OF THE NORTH END OF A METAL GUARD RAIL AND 0.34 M (1.1 FT) WEST OF THE METAL GUARD RAIL.
markers.setting: SET IN A RETAINING WALL OR CONCRETE LEDGE
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1923 (FTS) STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF LADRONE CAY, WHICH IS LOCATED IN WEATHER CHANNEL ABOUT 5 NAUTICAL MILES IN A NORTHWESTERLY DIRECTION FROM CULEBRITA LIGHTHOUSE.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK SET IN THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1, CREVICE OF A FLAT SOLID ROCK WAS COVERED WITH AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE WITH AN ARROW POINTED TO THE STATION IMPRINTED.  THIS MARK IS ABOUT 11.5 METERS W OF STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2, CREVICE OF FLAT SOLID ROCK COVERED WITH AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE WITH AN ARROW POINTED TO THE STATION IMPRINTED AND IS N OF THE STATION AND IN LINE WITH SHARK ROCK AND 28.2 METERS FROM STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1925)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) NOT RECOVERED.  ONLY REFERENCE MARK NO.2 WAS FOUND OF THE 1923 STATION.  THE LINE SHARK ROCK REFERENCE MARK NO.2, DOES NOT PASS THROUGH THE HIGHEST PART OF ISLAND, AS DESCRIBED IN 1923.
markers.setting: UNSPECIFIED SETTING

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) ONLY REFERENCE MARK NO.2 WAS RECOVERED FROM 1923 STATION (DAVY CAY 2).  DAVY CAY 3 IS 2.22 METERS S AND 1 FOOT LOWER THAN THE HIGHEST POINT ON THE CAY, WHICH IS REFERENCE MARK NO.1.  STATION IS 1/2-INCH BRASS ROD (1 INCH SHOWING) CEMENTED IN CRACK OF FIRM ROCK 20 BY 30 INCHES.  STATION IS ON RANGE WITH NW TANGENT OF CULEBRITA ISLAND AND MIDDLE OF SABA ISLAND (ST. THOMAS).  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS THE HIGHEST POINT ON THE OUTCROP OF ROCK ABOUT 2 FEET ON A SIDE.  HIGHEST POINT ON ISLET.  1 FOOT HIGHER THAN STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 (1925) IS A BRASS SCREW CEMENTED IN SMALL, FIRM ROCK, FOOT LOWER THAN STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JMC) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  STATION IS IN A SMALL CLEARING SURROUNDED BY THICK BRUSH AND CACTUS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) A THOROUGH SEARCH WAS MADE FOR THE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 BUT THEY WERE NOT RECOVERED.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 AND REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 (OLD) 1923 WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  DAVY CAY 4 WAS ESTABLISHED IN THE NEAR VICINITY.  SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1 MILE NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST COAST OF CULEBRA ISLAND AND ON THE NORTHWEST END OF A SMALL, BARE ISLAND KNOWN AS LADRONE OR BOTELLA CAY.  THE STATION MAY BE REACHED BY BOAT.  LAND ON THE SOUTHEAST TIP OF THE ISLAND, THENCE PACK NORTHWEST ALONG A TRAIL FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK, STAMPED DAVY CAY 4 1966, IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A BOULDER THAT PROJECTS 6 INCHES.  IT IS 58 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A PYRAMID-SHAPED CONCRETE POST THAT PROJECTS 4 FEET.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, STAMPED DAVY CAY 4 NO 1 1966, IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A BOULDER THAT PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  IT IS 45 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE PYRAMID-SHAPED CONCRETE POST THAT PROJECTS 4 FEET.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS THE TIP OF AN ARROW INSCRIBED IN A SMALL MASS OF CEMENT ON A BOULDER THAT PROJECTS 1 FOOT.  THE ARROW DOES NOT POINT TO THE STATION.  IT IS 28 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE PYRAMID-SHAPED CONCRETE POST THAT PROJECTS 4 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1993)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE 1993 (BR) THIS STATION WAS SEARCHED FOR, BUT NOT FOUND.  DID NOT MAKE A THOROUGH SEARCH BECAUSE AREA HAS BEEN HEAVILY BOMBED, AND STILL HAS LIVE EXPLOSIVES LYING ABOUT.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF A POINT OF LAND THAT IS ABOUT 3/4 MILE NORTHEAST OF THE TOWN OF CULEBRA, 3/4 MILE EAST-SOUTH-EAST OF THE NORTHWEST END OF GREAT HARBOR AND ON THE NORTHEAST SHORE OF GREAT HARBOR.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN CULEBRA, GO EASTERLY FOR 0.05 MILE TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND CONTINUE ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO A REVERSE Y-FORK.  BEAR TO THE LEFT AND GO NORTH-EASTERLY FOR 0.5 MILE TO A Y-FORK JUST BEFORE REACHING THE AIRPORT.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO 0.7 MILE TO A Y-FORK.  KEEP THE RIGHT FORK AND GO SOUTHERLY ON THE TRACK ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO A CONCRETE FOUNDATION ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE POINT OF LAND AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A CENTER PUNCHED STEEL BOLT EMBEDDED IN THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE CONCRETE FOUNDATION.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED DEBORAH NO 1 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE CONCRETE FOUNDATION.  THERE WAS NOT AN AZIMUTH MARK OR REFERENCE MARK 2 ESTABLISHED.
markers.setting: UNSPECIFIED SETTING

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1901 (JN) THIS STATION IS SITUATED ON A WOODED HILL ON THE PROPERTY OF LUIS DELGARDO, ABOUT 3 MILES SW OF ARECIBO, AND ABOUT 1/2 MILE S OF ROAD TO LARES.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A GALVANIZED IRON PIPE 2 FEET BY 2 INCHES SET IN A BED OF CEMENT, THE TOP OF THE PIPE PROJECTING ABOUT 2 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  THE PIPE IS FILLED WITH CEMENT AND THE CENTER OF A 20-PENNY NAIL, DRIVEN IN THE CEMENT MARKS THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION MARK, IS THE POINT OF A BRASS NAIL SET IN THE CENTER OF A CONCRETE BLOCK.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1, A MANGO TREE 2.5 FEET IN DIAMETER, 24.42 METERS W FROM STATION.  TRIANGLE CUT, AND NAIL AND WASHER.  TRUE AZIMUTH 65 DEG 00 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2, A MANGO TREE 2 FEET IN DIAMETER, 19.79 METERS N FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 316 DEG 34 MIN.  A TRIANGLE 6 INCHES ON SIDE CUT ON TREE, NAIL AND WASHER ON CENTER.  APPROACH BY ARECIBO-LARES ROAD.  K. 3 H. 6.  TAKE TRAIL TO E TO OWNERS HOUSE.  OWNER OF PROPERTY LUIS DELGARDO.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1940 STATION WAS ORIGINALLY VISITED BY ENRIQUE G. RUBIO AND ESTABLISHED IN 1931.  IT IS ON THE SAME HILL WHERE DELGARDO 1901 WAS ESTABLISHED BY J.N. IN 1901, BUT PIPE AND CONCRETE WERE NOT FOUND OR RECOVERED.  THE MONUMENT ESTABLISHED WAS A CONCRETE BLOCK WITH POINT OF NAIL IN THE CENTER.  IN 1934 IT WAS TIED BY ANGLES TO TANAMA, ALIANZA AND QUEBRADA BESIDES MALD, WHICH MIGHT BE A NO. 2 STATION ALSO.  STATION MARK--NAIL POINT CENTERED IN A CONCRETE BLOCK ON TOP OF HIGHEST POINT OF HILL.  SAME REFERENCE OF 1934.  INSTRUMENT--3 FT. 4-1/2 IN. (3.375 FT.) ECCENTRIC.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (GBG) ABOUT 3 MILES SW OF ARECIBO, AND 0.4 MILE E OF THE ARECIBO-LARES HIGHWAY, ON A HILL OWNED BY LUIS DELGRADO.  THE TOP OF THE HILL IS CLEARED.  BUT THE SIDES ARE WOODED, AND A FEW VERY LARGE TREES NEAR THE TOP MAKE IT DIFFICULT TO SEE OUT FROM GROUND LEVEL.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A NAIL SET IN A CONCRETE BLOCK ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THE CLEARING.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 WAS DESTROYED.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 WAS RECOVERED, BUT WITHOUT THE WASHER.  BOTH REFERENCE MARKS WERE IN UCAR TREES, AND NOT MANGOS.  NO NEW REFERENCE MARKS ESTABLISHED.  TO REACH FROM ARECIBO (PLAZA) GO W 0.7 MILE TO Y-FORK AT CROSSING OF AMERICAN RAILROAD.  TAKE LEFT FORK WHICH IS THE ROAD TO LARES, AND GO ABOUT 2 MILES TO KM. POST 3.65 AT A DIRT Y-ROAD SE.  ENTER THE DIRT ROAD, AND AFTER GOING 0.5 MILE, TAKE RIGHT FORK.  PROCEED TO NEXT FORK, AND TAKE LEFT, FOLLOWING IT PAST LUIS DELGARDOS HOUSE.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT ON ABOUT 200 METERS TO FENCE AND SMALL POND.  LEAVE CAR HERE.  STATION IS NE OF THIS POINT.  TAKE TRAIL N AT E EDGE OF FIELD, BEAR E BETWEEN TWO HILLS, AND BEAR N AGAIN UP TO FIRST SADDLE.  AT CREST TURN LEFT (W), AND FOLLOW TRAIL AND FENCE LINE UP TO TOP AND STATION.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE CONCRETE ROOF OF THE CHANNEL 8 TELEVISION BROADCASTING STATION BUILDING WHICH IS LOCATED ON ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL STATION.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM GATE NUMBER 3 OF ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL STATION, GO SOUTH FOR 0.05 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO EASTERLY ON LANGLEY DRIVE FOR 1.5 MILES TO A CROSSROADS.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHERLY ON NORTH PRINCETON DRIVE FOR 0.6 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO WESTERLY ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT ON THE TOP OF A CONCRETE BUILDING.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DELIC 1965.  CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF THE FLAT TOPPED ANTENNA DOME WHICH IS 15 FEET IN DIAMETER AND SETS ATOP THE TELEVISION BROADCASTING STATION BUILDING.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DELIC NO 1 1965.  CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF THE FORWARD WALL OF THE BUILDING.  IT IS 15 FEET LOWER IN ELEVATION THAN THE STATION MARK.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DELIC NO 2 1965.  CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF THE FORWARD WALL OF THE BUILDING.  IT IS 15 FEET LOWER IN ELEVATION THAN THE STATION MARK.  THE U.S. NAVY HYDROGRAPHIC OFFICE TRIANGULATION DISK IS STAMPED DELICIAS 2 1958.  CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF THE CONCRETE ANTENNA DOME AND IS THE SAME ELEVATION AS THE STATION MARK.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS SET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1978)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DEFENSE MAP AGENCY 1978 (EAW) DELIC 1965 SAME AS PREVIOUSLY DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1983)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1983 (WT) DELIC 1965 RECOVERED GOOD.  RM 1 AND 2 NOT FOUND.  THIS STRUCTURE IS THE MOUNT FOR A REMOTE TV CAMERA,  LOCATED JUST TO REAR OF BROADCAST STUDIO BLDG.
markers.setting: SET IN A MASSIVE STRUCTURE
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY US NAVY 1966 (JJL) STATION MARK IS A U.S. NAVY HYDROGRAPHIC OFFICE TRIANGULATION DISK STAMPED DELICIAS 2 1958, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF THE CONCRETE ANTENNA DOME.                            STATION RECOVERY (1983)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1983 (WHT) DELICIAS 2 1958 RECOVERED GOOD.  RM 1 AND 2 SEARCHED FOR NOT FOUND.  THIS STRUCTURE IS MOUNT FOR A REMOTE TELEVISION TOWER, TO REAR OF THE BROADCAST STATION BUILDING.
markers.setting: SET IN A MASSIVE STRUCTURE
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 SITUATED ON THE FIRST HILL W OF THE PLACE WHERE THE HORSE TRAIL FROM MARICAO TO SAN GERMAN CROSSES THE MAIN RIDGE.  IT IS ALSO W OF THE GREAT MASS OF MOUNTAINS KNOWN AS CERRO GORDO.  IT IS SITUATED ABOUT 2.8 MILES BY TRAIL FROM KILOMETER 24, H 3.5.  HILL IS COVERED BY WOODS ON ALL SIDES.  STATION MARK IS A U.S.G.S. STANDARD TABLET SET ON A CONCRETE BLOCK, 10 BY 10 BY 24 INCHES, WHICH IS AN OLD CORNER OF A PUBLIC FOREST RESERVE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A BRASS NAIL AND WASHER SET ON NATURAL ROCK, 4.02 METERS IN TRUE AZIMUTH 190 DEG 58 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A BRASS NAIL AND WASHER FASTENED WITH CONCRETE ON NATURAL ROCK, 1.43 METERS IN TRUE AZIMUTH 341 DEG 46 MIN.  SIGNAL--A TRIPOD WITH CROSS BLACK TARGET SET OFF CENTER 6 FEET 1-1/2 INCHES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1952)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1952 (JOP) STATION IS LOCATED ON A HIGH, BRUSHY, AND ROCKY KNOB, ABOUT 1 MI. NW OF THE HIGHEST POINT OF A HIGH RIDGE.  IT IS ABOUT 12 MI. E OF MAYAGUEZ, AND ABOUT 2 MI. SW OF THE TOWN OF MARICAO.  IT IS A STANDARD U.S.G.S. TRIANGULATION BENCH-MARK DISK, STAMPED DESCANSO 1934 AND SET IN THE TOP OF A 12- BY 12-INCH CONCRETE POST PROJECTING 12 IN. ABOVE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS ABOUT 5 FT. LOWER THAN THE STATION, AND IN THE CENTER OF THE FOOT PATH.  IT IS A STANDARD REFERENCE-MARK DISK, STAMPED DESCANSO NO 1 1934 AND SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS ABOUT 8 FT. LOWER THAN THE STATION ON A SMALL SHELF.  IT IS A STANDARD REFERENCE-MARK DISK, STAMPED DESCANSO NO 2 1934 AND SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN A BOULDER.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 357 AND 105 IN THE TOWN OF MARICAO (S EDGE), GO W ON HIGHWAY 105 FOR 0.9 MI. TO A REVERSE Y LEFT, TURN SHARP LEFT ON A GRAVEL ROAD AND GO 2.4 MI. TO A DIM TRAIL VERY SHARP RIGHT AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE PACK IN A N DIRECTION ON THE TRAIL FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO A DIM PATH LEFT THROUGH BUSHES, TURN LEFT AND FOLLOW THE PATH TO THE TOP OF A KNOB AND STATION AS DESCRIBED.  (ABOUT A 15-MIN. PACK.)  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1 M.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1952 DESCRIPTION AND ALL MARKS WERE FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE ROUTE IS ADEQUATE AND THE LAST 2.4 MILES OF THE ROAD IS NOW PAVED.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1952 (JOP) STATION IS ON THE SUMMIT OF DESECHEO ISLAND, WHICH LIES ABOUT 19 MI. SW OF POINT BORINQUEN LIGHT HOUSE.  THE ISLAND IS VISIBLE FROM ANY HIGH POINT ON THE W COAST OF PUERTO RICO.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD STATION DISK, STAMPED DESECHEO 1952 AND CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A ROCK ABOUT 3 IN. BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD REFERENCE-MARK DISK, STAMPED DESECHEO NO 1 1952 AND CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK.  IT IS ABOUT 2 M. LOWER THAN THE STATION ON THE E SLOPE OF A PEAK.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD REFERENCE-MARK DISK, STAMPED DESECHEO NO 2 1952 AND CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK.  IT IS ABOUT 1 M. LOWER THAN THE STATION ON THE W SLOPE OF A PEAK.  THE DANGEROUS LANDING MAY BE MADE BY SMALL BOATS ONLY.  BEST LANDING IS AT A SMALL BEACH ON THE NW TIP OF THE ISLAND.  POINT IS MARKED BY AN AIR FORCE STRAFING TARGET PAINTED WHITE.  IT IS ABOUT 10 YDS. W OF A CHAIN OF SMALL ROCK ISLANDS EXTENDING N FROM THE SHORE FOR ABOUT 150 YDS.  A DIM TRAIL LEADS S TO THE HIGHEST POINT AND STATION.  THIS IS ABOUT A 1-HR. PACK WITH GEAR.  THERE IS NO DRINKING WATER.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1941 V. A. ELEVATION 134.56 METERS.  STATION IS ON THE CENTRAL PART OF VIEQUES ISLAND, LOCATED ON A BARE TOP ABOUT 1 KM. SOUTH AND 1.3 KM. EAST OF ISABEL II AND ABOUT 0.6 KM. EAST OF THE MUNICIPAL ROAD TO LUJAN.  THE STATION IS ABOUT 80 METERS WEST OF AND 3 METERS BELOW THE HIGHEST PART OF THE HILL.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD TABLET STAMPED DESTINO 1941 AND SET IN A ROCK ABOUT 1/2 METER HIGH.  R.M. NO. 1 IS A DRILL HOLE 4.39 METERS FROM STATION.  PLANE AZIMUTH 312-37.  R.M. NO. 2 IS A DRILL HOLE IN ROCK 2.10 METERS FROM STATION.  PLANE AZIMUTH 236-19.  TO REACH FROM ISABEL II DRIVE SOUTH ON THE ROAD TO LUJAN 1.3 KMS.  LEAVE CAR AND WALK UP RIDGE TO STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US MARINE CORPS 1965 THE STATION MARK HAS BEEN REMOVED BUT THE DRILL HOLE IN ROCK REMAINS.  THE REFERENCE MARKS HAVE BEEN FOUND.  A TRAIL LEADS TO TOP OF HILL AND STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1967)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US MARINE CORPS 1967 STATION MARK IS 30 CALIBER CASING.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US MARINE CORPS 1970 STATION IS PRESUMED DESTROYED.  THE ROCK WAS LOCATED BUT BOLT IS MISSING AND THERE WAS NO INDICATION OF A 30 CALIBER CASING.
markers.setting: SET IN A BOULDER
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2002 (JMW) IN SAN JUAN, AT THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 1 AND 2, 99.7 M NORTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE WESTBOUND LANES OF STATE HIGHWAY 2, 15.4 M SOUTHEAST OF A UTILITY LIGHT POLE, 14.9 M SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE SOUTHBOUND LANES OF STATE HIGHWAY 1, 9.2 M NORTHWEST OF A LOOP (HIGHWAY 2 OFF RAMP AND HIGHWAY 1 ON RAMP), 0.9 M EAST OF A WITNESS POST, AND 0.5 M ABOVE THE LEVEL OF STATE HIGHWAY 1. NOTE--ACCESS TO THE DATUM POINT IS THROUGH A 5-INCH LOGO CAP.  THE SLEEVE DEPTH DOES NOT MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS FOR A CLASS A MARK.  THE MARK IS ON THE HIGHWAY RIGHT-OF-WAY.                            STATION RECOVERY (2002)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2002 (JMW) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (2009)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2009 (NMD) NO LOGO CAP, BUT THE ROD IS GOOD. MARQTEK ENGINEERING.                            STATION RECOVERY (2015)  RECOVERY NOTE BY POLYTECHNIC UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO 2015 (WID) IN SAN JUAN, AT THE JUCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 1 AND 2, 99.7 M NORTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE WESTBOUND LANES OF STATE HIGHTWAY 2, 15.4 M SOUTHHEAST OF A UTILITY LIGHT POLE, 14.9 M SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE SOUTBOUND LANES OF STATE HIGHWAY 1, 9.2 M NORTHWEST OF A LOOP ( HIGHWAY 2 OFF RAMP AND HIGHTWAY 1 ON RAMP), 0.9 M EAST OF A WITNEES POST, AND 0.5 M ABOVE THE LEVEL OF STATE HIGHWAY 1.
markers.setting: STAINLESS STEEL ROD IN SLEEVE (10 FT.+)
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 4 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF BARCELONETA, 3 MILES NORTH OF MANATI, ON THE HIGH POINT OF AN EAST-WEST RIDGE AND ON THE PROPERTY OF DR. RAMON DIAZ.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAY 2 AND 685 IN MANATI, GO NORTH ON HIGHWAY 685 FOR 2.65 MILES TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO EASTERLY ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH AND EAST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.55 MILE TO AN IRON GATE ON THE RIGHT AT A POINT WHERE THE ROAD TURNS LEFT.  (THE KEY FOR THE GATE WAS OBTAINED FROM DR. RAMON DIAZ OF MANATI, PUERTO RICO.) PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND GO EAST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO A HOUSE ON THE LEFT. BEAR RIGHT AND GO SOUTH ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE TOP OF AN EAST-WEST RIDGE.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ALONG THE TOP OF THE RIDGE FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE RIDGE.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DIAZ 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A ROCK OUTCROP THAT PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  IT IS 5 FEET NORTH OF AN EAST-WEST FENCE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DIAZ NO 1 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A ROCK OUTCROP THAT PROJECTS 5 INCHES.  IT IS 31 FEET NORTH OF THE FENCE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DIAZ NO 2 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A ROCK OUTCROP THAT PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  IT IS 19 FEET NORTH OF THE FENCE.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS SET.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 2004 (YRR) THE DISK STAMP HAS BEEN STOLEN OR REMOVED
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 4-1/2 MILES NORTHWEST OF MOCA, 1 1/2 MILES NORTHEAST OF AGUADILLA AND ON THE PROPERTY OF MR. PEDRO VELEZ.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 2 AND 107 WHICH IS ABOUT 2 MILES NORTHEAST OF AGUADILLA, GO EASTERLY ON HIGHWAY 2 FOR 0.4 MILE TO A WIRE GATE ON THE RIGHT.  (MR. PEDRO VELEZ LIVES 0.25 MILE WEST OF THIS POINT ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE ROAD.) PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND FOLLOW A TRACK ROAD SOUTHWEST AND WEST ALONG THE SOUTH SIDE OF A WIRE FENCE FOR 0.2 MILE TO A FENCE CORNER AND THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE PACK WEST ACROSS A PLOWED FIELD FOR ABOUT 200 YARDS TO THE BASE OF A BRUSH COVERED HILL.  PACK WEST AND NORTHWEST FOR 10 MINUTES TO THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE HILL AND THE STATION MARK AT THE WEST EDGE OF THE HILL.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DILLA 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A ROCK OUTCROP THAT PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DILLA NO 1 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A ROCK OUTCROP THAT PROJECTS 12 INCHES.  IT IS ON THE NORTHEAST SLOPE OF THE HILL AND IS ABOUT 3 FEET LOWER THAN THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DILLA NO 2 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A ROCK OUTCROP THAT PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  IT IS ON THE SOUTH SLOPE OF THE HILL AND IS ABOUT 4 FEET LOWER THAN THE STATION.  AN AZIMUTH MARK WAS NOT ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 2004 MARK RECOVERED IN POOR CONDITION.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS ABOUT 5 KILOMETERS E OF THE CAGUAS-CAYEY ROAD, ON BARRIO BEATRIZ OF CAGUAS ON A HIGH MOUNTAIN WHICH IS SEEN FROM KILOMETER 49 H.O.  THE STATION IS ON A COMPARATIVELY BARE HILL WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE SW SLOPE WHICH IS SHRUBBY AND WOODY.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD U.S.G.S. BENCH MARK SET IN A CONCRETE BASE.  A BOTTLE FILLED WITH BLACK DIRT IS BURIED UNDER CONCRETE BASE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A BRASS NAIL ON THE TREE STUMP, 26.46 FEET DISTANT IN TRUE AZIMUTH 208 DEG 39 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A BRASS NAIL ON TREE STUMP, 36.5 FEET DISTANT IN TRUE AZIMUTH 307 DEG 49 MIN.  SIGNAL--WHITE QUADRIPOD AND BLACK CROSS TARGETS ON CENTER POLE.  TO REACH THIS STATION, TURN E AT KILOMETER 49 H.O. AND RIDE ABOUT 3 KILOMETERS.  TAKE PATH ON THE WESTERN SLOPE.  THIS IS THE MOST DIRECT WAY TO REACH THIS STATION AND IT IS A GOOD PATH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1940)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1940 STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  BUT R.M.S NOT FOUND.  NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  LOCATED ABOUT 10 KM. SW OF CAGUAS, ABOUT 2-1/2 KM. E OF THE CAGUAS-CAYEY HIGHWAY.  AND ABOUT 3 KM. SE OF LAS CRUCES, (JUNCTION OF RD. TO CIDRAS) ON SAME HIGHWAY.  THE STATION IS ON TOP OF A HIGH PROMINENT MOUNTAIN, WHOSE N AND W SLOPES ARE COMPARATIVELY BARE EXCEPT FOR SOME PLATANO AND BANANA TREES NEAR THE TOP, AND WHOSE S AND E SLOPES ARE WELL COVERED WITH TREES.  THERE ARE FOUR CONCRETE ADOBE P.R.R.A. HOUSES NEAR THE TOP ON N AND W SLOPES.  THE TOP IS THICKLY COVERED WITH HIGH GRASS AND BRUSH. THE STATION IS ABOUT 5 FT. E. OF A DIM TRAIL CROSSING THE TOP. AND IS A STANDARD TABLET UNSTAMPED, SET IN CONCRETE, FLUSH WITH GROUND.  THE 1934 DESCRIPTION STATES THAT THERE IS A BOTTLE FILLED WITH BLACK DIRT UNDER THE CONCRETE BASE.  R. M. NO. 1 (1941) IS A STANDARD TABLET STAMPED R. M. NO. 1 1941 SET IN CONCRETE.  20.57 FT. FROM STATION IN AZIMUTH 140 DEG 39 MIN.  IT PROJECTS ABOUT 3 IN ABOVE GROUND, AT W SLOPE OF TOP.  R. M. NO. 2 (1941) IS A STANDARD TABLET STAMPED R. M. NO. 2 1941 SET IN CONCRETE.  10.89 FT. FROM STATION IN AZIMUTH 229 DEG 48 MIN.  IT PROJECTS ABOUT 8 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  TO REACH FROM CAGUAS, GO S FROM PLAZA ON CAYEY HIGHWAY 8.1 MILES (KM. 49 H O).  TURN LEFT BETWEEN TWO BUILDINGS, ON DIRT ROAD.  AND FOLLOW EASTWARD, AND DOWN STEEP HILL PASSING SCHOOL.  LEAVE CAR ABOUT 0.2 MILE BEYOND SCHOOL, AND CONTINUE AFOOT ON ROAD.  ABOUT 1/2 KM. E OF CAR TAKE TRAIL, RIGHT, BETWEEN HOUSE AND STORE OF LINO COLON.  AND FOLLOW MAIN TRAIL DIRECTLY UP MOUNTAIN TO STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 (CFO) THE STATION MARK AND THE REFERENCE MARKS HAVE ALL BEEN DESTROYED.  THE PROPERTY OWNER IS IN THE PROCESS OF BUILDING A NEW HOME ON THIS HILL, IT HAS BEEN GRADED DOWN ABOUT 30 FEET AND THIS HAS DESTROYED ALL OF THE MARKS.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL STATION, NEAR PIER NUMBER 1 AND 0.15 MILE NORTHWEST OF SURFACE OPERATIONS BUILDING NUMBER 45.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM GATE NUMBER 1 OF ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL STATION, GO SOUTHEAST ON TARAWA DRIVE FOR 0.1 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND CONTINUE SOUTHEAST ON TARAWA DRIVE FOR 1.7 MILES TO A FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO EAST ON FORRESTAL DRIVE FOR 0.5 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO SOUTH AND SOUTHEAST ON FORRESTAL DRIVE FOR 0.75 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWEST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT AT THE NORTHEAST END OF PIER NUMBER 1.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DOCK 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A CONCRETE HEAD-WALL.  IT IS 40 FEET NORTHEAST OF A POWER POLE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DOCK NO 1 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE HEAD-WALL.  IT IS 53 FEET EAST OF THE POWER POLE AND THE SAME ELEVATION AS THE STATION MARK.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DOCK NO 2 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE SEWER THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE SURROUNDING AREA AND IS SURROUNDED BY FOUR CONCRETE POST THAT PROJECT 2 FEET.  IT IS 75 FEET NORTH OF THE POWER POLE AND 1 FOOT SOUTH OF A SEWER VALVE THAT IS 18 INCHES IN DIAMETER.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS SET.
markers.setting: SET IN A RETAINING WALL OR CONCRETE LEDGE
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1901 (JBB) STATION IS THE SIGNAL ON THE EASTERN EXTREMITY OF THE SMALL ISLAND CALLED MEGOTE AFUERA (OUTER CAY OR ISLAND) ON TOP OF THE BLUFF.  MARKED BY A CEMENT BLOCK 16 INCHES LONG BY 6 INCHES SQUARE.  A HYDROGRAPHIC SIGNAL STANDS ON THE NEXT POINT TO THE SW.                            STATION RECOVERY (1902)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1902 (RLF) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THIS ISLAND HAS THREE NAMES, VIG, NORTH CABRUS (C.G.S. CHART NO.910) CABEZA DE PINEROS (HEAD OF PINEROS) MEGOTE AFUERA (OUTER SMALL ISLAND).                            STATION RECOVERY (1921)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1921 (JHP) STATION RECOVERED FROM DESCRIPTION AND IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE EASTERN SIDE OF CULEBRA ISLAND ABOUT 2-1/2 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF THE TOWN OF CULEBRA.  IT IS ON THE EXTREME EASTERN END OF A PROMINENT RIDGE LOCALLY KNOW AS DOLPHIN HEAD.  THE RIDGE IS EASILY IDENTIFIED BY THE GRADUAL SLOPE TO THE WEST AND THE SHARP DROP TO THE EAST.  TO REACH FROM THE POST OFFICE IN CULEBRA GO EAST FOR 0.05 MILE TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK FOR 0.05 MILE TO A REVERSE Y-FORK.  BEAR LEFT AND GO NORTHEASTERLY FOR 0.5 MILE TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO EASTERLY ALONG THE SHORELINE FOR 1.9 MILES TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK UP A STEEP SLOPE 0.1 MILE TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK 0.7 MILE TO A Y-FORK AND A GATE ACROSS THE LEFT FORK.  BEAR LEFT, PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND GO EAST ABOUT 200 FEET TO A WOODEN GATE.  PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND GO EASTERLY FOR 0.4 MILE TO A GATE.  PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND CONTINUE EASTERLY FOR 0.4 MILE TO A GATE AND A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT, PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND GO EASTERLY AND NORTHERLY FOR 1.2 MILES TO A GATE AT THE TOP OF A HILL.  PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND GO NORTHERLY 0.05 MILE TO A GATE ON THE LEFT.  TURN SHARP TO THE LEFT, PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND GO WESTERLY UP THE RIDGE 0.1 MILE TO A BUILDING.  CONTINUE WESTERLY KEEPING TO THE RIGHT OF THE BUILDING AND FOLLOW A TRACK ROAD ALONG THE RIDGE FOR 0.4 MILE TO THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  PACK WESTERLY UP THE DRAW TO A SADDLE.  TURN LEFT AND PACK SOUTHEATERLY UP THE RIDGE TO THE HIGHEST POINT AND THE STATION.  A 20 MINUTE PACK.  THE STATION MARK IS A 1/2-INCH COPPER PIN SET IN A 8-INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS SET IN A CRACK IN A MASS OF OUTCROPPING BEDROCK THAT PROJECTS THREE FEET.  INSCRIBED IN THE TOP OF THE SQUARE MONUMENT ARE THE WORDS DOLPHIN HEAD.  THIS MARK WAS PROBABLY SET BY THE U.S. ARMY ENGINEERS.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 1 IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED DOLPHIN HEAD NO 1 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK THAT PROJECTS FOUR FEET.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 2 IS A U.S. MARINE CORP ARTILLERY DISK, STAMPED LEECH, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK THAT PROJECTS THREE FEET.
markers.setting: UNSPECIFIED SETTING

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1901 (JBB) STATION ON THE EASTERN EXTREMITY AND HIGHEST POINT OF ALGODON CAY ON THE E COAST OF PUERTO RICO, JUST N OF PUNTA LIMA, WHICH FORMS THE NE SIDE OF THE HARBOR OF NAGUABO.  STATION IS 33.3 FEET ABOVE MEAN HIGH-WATER.  STATION MARKED BY A CEMENT BLOCK 18 INCHES LONG BY 6 INCHES SQUARE WITH A NAIL IN THE CEMENT MARKING CENTER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1922)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1922 (FTS) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  DESCRIPTION ADEQUATE.  STATION MARK IS IN A HEAVY GROWTH OF TALL TROPICAL GRASS AND THORNY BUSHES.  TWO REFERENCE MARKS WERE SET, WHICH ARE STANDARD DISKS SET IN IRREGULAR MASSES OF CONCRETE FLUSH WITH GROUND, ALONG SOUTHERN SIDE OF ISLAND ABOUT 6 FEET BACK FROM THE CLIFFS AND NEAR PATH FROM WESTERN END OF ISLAND TO SIGNAL AT E POINT.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS SET AT EDGE OF CLEARING WHERE AT PRESENT CORN IS GROWING.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 SET IN TALL GRASS, BUT CLOSE TO PATH.  REFERENCE MARKS SET IN RANGE WITH STATION, AND NEARLY IN RANGE WITH HIGHEST PART OF POINT LIMA.                            STATION RECOVERY (1926)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) STATION MARK IN GOOD CONDITION.  EASILY RECOVERED AS BUSHES HAVE BEEN CLEARED AWAY BY NATIVES.  NO ATTEMPT WAS MADE TO RECOVER REFERENCE MARKS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (RLS) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED IN POOR CONDITION.  THE TOP OF THE CONCRETE WAS BROKEN OFF TO THE DEPTH THAT THE NAIL WAS EMBEDDED IN IT.  THE ONLY REMAINING POINT WAS THE REMAINDER OF THE CONCRETE POST WITH THE IMPRESSION OF THE HEAD OF THE NAIL AT ABOUT THE CENTER.  THE CONCRETE POST APPEARED NOT TO HAVE BEEN MOVED FROM ITS ORIGINAL POSITION AND IT IS THOUGHT THAT RECOVERY OF THE OLD POINT WAS MADE WITHIN 5 MILLIMETERS.  THE OLD MARK WAS REMOVED AND THE STATION RE-MARKED BY A STANDARD DISK IN A CONCRETE POST 12 INCHES SQUARE.  THE DISK IS STAMPED DON 1901-1941.  THE REFERENCE MARKS ESTABLISHED IN 1922 COULD NOT BE FOUND.  AT THE POINTS DESCRIBED THE MARKS WOULD BE OFF THE TOP OF THE HILL ON THE STEEP SLOPE OF THE BLUFF AT THE S SIDE OF THE ISLAND.  THE BLUFF APPEARS TO HAVE ERODED SOMEWHAT IN RECENT YEARS AND IT IS THOUGHT THE REFERENCE MARKS ARE DESTROYED.  TWO NEW REFERENCE MARKS, STANDARD DISKS SET IN CONCRETE, AS DESCRIBED IN NOTE 11A, WERE SET.  THE STATION IS ABOUT 2-1/2 MILES E OF NAGUABO PLAYA, ABOUT MIDWAY BETWEEN THE MOUTH OF THE DAGUAO RIVER AND POINT LIMA, ON A SMALL ISLAND KNOWN AS ALGODONES CAY WHICH IS NEARLY CONNECTED WITH THE MAINLAND BY A NARROW STRIP OF MANGROVE.  THE STATION IS NEAR THE SE CORNER OF AND ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE ISLAND, AT THE E END OF A RIDGE ALONG THE S SIDE OF THE ISLAND, 3 METERS W OF THE EDGE OF THE BLUFF AT THE E END, 2 METERS N OF THE EDGE OF THE BLUFF AT THE S SIDE OF THE ISLAND, AND PROJECTS 5 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  THE ELEVATION OF THE STATION IS ABOUT 10.5 METERS.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS 5 METERS N OF THE SUMMIT OF THE RIDGE ALONG THE S SIDE OF THE ISLAND, ABOUT 2 FEET LOWER THAN THE SUMMIT, 21.3 METERS SW OF THE WITNESS MARK, 1.46 METERS LOWER THAN THE STATION, AND PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  THE DISK IS STAMPED DON NO.3 1941.  REFERENCE MARK NO.4 IS ON THE N SLOPE OF THE RIDGE, 5 METERS W OF THE EDGE OF THE BLUFF AT THE E END OF THE ISLAND, 13.7 METERS NE OF THE WITNESS MARK, 2.42 METERS LOWER THAN THE STATION, AND PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  THE DISK IS STAMPED DON NO.4 1941.  THE WITNESS MARK, A TRIANGULAR BLAZE, IS ON THE E SIDE OF THE EASTERLY OF A GROUP OF SMALL TAMARINDO TREES, AND 1 METER ABOVE THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN EXCELLENT CONDITION.  THEY ARE ALL COVERED BY VERY THICK TALL GRASS.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1982 (JCL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 9.5 KM (6 MI) NORTHEAST OF PONCE, 8 KM (5 MI) WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE SMALL TOWN OF JUANA DIAZ, AND ATOP THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS LABORATORY BUILDING.  OWNERSHIP--U.S. ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 14 AND 139 ABOUT 4 KM (2-1/2 MI) NORTHEAST OF PONCE, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 0.5 KM (0.3 MI) TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON A WINDING ROAD (HIGHWAY 139) FOR 3.1 KM (1.95 MI) TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 3.7 KM (2.35 MI) TO THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS LABORATORY BUILDING ON THE LEFT AND A GATE.  TURN LEFT AND PASS THROUGH THE GATE AT THE STATION SITE.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE ROOF OF THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS LABORATORY BUILDING.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED---DONNA 1982---, SET INTO A DRILL HOLE IN A CONCRETE ROOF.  IT IS LOCATED 11.52 METERS (37.8 FT) SOUTHWEST FROM THE NORTHEAST EDGE OF THE ROOF, 8.93 METERS (29.30 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE SOUTHEAST EDGE OF THE ROOF, 5.03 METERS (16.5 FT) WEST FROM A ANTENNA TOWER, AND 3.75 METERS (12.3 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM THE NORTHWEST EDGE OF THE ROOF.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 1 IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED ---DONNA NO 1 1982---, CRIMPED TO THE TOP OF A STAINLESS STEEL ROD DRIVEN TO THE DEPTH OF 12 FEET AND SURROUNDED BY A CONCRETE POST 25 CM IN DIAMETER RECESSED 2 CM BELOW THE GROUND.  IT IS LOCATED 23.28 METERS (76.4 FT) WEST FROM A ANTENNA TOWER, 8.80 METERS (28.9 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE BUILDING, AND 1.22 METERS (4.0 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM A FENCE.  MARK IS BELOW STATION 1.2 METERS.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 2 IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED ---DONNA NO 2 1982---, CRIMPED TO THE TOP OF A STAINLESS STEEL ROD DRIVEN TO A DEPTH OF 12 FEET AND SURROUNDED BY A CONCRETE POST 25 CM IN DIAMETER FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  IT IS LOCATED 17.25 METERS (56.6 FT) NORTH FROM A ANTENNA TOWER, 8.50 METERS (27.9 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE NORTH CORNER OF THE BUILDING, AND 0.7 METER (2.3 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM A FENCE.  MARK IS BELOW STATION 0.9 METERS.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN ABOVE THE MARK WAS 1.8 METERS.  A LEVEL TIE WAS MADE TO THIS STATION AND IS INCLUDED IN LEVEL LINE 1A.                            STATION RECOVERY (1982)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1982 9.5 KM (5.90 MI) NE FROM PONCE. FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAY 14 AND 139, WHICH IS ABOUT 4.0 KM (2.5 MI) NORTHEAST OF PONCE, GO NORTH ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 0.5 KM (0.3 MI) TO A CROSSROAD, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST AND NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 3.2 KM (2.0 MI) TO A FORK LEFT, KEEP RIGHT AND CONTINUE NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139, 3.9 KM (2.4 MI) TO A GATE ON THE LEFT TO THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS LABORATORY AND IN THE CONCRETE ROOF OF THE LABORATORY BUILDING, 1.5 METERS (32.8 FT) SOUTHWEST FROM THE NORTHEAST EDGE OF THE ROOF, 8.95 METERS (29.3 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE SOUTHEAST EDGE OF THE ROOF, 3.7 METERS (12.3 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM THE NORTHWEST EDGE OF THE ROOF, AND 5.0 METERS (16.5 FT) WEST OF AN ANTENNA TOWER.
markers.setting: SET IN A MASSIVE STRUCTURE
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1982 9.5 KM (5.90 MI) NE FROM CERRILLOS DAM SITE. FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 14 AND 139, WHICH IS ABOUT 4.0 KM (2.5 MI) NORTHEAST OF PONCE, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 0.5 KM (0.3 MI) TO A CROSSROAD, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST AND NORTHERLY FOR 3.2 KM (2.05 MI) ON HIGHWAY 139 TO A FORK LEFT, KEEP RIGHT AND CONTINUE NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 3.8 KM (2.4 MI) TO A GATE AND THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS LABORATORY ON THE LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH FOR 30.5 METERS (100.0 FT) TO A FENCE AND THE STATION, 23.3 METERS (76.4 FT) WEST AN ANTENNA ATOP THE ROOF, 8.8 METERS (28.9 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE BUILDING AND 1.2 METERS (4.0 FT) SOUTHEAST OF A FENCE.  THE DISK IS CRIMPED TO THE TOP OF A STAINLESS STEEL ROD AND DRIVEN TO THE DEPTH OF 12 FT AND SURROUNDED BY A CONCRETE POST OF 25 CM (10 IN) IN DIAMETERS AND IS RECESSED 2 CM (1 IN) BELOW THE GROUND.
markers.setting: STAINLESS STEEL ROD W/O SLEEVE (10 FT.+)
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1982 9.50 KM (5.90 MI) NE FROM PONCE. FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 14 AND 139, WHICH IS ABOUT 4.0 KM (2.5 MI) NORTHEAST OF PONCE, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 0.5 KM (0.3 MI) TO A CROSSROAD, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST AND NORTHERLY FOR 3.2 KM (2.0 MI) ON HIGHWAY 139 TO A FORK LEFT, KEEP RIGHT AND CONTINUE NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 3.9 KM (2.4 MI) TO A GATE ON THE LEFT AT THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS LABORATORY, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH 30.5 METERS (100.0 FT) TO A FENCE AND THE STATION, 17.3 METERS (56.6 FT) NORTH FROM A ANTENNA ATOP THE ROOF, 8.5 METERS (22.9 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE BUILDING, AND 0.7 METERS (2.3 FT) SOUTHEAST OF A FENCE, THE DISK IS CRIMPED TO THE TOP OF A STAINLESS STEEL ROD AND DRIVEN TO THE DEPTH OF 12 FT AND SURROUNDED BY A CONCRETE POST OF 25 CM (10 IN) IN DIAMETER AND IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND. THE MARK IS ABOVE LEVEL WITH GROUND.
markers.setting: STAINLESS STEEL ROD W/O SLEEVE (10 FT.+)
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JPR) THE STATION IS LOCATED APPROXIMATELY 5.0 MILES EAST OF ISABEL SEGUNDA ON THE NORTH COAST OF VIEQUES ISLAND.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY AN EIGHT INCH STEEL PIN DRIVEN INTO THE GROUND.  IT IS APPROXIMATELY 5.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE CREST OF A HILL FORMED BY A BUNKER.  NO REFERENCE MARKS WERE SET.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE COMMAND POST ON CAMP GARCIA, GO EASTWARD ALONG GRAVEL ROAD FOR APPROXIMATELY 1/4 MILE TO THE SECOND SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND FOLLOW SIGNS TO O.P.S 7,8, 9,.  AFTER PASSING RANGES NOS. 1-6 CONTINUE ALONG GRAVEL ROAD UNTIL COMING TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT, ABOUT 1/2 MILE DUE NORTH OF O.P. 7, AND A SIGN GIVING NOTICE OF THE WESTERN LIMITS OF THE IMPACT AREA.  THE STATION IS ON THE LEFT ON TOP OF A SMALL HILL.
markers.setting: METAL ROD DRIVEN INTO GROUND. SEE TEXT FOR ADDITIONAL
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1982 5.5 KM (3.42 MI) NE FROM PONCE. FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAY 14 AND 139, ABOUT 4.0 KM (2.5 MI) NORTHEAST OF PONCE, GO EAST ON HIGHWAY 14 FOR 1.1 KM (0.7 MI) TO A DIRT ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHERLY ON A DIRT ROAD FOLLOWING THE CANAL FOR 1.1 KM (0.7 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT, 18.1 METERS (59.5 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM THE CENTER OF A ROAD, 2.8 METERS (9.2 FT) EAST FROM THE WESTERN MOST OF THREE POWER POLES AND 0.7 METERS (2.4 FT) WEST FROM THE CENTER ONE OF THREE POWER POLES.  MARK IS DATUM POINT WITH ACCESS COVER. THE MARK IS 1.6 FT ABOVE ROAD.
markers.setting: STAINLESS STEEL ROD W/O SLEEVE (10 FT.+)
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1995 (CSM) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE WEST SECTION OF THE MUNICIPALITY OF CAROLINA AT THE CONCRETE AIRPORT ENTRANCE SIGN FROM WESTBOUND ROUTE 26 AIRPORT EXIT JUST EAST OF THE ROUTE 17 OVERPASS OF ROUTE 26.  THE STATION IS A STAINLESS STEEL ROD DRIVEN TO REFUSAL IN A GREASED SLEEVE SET FLUSH WITH THE GROUND, 86.1 FT (26.2 M) NE OF EDGE OF GUARDRAIL OF 26 WESTBOUND, 44.7 FT (13.6 M) NW OF GUARDRAIL EDGE TO AIRPORT EXIT, 40.4 FT (12.3 M) SW FROM CENTER OF CONCRETE FOUNDATION TO MISSING LIGHT POLE, 1.5 FT (0.5 M) NE OF THE NW END OF AIRPORT WELCOME SIGN WHICH EXTOLLS THE VIRTUES OF THE AUTORIDAD DE LOS PUERTOS.  THE AIRPORT ENTRANCE SIGN IS OF CONCRETE CONSTRUCTION WITH ROUNDED AND SLOPING SIDES.  A STAINLESS STEEL ROD DRIVEN TO REFUSAL WITH GREASE SECURITY SLEEVE ENCASED IN 5 INCH PVC PIPE WITH AN ALUMINUM ALLOY ACCESS COVER.  THE SS ROD WAS ROUNDED AND CENTERPUNCHED AT THE TOP TO FACILITATE PRECISE LEVELING AND INSTRUMENT CENTERING.  MARK IS REPORTED AS BEING SUITABLE FOR GPS OCCUPATION BUT NO SUCH OCCUPATION WAS MADE AT THIS TIME.  DESCRIBED BY M.L.  ASKALKSON.                            STATION RECOVERY (2002)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2002 (JMW) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2007 (MR) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED                            STATION RECOVERY (2009)  RECOVERY NOTE BY JAVIER E. BIDOT AND ASSOC. 2009 (CFA) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.
markers.setting: STAINLESS STEEL ROD IN SLEEVE (10 FT.+)
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2002 (JMW) 3.4 KM (2.1 MI) SOUTHWESTERLY ALONG STATE HIGHWAY 2  FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 1 IN SAN JUAN,  SET VERTICALLY IN THE EAST FACE OF THE MOST NORTHERLY OF 2 COLUMNS OF THE 1ST PIER EAST OF THE WEST ABUTMENT OF A STREET OVERPASS OF THE HIGHWAY, 12.1 M WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE SOUTH-WESTBOUND LANES OF THE HIGHWAY, 3.3 M NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE OVERPASS, AND 1.3 M ABOVE THE LEVEL OF THE HIGHWAY. NOTE--THE MARK IS ON THE HIGHWAY RIGHT-OF-WAY.

markers.description: BY RLDA SURVEYING AND MAPPING 2010 (RLD) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 6.9 MI (11.1 KM) SOUTHEAST OF ANGELES, 5.3 MI (8.5 KM) SOUTHWEST OF LA PLAYA, 4.3 MI (6.9 KM) NORTH OF ADJUNTAS AND 2.9 MI (4.7 KM) SOUTH OF UTUADO, PUERTO RICO.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF PR-135 AND PR-123 1.5 MI (2.4 KM) NORTHWEST OF ADJUNTAS, GO NORTHERLY ON PR-123 FOR 6.3 MI (10.1 KM) TO THE MONUMENT ON THE RIGHT.   THE STATION IS 33.82 M (111.0 FT) NORTHEAST OF POWER POLE, 28.84 M (94.6 FT) SOUTHEAST OF KM POST 47.6, 27.00 M (88.6 FT) SOUTHEAST OF POWER POLE, 15.63 M (51.3 FT) SOUTH OF A POWER POLE AND 5.86 M (19.2 FT) EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF PR-123.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) NOTE--THIS STATION IS LOCATED IN A GUNNERY RANGE.  PERMISSION MUST BE OBTAINED FROM THE U.S. NAVY OBSERVATION POST ON CULEBRA ISLAND BEFORE VISITING THE STATION.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3 MILES NORTHWEST OF CULEBRA AND ON A POINT ON THE NORTHWEST-SOUTHEAST RIDGE THAT RUNS THE LENGTH OF FLAMENCO PENINSULA.  THIS IS THE HIGHEST POINT IN THE IMMEDIATE VICINITY BUT IT IS NOT THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE RIDGE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN CULEBRA, GO EASTERLY FOR 0.05 MILE TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK FOR 0.05 MILE TO A REVERSE Y-FORK.  BEAR LEFT AND GO NORTHEASTERLY FOR 0.5 MILE TO A Y-FORK, JUST BEFORE REACHING THE AIRPORT.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO NORTHERLY FOR 1.0 MILE TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO NORTHWESTERLY FOR 0.4 MILE TO A GATE.  PASS THROUGH THE GATE, KEEP RIGHT AND CONTINUE NORTHWESTERLY FOR 0.5 MILE TO A LOCKED GATE.  (A KEY FOR THE GATE MAY BE OBTAINED AT THE U.S. NAVY OBSERVATION POST.) PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND KEEPING TO THE RIGHT OF A BEACH HOUSE GO NORTHWESTERLY FOR 2.0 MILES TO THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  PACK WESTERLY UP A GRASSY, ROCKY SLOPE FOR ABOUT 50 YARDS TO THE TOP OF THE RIDGE AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK, STAMPED EAKIN 1966, IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A BOULDER THAT PROJECTS 8 INCHES.  IT IS 32 FEET EAST OF A 4-INCH STEEL POLE THAT PROJECTS 12 FEET.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, STAMPED EAKIN NO 1 1966, IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A BOULDER THAT PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  IT IS 49 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE 4-INCH STEEL POLE THAT PROJECTS 12 FEET.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, STAMPED EAKIN NO 2 1966, IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A BOULDER THAT PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  IT IS 43 FEET SOUTH OF THE 4-INCH STEEL POLE THAT PROJECTS 12 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1993)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE 1993 (BR) FOUND IN DENSE BRUSH THICKET WHICH WAS CLEARED OUT.  GPS VISIBILITY EXCELLENT.  PREVIOUS DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE EXCEPT THE 4 INCH STEEL POLE WAS NOT FOUND.  STATION USED FOR GPS SURVEY.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 2004 (UPR) MARK NOT FOUND.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (WCH) THIS STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THE RATHER LOW HEADLAND FORMING THE EASTERN END OF VIEQUES ISLAND AND SEPARATED FROM THE MAIN BODY OF THE ISLAND BY A LOW NECK.  IT IS NEARER THE HIGH CLIFFS ON THE N SIDE OF THE SLOPE TO THE S BEING MORE GRADUAL.  A BED OF LAVA COVERS THE SURFACE, BUT THERE IS A DENSE GROWTH OF LOW BUSHES, PALMETTO, ETC.  MARKED BY AN IRON PIPE SET IN A HOLE CUT THROUGH THE LAVA HERE ABOUT 6 INCHES THICK AND SECURED WITH CEMENT.  THE STATION CAN BE REACHED EITHER FROM A SMALL COVE ON THE S SHORE OR, BETTER, FROM A SAND BEACH IN LARGE COVE ON N SHORE NEARLY CLOSED BY A CORAL REEF.  A QUADRUPED SIGNAL WITH 30-FOOT LEGS WAS BUILT HERE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1907)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1907 (PAW) STATION MARK RECOVERED AND NEW SIGNAL ERECTED.  THE BEST PLACE FOR LANDING WAS FOUND TO BE UPON THE N SHORE.  ENTERING THE COVE NEAR THE WESTERN END OF BIGHT.  MODERATELY SMOOTH SEA IS REQUIRED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1918)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1918 (OWS) AS STATION WAS DIFFICULT TO RECOVER THE FOLLOWING DESCRIPTION WILL HELP RECOVERY IN THE FUTURE--  IT IS MARKED BY AN IRON PIPE 2-INCH BORE, HELD IN PLACE BY PURE CEMENT ABOUT 6 INCHES WIDE.  PIPE IS OPEN, APPARENTLY 14 INCHES DEEP AND PROJECTS ABOUT 1 INCH ABOVE THE FLAT LAVA OUTCROP WHICH SURROUNDS IT.  A MOUND OF BROKEN LAVA ROCK 2 FEET HIGH, 3 FEET IN DIAMETER WAS PLACED AROUND THE MARK.  A QUADRIPOD SCAFFOLD AND TRIPOD FOR INSTRUMENT 30-FEET HIGH WAS ERECTED HERE.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON A TRAIL LEADING FROM THE VILLAGE OF SALINA TO THE SE END OF THE ISLAND WHERE A FISHING BANK EXISTS.  A LANDING WAS MADE AT SALINA, BUT AS THE DISTANCE IS MORE THAN 3 MILES, A SMALL COVE, NEARLY CLOSED BY A REEF, CAN BE ENTERED BY A SMALL PASSAGE WHICH IS CLOSE TO THE WESTERN POINT OF THE COVE.  COVE IS LAST ONE ON N SIDE OF ISLAND.  WITNESS MARK NO.1 IS REGULATION REFERENCE MARK PUT IN TOP OF 4- BY 4-INCH POST, DRIVEN 3 FEET IN GROUND, PROJECTING ABOUT 1 FOOT ABOVE THE SURFACE, IS 129 FEET FROM STATION AND 11 FEET FROM CLIFF IN LINE WITH MOST WESTERLY HIGHEST PEAK ON CULEBRA ISLAND.  SAVANNA TO REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS 299 DEG 51 MIN.  WITNESS MARK NO.2 IS SIMILAR TO NO.1, BUT ON LINE WITH CULEBRITA LIGHTHOUSE, DISTANCE 146 FEET FROM STATION AND 29 FEET FROM CLIFF.  SAVANNA TO REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS 331 DEG 45 MIN.  A ROMAN NUMERAL I IS CHISELED ON NO.1 AND II ON NO.2.  BOTH POSTS ARE SURROUNDED BY ROCKS AND EARTH TO FORM A MOUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1923)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1923 (FTS) DESCRIPTION OF STATION AS FURNISHED BY O.W.S. IS AMPLE.  STATION MARK IN GOOD CONDITION.  SURROUNDED BY A CAIRN OF CORAL ROCKS.  SIGNAL ERECTED IN 1918 HAS FALLEN TO WESTWARD OF STATION.  WITNESS MARKS DESTROYED.  STATION MARK, WHICH IS A 2-INCH IRON PIPE HAD NOT BEEN TAMPERED WITH, AS IT IS SECURELY EMBEDDED INTO THE CORAL ROCK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1941 STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE STATION CAN BE REACHED BY AUTOMOBILE ALONG THE NORTH COAST ROAD FROM ISABEL II.                            STATION RECOVERY (1955)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1955 (CAS) STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE STATION MAY BE REACHED BY A FOUR WHEEL DRIVE VEHICLE BY ROAD FROM THE TOWN OF ISABEL.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JMC) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  CAN BE DRIVEN TO FROM CAMP GARCIA THROUGH IMPACT AREA WITH 4 WHEEL DRIVE VEHICLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (MTP) STATION FOUND AS DESCRIBED WITH ONE ADDITION.  STATION IS ABOUT (8) EIGHT FEET SOUTH OF DIRT ROAD AND 1000 FEET WEST OF LIGHT AT END OF ISLAND.  STATION LOCATED IN IMPACT AREA OF CAMP GARCIA BOMBING RANGE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION MARK WAS FOUND AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE NOT FOUND.  REFERENCE MARKS 3 AND 4 WERE ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE.  A NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 13 MILES EAST OF CAMP GARCIA, 0.35 MILE WEST OF A SHORE LIGHT WHICH SETS ATOP A 20 FOOT STEEL TRUSS- WORK STRUCTURE, ON THE HIGH POINT OF A LOW HEADLAND WHICH FORMS THE EASTERN END OF VIEQUES ISLAND AND 150 FEET SOUTH OF A SHEER CLIFF.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE S 3 HEADQUARTERS AT CAMP GARCIA, GO EAST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 1.4 MILES TO A FORK JUST AFTER REACHING THE END OF THE PAVED ROAD.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE EASTERLY ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND CONTINUE EAST ON A DIRT ROAD FOR 0.4 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND CONTINUE EASTERLY ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 1.2 MILES TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE EASTERLY ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 1.8 MILES TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE EASTERLY ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 1.1 MILES TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE EASTERLY ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.9 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE EASTERLY ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO A FORK. TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND CONTINUE EASTERLY ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 3.0 MILES TO A FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND CONTINUE EASTERLY ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH AND EAST ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO EAST ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO EASTERLY ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.85 MILE TO A CROSSROADS.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD, EAST, ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 1.2 MILES TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE EAST ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.6 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT, SOUTH SIDE OF THE TRACK ROAD.  THE STATION MARK IS A 2-INCH OPEN TOP IRON PIPE SET IN CORAL ROCK AND IS SURROUNDED WITH CEMENT.  IT PROJECTS 1 INCH AND IS 17 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE TRACK ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED EAST END NO 3 1900, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A ROCK OUTCROP THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  IT IS 19 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE TRACK ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 4 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED EAST END NO 4 1900, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A ROCK OUTCROP THAT PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  IT IS LOCATED APPROXIMATELY IN THE CENTER OF THE TRACK ROAD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US MARINE CORPS 1970 STATION RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  STATION IS NOW MARKED BY A TRIPOD CONSTRUCTED OF 2-1/2 INCH STEEL PIPE PAINTED RED AND WHITE.  THE TRIPOD SITS DIRECTLY OVER THE STATION WITH A HEIGHT OF APPROXIMATELY 18 FEET AND LEGS EMBEDDED IN CONCRETE POURED INTO THE ROCK.  RM NO. 4 IS LOCATED IN A ROCK APPROXIMATELY 3 FEET IN DIAMETER IN CENTER OF ROAD.  DISTANCE FROM RM TO STATION IS 17.3 FEET ON A MAGNETIC AZIMUTH OF 177 DEGREES.
markers.setting: OBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (WCH) STATION IS A LEDGE OF DARK ROCK LYING E OF PUERTO RICO, AND NW OF PORT MULA.  THE WORD PIRAGUA MEANS A KIND OF LARGE CANOE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE.

BY RLDA SURVEYING AND MAPPING 2008 THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2.02 MI (3.3 KM) SOUTHWEST OF LA SOLEDAD, 1.86 MI (3.0 KM) SOUTHEAST OF MANI AND 1.41 MI (2.3 KM) NORTHWEST OF MAYAGUEZ AND ON THE WEST SIDE OF PR 2 AND NORTH OF PR 102.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF PR 2 AND PR 102 IN MAYAGUEZ GO NORTH INTO THE GRASS MEDIAN AT THE INTERSECTION AS DESCRIBED.   THE STATION IS A STANDARD NGS DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT LOCATED 52.41 M (171.9 FT) EAST OFF THE WESTERN CORNER OF TRIANGLE MEDIAN, 29.02 M (95.2 FT) SOUTH OF THE EXIT ROAD TO PR 102 WEST, 27.10 M (88.9 FT) NORTH OF THE CENTER OF PR 102 TO PR 2, 22.88 M (75.1 FT) NORTH OF THE EAST CURB OF CONCRETE AROUND MEDIAN, 22.15 M (72.7 FT) SOUTH OF THE NORTH CORNER OF TRIANGLE MEDIAN, 15.99 M (52.5 FT) NORTHWEST OF A POWER POLE, 15.50 M (50.9 FT) SOUTH OF A ROAD SIGN, 10.69 M (35.1 FT) WEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF PR 2 SOUTHBOUND LANE AND 6.5 M (21.3 FT) WEST OF THE CONCRETE CURB AROUND MEDIAN.                            STATION RECOVERY (2009)  RECOVERY NOTE BY RLDA SURVEYING AND MAPPING 2009 (RLD) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2.02 MI (3.3 KM) SOUTHWEST OF LA SOLEDAD, 1.86 MI (3.0 KM) SOUTHEAST OF MANI AND 1.41 MI (2.3 KM) NORTHWEST OF MAYAGUEZ AND ON THE WEST SIDE OF PR-2 AND NORTH OF PR-102.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF PR-2 AND PR-102 IN MAYAGUEZ GO NORTH INTO THE GRASS MEDIAN AT THE INTERSECTION AS DESCRIBED.    THE STATION IS A STANDARD NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT LOCATED 52.41 M (171.9 FT) EAST OFF THE WESTERN CORNER OF TRIANGLE MEDIAN, 29.02 M (95.2 FT) SOUTH OF THE EXIT ROAD TO PR-102 WEST, 27.10 M (88.9 FT) NORTH OF THE CENTER OF PR-102 TO PR-2, 22.88 M (75.1 FT) NORTH OF THE EAST CURB OF CONCRETE AROUND MEDIAN, 22.15 M (72.7 FT) SOUTH OF THE NORTH CORNER OF TRIANGLE MEDIAN, 15.99 M (52.5 FT) NORTHWEST OF A POWER POLE, 15.50 M (50.9 FT) SOUTH OF A ROAD SIGN, 10.69 M (35.1 FT) WEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF PR-2 SOUTHBOUND LANE AND 6.5 M (21.3 FT) WEST OF THE CONCRETE CURB AROUND MEDIAN.

markers.description: BY RLDA SURVEYING AND MAPPING 2008 (RLD) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 9.9 MI (15.9 KM) SOUTHEAST OF LAJAS, 7.1 MI (11.4 KM) NORTHEAST OF LA PARGUERA, 1.6 MI (2.6 KM) SOUTHWEST OF FUIG AND 0.5 MI (0.8 KM) SOUTHWEST OF GUANICA.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF PR-116 AND PR-3116 ABOUT 0.8 MI (1.3 KM) EAST OF GUANICA, GO WEST ON PR-116 FOR 1.30 MI (2.1 KM) TO THE TOP OF HILL AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT SET IN ROCK AS DESCRIBED.   THE MARK IS 30.63 M (100.5 FT) SOUTHEAST OF KM POST 18.7 WHICH IS ON THE NORTH SIDE OF PR-116, 14.10 M (46.3 FT) SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER LINE OF PR-116, 6.72 M (22.0 FT) SOUTHWEST OF THE WHITE LINE OF EDGE OF PR-116 AND 0.75 M (2.5 FT) NORTHEAST OF THE ROCK WALL CUTOUT.

markers.description: BY JAVIER E. BIDOT AND ASSOC. 2008 (CFA) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE NORTHEAST SECTION OF YABUCOA AT KILOMETER POST 40.8 ON TOP OF BRIDGE DECK ALONG PR-53 SOUTHBOUND SHOULDER.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF STATE ROAD PR-30 AND PR-53 IN HUMACAO, DRIVE 4.4 MI (7.1 KM) SOUTH ON PR-53 TO THE MARK ON THE RIGHT.   THE STATION IS A BRONZE DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE FLUSH WITH SURROUNDING CONCRETE, 6.40 M (21.0 FT) NORTHWEST OF MEDIAN CONCRETE PARAPET, 2.03 M (6.7 FT) SOUTH OF ALUMINUM LIGHT POLE AND 0.61 M (2.0 FT) SOUTHEAST OF SOUTHBOUND LANE SHOULDER CONCRETE PARAPET.   OWNERSHIP--PRHTA RIGHT-OF-WAY.
