markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1939 LOCATED ON TOP OF THE S END OF A RIDGE OF HILLS ABOUT 1 KM. E OF RD. NO. -- (VEGA-BAJA-MOROVIA RD.) AT ITS KM. 8, ON W LIMIT OF PROPERTY OF PABLO EGUIA.  IT IS APPROACHED FROM RD. NO. -- BY HARD SURFACE FARM RD. STARTING E FROM KM 8.8, FOLLOW UP HILL TO SWING DOORS, KEEPING STRAIGHT (E) AT T-RD. FORK, FOLLOW WINDING DOWN ALONG N FOOT OF LOW RIDGE, THEN UP ACROSS SADDLE, THEN ALMOST NE TO TWO-STORY FARM HOUSE.  KEEP LEFT AT FIRST AND SECOND FORK AFTER HOUSE, REACH CANE DERRICK BETWEEN TWO HOUSES WHERE YOU WILL MEET AN X-CROSSING FOLLOWED IMMEDIATELY BY Y-FORK TO N, TAKE LEFT BRANCH OF Y, KEEP STRAIGHT (N) AT NEXT X-CROSSING UNTIL THE RD. TOUCHES FOOT OF RIDGE E OF SADDLE.  CLIMB THROUGH BRUSH TO S TOP AND STATION.  STATION MARK--STANDARD TABLET STAMPED EGUIA 1939 COUNTER SUNK ON TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT 8- BY 10- BY 30-INCHES WITH AN ALMOST CIRCULAR CROWN OF 12-INCH DIAMETER.  SIGNAL--2- BY 2-INCH SAWED LUMBER POLE 14 FT. HIGH WITH BLACK AND WHITE TARGETS, CENTERED OVER STATION MARK.  R. M. NO. 1--4.93 METERS WIRE NAILED ON CENIZO TREE.  R. M. NO. 2--2.43 METERS WIRE NAIL ON PENDALA TREE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (GBG) LOCATED ON THE S END OF A BRUSHY RIDGE, ABOUT A KILOMETER E OF THE VEGA BAJA-MOROVIS ROAD, ON PROPERTY OF PABLO EGUIA.  THIS HILL IS ABOUT 8 KILOMETERS S OF VEGA BAJA.  THE STATION IS ON THE TOP OF A ROUNDED HILL, COVERED WITH WEEDS AND BRUSH.  AND IS MARKED BY A STANDARD DISK STAMPED EGUIA 1939, SET IN TOP OF ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT, PROJECTING 8 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A WIRE NAIL IN CENIZO TREE, 4.93 METERS DISTANT.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A WIRE NAIL IN PENDALA TREE, 2.43 METERS DISTANT.  TO REACH FROM VEGA BAJA.  GO E ON ROAD 2, 1.1 MILES TO FORK OF MOROVIS ROAD S.  RUN S 5.0 MILES TO KM. POST 8.8.  AND TURN E PASSING GATE AT 0.15 MILE.  AT 0.9 MILE TURN E.  AND GO 0.85 MILE TO FORK.  KEEP STRAIGHT AHEAD, REACHING CANE DERRICK 0.35 MILE BEYOND, WHERE, BEAR LEFT ON Y-FORK.  LEAVE CAR 0.3 MILE BEYOND HERE.  AND PROCEED LEFT THROUGH NARROW PART OF CANE FIELD, AND UP HILL TO STATION ON THE SOUTHERLY SUMMIT.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (JBB) STATION IS SITUATED ON THE VERY PROMINENT HILL IN THE EASTERN PART OF CULEBRA ISLAND, ABOUT 2/3 MILE NW OF MANGROVE HARBOR, LOCALLY KNOWN BY THE SAME NAME, BUT CALLED DOLPHIN HEAD, ELEVATION 550 FEET.  THE STATION WAS SOME 80 METERS BACK FROM THE SE END OF THE HILL AND WAS MARKED BY A NAIL IN A SUBSTANTIAL WOODEN STUB.  A TRIPOD SIGNAL WAS ERECTED OVER THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1900)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (WCH) STATION IS A TRIPOD SIGNAL ON THE BROW OF THE HIGH HILL CALLED DOLPHIN HEAD.  SIGNAL PUT UP BY ASSISTANT BOUTELLE.  MARKED BY MY PARTY WITH IRON PIPE AND CEMENT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1905)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1905 (RLF) SIGNAL STILL STANDING OVER THIS STATION, APPARENTLY IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1922)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1922 (FTS) STATION RECOVERED READILY FROM DESCRIPTION.  MARK IN GOOD CONDITION.  HAD NOT BEEN DISTURBED.  TOP OF HILL SOMEWHAT THICKLY COVERED WITH UNDERBRUSH.  STATION IS NOT EXPOSED TO PREYING NATIVES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (MTP) THE TRIANGULATION STATION WAS RECOVERED.  TO REACH THE STATION DRIVE ALONG THE DIRT ROAD LEADING NORTHEAST FROM POINT CABRAS ON ENSENADA HONDA TOWARD DUCK POINT ON THE NORTH SHORE OF CULEBRA ISLAND.  FROM EL BALCONS CLOSEST POINT TO THE ROAD, HIKE APPROXIMATELY 0.6 MILE TO THE SUMMIT, THE HIGHEST, MOST PROMINENT HILL ON THE EASTERN END OF THE ISLAND.  THE STATION MARK WAS A CROSS INSCRIBED INSIDE A 1-1/2 IN EQUILATERAL TRIANGLE WHICH WAS ETCHED IN A 9 IN BY 9 IN CONCRETE PAD, 3 IN THICK.  THE CONCRETE PAD WAS CEMENTED IN A CREVASSE RUNNING IN A EAST-NORTHEAST DIRECTION ACROSS A 7 FT BY 10 FT BY 2 FT HIGH BOULDER SITUATED ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE PEAK.  A UNITED STATES MARINE CORP MARKER WAS FOUND 33 FT EAST FROM THE TRIANGULATION STATION.  THE NAME LEECH AND THE COORDINATES 69,202.2, 11,064.9 WERE INSCRIBED IN THE TOP OF A 2 IN DIAMETER IRON DISK.  THE DISK WAS LYING LOOSE IN A DRILL HOLE ON TOP OF A 5 FT. BY 5 FT. BY 3 FT. HIGH BOULDER.  NO REFERENCE MARK DISKS WERE FOUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) A THOROUGH SEARCH WAS MADE BUT THE MARK WAS NOT RECOVERED.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1941 V.A. ELEVATION 139.17 METERS.  IN THE NORTHWEST PART OF VIEQUES ISLAND ABOUT 3-1/2 KMS. SE OF PUNTA ARENAS, 1-1/2 KMS. NE OF MT. PIRATA AND 1-1/2 KMS. SOUTH OF THE NORTH COAST ON A LONE BRUSHY RIDGE KNOWN AS EL BUEY.  THERE ARE THREE TOPS ON THIS RIDGE, THE STATION BEING ON THE MIDDLE TOP.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD TABLET STAMPED EL BUEY AND SET IN THE ROCK NEAR THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IN SETTING THIS TABLET THE ROCK WAS CUT AWAY ABOUT 3 INCHES BELOW TOP.  R.M. NO. 1 IS A CHISELED CROSS ON A ROCK.  DISTANCE FROM STATION--3.22 METERS.  PLANCE AZIMUTH 266-48.  R.M. NO. 2 IS A CHISELED CROSS ON THE TOP OF A ROCK WHICH IS ABOUT 2 FT. BELOW THE TOP OF THE HILL.  DISTANCE FROM STATION-- 5.74 METERS.  PLANE AZIMUTH 341-32.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) THIS STATION WAS RECOVERED BUT NOT THE R.M.S WHICH WERE SEARCHED FOR AS DESCRIBED.  A NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE NORTHWESTERN PART OF VIEQUES IN AN AREA KNOWN AS N.A.D. (NAVAL AMMUNITION DUMP).  THE STATION IS ON A RIDGE OF HILLS JUST EAST OF THE MOST WESTERLY RIDGE (MT. PIRUTA).  THE HILL WITH THE STATION IS MADE OF 3 TOPS, THE MIDDLE ONE BEING THE HIGHEST AND ALSO CONTAINING THE STATION.  TO REACH STATION START BEHIND BUILDING 4PS20, GOING EASTERLY ON DIRT ROAD WITH JEEP, GO THROUGH COW PASTURE AND CONTINUE UP MOUNTAIN UNTIL ROAD REACHES TOP AND STARTS DOWN.  WALK SOUTHERLY ALONG TRAIL ON RIDGE UNTIL YOU REACH MIDDLE OR SECOND TOP.  THE STATION IS IN THE MIDDLE OF TRAIL IN A ROCK THAT HAS BEEN CUT OUT TO ACCEPT MARK.  STATION IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED EL BUEY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JMC) STATION AND RM 1 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  RM 2 DESTROYED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1967)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1967 (SCM) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE REFERENCE MARKS WERE NOT SEARCHED FOR.  A NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 10 MILES SOUTHWEST OF ISABEL SEGUNDA ON THE WESTERN PART OF VIEQUES ISLAND.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POLICE STATION AT THE PLAZA IN THE CENTER OF ISABEL SEGUNDA, PROCEED SOUTH FOR ONE BLOCK AND TURN LEFT AND GO EAST FOR ONE BLOCK, TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH FOR 0.25 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.10 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE WESTERLY ON THE MAIN ROAD BETWEEN ISABEL SEGUNDA AND PT. ARANAS FOR 0.50 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT FOR 0.20 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  CONTINUE WESTERLY ON MAIN ROAD FOR 0.50 MILE TO CROSSROADS.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.8 MILE TO THE JOB CORPS CENTER ON LEFT AND CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 1.35 MILES TO THE EAST END OF THE RUNWAY OF THE NEW VIEQUES AIRPORT ON THE RIGHT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.50 MILE TO A FARM ROAD LEFT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.75 MILE TO A MILEPOST (K7H3) AND FARM ROAD LEFT AND A CORRAL ON LEFT.  CONTINUE WESTERLY FOR 0.30 MILES TO THE MAIN GATE OF U. S. NAVAL AMMUNITION FACILITY.  PASS THROUGH GATE AND CONTINUE WESTERLY FOR 0.50 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT. CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.60 MILE AND SIDE ROAD LEFT. CONTINUE WESTERLY FOR 0.10 MILE TO SIDE ROAD LEFT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.25 MILE AND SIDE ROAD LEFT LEADING TO THE U.S. NAVAL AMMUNITION FACILITY MOTOR POOL.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 1.15 MILES TO A CROSSROADS. TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH FOR 0.15 MILES TO THE HEADQUARTERS OF U. S. NAVAL AMMUNITION FACILITY ON RIGHT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.05 MILES TO CROSSROADS.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD GOING LEFT OF BUILDING 4SH5.  PROCEED ALONG ROAD BEHIND AMMUNITION MAGAZINES FOR 0.85 MILE TO MAGAZINE 4PC 19 ON THE RIGHT.  CONTINUE ON ROAD FOR 0.10 MILES DUE NORTH OF MAGAZINE 4PC 20 AND DIM TRACK ROAD LEFT. TURN LEFT ONTO DIM TRACK ROAD AND PROCEED FOR 0.60 MILE NORTH THROUGH PASTURE AND AROUND THE NORTH AND EAST FACES OF HILL TO TOP OF HILL AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  PROCEED EASTERLY ALONG RIDGE LINE FOR ABOUT 75 YARDS TO THE HIGHEST AND MIDDLE OF THREE PROMINENT NOBS OF HILL AND STATION.  THE STATION, A STANDARD U. S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY BENCH MARK DISK, IS SET IN A 4-INCH DEPRESSION IN ROCK OUTCROP ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE HILL.  THE STATION IS STAMPED EL BUEY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US MARINE CORPS 1970 STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 4 MILES NORTHEAST OF PONCE AND AT THE NORTH EDGE OF THE EL MONTE HOUSING PROJECT.  THE TANK IS A ROUND, STEEL STRUCTURE, SILVER IN COLOR, SUPPORTED BY A LARGE STEEL PIPE AND IT IS ABOUT 35 FEET HIGH.  POINT INTERSECTED IS THE VENT ATOP AND CENTER OF THE TANK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (PDC) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1982)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1982 (JCL) THE STATION, EL MONTE MUNICIPAL TANK, WAS RECOVERED AS PREVIOUSLY DESCRIBED.

BY ANDREGG INCORPORATED 1995 (DJR) THE STATION IS AT THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS PR 153 AND PR 52  THE STATION IS IN GRASS MEDIAN NORTHWEST OF JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS PR 153 AND PR 52 NEAR THE WEST END OF THE ON-RAMP FROM SOUTH-BOUND HIGHWAY PR 153 TO WEST-BOUND HIGHWAY PR 52.  THE STATION IS 4 METERS (13.1 FT) SOUTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF ON-RAMP PAVEMENT, 2.8 METERS (9.2 FT) NORTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF PAVEMENT OF WEST-BOUND HIGHWAY PR 52, 1.4 METERS (4.6 FT) SOUTH OF ON-RAMP GUARD RAIL, 1.7 METERS (5.6 FT) NORTH OF HIGHWAY PR 52 GUARD RAIL, AND 8.5 EAST OF END OF GUARD RAILS  THE STATION IS 1 METER (3.3 FT) SOUTH OF A CARSONITE SURVEY MARKER WITNESS POST  THE STATION IS A 3-1/4 INCH BRASS CAP STAMPED CENTRO DE RECAUDACION DE INGRESSOS MUNICIPALES, PUERTO RICO GPS CONTROL, C.R.I.M., UNLAWFUL TO DISTURB, EL OJO, SET ATOP A 9/16 INCH STAINLESS STEEL ROD DRIVEN TO REFUSAL AND COVERED FLUSH WITH THE GROUND BY AN ALUMINUM COVER EPOXYED ONTO A 6 INCH SCHEDULE 40 PVC PIPE SET IN CONCRETE INSIDE AND OUT                            STATION RECOVERY (2002)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2002 (JMW) 0.2 KM (0.1 MI) WESTERLY ALONG PR 52 FROM THE JUNCTION OF PR 153 ABOUT 6.0 KM (3.7 MI) NORTH OF SANTA ISABEL, ABOUT 17.5 KM (10.9 MI) EAST OF THE SECOND PR 52 TOLL BOOTH EAST OF PONCE, NEAR THE TOP OF THE PR 153 ON-RAMP LEADING TO WESTBOUND PR 52, 9.2 M (30.2 FT) NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE WESTBOUND HIGHWAY, 6.6 M (21.7 FT) SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF THE RAMP, 1.7 M (5.6 FT) NORTHWEST OF THE WEST END OF A GUARDRAIL AND 0.6 M (2.0 FT) NORTH OF THE GUARDRAIL.  NOTE-THE MARK IS ON THE HIGHWAY RIGHT-OF-WAY.                            STATION RECOVERY (2002)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2002 (JMW) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (2009)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2009 (NMD) NO COVER, BUT MARK IS GOOD. MARQTEK ENGINEERING.                            STATION RECOVERY (2016)  RECOVERY NOTE BY ATKINS NORTH AMERICA INC 2016 (DWD) THIS MARK WAS RECOVERED IN CONJUNCTION WITH A TOPOGRAPHIC SURVEY OF FORT ALLEN TRAINING ANNEX, PUERTO RICO ARMY NATIONAL GUARD BASE 100050899 0101L
markers.setting: STAINLESS STEEL ROD W/O SLEEVE (10 FT.+)
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY US ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1-3/4 MILES NORTH-NORTHEAST OF CULEBRA, 3/4 MILE SOUTH OF POINT RESACA AND ON THE HIGHEST POINT ON A BRUSH AND TREE COVERED MOUNTAIN THAT IS THE HIGHEST POINT ON CULEBRA ISLAND.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN CULEBRA, GO EASTERLY FOR 0.05 MILE TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK FOR 0.05 MILE TO A REVERSE Y-FORK.  BEAR LEFT AND GO NORTHEASTERLY FOR 0.5 MILE TO A Y-FORK, JUST BEFORE REACHING THE AIRPORT.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO EASTERLY ON THE SURFACED AND DIRT ROAD FOR 1.9 MILES TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK FOR 0.1 MILE TO A Y-FORK AND SIGN FRAIL SAN ISORO.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO NORTHERLY ON THE SURFACED AND DIRT ROAD FOR 1.0 MILE TO A GATE.  PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND CONTINUE NORTH FOR 0.05 MILE TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO NORTHWESTERLY FOR 0.2 MILE TO A GATE AND THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  PACK WESTERLY ALONG THE NORTH SIDE OF A FENCE FOR ABOUT 1/4 MILE TO A POINT WHERE THE FENCE BEARS TO THE LEFT.  CONTINUE WESTERLY ON A WELL-DEFINED TRAIL FOR ABOUT 1/2 MILE, PASSING ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE FIRST KNOB, ACROSS THE TOP OF THE SECOND KNOB TO THE TOP OF THE THIRD AND HIGHEST KNOB AND THE STATION.  A 3/4 HOUR PACK.  THE STATION MARK IS AN X-ED COPPER PIN SET IN THE TOP AND NEAR THE SOUTH EDGE OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  EL VIGIA USED IS INSCRIBED IN THE CONCRETE.  THE MARK SETS ATOP A PILE OF BOULDERS THAT ARE LOOSELY CEMENTED TOGETHER.  THE PILE OF BOULDERS PROJECT ABOUT 5 FEET.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, STAMPED EL VIGIA USED NO 1 1966, IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A BOULDER THAT PROJECTS 3 FEET.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS A 1-1/2 INCH IRON PIPE EMBEDDED IN THE GROUND AND IT PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 3, STAMPED RESACA 1914 1966, IS A STANDARD STATION DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A LARGE FLAT BOULDER THAT PROJECTS 2 FEET.  (NOTE--A NUMERAL 2 SHOULD ALSO BE STAMPED ON THE DISK BUT IT WAS INADVERTENTLY LEFT OFF.)
markers.setting: UNSPECIFIED SETTING

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) AN IRON PIPE OF THE TYPE USED AT THE TIME OF THE ESTABLISHING OF THIS STATION WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN FAIR CONDITION.  DUE TO THE VAGUENESS OF THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IT COULD NOT BE DETERMINED IF THIS WAS THE ORIGINAL MARK OR NOT.  DUE TO THE TYPE OF PIPE AND ITS CONDITION IT WAS ASSUMED THE ORIGINAL MARK HAD BEEN RECOVERED.  THIS MARK WAS USED AS A REFERENCE MARK FOR EL VIGIA (USE).  THE STATION MARK IS A 1-1/2 INCH IRON PIPE EMBEDDED IN THE GROUND AND IT PROJECTS 2 INCHES.
PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1939 THIS AUXILARY STATION WAS ESTABLISHED TO SUPPLEMENT CONTROL ON THE SE CORNER OF THE RIO GRANDE QD.  IT IS ABOUT 3 KMS. SE OF THE TOWN OF RIO GRANDE AND ABOUT A KILOMETER S OF ROAD AT KM. 29.3 ON LAND OWNED BY FRANCISCO FUSTER.  APPROACHED FROM KM 29.3 OF RD 3 BY ENTRANCE TO COLONIA BLASINA OF THE FAJARDO SUGAR CO. PASSING FARM HOUSE AND DERRICK, FOLLOW UP DRAW BY TRAIL, CROSS DRAIN THEN CLIMB TO LONG SADDLE AND FARM HOUSE OF FUSTER.  TOP AND STATION ARE ABOUT 125 METERS S OF HOUSE. HILL IS THIRD FROM N OF RIDGE RUNNING S FROM ROAD.  PLACE IS KNOWN AS EL ZARAL.  STATION MARK--R.R. SPIKE CEMENTED TO TOP OF ROUND FLATTENED BOULDER ON TOP OF HILL.
markers.setting: SET IN A BOULDER
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS SITUATED ON A HILL 1 MILE N 7 DEG W OF THE CHURCH TOWER OF THE TOWN OF MANATI.  IT IS ON LAND BELONGING TO JOSE RIVERA MIRANDA.  THE HILL IS A ROUND KNOLL ABOUT 350 FEET IN HEIGHT AND COVERED WITH BRUSH AND TREES.  STATION IS MARKED BY AN IRON ROD ON CONCRETE BASE PLACED AS NEAR AS POSSIBLE TO THE OLD POSITION OF STATION ELABRA.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1, IS A STANDARD U.S.G.S. NAIL AND WASHER NAILED TO CENTER OF TRIANGLE BLAZED ON LAUREL TREE 18 CENTIMETERS IN DIAMETER, 1.40 METERS ABOVE GROUND, W OF N OF STATION, DISTANT 11.12 METERS, IN TRUE AZIMUTH 188 DEG 49 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2, IS A STANDARD U.S.G.S. WASHER AND WIRE NAIL ON TRIANGLE BLAZED ON A GUAYABOTE TREE 30 CENTIMETERS IN DIAMETER, 1.50 METERS ABOVE GROUND, 15.26 METERS (HORIZONTAL) E OF STATION, IN TRUE AZIMUTH 224 DEG 42 MIN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (GBG) SITUATED ON A HILL 1 MILE N 70 DEG W OF THE CHURCH TOWER IN MANATI.  ON LAND BELONGING TO J. RIVERA CHAVEZ.  THE HILL IS A ROUND KNOLL ABOUT 350 FEET HIGH, AND COVERED WITH BRUSH AND TREES.  THE STATION IS ON ABOUT THE HIGHEST PART.  THERE ARE MANY ROCKS AND OUTCROPS OF THE CORAL LIMESTONE ON THE TOP.  THE STATION IS AT THE APPROXIMATE LOCATION OF STATION ELABRA (1901) U.S.C. AND G.S., WHICH WAS NOT RECOVERED IN 1934.  IN 1941 IT WAS REMARKED BY A TABLET STAMPED ELABRA 2 1934, WHICH WAS CENTERED OVER THE IRON ROD OF 1934, AND EMBEDDED IN CEMENT BUILT UP AROUND IT.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 (1934) NOT FOUND.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 (1934) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED. I.E. U.S.G.S. WASHER AND WIRE NAIL ON TRIANGLE BLAZED ON 30-INCH GUAYABOTE TREE 1.50 METERS ABOVE GROUND.  15.26 METERS (HORIZONTAL) FROM STATION IN AZIMUTH 224 DEG 42 MIN.  TO REACH FROM MANATI, TAKE ROAD TO RAILROAD STATION TO NEW MAIN HIGHWAY E AND W.  TURN E, AND GO TO FIRST GRAVEL ROAD WHICH GOES N ACROSS RAILROAD--ABOUT 0.3 MILE E OF STATION.  CROSS RAILROAD ON THIS ROAD AND CONTINUE 0.3 MILE TO T-ROAD FORK.  LEAVE CAR AND TAKE ROAD W DOWNHILL ABOUT 80 METERS TO TRAIL FORK N.  GO ON TRAIL N ABOUT 125 METERS, CROSSING GAP, AND GOING DOWN DRAIN PAST POND.  TURN W (LEFT) AND FOLLOW TRAIL DOWN.  TURN RIGHT ALONG FENCE JUST E OF HOUSE OF PEDRO SILVA.  AND BEAR AGAIN RIGHT UP LONG DRAIN (E) TO BASE OF HILL.  TURN N (LEFT) UPHILL TO STATION.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) STATION IS ON THE TOP OF THE EASTERN BANK OF A SMALL GULLY.  ON THE WESTERN BANK OF THE GULLY THERE IS A SMALL HOUSE AND AT THE HEAD OF THE GULLY THERE IS A LARGE PROMINENT TREE, SOME 90 METERS FROM THE STATION.  THE SITE IS SURROUNDED BY CANE.  STATION IS MARKED BY A 2-INCH PIPE, 3 FEET LONG, SET IN CONCRETE AT THE EDGE OF A BANK 20 FEET ABOVE AND 12 METERS BACK FROM THE HIGH-WATER LINE.  REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN IRREGULAR MASSES OF CONCRETE.  HEIGHT OF SIGNAL ABOVE STATION MARK - 3 METERS.
markers.setting: OBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON A LOW BRUSH COVERED HILL, 4 AIRLINE MILES WEST OF GUANICA AND IN THE NORTHWEST EDGE OF ENSENADA.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN ENSENADA, GO WEST ON HIGHWAY 116 FOR ABOUT 200 FEET TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH ON A PAVED STREET FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO WEST ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE END OF THE ROAD AT THE BASE OF A LOW HILL AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE PACK WESTERLY UPHILL FOR ABOUT 15 MINUTES TO THE TOP OF THE LOW HILL.  CONTINUE WESTERLY UPHILL FOR ABOUT 200 YARDS TO THE TOP OF THE BRUSH COVERED HILL AND THE STATION ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE HILL.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ENSENADA 1966, SET IN THE TOP OF A MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH PROJECTS 5 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ENSENADA NO 1 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A BOULDER WHICH PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ENSENADA NO 2 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A BOULDER WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1971)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1971 (EKM) THE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED THOUGH ALL MARKS ARE NOW SLIGHTLY BENT.  THE TO-REACH IS ADEQUATE.  ADD PARAGRAPH--THERE ARE REMNANTS OF A ROCK CAIRN IN THE VICINITY OF THE STATION MARK.  APPROACH THE TOP OF THE HILL FROM THE EAST WHERE THERE IS A GAP IN A CACTUS HEDGE.  ADEQUATE CLOTHING FOR PROTECTION AGAINST THORN BUSHES AND CACTUS SHOULD BE WORN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1999)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 1999 (VMR) TO REACH THE POINT IS ADECUATE TO COME FROM LAJAS TO GUANICA TAKING THE 116 HIGHWAY TO THE 3116 INTERSECTION. THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED BY THE NORTH SIDE OF THE MOUNTAIN WALKING TO THE SOUTH TO A LOW HILL THEN CONTINUE SOUTH FOR ABOUT 15 MINUTES TO THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE LOW BUSH AND CACTUS COVERED HILL.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1941 V. A. ELEVATION 32.24 METERS.  STATION IS LOCATED ON THE SE COAST OF VIEQUES ISLAND ON THE MIDDLE ONE OF THREE HILLS WHICH FORM THE LONG PENINSULA BOUNDING THE EASTERN SIDE OF A BAY KNOWN AS ENSENDA HONDA AND ABOUT 1/2 MILE EAST OF THE WESTERN END OF THE PENINSULA.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD TABLET STAMPED ENSENADA 1941 AND ANCHORED BY A CONCRETE BASE TO ROCK.  R.M. NO. 1 IS A DRILL HOLE IN ROCK 1.39 METERS FROM STATION.  PLANE AZIMUTH 178-07.  R.M. NO. 2 IS A DRILL HOLE ON ROCK AND LINED WITH CEMENT 2.80 METERS FROM STATION.  PLANE AZIMUTH 83-08.  TO REACH THIS STATION FROM ISABEL II DRIVE EAST ALONG THE NORTH COAST ROAD 18.2 KMS. TO THE END OF THE HARD SURFACE.  CONTINUE EAST ON DIRT ROAD 0.4 MILES, THEN TURN RIGHT (S) AT Y FORK.  DRIVE SOUTH TO LLAUREL CATTLE YARD OF MR. ESTEBAN DIAZ WHICH IS ABOUT 1/2 MILE FROM NW CORNER OF ENSENADA HONDA.  THEN FOLLOW ROAD AND TRAILS SE TO PENINSULA AND STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JMC) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  NOW LOCATED IN A SECURITY AREA OF CAMP GARCIA.  A LAAM SITE.  27 FT. N OF A DIRT ROAD, 12 FT. W OF WESTERNMOST OF 3 CACTI (ABOUT 12 FEET HIGH) IN A SMALL CLEARING ATOP A SMALL HILL.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US MARINE CORPS 1970 STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.setting: SET IN UNSPECIFIED ROCK OR BOULDER
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS THE TOP AND CENTER OF THE SOUTHEAST ONE OF TWO STACKS.  THE OVERALL HEIGHT IS ABOUT 250 FEET AND IT IS PAINTED BROWN IN COLOR.  IT IS LOCATED IN THE SOUTH PART OF ENSENADA AND 0.1 MILE SOUTHEAST OF THE ENSENADA POST OFFICE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1971)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1971 (EKM) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD ORDER AS DESCRIBED BY J.J. LIUM IN 1966.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS THE TOP AND CENTER OF THE NORTHWEST ONE OF TWO STACKS.  THE OVERALL HEIGHT IS ABOUT 250 FEET AND IT IS PAINTED WHITE IN COLOR.  IT IS LOCATED IN THE SOUTH PART OF ENSENADA AND 0.1 MILE SOUTHEAST OF THE ENSENADA POST OFFICE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1971)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1971 (EKM) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD ORDER AS DESCRIBED BY J.J. LIUM IN 1966.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1899 (WCH) STATION IS ON THE TOP OF THE MASONRY WALL AT THE EASTERN END OF THE SMALL BATTERY OF ABOVE NAME AND BETWEEN TWO EMBRASURES.  AN OLD SPANISH POINT.  MARKED BY A HOLE CUT THROUGH THE SURFACE AND FILLED WITH COLORED MORTAR.  THREE CROSSES CUT IN THE MASONRY POINT TO THE CENTER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1902)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1902 (JN) THIS IS THE SAME POINT AS DESCRIBED BY ASSISTANT HODGKINS IN 1899, AND IS AN OLD SPANISH TRIANGULATION POINT.  IT IS ON THE EASTERN RAMPARTS OF OLD FORT ESCAMBRON AT THE EASTERN END OF SAN JUAN ISLAND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1909)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1909 (WCH) STATION RECOVERED BUT MARKS FOUND SOMEWHAT ALTERED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1927)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1927 (GCM) MARKED BY A CAST IRON PIPE 4 INCHES IN DIAMETER SET IN A BRICK PEDESTAL ON THE OLD MASONRY WALL.  BOTH PIPE AND PEDESTAL ARE SOMEWHAT DISINTEGRATED.  THE CROSSES CUT IN THE MASONRY WALL WERE NOT FOUND, THE MORTAR ON THE TOP OF THE WALL HAVING BEEN WORN AWAY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) THE CAST IRON PIPE IS 6 INCHES IN DIAMETER.  RM, NORTH, IS A 3/8 INCH ROD SET IN CONCRETE AND MARKED NORTH, 25 METERS N OF THE STATION IN A GUN SLOT.  THERE IS A USED REFERENCE MARK DISC ON TOP OF THE WALL ABOUT 12 METERS NE OF THE STATION.  A COMPLETE DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  ON POINT ESCAMBRON, ON TOP OF THE RAMPARTS OF FORT ESCAMBRON AT THE EASTERN END OF BATTERY, BETWEEN TWO EMBRASURES, A 6 INCH CAST IRON PIPE SET IN BRICK PEDESTAL.  RM NORTH IS A 3/8 INCH ROD 25 METERS N OF THE STATION IN A GUN SLOT.  IT IS SET IN CONCRETE AND MARKED NORTH.  ABOUT 12 METERS NE OF THE STATION IS A USED REFERENCE MARK DISC SET IN THE TOP OF THE WALL.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (DCW) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED BY GLENN W. MOORE, EXCEPT A CORP OF ENGINEERS, U.S. ARMY SURVEY MARK IS SET INSIDE THE 6 INCH PIPE.  THE STANDARD DISK IS STAMPED ESCAMBRON 1953.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION WAS FOUND AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A REFERENCE MARK 1 WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED 1/4 MILE NORTH OF THE NORMANDIE HOTEL, 0.1 MILE EAST OF THE NEW ATHLETIC GAMES SWIMMING POOL AND ON AN OLD SPANISH POINT THAT IS LOCALLY KNOWN AS ESCAMBRON.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF HIGHWAY 25 AND ASHFORD AVENUE, AT THE NORTH END OF THE SAN ANTONIO BRIDGE, GO NORTH ON HIGHWAY 25 FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE NORMANDIE HOTEL.  CONTINUE NORTH PASSING ALONG THE WEST SIDE OF THE NORMANDIE HOTEL AND GO 0.1 MILE TO THE ENTRANCE TO THE NEW ATHLETIC GAMES SWIMMING POOL WHICH IS NOW UNDER CONSTRUCTION.  BEAR RIGHT, THEN LEFT PASSING TO THE RIGHT OF THE ENTRANCE AND CONTINUE NORTH ON A SAND ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL AND A SET OF STEPS LEADING TO THE OLD BATTERY.  HERE CLIMB THE STEPS AND PACK EAST ALONG THE NORTH WALL OF THE BATTERY FOR 30 YARDS TO THE STATION ON THE EAST WALL.  THE STATION MARK IS A U.S. ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS SURVEY DISK STAMPED ESCAMBRON 1953, SET IN A 6-INCH CAST IRON PIPE WHICH IS FILLED WITH CONCRETE AND SURROUNDED BY A 3 FOOT SQUARE BLOCK OF CONCRETE AND BRICK.  IT IS 2 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF AN EMBRASURE AND 6 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF AN EMBRASURE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ESCAMBRON NO 1 1899, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE EAST WALL OF THE BATTERY.  IT IS 14.5 FEET WEST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE WALL AND 3.5 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF AN EMBRASURE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A U.S. ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS DISK THAT IS UNSTAMPED.  IT IS SET IN A 12 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 2 INCHES AND IS 7.5 FEET WEST OF THE EAST WALL OF THE BATTERY.  THE BATTERY WALL PROJECTS ABOUT 20 FEET ON ALL SIDES.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN IN THE TOWN OF SAN JUAN.                            STATION RECOVERY (2006)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2006 (LM) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1940 LOCATED 8 KM. SW OF ARECIBO AND 1.5 MILES E OF ARECIBO-LARES RD. ON A BARE HILL.  LAND IS OWNED BY BRAULIO GONZALEZ.  TO REACH FROM ARECIBO FOLLOW ARECIBO-LARES RD. TO KM. POST K13 H3.  TURN LEFT (E) ONTO OLD GRAVEL ROAD TO CLINEGAETA.  DRIVE 1.7 MILES TO T-RD. N AT SHARP TURN IN MAIN ROAD TO THE S.  TAKE T-ROAD 0.1 MILE.  FROM THIS POINT THE HILL ON WHICH THE STATION IS LOCATED CAN BE SEEN N45E ABOUT 500 METERS.  FOLLOW TRAIL AROUND S END OF RIDGE AND UP E SIDE THROUGH THE FIRST SADDLE.  AFTER PASSING SECOND THATCHED HOUSE TURN LEFT INTO SMALL COVE AND CLIMB TO TOP OF HILL.  STATION MARK--STANDARD TABLET SET IN ROCK OUTCROP AND STAMPED ESPERANZA.  R. M. NO. 1 DRILL HOLE IN ROCK OUTCROP 7.9 FT. N30W.  R. M. NO. 2 DRILL HOLE IN ROCK OUTCROP 16.4 FT. N85E.                            STATION RECOVERY (1942)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1942 (GBG) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED, IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS A ROBLE TREE LOCATED ON S SIDE OF A MUNICIPAL ROAD THAT CROSSES WIDE-TOPPED HILL ON BO. ESPINO ON THE LIMITS OF THE PROPERTIES OF PEDRO SUAU AND ALCOVAR AND COMPANY.  HILL IS BARE TO N AND COVERED BY A COFFEE PLANTATION ON OTHER SIDES.  STATION IS A BLACK AND WHITE FLAG ON ROBLE TREE 4 METERS FROM CENTER OF ROAD.  TREE IS MARKED BY THREE 6-INCH TRIANGLES CUT DEEP WITH U.S.G.S. BRASS NAILS AND WASHERS.  TRIANGLES LOOK NE AND W.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A BRASS NAIL AND WASHER ON CENTER OF TRIANGLE, ON 16-INCH GUARAGUAO TREE, 14.06 METERS FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 93 DEG 18 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A BRASS NAIL AND WASHER ON CENTER OF TRIANGLE ON SWEET ORANGE TREE (CHINA), 5.15 METERS FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 12 DEG 37 MIN.  TO REACH TAKE MUNICIPAL ROAD TO ESPINO AT KILOMETER 35, H 3 OF LARES-SAN SEBASTIAN ROAD, FOLLOW IT S 1.5 MILES TO A FORK NEAR A STORE.  LEAVE CAR AND FOLLOW TRAIL W 300 METERS TO HIGHEST PART.  STATION TREE IS 38.35 METERS E OF A SMALL HOUSE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (GBG) ABOUT THREE KILOMETERS SW OF LARES, AND TWO KILOMETERS N OF THE ANASCO RIVER.  ON THE S SIDE OF THE BARRIO-ESPINO MUNICIPAL ROAD.  THE HILL ON WHICH THE STATION IS LOCATED IS A HIGH, WIDE ONE, THE HIGH PART OF AN E-W RIDGE.  THE STATION IS A ROBLE TREE ABOUT 8 INCHES IN DIAMETER.  MARKED BY 6-INCH TRIANGLE MADE WITH U.S.G.S. BRASS NAILS AND WASHERS ON THE N, E, AND W SIDES.  THE TREE IS 4 METERS S OF CENTER LINE OF ROAD, AND 38.35 METERS E OF SMALL HOUSE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A BRASS NAIL AND WASHER AT CENTER OF TRIANGLE ON A 16-INCH GUARAGUAO TREE.  14.06 METERS FROM STATION, IN AZIMUTH 93 DEG 18 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A BRASS NAIL AND WASHER AT CENTER OF TRIANGLE ON AN ORANGE TREE 5.15 METERS FROM STATION, IN AZIMUTH 12 DEG 37 MIN.  TO REACH FROM LARES, GO SW ON THE ROAD TO SAN SEBASTIAN TO A SHARP CURVE AND ROAD FORK SE AT THE SW EDGE OF TOWN AND KM. 35.3.  TAKE MUNICIPAL ROAD S, AND PROCEED TO END TO PAVING.  CONTINUE AHEAD ON DIRT ROAD, KEEPING STRAIGHT AND ON RIDGE AT FORKS.  CAR CAN BE TAKEN TO STATION IN GOOD WEATHER.  STATION IS JUST E OF CREST OF GRADE, WHERE HILL IS CLEARED TO N, AND PLANTED WITH COFFEE, PLATANO, AND OTHER TREES TO S.

CONTINUE ON FOOT FOR APPROXIMATELY 54 M (177.2 FT) TO THE ENTRANCE OF THE CONCRETE HOUSE ON THE RIGHT.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 17.02 M (55.8 FT) WEST FROM THE BOUNDARY CORNER MARK HITO-4, 9.09 M (29.8 FT) SOUTH-EAST FROM A WOODEN POWER POLE AND 8.05 M (26.4 FT) NORTH-WEST FROM THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE CONCRETE HOUSE. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) STATION HAS BEEN DESTROYED.  THE PRESENT TWO STACKS WERE BUILT IN 1934.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (SF) THIS STATION IS SITUATED ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF FARALLON MOUNTAIN, WHICH IS ABOUT SEVEN MILES NW OF THE TOWN OF BARRANQUITAS, AT TOWN IN THE INTERIOR OF PUERTO RICO.  THE STATION IS MARKED WITH A BOTTLE, FILLED WITH ASHES AND SURROUNDED WITH ASHES, PLACED IN AN UPRIGHT POSITION TWO FEET BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  ABOVE THIS WAS PLACED A LARGE STONE WHICH PROJECTS SIX INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE CENTER OF A CROSS, CUT ON THE TOP OF THIS STONE, MARKS THE STATION.  ASHES, CHARCOAL, AND EARTH WERE PLACED AROUND THE STONE.  AT A DISTANCE OF ABOUT FIVE FEET FROM THE STATION, APPROXIMATELY N, E, S, AND W WERE PLACED FOUR BOTTLES, ONE FOOT BELOW SURFACE OF THE GROUND, WITH THEIR MOUTHS POINTING TOWARD THE STATION.  ASHES MIXED WITH EARTH WERE PLACED AROUND THESE REFERENCE BOTTLES. THERE ARE NO NATURAL OBJECTS TO USE AS REFERENCE MARKS.  FROM BARRANQUITAS, FARALLON MOUNTAIN IS REACHED BY A FAIR MOUNTAIN TRAIL WHICH PASSES A HIGH MOUNTAIN PEAK, NAMED LATORRES OR LATORRE.  FARALLON MOUNTAIN STANDS RATHER ALONE AND SHOWS THREE PEAKS CLOSE TOGETHER.  IT IS ABOUT FOUR MILES TO THE N OF LATORRE.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE HIGHEST AND MOST WESTERLY OF THESE PEAKS, AND IS ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THIS PEAK.  THE SOUTHERN SLOPE IS BARE WHILE THE NORTHERN SIDE IS COVERED BY A COFFEE GROVE.  THE PROPERTY IS OWNED BY PABLO RODRIGUEZ, WHO LIVES AT THE FOOT OF THE MOUNTAIN.  THE SKETCH SHOWS THE APPROXIMATE CONFIGURATION OF THE TOP OF FARALLON MOUNTAIN.  THIS MOUNTAIN IS VERY WELL KNOWN AND CAN BE REACHED VERY EASILY WITH THE SERVICES OF A GUIDE FROM BARRANQUITAS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 SURFACE MARK FOUND AS DESCRIBED AND IN GOOD CONDITION APPARENTLY UNDISTURBED.  IT IS A CROSS CUT ON ROCK SET IN GROUND.  TWO NEW REFERENCE MARKS WERE SET.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A COPPER NAIL AND WASHER IN BLAZE ON STUMP OF GUAMA TREE, 13.35 FEET FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 139 DEG 51 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A COPPER NAIL AND WASHER IN BLAZE ON STUMP OF JAGUA TREE, 14.40 FEET FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 206 DEG 11 MIN.  SIGNAL--QUADRIPOD OF LUMBER WITH BLACK CROSS-TARGETS ON CENTER POLE.  THE STATION IS NOW BEST REACHED FROM BARRANQUITAS BY FOLLOWING CARRETERA FROM BARRANQUITAS TO COMERIO FOR 3 KILOMETERS TO MUNICIPAL ROAD WHICH LEAVES THE MAIN ROAD AT TIENDA NEAR TOP OF GRADE, FOLLOW THIS MUNICIPAL ROAD WESTWARD 3 KILOMETERS TO FORKS AT ANOTHER TIENDA, TURN RIGHT (NORTHWARD) AT THIS FORK AND FOLLOW MAIN TRAIL ALONG DIVIDING RIDGE TO PEAK.  THIS TRAIL FORKS IN MANY PLACES AND INQUIRY SHOULD BE MADE ALONG THE ROUTE AS TO WHICH BRANCH APPROACHES NEAREST THE MOUNTAIN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) A THOROUGH SEARCH WAS MADE FOR THE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS 1,2 AND 3 BUT THEY WERE NOT RECOVERED.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 4 WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  FARALLON 2 WAS ESTABLISHED IN THE NEAR VICINITY.  SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.  OFFICE NOTE--STATION IS LOST.  (SEE G-16362)
markers.setting: SET IN UNSPECIFIED ROCK OR BOULDER
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 5 MILES WEST OF COMERIO, 3-1/2 MILES NORTH OF BARRANQUITAS, ON THE MOST WESTERLY AND HIGHEST PEAK OF THREE BRUSHY PEAKS THAT ARE KNOWN AS MOUNT FARRALLON AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. SANTIAGO SANTIAGO WHO RESIDES IN BARRANQUITAS.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE PLAZA IN BARRANQUITAS, GO WESTERLY ON HIGHWAY 156 FOR 0.8 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 156 AND 771.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH ON HIGHWAY 771 FOR 1.2 MILES TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO NORTHERLY AND WESTERLY ON HIGHWAY 771 FOR 2.8 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHERLY FOR 1.2 MILES TO A Y-FORK.  (A FOUR-WHEEL DRIVE VEHICLE IS REQUIRED FROM THIS POINT.) TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO NORTH AND WEST FOR 0.7 MILE TO A T-INTERSECTION.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHWEST FOR 0.15 MILE TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO WESTERLY FOR 0.25 MILE TO A GATE AND THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  PACK SOUTH FOR ABOUT 200 YARDS TO THE TOP OF A RIDGE.  BEAR RIGHT AND GO WESTERLY ALONG THE RIDGE FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO THE TOP OF THE MOST WESTERLY PEAK AND THE STATION.  A 5-MINUTE PACK.  THE STATION MARK IS A CENTER-PUNCHED STEEL ROD SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 1 INCH.  FARALLON 11 RAC AS 2/8/61 IS INSCRIBED IN THE CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, STAMPED FARALLON 2 NO 1 1966, IS A STANDARD DISK BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3-INCH CAST IRON PIPE THAT PROJECTS 5 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STEEL ROD SET IN THE TOP OF A 6-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  AN AZIMUTH MARK WAS NOT ESTABLISHED.

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 5 MILES SOUTHEAST OF GUAYAMA, 4-1/2 MILES SOUTHWEST OF PATILLAS, 1-1/2 MILES SOUTHEAST OF ARROYO, ON A POINT OF LAND KNOWN AS POINT FIGURAS AND DIRECTLY BENEATH THE U.S. COAST GUARD POINT FIGURAS BEACON LIGHT.  NOTE--THE STATION MARK WAS SET PRECISELY BENEATH THE POINT FIGURAS BEACON LIGHT AND OBSERVATIONS WERE MADE FROM THE STEEL TOWER THAT SUPPORTS THE BEACON LIGHT.  PERMISSION MUST BE OBTAINED FROM THE U.S. COAST GUARD BEFORE OCCUPYING THE STATION.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN PATILLIS, GO SOUTH AND WEST ON HIGHWAY 3 FOR 3.4 MILES TO A CROSSROAD AT KILOMETER POST 132.3.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH FOR 1.0 MILE, THENCE BEAR RIGHT AND GO WESTERLY FOR 0.9 MILE TO A Y-FORK AT AN ABANDONED LIGHTHOUSE.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO SOUTHWEST FOR 0.3 MILE TO THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK, STAMPED FIGG 1965, IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE FOUNDATION OF THE POINT FIGURAS BEACON LIGHT.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, STAMPED FIGG NO 1 1965, IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS 1 FOOT IN DIAMETER AND PROJECTS 1 INCH.  IT IS 61 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE CONCRETE FOUNDATION OF THE BEACON LIGHT.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, STAMPED FIGG NO 2 1965, IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS 1 FOOT IN DIAMETER AND PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  IT IS 59 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE CONCRETE FOUNDATION OF THE BEACON LIGHT.  NO SUITABLE LOCATION FOR AN AZIMUTH MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (JDS) THE STATION MARK DISK HAS BEEN REMOVED FROM THE CONCRETE FOUNDATION OF THE POINT FIGURAS BEACON LIGHT, HOWEVER, THE IMPRINT OF THE DISK AND THE SHANK ARE INTACT.  REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE NOT RECOVERED AND HAVE PROBABLY BEEN DESTROYED BY VANDALS OR WASHED OUT BY THE TIDE AND WAVE ACTION.  THE SAND UNDER THE BEACON LIGHT FOUNDATION HAS BEEN WASHED AWAY ON THE SOUTH SIDE CAUSING THE FOUNDATION TO SETTLE SLIGHTLY TO THE SOUTH.  THE BEACON LIGHT IS NO LONGER DIRECTLY OVER THE STATION MARK.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE FOR RECOVERY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RMB) THE SHAFT OF THE STATION MARK IS STILL IN PLACE ALTHOUGH THE DISK HAS BEEN REMOVED.  BOTH REFERENCE MARKS WERE SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.  THE U.S. COAST GUARD LIGHT HAS BEEN MOVED TO THE PREVIOUSLY ABANDONED LIGHTHOUSE ABOUT 0.3 MILES FURTHER INSHORE.  THE LIGHT STRUCTURE AT FIGG WAS ORIGINALLY SUPPORTED BY 4 CONCRETE PILES AND A SQUARE CONCRETE FOOTING WHICH APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN POURED IN PLACE ON THE SURFACE.  A COAST GUARDSMAN REPORTED THAT IN 1966 SAND ON THE POINT WAS LEVEL WITH THE TOP OF THE FOOTING, BUT SINCE THEN THE LEVEL HAS FLUCTUATED.  IN 1970 NATIONAL OCEAN SURVEY SHORELINE PHOTOGRAPHS, THE SAND LEVEL WAS VERY LOW AND MHWL WAS INSHORE OF THE TOWER.  NOW, THE SAND IS ALMOST A FOOT ABOVE MHWL BUT STILL ONE FOOT BELOW THE FOOTING.  IT IS ASSUMED THAT BOTH REFERENCE MARKS WERE DESTROYED WHEN THE SAND ERODED FROM THE POINT.  THE LIGHT STRUCTURE APPEARS TO LEAN, AND SAND PROBABLY HAS SETTLED SINCE THE FOOTING IS NO LONGER SUPPORTED BY THE SAND.  THE TOP OF THE STRUCTURE IS NO LONGER EXACTLY OVER THE MARK.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN PATILLAS, GO SOUTH AND WEST ON HIGHWAY 3 FOR 3.4 MILES TO THE CROSS ROAD AT KILOMETER 132.3.  TURN LEFT AND GO 0.9 MILES SOUTH TO THE CONCRETE GUARD STATION AT THE ENTRANCE TO A PUBLIC PARK.  CONTINUE 0.4 MILES TO THE PARK ADMINISTRATION OFFICE, GO THROUGH THE CAR PORT AND DRIVE DOWN THE CONCRETE WALKWAY ABOUT 200 FEET.  BEAR LEFT ON A DIRT ROAD FOR ABOUT 100 FEET, THEN RIGHT ON ANOTHER DIRT ROAD AND HEAD SOUTHWEST TO A LOCKED GATE.  THROUGH THE GATE, GO 0.4 MILES, BEAR LEFT AT THE FORK NEAR THE LIGHTHOUSE, AND CONTINUE 0.3 MILES TO THE STATION.  PARK PERSONNEL IN THE ADMINISTRATION OFFICE HAVE THE GATE KEY AND WILL ACCOMPANY VISITORS.  IDENTIFICATION MAY BE REQUIRED.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (RLS) STATION IS ABOUT 1-1/2 MILES ENE OF CEIBA, WITHIN THE PROPOSED LIMITS OF THE ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL RESERVATION, ON POINT FIGUERITA, NEAR THE OUTER END OF THE POINT, ON THE SAND SPIT WHICH FORMS THE END AND N SIDE OF THE POINT, ABOUT 7 METERS W OF THE END OF THE POINT, 5 METERS N OF THE S SIDE, ABOUT 10 METERS S OF THE N SIDE.  ORIGINALLY, A TREE WAS CUT OFF AND THE STATION WAS MARKED BY A NAIL DRIVEN INTO THE TOP OF THE STUMP.  BUT THE STUMP HAS BEEN REMOVED AND THE STATION IS NOW MARKED BY A STANDARD BRONZE DISK SET IN A BLOCK OF CONCRETE WHICH PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THERE IS NO UNDERGROUND MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) STATION SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED.  ACCORDING TO THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION, THE POINT WHERE THE STATION EXISTED WAS APPROXIMATELY 15 METERS WIDE.  AT THE PRESENT THERE IS NO DEFINITE POINT BUT RATHER A VERY ROUNDED POINT.  IT APPEARS THAT THE POINT HAS BEEN ERODED AND THE STATION MARK DESTROYED.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (JBB) STATION IS ON THE TOP OF THE HIGH HILL W BY N FROM LAGUNA DES FLAMINCOS OR FLAMINGO POND AND N BY E OF STREAM POINT.  IT IS BACK SOME 300 METERS FROM THE SEA AND ABOUT 950 METERS FROM LAGUNA DES FLAMINCOS.  THE POINT OF A NAIL SET IN A CEMENT BLOCK SET IN THE GROUND, MARKS THE STATION.  A TRIPOD SIGNAL WAS ERECTED OVER THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1945)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US NAVY 1945 (HTG) STATION RECEIVED DIRECT BOMB HIT.  MANY SMALL SCATTERED FRAGMENTS OF MONUMENT RECOVERED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1957)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1957 (RCD) STATION HAS BEEN DESTROYED.  NO PIECES OF THE MARK WERE FOUND.  THERE IS AN IRON PIPE 5 IN DIAMETER AND 20 FT. HIGH AT THE SITE, AND 3 CONCRETE POSTS WHICH ONCE SUPPORTED A LARGE WHITE WOODEN TRIPOD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JMC) STATION DESTROYED.  NAVY STATION FLAMINGO 3, 1963 ESTABLISHED AT THIS POSITION (4TH ORDER).

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) FLAT WATER TANK SOME 400 METERS SSE OF MACHETE.  THE TANK ITSELF IS 10 FEET HIGH AND SUPPORTED BY CONCRETE PINS 20 FEET HIGH.  IT IS PART OF THE WATER SYSTEM OF CENTRAL MACHETE AND IS 150 METERS FROM THE BEACH.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL STATION, 1-1/4 MILES SOUTHEAST OF GATE NO. 3, SOUTH GATE, 0.2 MILE SOUTH OF THE ALANTIC FLEET WEAPONS RANGE BUILDING AND ON A NORTH-SOUTH RIDGE COVERED WITH HIGH GRASS.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM GATE NO. 3, SOUTH GATE, GO SOUTHERLY FOR 0.05 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE LEFT, LANGLEY DRIVE, TURN LEFT AND GO EASTERLY ON LANGLEY DRIVE FOR 1.5 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT, TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHERLY ON SOUTH PRINCETON ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO A FORK, KEEP THE RIGHT FORK AND GO 0.2 MILE TO THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL AT THE REAR OF THE ALANTIC FLEET WEAPONS RANGE BUILDING, PACK SOUTHERLY ALONG THE RIDGE FOR ABOUT 350 YARDS TO THE STATION ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE RIDGE.  THE STATION IS ABOUT 30 YARDS EAST OF THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE RIDGE.  IT IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED FLEET 1966, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3 INCH SOIL PIPE.  IT IS PROJECTING 5 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED FLEET NO 1 1966, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3 INCH SOIL PIPE PROJECTING 5 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED FLEET NO 2 1966, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3 INCH SOIL PIPE PROJECTING 3 INCHES.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY RLDA SURVEYING AND MAPPING 2007 (RLD) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2.10 MI (3.4 KM) NORTHEAST OF MANI, 2.09 MI (3.4 KM) SOUTHEAST OF LA PLAYA AND 1.72 MI (2.8 KM) SOUTHWEST OF ANASCO ON THE SOUTH END OF AN OLD METAL BRIDGE ON THE WEST SIDE OF PR 2.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF PR 2 AND PR 109-PR 185, GO SOUTH ON PR 2 FOR 0.47 MI (0.8 KM) TO A BRIDGE OVER THE ANASCO RIVER AND AN OLD METAL BRIDGE ON THE RIGHT AND STATION ON NORTH END OF OLD BRIDGE ON THE CONCRETE WALKWAY AS DESCRIBED.   THE MONUMENT IS 19.50 M (64.0 FT) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHERLY END OF THE STEEL BRIDGE STRUCTURE, 14.55 M (47.7 FT) WEST OF THE WHITE LINE ON WEST EDGE OF SOUTHBOUND LANE OF PR 2, 3.5 M (11.5 FT) SOUTH OF THE NORTH END OF BRIDGE AND 0.50 M (1.6 FT) EAST OF THE WEST CONCRETE GUARD RAIL.
markers.setting: SET IN A PAVEMENT SUCH AS STREET, SIDEWALK, CURB, ETC.
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY RLDA SURVEYING AND MAPPING 2007 (RLD) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON EUGENIO MARIA DE HOSTAS AIRPORT APPROXIMATELY MID FIELD.  TO OBTAIN ACCESS TO THE AIRPORT AND THE STATION CONTACT MR. ANDREW BONILLA, DIRECTOR AIRPORT OPERATIONS (ACTING AIRPORT MANAGER), BOX 710, MAYAGUEZ, PUERTO RICO 00709.  PHONE 809-832-3390.  THE MONUMENT IS SET IN A CONCRETE SIDEWALK THAT IS ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE CONTROL BUILDING AT THE AIRPORT.  THE STAMPING ON THIS MONUMENT HAS BEEN MARKED OUT AND SKUFFED OUT.   THE STATION IS 38.33 M (125.8 FT) NORTHEAST OF A PALM TREE, 25.32 M (83.1 FT) NORTH OF A LIGHT POLE, 21.69 M (71.2 FT) WEST OF A MAN HOLE COVER, 10.73 M (35.2 FT) NORTH OF A CONCRETE CURB, 10.30 M (33.8 FT) SOUTH OF A CHAIN LINK FENCE AND 8.21 M (26.9 FT) NORTH OF A CONCRETE CURB.
markers.setting: SET IN A PAVEMENT SUCH AS STREET, SIDEWALK, CURB, ETC.

markers.description: PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1970 (JKW) THIS STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  ACCORDING TO THE OFFICER IN CHARGE OF PUBLIC WORKS AT FORT ALLEN, THE TANK WAS BUILT AS IT NOW EXISTS IN 1960.  THIS IS THE ONLY WATER TANK FORT ALLEN HAS EVER HAD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1971)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1971 (EKM) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  A TO-REACH FOLLOWS--TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF ROUTE 2 AND THE PONCE BY-PASS, PROCEED 6.5 MILES EASTWARD ON ROUTE 2 TO ROUTE 158 ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND PROCEED 0.5 MILE TO THE MAIN GATE AT FORT ALLEN.  AFTER PASSING THROUGH THE GATE, TURN LEFT AND PROCEED 0.2 MILE TO THE INTERSECTION WITH MITCHELL STREET.  TURN RIGHT AND PROCEED 0.2 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  THE STATION IS A FOUR-LEGGED, WHITE AND ORANGE CHECKERBOARD PAINTED WATER TANK WITH AN OVERALL HEIGHT OF 138 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RMB) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED.
PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1939 (HAC) THIS IS AN OLD SPANISH FORT AT THE ENTRANCE OF THE SAN JUAN HARBOR.  IT IS A SMALL RECTANGULAR MASONRY STRUCTURE LOCATED AT A SHORT DISTANCE OFF PALO SECO POINT.  THE STATION IS THE TIP OF THE TURRET OR SENTRY BOX ON THE EASTERLY CORNER OF THE FORT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (MTP) THIS STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  DESCRIPTION ADEQUATE.  STATION IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (JN) THIS IS AN INTERMEDIATE STATION ESTABLISHED FOR THE PURPOSE OF SECURING POINTS IN GUANICA BAY FOR TOPOGRAPHICAL AND HYDROGRAPHIC USE.  THE STATION WAS PLACED ON THE HILL WHERE THE AMERICAN ARMY OF OCCUPATION IN 1898 HAD CONSTRUCTED THE SMALL FORT CALLED FORT CAPRON.  A ZIGZAG ROAD BUILT FROM THE CAMP OF THE ARMY OF OCCUPATION TO THE HILL SUMMIT BY THE ENGINEER TROOPS GIVES CONVENIENT ACCESS TO THIS FORT.  THIS WAS A SMALL WORK, AND ON THE HIGH GROUND BETWEEN THE N AND S EXCAVATIONS IN THE HILLTOP, WE PLACED OUR SIGNAL.  THE PARTY THAT SET UP THE POLE FOUND CONSIDERABLE DIFFICULTY IN SINKING A HOLE DEEP ENOUGH FOR THE STATION MARK.  STATION IS MARKED BY A 2-INCH PIPE, PROJECTING ABOUT 10 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  THE BASE OF THE PIPE WAS SET IN CEMENT AND THE PIPE WAS FILLED WITH CEMENT.  THE SIGNAL POLE WAS W OF THE IRON PIPE, AND WHEN THE STATION WAS OCCUPIED, THE OBSERVER SET HIS INSTRUMENT OVER THE CENTER OF THE POLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (MTP) THE IRON PIPE NO LONGER PROJECTS ABOVE THE CONCRETE AND IS ALMOST COMPLETELY RUSTED AWAY.  THE BLOCK OF CONCRETE PROJECTS APPROXIMATELY 8 INCHES (20 CM) ABOVE THE GROUND. A CAPITAL P, 4 INCHES (10 CM) IN HEIGHT IS MOLDED IN THE SIDE OF THE CONCRETE BLOCK.  THE STATION IS EASY TO REACH VIA THE GRAVEL ROAD THAT LEADS TO THE ABANDONED FORT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1971)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1971 (EKM) TO REACH STATION USE DIRECTIONS GIVEN FOR CAPRON (PRS).  IN ADDITION TO THE ABOVE ADD...ENTERING THE RUINS AREA FROM THE EAST, THE STATION IS ON THE RIGHT AND ABOUT 7 FEET ABOVE ENTRANCE LEVEL.  THE IRON PIPE IS COMPLETELY RUSTED AWAY, LEAVING A 2 INCH DIAMETER HOLE ABOUT 4 INCHES DEEP IN THE BLOCK OF CONCRETE.  THE BLOCK OF CONCRETE PROJECTS APPROXIMATELY 18 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  A CAPITAL P, 10 INCHES IN HEIGHT IS MOLDED IN THE SIDE OF THE CONCRETE BLOCK.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (WCH) STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE LOFTY YELLOW CLIFF, NW OF THE EASTERN POINT OF VIEQUES ISLAND AND THE MOST PROMINENT FEATURE OF THAT PART OF THE COAST.  ACCESS TO THE SUMMIT IS GAINED BY A PATH FROM THE BEACH JUST WEST OF THE CLIFFS.  MARKED AS USUAL BY IRON PIPE AND CEMENT, 4 INCHES (10 CM) OF PIPE PROJECTING.  TRIPOD SIGNAL, 45 FT (13.7 M) TO FLAG.                            STATION RECOVERY (1923)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1923 (FTS) DESCRIPTION AMPLE.  STATION MARK HAS BEEN TAMPERED WITH.  THE PIPE USED FOR CENTER MARK HAS BEEN WITHDRAWN BUT THE REMAINS OF THE ORIGINAL CEMENT WERE LEFT INTACT.  A ROUGH MASS OF ROCK WAS BUILT UP IN THE ORIGINAL HOLE AND 2-INCH IRON PIPE WAS REBEDDED IN PLACE.  NO REFERENCE MARKS WERE PLACED AS THE ORIGINAL MARK IS APT TO SURVIVE THE DEPREDATIONS OF NATIVES, AS ARE THE STANDARD BRASS DISKS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1941 STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED BUT THE PIPE WAS FOUND LOOSE AND TILTED.  IT WAS FOUND THAT AN ANGLE OBSERVED AT EAST END FROM FOSSIL CLIFF TO CULEBRITA LIGHTHOUSE DOES NOT AGREE WITH THE SAME ANGLE COMPUTED FROM THE C. AND G. S. COORDINATES FOR THIS STATION.  A NEW POSITION WAS DETERMINED FOR FOSSIL CLIFF AND THIS ALSO DISAGREES WITH THE C. AND G. S. COORDINATES.  IT IS POSSIBLE THAT THE STATION MARK HAD BEEN MOVED BUT FROM THE APPEARANCE OF THE STATION THIS IS IMPROBABLE.  AS THIS STATION, WHEN ORIGINALLY ESTABLISHED, WAS NOT TIED TO ANY STATION ON VIEQUES ISLAND IT IS MORE PROBABLE THAT THERE WAS SOME DISCREPANCY IN THE ORIGINAL WORK.  THE IRON PIPE WAS RESET AS RECOVERED WITH NEW CEMENT.  THE STATION IS ABOUT 3 KM. WEST OF THE EAST END OF THE ISLAND, ABOUT 300 METERS NORTH OF THE AUTOMOBILE ROAD AND ABOUT 500 METERS NE OF THE MORE EASTERLY OF TWO LAGOONS.
markers.setting: OBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

A NEW POSITION WAS DETERMINED FOR FOSSIL CLIFF AND THIS ALSO DISAGREES WITH THE C. AND G. S. COORDINATES. WEST OF THE EAST END OF THE ISLAND, ABOUT 300 METERS NORTH OF THE AUTOMOBILE ROAD AND ABOUT 500 METERS NE OF THE MORE EASTERLY OF TWO LAGOONS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JMC) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THIS IS NOW AN IMPACT AREA AND THERE ARE SEVERAL SHELL HOLES NEAR THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (MTP) STATION FOUND AS DESCRIBED.  STATION LOCATED IN IMPACT AREA OF CAMP GARCIA (U.S. MARINES) BOMBING RANGE.  THERE HAS BEEN MUCH BOMBING IN AREA AS THERE IS A BOMB CRATER ABOUT 10 FEET EAST OF STATION.  STATION LOCATED 30 FEET EAST OF SLIGHT BREAK IN CLIFF.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US MARINE CORPS 1970 STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  STATION MARK IS A BOLT WITH CROSS (+) STAMPED ON IT.  BOLT IS SET IN CONCRETE IN 2 IN PIPE.
markers.setting: UNSPECIFIED SETTING

markers.description: BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS IN THE MUNICIPALITY OF BAYAMON ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE INTERSECTION OF HIGHWAY 22 AND STATE ROAD 167 IN DIRECTION TO SAN JUAN. TO REACH THE STATION FROM SAN JUAN, TAKE HIGHWAY NO 2 UNTIL YOU REACH THE INTERSECTION OF STATE ROAD NO 2 AND 167, IN THIS INTERSECTION MAKE A RIGHT TURN AND KEEP RIGHT UNTIL REACHING HIGHWAY 22.  ON THE SOUTHEAST EMBANKMENT NEAR THE ABUTMENT IS THE STATION. THE STATION MARK IS A 3/8TH INCH STEEL ROD EMBEDDED IN CEMENT AND STAMPED FOTO 22-3.                            STATION RECOVERY (2009)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2009 BAD CONDITION, WEAR DUE TO CARS PASSING OVER IT. NOT A GOOD PLACE TO BE STANDING. MARQTEK ENGINEERING.
markers.setting: OBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1901 (JN) THE STATION IS SITUATED ON SAVAHA HILL, ABOUT 3/4 MILE W OF THE RIO PLATTE RIVER.  THERE ARE SEVERAL HIGH POINTS IN THIS VICINITY AND THE STATION IS ON THE SECOND HIGH POINT IN THE GROUP, FROM THE W, IT BEING ON NEXT TO THE HIGHEST ONE.  IT IS ON THE IMMEDIATE HIGH BANK ON THE COAST, ON A ROCKY POINT, AT THE N SIDE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD ABOUT 600 FEET, BUT NE FROM A CABIN.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A GALVANIZED-IRON PIPE 2 FEET BY 2 INCHES SET IN CEMENT IN A HOLE DRILLED IN THE ROCK.  THE PIPE PROJECTS 5 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE POINT IS THE CENTER OF A SPIKE CEMENTED WITHIN THE PIPE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1931)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1931 STATION RECOVERED AS ORIGINALLY DESCRIBED.  PLANTATION S OF STATION IS A COCOANUT PALM GROVE.  LAND OWNED BY SUC. JAIME PIZA.  CONCRETE MONUMENT WITH IRON ROD MARKING CENTER OF STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS 1946 STATION HAS BEEN DESTROYED.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION SITUATED ON A PROMINENT HILL THAT SPURS S FROM MAIN RIDGE OF MOUNTAINS AT KILOMETER 22 OF YAUCO-LAVA ROAD.  IT IS THE SOUTHERN AND MOST PROMINENT HILL OF THE SPUR, ABOUT 5 MILES N OF SABANA GRANDE HILL, COVERED BY COFFEE PLANTATION ON NW AND W SIDES.  REST GRASSY.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD U.S.G.S., TABLET SET ON NATURAL ROCK STAMPED FRAILE 1934.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A BRASS NAIL AND WASHER SET WITH CEMENT ON NATURAL ROCK, 2.19 METERS FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 68 DEG 24 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A BRASS NAIL AND WASHER SET ON CENTER OF A TRIANGLE BLAZED ON TRUNK OF A 6-INCH POMARROSA, 300 METERS FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 150 DEG 52 MIN.  TO REACH STATION LEAVE CAR NEAR A CHURCH ON MARICAO ROAD, 0.25 MILE FROM JUNCTION OF YAUCA-LAVA ROAD, AND FOLLOW HORSE TRAIL THROUGH OLIVARYS FARM, AND SUCN. DAMIANIS COFFEE PLANTATION, TO GAZTAMBIDE FARM, WHERE AT THE SOUTHERN LIMITS IS THE HILL.  FROM ROAD TO HILL ABOUT 8 MILES.
markers.setting: SET IN UNSPECIFIED ROCK OR BOULDER
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 LOCATED 4 KILOMETERS SE OF SABANA GRANDE ON A SHARP CONICAL PEAK ABOUT 1 KILOMETER NE OF MAIN HIGHWAY AT KILOMETER 218 H 7 1/2.  PEAK IS KNOWN LOCALLY AS CERRO FRANCHONI, AND THE LAND IS OWNED BY DELFIN RODGRIGUEZ OF SABANA GRANDE.  STATION IS SLIGHTLY TO THE S AND W OF CENTER OF TOP.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD TABLET STAMPED FRANCHO 1934 CEMENTED IN PROJECTING ROCK LEDGE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A CROSS CUT ON ALMOST VERTICAL FACE OF PROJECTING ROCK LEDGE, 8.25 FEET FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 129 DEG 09 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A CROSS CUT ON SLOPING TOP OF ROCK, 7.40 FEET FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 194 DEG 00 MIN.  STATION IS BEST REACHED FROM TIENDA OF LIBORIO NEGRON WHICH IS ALONG THE HIGHWAY AT KILOMETER 218 H 7-1/2 AND CAN BE PLAINLY SEEN FROM THAT POINT.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1982 (JCL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 8.5 KM (5-1/4 MI) NORTHEAST OF THE CITY OF PONCE.  THIS STATION WILL BE UNDER WATER UPON COMPLETION OF THE CERRILLOS DAM.  OWNERSHIP--U.S. ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 14 AND 139 ON THE NORTHEAST SIDE OF PONCE, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 0.5 KM (0.3 MI) TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST AND NORTH ON A WINDING ROAD (HIGHWAY 139) FOR 3.1 KM (1.95 MI) TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 3.7 KM (2.35 MI) TO THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS LABORATORY BUILDING ON THE LEFT. CONTINUE AHEAD NORTH AND EAST ON HIGHWAY 139 1.2 KM (0.75 MI) TO A DIRT REVERSE FORK RIGHT.  TURN SHARP RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEASTERLY ON THE DIRT TRACK ROAD FOR 0.08 KM (0.05 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED---FRANK 1982---, SET INTO A DRILL HOLE IN BEDROCK AND RECESSED 36 CM BELOW THE GROUND.  IT IS LOCATED 7.74 METERS (24.3 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM THE CENTER OF A TRACK ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 1 IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED ---FRANK NO 1 1982---, SET INTO THE TOP OF A BOULDER OF 1.1 METERS LARGEST DIMENSION.  IT IS LOCATED 5.0 METERS (16.4 FT) EAST FROM THE CENTER OF THE TRACK ROAD.  MARK IS LEVEL WITH STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 2 IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED ---FRANK NO 2 1982---, SET INTO THE TOP OF A PARTIALLY EXPOSED BOULDER OF 0.5 METER LARGEST DIMENSION.  IT IS LOCATED 3.8 METERS (12.4 FT) EAST FROM THE CENTER OF THE TRACK ROAD AND 1.0 METER (3.2 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE CENTER OF A DIM TRACK ROAD.  MARK IS BELOW STATION 0.5 METER.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN ABOVE THE MARK WAS 1.4 METERS.  THIS STATION WAS TIED INTO LEVEL LINE 1A.                            STATION RECOVERY (1982)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1982 10.0 KM (6.21 MI) NE FROM PONCE.  FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 14 AND 139 ON THE NORTHEAST SIDE OF PONCE, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 0.5 KM (0.3 MI) TO A CROSSROAD, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST AND NORTH ON A WINDING ROAD (HIGHWAY 139) FOR 3.2 KM (2.0 MI) TO A FORK, TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 3.9 KM (2.4 MI) TO THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS LABORATORY BUILDING ON THE LEFT, CONTINUE AHEAD NORTH AND EAST ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 1.3 KM (0.8 MI) TO A DIRT REVERSE FORK RIGHT, TURN SHARP RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEASTERLY ON THE DIRT TRACK ROAD FOR 0.2 KM (0.1 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT, 0.3 METERS (1.0 FT), IN BEDROCK, RECESSED BELOW THE GROUND, 7.4 METERS (24.3 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM THE CENTER OF THE TRACK ROAD.  THIS STATION WILL BE UNDER WATER UPON COMPLETION OF THE DAM.  THE MARK IS 1.0 FT BELOW ROAD.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1982 10.0 KM (6.21 MI) NE FROM PONCE. THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 14 AND 139 ON THE NORTHEAST SIDE OF PONCE, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 0.5 KM (0.3 MI) TO A CROSSROAD, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST AND NORTH ON A WINDING ROAD, (HIGHWAY 139) FOR 3.2 KM (2.0 MI) TO A FORK, TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 3.9 KM (2.4 MI) TO THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS LABORATORY BUILDING ON THE LEFT, CONTINUE AHEAD NORTH AND EAST ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 1.3 KM (0.8 MI) TO A DIRT REVERSE FORK RIGHT, TURN SHARP RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEASTERLY ON THE DIRT TRACK ROAD FOR 0.2 KM (0.1 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT, AN EXPOSED BOULDER, 1.1 METERS IN THE LARGEST DIMENSION, 5.0 METERS (16.4 FT) EAST FROM THE CENTER OF THE DIRT TRACK ROAD. THE MARK IS 1.6 FT ABOVE GROUND.
markers.setting: SET IN A BOULDER
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1982 10.0 KM (6.21 MI) NE FROM PONCE. FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 14 AND 139 ON THE NORTHEAST SIDE OF PONCE, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 0.5 KM (0.3 MI) TO A CROSSROAD, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST AND NORTH ON A WINDING ROAD (HIGHWAY 139) FOR 3.2 KM (2.0 MI) TO A FORK, TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 3.9 KM (2.4 MI) TO THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS LABORATOR BUILDING ON THE LEFT, CONTINUE AHEAD NORTH AND EAST ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 1.3 KM (0.8 MI) TO A DIRT REVERSE FORK RIGHT, TURN SHARP RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEASTERLY ON THE DIRT TRACK ROAD FOR 0.2 KM (0.1 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT, IN A PARTIALLY EXPOSED BOULDER, 0.5 METERS (1.6 FT) IN LARGEST DIMENSION, IN THE TRACK ROAD 3.8 METERS (12.4 FT) EAST OF THE CENTER OF THE TRACK ROAD, 1.1 METERS (3.7 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE CENTER AND IN A DIM TRACK ROAD. THE MARK IS 0.2 FT ABOVE GROUND.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1899 (WCH) THIS STATION IS ON THE E END OF A SMALL ISLAND NOT FAR FROM MAIN SHORE, ABOUT 4 OR 5 MILES N OF MUERTOS ISLAND.  THE ISLAND IS COVERED WITH A THICK GROWTH OF MANGROVES.  STATION IS MARKED BY A 2-INCH IRON PIPE 18 INCHES LONG, SUNK IN A BED OF CEMENT AND PROJECTS ABOUT 2 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  A 40-FOOT TRIPOD SIGNAL WAS ERECTED OVER THIS STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1926)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) STATION COULD NOT BE FOUND.  LARGE PILES OF SAND AND DEBRIS WASHED ASHORE COVERING MOST OF ISLAND.
markers.setting: OBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS ON A WIDE TOP HILL (BARE) THAT BELONGS TO RIDGE THAT SPURS N FROM THE E OF SIERRA LUQUILLO.  IT IS OWNED BY NICASIO BETANCOURT.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD U.S.G.S. BENCH MARK TABLET SET ON A ROCK STAMPED FRIO 1934.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A CROSS WITH HOLE DRILLED IN MIDDLE OF A ROCK BURIED 2.42 METERS FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 348 DEG 20 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A CROSS WITH HOLE DRILLED ON MIDDLE OF A ROCK BURIED 3.06 METERS FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 73 DEG 00 MIN.  SIGNAL--A QUADRIPOD WITH BLACK CROSS TARGETS.  TO REACH FROM KILOMETER 7 H 6 OF THE CANOVANAS-HATO PUERCO ROAD, FOLLOW E A CART ROAD THROUGH FARM OF TOMAS SACHEZ, PASS CANOVANAS RIVER AND FOLLOW ROAD UPHILL THROUGH PEDRO FUSTEV FARM.  PASS FIRST RIDGE, AND ON SECOND IS THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1940)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1940 STATION AND R.M.S RECOVERED.  NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  ABOUT 6 KMS. SE OF CANOVANAS ON A HIGH GRASS AND BRUSH COVERED HILL.  ABOUT 3/4 KM. NE OF THE PENIER SCHOOL.  ON PROPERTY OF NICASIO BENTANCOURT.  THE HILL IS BROAD TOPPED.  AND THERE ARE NO PROMINENT FEATURES NEARBY TO WHICH TO REFER THE STATION.  BUT IT IS ON THE HIGHEST PART.  IT IS A STANDARD TABLET STAMPED FRIO 1934 SET IN A ROCK, FLUSH WITH GROUND AND SURROUNDED BY BUSHES.  R. M. NO. 1 IS A CROSS WITH A HOLE DRILLED IN ITS MIDDLE, IN A ROCK, FLUSH WITH GROUND, 2.42M FROM STATION IN AZIMUTH 348 DEG 20 MIN.  R. M. NO. 2 IS A CROSS WITH A HOLE DRILLED IN ITS MIDDLE, IN A ROCK, FLUSH WITH GROUND, 3.06M FROM STATION IN AZIMUTH 73 DEG 00 MIN.  TO REACH FROM CANOVANAS (PLAZA).  GO S ON ROAD TO HATA PUERCA (BEING EXTENDED TO JUNCOA), 5.3 MILES TO STORE OF PEDRO FUSTEV ON LEFT.  LEAVE CAR.  TAKE TRAIL DOWN TO AND ACROSS RIVER, CONTINUING UP E SIDE OF RIVER ABOUT 400 FT.  HERE TAKE LEFT FORK UP TO GROUP OF YELLOW HOUSES AND CASUALIDAD SCHOOL, ABOUT 0.2 MILE.  TAKE CART ROAD SOUTHWARD ALONG W SIDE OF FENCE.  AND AT FORKS, ABOUT 1000 FT. FARTHER, TAKE LEFT UP HILL.  FOLLOW THIS MAIN TRAIL UP HILL TO SADDLE (ABOUT 1-1/4 KM.).  AND PASS LARGE TIN HOUSE AND BARN ON LEFT.  CONTINUE ON UP TRAIL TO PENJER SCHOOL (NO. 517), FROM WHERE THE STATION HILL IS PROMINENT TO THE LEFT. CONTINUE ON TRAIL, BEARING LEFT ON SADDLE, THROUGH GATE AND UP TO TOP.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 (CFO) THE STATION DISK IN A BURIED BOULDER SET ABOUT FLUSH WITH THE GROUND, WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS LOCATED IN A FIELD AREA.  THE TWO REFERENCE MARKS HAVE BEEN DESTROYED, EVIDENCE OF ONE WAS FOUND NEAR THE STATION.
markers.setting: SET IN UNSPECIFIED ROCK OR BOULDER
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY ANDREGG INCORPORATED 1995 (MJB) NEW C.R.I.M.  GPS CONTROL SURVEY MONUMENT (PERPETUATES U.S.  NAVY HYDROGRAPHIC OFFICE MONUMENT FRIO) THE 2D TOPOGRAPHIC COMPANY, U.S. NAVY HYDRO OFFICE DESCRIPTION AS FOLLOWS  ON THE WESTERN COAST OF VIEQUES ISLAND ON POINT BOCA QUEBRADA WHICH IS A PROMINENT POINT ABOUT 2 KILOMETERS (1.25 MI) SOUTH OF PUNTA ARENAS.  STATION DISK IS STAMPED FRIO (1966) U.S.  NAVY HYDROGRAPHIC OFFICE TRIANGULATION STATION AND IS SET IN CONCRETE APPROXIMATELY 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE. THE SHAPE OF THE CONCRETE BASE IS IN THE FORM OF A DOME  NOTE  THE MONUMENT WAS FOUND BUT THE STATION DISK HAD BEEN REMOVED.  THE DISK STEM WAS FOUND SOLID AND STABLE AND IMBEDDED IN CONCRETE INSIDE A 2 INCH IRON PIPE IN THE CONCRETE MOUND  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE VIEQUES ISLAND AIRPORT, GO WEST ALONG HIGHWAY PR 200 FOR 0.9 KILOMETERS (0.55 MI) TO THE END OF HIGHWAY PR 200 AT GUARD SHACK OF THE ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL STATION. CONTINUE WESTERLY ON PAVED ROAD 2.1 KILOMETERS (1.30 MI) TO AN INTERSECTION. CONTINUE WESTERLY ALONG PAVED ROAD 1.7 KILOMETERS (1.05 MI) TO AN INTERSECTION AND THE ENTRANCE TO THE ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL STATION. CONTINUE WESTERLY ALONG PAVED ROAD 3.0 KILOMETERS (1.85 MI) TO THE END OF THE PAVED ROAD AND THE BEGINNING OF A GRAVEL TRACK. CONTINUE WESTERLY ALONG GRAVEL TRACK 1.3 KILOMETERS (0.80 MI) TO A SMALL ONE-LANE METAL BRIDGE.  CROSS BRIDGE AND CONTINUE ALONG DIRT TRACK 1.5 KILOMETERS (0.95 MI) TO A T INTERSECTION.  TURN LEFT AND GO ALONG DIRT TRACK 2.1 KILOMETERS (1.30 MI) TO END OF DIRT TRACK AT EDGE OF SANDY BEACH.  PROCEED ON FOOT WESTERLY ALONG WATERS EDGE 150 METERS (492.1 FT) TO SMALL GRASSY POINT AND THE STATION  THE STATION IS LOCATED APPROXIMATELY 9 METERS (29.5 FT) NORTH OF THE BEACH, APPROXIMATELY 6.5 METERS (21.3 FT) EAST OF THE BEACH AND APPROXIMATELY 8 METERS (26.2 FT) SOUTH OF THE BEACH  THE STATION IS A 3-1/4 INCH BRASS CAP STAMPED CENTRO DE RECAUDACION DE INGRESSOS MUNICIPALES, PUERTO RICO GPS CONTROL, C.R.I.M., UNLAWFUL TO DISTURB, FRIO, EPOXYED CEMENTED INTO THE STEM OF THE MISSING CAP IN A CONCRETE-FILLED 2 INCH PIPE IN A ROUNDED CONCRETE MOUND                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 2007 (TAB) RECOVERY AS DETAILED IN PREVIOUS DESCRIPTION. FINAL ROAD TO MARK ACCESSED FROM GREEN BEACH. GATE IS LOCKED. ACCESS MAY BE PROVIDED BY US FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE, VIEQUES AS MARK IS LOCATED ON FWS PROPERTY ADJACENT TO US NAVY RESTRICTED AREA. MARK IS LOCATED 10 M NORTH OF FWS BEACH HEAD SIGN NUMBER 20.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) A STATION WAS BUILT ON THE INSHORE END OF A SPIT OF LOOSE CORAL PILED UP 4 FEET ABOVE HIGH WATER.  THIS NECK OF CORAL LIES E OF FRIO ISLAND ABOUT 200 METERS.  STATION IS MARKED BY 3-INCH GALVANIZED-IRON PIPE, 36 INCHES LONG, DRIVEN INTO LOOSE CORAL, PROJECTING ABOUT 2 INCHES FROM SURFACE.  THIS ISLAND IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE, AND DURING PERIOD OF THIS SURVEY, CHANGED TO CONSIDERABLE EXTENT.  BELIEVE STATION WILL BE LOST AFTER FIRST HEAVY STORM.                            STATION RECOVERY (1971)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1971 (EKM) NO TRACE OF THE STATION REMAINS.  STATION DESTROYED.
markers.setting: OBJECT DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.
PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.
BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) FRONT RANGE BEACON AT ARROYO.  STEEL TOWER.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS ON A LIMESTONE HILL, THE SIDES OF WHICH ARE STEEP AND DIFFICULT TO CLIMB, ABOUT 5 KILOMETERS S OF FLORIDA AND ABOUT 1.5 KILOMETERS W OF K 15 H 7 OF THE FLORIDA-MAMEYES ROAD.  IT IS ON LAND OWNED BY ANTONIO OLIVER.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD U.S.G.S. BENCH MARK TABLET CEMENTED ON ROCK S OF SIGNAL.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD TABLET CEMENTED ON ROCK, 2.13 METERS S OF STATION, TRUE AZIMUTH 357 DEG 07 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD TABLET CEMENTED ON ROCK, 3.03 METERS E OF STATION, TRUE AZIMUTH 299 DEG 45 MIN.  TO REACH TAKE A TRAIL THAT GOES W OF BRIDGE ON K 15 H 7 ALONG SIDE OF A HILL AND OVER A CLOSED VALLEY TO THE HOUSE OF CRISTINO AND FROILAN DE CLERE ON A LOW SADDLE.  CROSS THE SADDLE AND CONTINUE W, NEAR ANOTHER HILL AND ANOTHER ABOVE SW OF THIS HOUSE AND DESCENT ON ITS W PART DOWN A STEEP WALL TO A SADDLE.  CLIMB ALONG THE RIDGE TO ITS TOP WHERE YOU WILL FIND THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (GBG) ABOUT 5 KILOMETERS SW OF FLORIDA, 1.5 KILOMETERS W OF THE FLORIDA-MAMEYES ROAD AT ITS K15 H7, AND 1.5 KILOMETERS N OF THE RIO YUNES, ON THE HIGHEST HILL IN THE VICINITY.  THE HILL IS A ROCKY PROMONTORY, COVERED WITH TREES AND BRUSH.  STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST PART OF A NARROW NW-SE TOP.  STATION IS A BRONZE DISK CEMENTED IN ROCK.  R.M. 1 IS A BRONZE DISK CEMENTED IN ROCK 2.13 METERS (HOR.) FROM STATION IN AZIMUTH 357 DEG 07 MIN.  R.M. 2 IS A BRONZE DISK CEMENTED IN ROCK 3.03 METERS (HOR.) FROM STATION IN AZIMUTH 299 DEG 45 MIN.  TO REACH FROM FLORIDA, GO SW ON THE FLORIDA-MAMEYES ROAD 3.55 MILES TO A CONCRETE BRIDGE ON CURVE AT KM. 15.75.  TAKE TRAIL W ALONG SIDE OF HILL AND ACROSS A CLOSED VALLEY TO HOUSE OF CHRISTINO AND FROILAN DE CLERC ON A LOW SADDLE.  CONTINUE W, BEARING RIGHT AT A CULTIVATED PATCH.  AND THEN BEARING LEFT TO WORK AROUND SIDE OF STEEP HILL FORMING SE WALL OF A HUGE NATURAL BOWL.  TRAIL LEADS TO A WOODEN LADDER SCALING CLIFF AT ITS LOW POINT ON THE S SIDE.  PASSING DOWN OTHER SIDE OF THIS CROSSING, CONTINUE THROUGH COFFEE GROVE TO S SIDE OF VALLEY, AND A DRAIN RISING STEEPLY TO SW.  WORK UP THIS DRAIN TO RIDGE (DIFFICULT) AND TURN RIGHT ALONG RIDGE TO STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AND ALL MARKS WERE FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 10-1/2 AIRLINE MILES SOUTHWEST OF MANATI, 14 AIRLINE MILES SOUTHEAST OF ARECIBO AND ON THE TOP OF A HIGH BRUSH COVERED HILL WHICH IS THE HIGHEST POINT IN THE VICINITY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE PLAZA IN FLORIDA ADENTRO, GO SOUTHWEST ON HIGHWAY 140 FOR 3.55 MILES TO KILOMETER POST 48.6 AT THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF A CONCRETE BRIDGE.  FROM HERE PACK WEST ON A WELL MARKED TRAIL FOR ABOUT 0.2 MILE TO THE SECOND ONE OF TWO HOUSES.  THE STATION HILL IS LOCATED ABOUT 1/2 MILE WEST OF THIS POINT JUST BEYOND A STEEP CLIFF WHICH CAN BE SEEN FROM THIS POINT.  CONTINUE WESTERLY ON A DIM TRAIL FOR ABOUT 0.1 MILE TO A VERY STEEP WASH ON THE LEFT.  BEAR LEFT AND PACK SOUTHWEST UP THE WASH FOR ABOUT 1/4 MILE TO A POINT WHERE THE CLIFF APEARS TO STEEP TO CLIMB. PACK UP THE CLIFF ON THE SOUTHEAST SIDE OF THE WASH FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO A SADDLE, TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ACROSS A RIDGE FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE HILL AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A USGS STATION DISK STAMPED FRONTON 1934, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH PROJECTS 1 INCH.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A USGS REFERENCE DISK WITH NO STAMPING, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A USGS REFERENCE DISK WITH NO STAMPING, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3-1/2 MILES SOUTHWEST OF FLORIDA ADENTRO.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 2004 (AAB) MARK NOT FOUND.
markers.setting: UNSPECIFIED SETTING

markers.description: BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 2004 (LLV) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 4.25 KM EAST OF PLAZA DE COLON AT OLD SAN JUAN AND ABOUT 8.05 KM  NORTH OF PLAZA LAS AMERICAS AT HATO REY,  AT THE SAN JERONIMO FORT IN PUERTA DE TIERRA  WARD OF SAN JUAN PUERTO RICO ON PROPERTY OF THE PUERTO RICAN CULTURAL INSTITUTE  (INSTITUTO DE CULTURA PUERTORIQUENA). THE FORT IS SURROUNDED BY THE ATLANTIC OCEAN TO  THE NORTH NORTHEAST, THE CONDADO LAGOON TO THE SOUTH SOUTHEAST, THE CARIBE HILTON  HOTEL TO THE NORTHWEST, AND THE PASEO CARIBE CODO COMPLEX TO THE SOUTHWEST.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM PLAZA LAS AMERICAS, GO NORTH ON STATE HIGHWAY PR-18  (EXPRESO LAS AMERICAS) AND THEN NORTH ON STATE HIGHWAY PR-22 (EXPRESO DE DIEGO) FOR 2.74  KM TO SAN JUAN AND THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY PR-1 (EXPRESO LUIS MUNOZ). GO WEST ON  STATE HIGHWAY PR-1 FOR 3.38 KM, JUST PASSING THE BRIDGE OVER THE SAN ANTONIO CHANNEL AND CONDADO LAGOON. CONTINUE ON PONCE DE LEON AVENUE (PR-25) FOR 0.48 KM, TURN RIGHT  ONTO MARGINAL STREET AND GO 0.32 KM AS IF GOING TO THE CONDO COMPLEX PASEO CARIBE,  BEAR RIGHT (EAST) ONTO THE LOCAL ROAD THAT ENDS AT THE ENTRANCE TO THE SAN JERONIMO  FORT.   PASSING THE BRIDGE TO THE FORT, TAKE THE NORTH RAMP TO THE UPPER LEVEL. MAKE A U-TURN  IN FRONT OF THE SENTRY BOX AND WALK WEST TO THE STATION JUST BEFORE THE WALL. STATION  IS 1.06 METER FROM THE END WALL. STATION IS A 3.5 INCH BRONZE DISK EMBEDDED IN THE FLOOR  WITH THE INSCRIPTION INSTITUTO DE CULTURA PUERTORRIQUENA GPS ON THE OUTER CIRCLE,  AND UPR-MAYAGUEZ AGRIMENSURA CONTROL H  V ON THE INNER CIRCLE, AND STAMPED FSJ-N.                            STATION RECOVERY (2006)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2006 (LM) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2011)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS 2011 (JJ) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED
markers.setting: SET IN A LARGE STRUCTURE WITH FOUNDATIONS ON BEDROCK
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 2004 (LLV) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 4.25 KM EAST OF PLAZA DE COLON AT OLD SAN JUAN AND ABOUT 8.05 KM  NORTH OF PLAZA LAS AMERICAS AT HATO REY,  AT THE SAN JERONIMO FORT IN PUERTA DE TIERRA  WARD OF SAN JUAN PUERTO RICO ON PROPERTY OF THE PUERTO RICAN CULTURAL INSTITUTE  (INSTITUTO DE CULTURA PUERTORIQUENA). THE FORT IS SURROUNDED BY THE ATLANTIC OCEAN TO  THE NORTH NORTHEAST, THE CONDADO LAGOON TO THE SOUTH SOUTHEAST, THE CARIBE HILTON  HOTEL TO THE NORTHWEST, AND THE PASEO CARIBE CODO COMPLEX TO THE SOUTHWEST.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM PLAZA LAS AMERICAS, GO NORTH ON STATE HIGHWAY PR-18  (EXPRESO LAS AMERICAS) AND THEN NORTH ON STATE HIGHWAY PR-22 (EXPRESO DE DIEGO) FOR 2.74  KM TO SAN JUAN AND THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY PR-1 (EXPRESO LUIS MUNOZ). GO WEST ON  STATE HIGHWAY PR-1 FOR 3.38 KM, JUST PASSING THE BRIDGE OVER THE SAN ANTONIO CHANNEL AND CONDADO LAGOON. CONTINUE ON PONCE DE LEON AVENUE (PR-25) FOR 0.48 KM, TURN RIGHT  ONTO MARGINAL STREET AND GO 0.32 KM AS IF GOING TO THE CONDO COMPLEX PASEO CARIBE,  BEAR RIGHT (EAST) ONTO THE LOCAL ROAD THAT ENDS AT THE ENTRANCE TO THE SAN JERONIMO  FORT.   PASSING THE BRIDGE TO THE FORT, TAKE THE SOUTH RAMP TO THE UPPER LEVEL. FROM THAT  POINT LOOK FORWARD TO THE FIRST STEP (TRUSS SHOE) TOWARD THE RIGHT (SOUTH). STATION IS  A 3.5 INCH BRONZE DISK EMBEDDED IN THE CENTER OF THE STEP WITH THE INSCRIPTION INSTITUTO  DE CULTURA PUERTORRIQUENA GPS ON THE OUTER CIRCLE AND UPR-MAYAGUEZ AGRIMENSURA CONTROL H  V ON THE INNER CIRCLE, AND STAMPED FSJ-S. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (WCH) THIS STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE PECULIARLY SHAPED ROCK WHICH BEARS THAT NAME AND WHICH FROM ITS DOME-LIKE TOP AND PRECIPITOUS SIDES IS LIKENED BY THE FISHERMEN TO AN INVERTED BOWLFUL OF FUNGY OR CORN PORRIDGE.  STATION IS MARKED BY IRON PIPE AND CONCRETE AS USUAL.  TRIPOD SIGNAL.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (SWM) THE DESCRIPTION SEEMS ADEQUATE.  THE STATION WAS NOT VISITED BUT IT WAS USED AS A HYDRO SIGNAL DURING 1964.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION SITE WAS VISITED AND THE MARK WAS FOUND LYING ON THE GROUND NEAR THE ORIGINAL LOCATION.  A NEW MARK WAS NOT ESTABLISHED BECAUSE THE SITE IS NOW USED FOR AN AIRCRAFT BOMBING TARGET.

markers.description: BY JAVIER E. BIDOT AND ASSOC. 2007 THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE NORTHWEST SECTION OF CAROLINA AT KILOMETER POST 2.5 ON THE EASTBOUND LANES OF STATE ROAD PR 66 AND THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF OVERPASS CARRYING PR 66 OVER CIARO ROAD.   OWNERSHIP PRHTA RIGHT-OF-WAY.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE ROADS PR-3, PR-26 AND PR-66, DRIVE 1.55 MI (2.5 KM) SOUTHERLY ON PR 66 TO THE MARK ON THE RIGHT AT THE FAR END OF THE BRIDGE.   THE STATION IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK IN A DRILLED HOLE FLUSH WITH CONCRETE SURFACE.  IT IS 5.71 M (18.7 FT) NORTHWEST OF MANHOLE COVER, 2.72 M (8.9 FT) SOUTHWEST OF WHITE CONTINUOUS LINE OF THE EMERGENCY LANE AND 0.6 M (2.0 FT) NORTHEAST OF CONCRETE PARAPET.
