markers.description: PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1901 (JN) THIS STATION IS ON THE LAND OF PACO QUEBEDO, AND IS 45 FEET S OF THE LINE BETWEEN HIS LAND AND THE PROPERTY OF ANTONIO REGES, AND 20 FEET W OF A N-S HEDGE OF WILD PINEAPPLE.  IT IS ONE MILE DISTANT AND BEARS S 6 DEG E FROM THE CHURCH IN ISABELA.  IT IS IN THE NE CORNER OF A FIELD AND JUST BELOW THE HIGHEST PART OF THE HILL DISTANT ABOUT 12 FEET AND BEARS S 73 DEG W.  THE MARK IS A GALVANIZED IRON PIPE 2 INCHES IN DIAMETER AND 2 FEET LONG SET IN A BED OF CEMENT.  THE LOWER 10 INCHES OF THE PIPE IS CEMENTED IN A HOLE CUT IN THE LIMESTONE ROCK.  THE TOP OF THE PIPE PROJECTS ABOUT 2-1/2 INCHES ABOVE THE BED OF CEMENT.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A 20-PENNY NAIL SET INSIDE OF THE PIPE.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1922 THIS STATION IS NEAR THE UNITED STATES COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY POSITION OF THE SAME NAME WHICH COULD NOT BE RECOVERED.  IT IS 13.7 METERS S OF AN E-W LINE OF HEDGE AND BRUSH AND 8.5 METERS W OF A N-S LINE.  IT IS 1.9 KILOMETERS DISTANT AND S 9 DEG 09 MIN E FROM THE WATER TANK AT ISABELA, AND IS IN THE NE CORNER OF A FIELD JUST BELOW THE HIGHEST PART OF THE FIELD WHICH IS ABOUT 4 METERS N 73 DEG E.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A STANDARD U.S.G.S. BRONZE BENCH MARK TABLET CEMENTED INTO A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF A LIMESTONE ROCK, WHICH IS PLANTED IN THE GROUND ABOUT 2-1/2 FEET, AND PROJECTS SLIGHTLY ABOVE THE SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1, IS A COPPER NAIL AND WASHER DRIVEN INTO A BLAZE ON THE E SIDE OF A LARGE TREE IN A CULTIVATED FIELD ON THE W SLOPE OF THE HILL.  IT IS 28.60 METERS DISTANT FROM THE STATION ON A TRUE AZIMUTH OF 139 DEG 00 MIN 34 SEC.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2, IS A DRILL HOLE IN SOLID ROCK OUTCROP ON THE N SLOPE OF THE HILL.  IT IS 5.80 METERS DISTANT FROM THE STATION ON A A TRUE AZIMUTH OF 219 DEG 49 MIN 34 SEC.  ELEVATION 117.05 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1959)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1959 (MM) STATION WAS FOUND AS DESCRIBED AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT WAS MARKED BY A STANDARD U.S.G.S. BRONZE BENCH MARK CEMENTED IN A SMALL CONCRETE MONUMENT, 8 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE REFERENCE MARKS AS DESCRIBED WERE DESTROYED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US NAVY 1964 THE HOLE WHERE THE STATION MARK HAD BEEN WAS FOUND, BUT THE MARK HAD BEEN DESTROYED.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED 7 AIRLINE MILES WEST-NORTHWEST OF SANTA ISABEL, 5-1/2 AIRLINE MILES SOUTH OF JUANA DIAZ AND ON A ROCKY SHORE LINE JUST SOUTH OF A CANE FIELD.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE PLAZA IN SANTA ISABEL, GO WEST ON HIGHWAY 1 FOR 6.65 MILES TO A CROSSROAD AT KILOMETER POST 114.4.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH ON A BLADED ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO A T-INTERSECTION.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON A BLADED ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH ON A BLADED ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A T-INTERSECTION AT THE SHORE LINE.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON A BLADED ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT AND THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PAGEN 1966, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING 1 INCH.  IT IS 75 FEET NORTH OF THE SHORE LINE, 50 FEET NORTHWEST OF A GROUP OF TREES, 43 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF A TRACK ROAD AND 15 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF A TRACK ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PAGEN NO 1 1966, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 37 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE TRACK ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PAGEN NO 2 1966, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING 1 INCH.  IT IS 6 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE TRACK ROAD.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JMC) STATION MARK, RM 1 AND RM 2 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  RM 1 DISK HAS BEEN TAMPERED WITH.  STATION IS NOW 5 FEET NORTH OF A FENCE AND 6 FEET SOUTH OF A CANE ROW.  ALL DISKS ARE STAMPED PAGAN, 1966.                            STATION RECOVERY (1971)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1971 (EKM) A THOROUGH SEARCH WAS CONDUCTED AND NO TRACE OF THE STATION MARK OR REFERENCE MARKS WAS FOUND.  STATION DESTROYED.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) STATION IS LOCATED ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THE N END OF PAJARITA CAY.  STATION IS ABOUT 10 FEET S OF THE CLIFF, WHICH DROPS AWAY SHEER TO THE NORTHWARD, AND IS ABOUT MIDWAY BETWEEN THE E AND W LIMITS OF CAY.  THE TOP OF THE CAY, ESPECIALLY IN THE VICINITY OF THE STATION IS COVERED WITH A GROWTH OF LARGE CACTUS.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN THE TOP OF A MIXTURE OF STONE AND CEMENT FILLING A HOLE ABOUT 1-1/2 FEET DEEP.  NO REFERENCE MARKS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (MTP) STATION SEARCHED FOR EXTENSIVELY BUT WAS NOT FOUND.  POSSIBLE WAVE ACTION HAS ERODED SHEER BLUFF.
markers.setting: UNSPECIFIED SETTING

markers.description: PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) STATION IS LOCATED ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THE SE HILL OF THE PALADA CAYS.  MARK IS A STANDARD BRASS TRIANGULATION MARK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE ON OUTCROPPING BEDROCK.  THERE IS A CONSIDERABLE GROWTH OF FIG TREE SCRUBS FROM 8 TO 12 FEET HIGH NEAR THE TOP OF THIS HILL.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN CREVICE OF SMALL ROCK SHELF TO THE SOUTHWARD.  FROM STATION, REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS ABOUT IN LINE WITH HIGH PART OF GREEN RIDGE, WHICH FORMS THE NE PART OF CULEBRITA ISLAND.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD BRASS DISK CEMENTED IN CREVICE OF ROCK, ON LINE ABOUT HALF-WAY BETWEEN PAJARITA CAY AND SHARK ROCK.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 3 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (MTP) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  MARK IS NEAR EASTERN EDGE OF HIGHEST PART OF ISLAND ABOUT ONE FOOT EAST OF DENSE GROWTH.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS ON LONE LARGE BOULDER SSW OF STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND ALL MARKS WERE IN GOOD CONDITION.  NOTE--THERE IS NO STAMPING ON THE MARKS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1993)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE 1993 (BR) STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  NO STAMPING ON CAPS.  GPS VISIBILITY IS EXCELLENT.  PREVIOUS DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE EXCEPT THERE IS NOW VERY LITTLE VEGATATION ON THE ISLAND WHICH IS MOSTLY ROCK.  CONTACT U.S. FISH AND WILDFIRE SERVICE IN CULEBRA BEFORE USING THIS STATION.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (WCH) STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THE ISLAND, WHICH THOUGH NOT VERY HIGH, HAS A PRECIPITOUS FACE ON ALL SIDES, MAKING IT RATHER DIFFICULT OF ACCESS.  A TRIPOD SIGNAL WAS BUILT HERE BY MR. MITCHELL, WHO ALSO OCCUPIED THE STATION.  HE MAKES NO MENTION OF THE CENTER MARK, WHICH IS THEREFORE SUPPOSED TO BE AS USUAL, PIPE IN CEMENT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1923)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1923 (FTS) STATION MARK FOUND LYING ON GROUND, NEAR HOLE INTO WHICH MARK FITTED.  RECOMMEND NEW STATION BE PLACED.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (SF) MEDIUM HEIGHT CHIMNEY.  RED, VERY BLACK TOP NEAR LARGE, FLAT, WHITE TIN ROOF FACTORY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1970 (JKW) STATION RECOVERED IN APPARENT GOOD CONDITION FROM ITS PLOTTED POSITION.  STATION APPEARS TO BE VERY OLD, BUT IT SHOULD BE USED WITH CAUTION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RMB) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN FAIR CONDITION.  IT IS CONSTRUCTED OF RED BRICK AND IS 76 FEET HIGH.  ABOUT THE TOP 6 FEET OF THE NORTH SIDE HAS FALLEN AWAY.  CRACKS IN THE STRUCTURE ON TWO SIDES EXTEND ALL THE WAY TO THE GROUND.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 4 MILES WEST OF SALINAS.

BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1982 (JCL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 8.0 KM (6 MI) NORTHEAST OF PONCE, 4 KM (2-1/2 MI) NORTHWEST OF COTO LAUREL, AND 0.4 KM (1/4 MI) EAST OF THE EAST END OF THE PROPOSED CERRILLOS DAM.  OWNERSHIP--U.S. ARMY CORPS OF ENGINERRS.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 14 AND 139 ABOUT 4 KM (2-1/2 MI) NORTHEAST OF PONCE, GO NORTHWEST ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 0.5 KM (0.3 MI) TO A CROSSROAD AND JUNCTION OF HIGHWAY 505.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHEAST ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 3.1 KM (1.95 MI) TO A FORK.  KEEP RIGHT FORK DOWN GRADE ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 3.5 KM (2.2 MI) TO THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS SOIL TESTING LABORATORY ON THE LEFT. CONTINUE AHEAD FOR 0.2 KM (0.1 MI) TO A FIELD ENTRANCE ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT THROUGH GATE, THEN BEAR HALF-RIGHT FOR 0.08 KM (0.05 MI) TO A CREEK CROSSING. CROSS CREEK, THEN TURN RIGHT ON DIRT ROAD FOR 0.3 KM (0.2 MI) TO A REVERSE FORK.  TURN SHARP LEFT FOR 0.08 KM (0.05 MI) TO A 3-WAY FORK. KEEP RIGHT UP STEEP GRADE FOR 1.0 KM (0.65 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT AT SHARP CURVE TO THE RIGHT.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED---PALM 1982---, EPOXIED TO THE TOP OF A 1/2 INCH STEEL ROD DRIVEN 1 METER INTO THE GROUND.  THE TOP 30 CM IS IN A CONCRETE FILLED PLASTIC TILE.  IT IS LOCATED 9.40 METERS (31.0 FT) WEST FROM THE CENTER OF THE GRAVEL ROAD, 8.70 METERS (28.6 FT) NORTH FROM A LONE PALM TREE, APPROXIMATELY 10 FEET HIGHER THAN THE GRAVEL ROAD, AND ON THE NORTH END OF A CUT BANK.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 1 IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED ---PALM NO 1 1982---, EPOXIED TO THE TOP OF A 1/2 INCH STEEL ROD DRIVEN 1.5 METERS  INTO THE GROUND, PROJECTING 10 CM, AND IN A 25 CM CONCRETE FILLED PLASTIC TILE.  IT IS LOCATED 21.9 METERS (72.0 FT) NORTHEAST FROM A LONE PALM TREE AND 5.3 METERS (17.5 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE CENTER OF THE GRAVELED ROAD.  MARK IS BELOW STATION 0.6 METERS.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 2 IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED ---PALM NO 2 1982---, EPOXIED TO THE TOP OF A 1/2 INCH STEEL ROD DRIVEN 1.3 METERS INTO THE GROUND, PROJECTING 10 CM, AND IN A CONCRETE FILLED PLASTIC TILE.  IT IS LOCATED 21.3 METERS (70.0 FT) EAST-NORTHEAST FROM A LONE PALM TREE AND 2.1 METERS (7.0 FT) EAST FROM A CUT BANK.  MARK IS BELOW STATION 0.6 METERS.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN ABOVE THE MARK WAS 2.9 METERS.  NO AZIMUTH MARK FOR THIS STATION, ALTHOUGH TRIANGULATION STATION DONNA IS ABOUT 1/2 KM AWAY.  THIS STATION WAS ALSO USED FOR DOPPLER OBSERVATIONS.
markers.setting: METAL ROD DRIVEN INTO GROUND. SEE TEXT FOR ADDITIONAL
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (RLS) STATION IS ABOUT 1-1/2 MILES NE OF CEIBA, WITHIN THE PROPOSED BOUNDARY OF THE ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL RESERVATION, ON POINT FIGUERA, ABOUT 450 METERS W OF THE HIGH-WATER LINE AT THE EXTREME E END OF THE POINT.  THIS POINT AND POINT FIGUERITA TO THE S ARE MADE UP OF SEVERAL NARROW SAND SPITS SLIGHTLY ABOVE HIGH WATER AND CONNECTED TO EACH OTHER AND TO THE MAINLAND BY MANGROVE SWAMP. THE STATION IS AT THE OUTER END OF THE INNER ONE OF THE SAND SPITS WHICH FORMS THE INNER PART OF THE N SIDE OF THE POINT, ABOUT 35 METERS W OF THE E END OF THE SPIT, ABOUT MIDWAY BETWEEN THE HIGH-WATER LINES ON THE N-AND-S SIDES.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A STANDARD BRONZE DISK, SET IN A CONCRETE BLOCK WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THERE IS NO UNDERGROUND MARK.  THE WITNESS MARKS ARE TRIANGULAR BLAZES ON PALM TREES.  NO.1 IS ON THE E SIDE OF THE SOUTHEASTERLY PALM TREE AND NO.2 IS ON THE S SIDE OF THE EASTERLY PALM TREE ON THE INNER POINT.  THERE ARE NO REFERENCE MARKS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) STATION SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS LOCATED ON A PROMINENT BARE POINTED ROCKY HILL THAT PROJECTS ABOVE THE LINE OF LIMESTONE HILLS RUNNING N OF LARES.  IT IS ABOUT 3.5 KILOMETERS N OF E OF THE TOWN, ON BO. PALMAR LLANO, ON LAND OWNED BY FIDEL TORRES.  IT IS APPROACHED FROM KILOMETER 30 H 7 ON LARES-ARECIBO ROAD, FOLLOWING A TRAIL UPHILL JUST S OF CULVERT IN FRONT OF PRIMITIVE GORENGS HOUSE, IN A NW DIRECTION.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD U.S.G.S. TABLET CEMENTED ON NATURAL ROCK.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD U.S.G.S. TABLET CEMENTED ON NATURAL ROCK, 2.39 METERS FROM STATION MARK IN TRUE AZIMUTH 256 DEG 45 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD U.S.G.S. TABLET CEMENTED ON NATURAL ROCK, 5.63 METERS FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 349 DEG 02 MIN.  SIGNAL--QUADRIPOD AND BLACK CROSS-TARGETS AND A WHITE FLAG.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (GBG) RECOVERED STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS AS DESCRIBED.  TRAIL TO STATION STARTS AT KM. 30.8 OF THE LARES-ARECIBO ROAD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AND ALL MARKS WERE FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED 11 AIRLINE MILES EAST-SOUTHEAST OF SAN SABASTIAN, 10 AIRLINE MILES NORTHEAST OF LOS MARIAS, 2 AIRLINE MILES EAST OF LARES AND ON THE TOP OF A HIGH ROCK COVERED HILL.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE PLAZA IN LARES, GO EASTERLY ON HIGHWAY 111 FOR 2.5 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT AT KILOMETER POST 30.3.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHERLY ON A ROCK ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE ROCK COVERED HILL AND THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE PACK NORTHERLY UP THE HILL FOR ABOUT 15 MINUTES TO THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE HILL AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY BENCH MARK DISK STAMPED PALMAR 1934, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH PROJECTS 2 FEET.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED NO 1, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED NO 2, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2 MILES EAST OF LARES.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 2004 (RCC) MARK RECOVERED IN POOR CONDITION.
markers.setting: SET IN UNSPECIFIED ROCK OR BOULDER
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1939 STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3/4 KM. N OF PABLADO PALMER, ON THE FIRST TOP OF THE RIDGE RUNNING N FROM TOWN TOWARD THE COAST AND W OF MAMEYES RIVER.  APPROACHED FOLLOWING RD. 3 E FROM PALMER TOWN FROM ABOUT 500 METERS TURN N BY CAR ROAD WHICH IS FOLLOWED TO ITS SECOND FORK TO SW, TURN SW THERE GOING AROUND A ROUND SPUR AT CANE SCALE, THEN W ABOUT 100 TURNING AT FORK TO THE N CONTINUE ON THAT DIRECTION TO FENCE LINE, FOLLOW TRAIL UP RIDGE TO TOP OF HILL AND STATION.  LAND OWNED BY FAJARDO SUGAR COMPANY.  STATION MARK--STANDARD TABLET STAMPED PALMER 1939 CEMENTED TO A BIG BOULDER, VISIBLE SURFACE 1 BY 1/2 METER AND ABOUT 70 METERS S OF N SADDLE, TOP OF HILL ABOUT 200 METERS LONG.  REFERENCE MARK 1--HOLE DRILLED ON ROCK 4.70 METERS N OF STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 2--HOLE DRILLED ON ROCK 18.60 METERS E OF STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1942)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1942 (GBG) THIS STATION RECOVERED.  IT IS IMMEDIATELY N OF THE TOWN OF MAMEYES OR PALMER.  ON A PROMINENT, BARE, LONG, FLAT-TOPPED N AND S HILL.  THE STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THE HILL, CLOSER TO THE E SLOPE, AND ABOUT CENTRAL IN A N AND S DIRECTION, OR APPROXIMATELY 300 FEET N OF THE S END OF THE HILL, AND 20 FEET E OF THE HIGHEST POINT.  IT IS ABOUT 1/2 KILOMETERS S OF A GROUP OF HOUSES, AND AN EQUAL DISTANCE SW OF A ROUNDED HILL.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A TABLET STAMPED PALMER 1939, CEMENTED INTO ROCK.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A HOLE DRILLED IN THE ROCK 4.7 METERS N OF THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A HOLE DRILLED IN THE ROCK 18.60 METERS E OF THE STATION.  TO REACH FROM PALMER (MAMEYES), GO THE RAILROAD STATION AND LEAVE CAR.  TAKE TRAIL, ANGLING NE UP THROUGH CANE FIELD, TO A BRUSHY N-S FENCE ON STEEP HILLSIDE.  FOLLOW FENCE UPHILL ON A DIM TRAIL.  AND AT RIDGE BEAR RIGHT TOWARDS HIGHEST TOP, ON WHICH THE STATION IS LOCATED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLC) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  R.M. NO. 1 WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED.  IT HAS PROBABLY BEEN DESTROYED BY SMALL TRAIL ALONG RIDGE.  R.M. NO. 2 WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 (CFO) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND IS IN GOOD CONDITION, EXCEPT THAT THE DISK IS BATTERED TO THE EXTENT THAT THE STAMPING IS NO MORE LEGIBLE.  THE TWO REFERENCE MARKS WERE SEARCHED FOR AND NOT RECOVERED.
markers.setting: SET IN A BOULDER
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2-1/2 MILES NORTHEAST OF FAJARDO, 1-1/2 MILES NORTH OF PLAYA DE FAJARDO, ON THE HIGHEST POINT IN THE GENERAL VICINITY AND ABOUT 200 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A LARGE HOME.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 194 AND 195 AT THE NORTHEAST EDGE OF FAJARDO, GO EASTERLY ON HIGHWAY 195 FOR 0.3 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 195 AND 987.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH AND NORTHEAST ON HIGHWAY 987 FOR 2.6 MILES TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO NORTHEAST FOR 0.4 MILE TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO EAST FOR ABOUT 100 FEET TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH AND EAST FOR 0.6 MILE TO A LARGE HOUSE ON THE RIGHT, AT THE TOP OF A HILL.  CONTINUE EAST AND SOUTH ON A NARROW, DIRT ROAD, PASSING ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE HOUSE, FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A CENTER-PUNCHED IRON PIN THAT IS SET IN THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  PALMITA 1961 IS INSCRIBED IN THE IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE.  IT IS 29 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A CONCRETE CISTERN AND 8 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A POWER POLE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, STAMPED PALMITA PRS NO 1 1965, IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A BOULDER THAT PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  IT IS 20 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE CONCRETE CISTERN AND 16 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE POWER POLE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, STAMPED PALMITA PRS NO 2 1965, IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A BOULDER THAT PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  IT IS 25 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE CONCRETE CISTERN AND 12 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE POWER POLE.  NO SUITABLE LOCATION FOR AN AZIMUTH MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 2004 (UPR) MARK RECOVERED IN POOR CONDITION.
markers.setting: OBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1901 (JN) THIS STATION IS SITUATED ON THE SITE OF ONE OF THE STATIONS OF THE SPANISH TRIANGULATION.  IT IS ON THE HIGHEST HILL IN THE VICINITY BEING ABOUT 3/4 MILE W OF THE MOUTH OF THE MANATI RIVER AND 1 MILE DISTANT N 25 DEG W OF THE CENTRAL PLAZUELA CHIMNEY.  IT IS 1/4 MILE FROM THE COASTLINE AND ABOUT 100 METERS W FROM A CABIN IN THE VICINITY.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY AN IRON PIPE 3 INCHES IN DIAMETER, SET IN A BED OF CEMENT, THE TOP OF THE PIPE EXTENDING 4 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  THE PIPE IS FILLED WITH CEMENT AND THE CENTER OF A 20-PENNY NAIL DRIVEN INTO THE CEMENT MARKS THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1927)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1927 (GCM) CABIN NAMED IN DESCRIPTION IS GONE AND IRON PIPE IS PULLED OUT.  STATION IS BUILT OF BRICKS AND MORTAR WITH FACING OF MORTAR IN SHAPE OF A TRUNCATED PYRAMID 2 FEET SQUARE AT BASE (GROUND SURFACE) AND 1-1/2 FEET HIGH (ABOVE GROUND).  STATION WAS LOCATED BY MEANS OF DESCRIPTION AND LOCAL GUIDE, WHO ASSURED ME IT HAD BEEN USED BY PREVIOUS PARTIES, SURVEYING IN THAT LOCALITY.  HILL IS BARE ON TOP AND IS EASTERN OF TWO IN VICINITY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS 1946 LETTER FROM MR. E.G. RUBIO, HQ. ANTILLES DEPT., OFFICE OF DEPT. ENGR., A.P.O. 851, C/O P.M., MIAMI, FLORIDA, DATED OCTOBER 30, 1946--  ORIGINAL NOTES CALL FOR A PIPE IN CONCRETE MONUMENT FLUSH WITH GROUND AND NEAR BRICK PYRAMID (SPANISH TRIANGULATION MONUMENT).  STATION NOT REALLY RECOVERED BY C.M. MATTISON IN 1927.  ORIGINAL PIPE AND MONUMENT GONE, ONLY FOUND PYRAMID (WHICH IS CALLED PALMUS 2).  SEE OBSERVATIONS OF 1934 AND 1939-1940 GEOLOGICAL SURVEY.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1940 THIS STATION WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1931 BUT WAS NOT OBSERVED (POINTED) AS AN INTERSECTION POINT UNTIL 1934.  IT IS ON THE SAME HILL AND VERY NEAR THE LOCATION OF PALMUS 1901, ESTABLISHED BY J.N., WHICH WAS NOT REALLY RECOVERED IN 1927 NOR 1931.  THE ORIGINAL STATION WAS A PIPE EMBEDDED IN CONCRETE, FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  IN 1927 ONLY THE PYRAMID WAS FOUND, AND NOT THE PIPE.  STATION IS APPROACHED FROM BARCELONETA BY FOLLOWING N BY MUN. ROAD TO PALMOS ALTOS TO ITS KM. POST, WHERE TURNING RIGHT (E) BY DIRT ROAD E ABOUT 300 METERS TO FOOT OF HILL.  CONTINUE E ALONG S EDGE OF SAME ABOUT 200 METERS MORE, TURN N TO RIDGE AND W TO STATION, WHICH IS LOCATED ON ITS MIDDLE TOP.  STATION MARK - CENTER POINT OF IRON ROD CEMENTED TO TOP OF BRICK PYRAMID, PROBABLY OLD SPANISH STATION.  R.M. 1 IS A R.R. SPIKE FIXED TO ROCK 2.955 METERS E OF STATION.  R.M. 2 IS A R.R. SPIKE CEMENTED TO ROCK 1.60 METERS S OF STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION MARK WAS FOUND AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE NOT FOUND.  REFERENCE MARKS 3 AND 4 WERE ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 12-1/4 MILES EAST OF ARECIBO, 3-1/2 MILES NORTH OF HIGHWAY 2, 2-1/2 MILES NORTHWEST OF BARCELONETA AND ON A LOW RIDGE THAT IS COVERED BY BRUSH AND TREES.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE PLAZA IN BARCELONETA, GO WEST ON A PAVED STREET FOR 0.2 MILE TO A T-ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO WEST, NORTH AND WEST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 2.1 MILES TO A CROSSROAD AT KILOMETER POST 6.4.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH ON A FIELD ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A T-ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON A FIELD ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO A WIRE GATE ON THE LEFT AND THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE PACK NORTH THROUGH THE GATE, BEAR RIGHT AND PACK NORTHEAST THROUGH THICK BRUSH FOR ABOUT 15 MINUTES TO THE STATION ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE EAST END OF THE EAST-WEST RIDGE.  THE STATION MARK IS A 1/2-INCH IRON ROD WITH A CHISELED CROSS ON ITS TOP, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE POST THAT PROJECTS 14 INCHES WITH THE LEGEND PALMOS 2 ACROSS ITS TOP.  NOTE DESC.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PALMUS 2 USGS NO 3 1934 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A ROCK OUTCROP THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND AND IS THE SAME ELEVATION AS THE STATION MARK.  NOTE 12A  REFERENCE MARK 4 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PALMUS 2 USGS NO 4 1934 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A ROCK OUTCROP THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND AND IS 1 FOOT LOWER IN ELEVATION THAN THE STATION MARK.  NOTE 12A  NO SUITABLE PLACE WAS FOUND FOR AN AZIMUTH MARK.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2-1/2 MILES NORTHWEST OF BARCELONETA.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 2004 (AYP) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1941 V. A. ELEVATION 77.79 METERS.  STATION IS IN THE EASTERN PART OF VIEQUES ISLAND ON AN E-W RIDGE ABOUT 1-1/4 KM. SOUTH OF THE NORTH COAST 1-1/2 KM. NE OF ENSENADA HONDA ON A GRASSY TOP WHICH IS ABOUT 1/2 KM. WEST OF A MORE PROMINENT WOODED TOP.  TO REACH FROM ISABEL II DRIVE EAST ON NORTH COAST ROAD 18.2 KM. TO THE END OF THE HARD SURFACE.  CONTINUE EAST ON DIRT ROAD 0.4 MILES THEN TURN RIGHT (S) AT Y FORK.  DRIVE SOUTH TO LLAUREL CATTLE YARD OF MR. ESTEBAN DIAZ.  FOLLOW CART ROAD EAST TO FIRST SADDLE WHERE THERE ARE SEVERAL BIG QUENEPO TREES ON THE SOUTH AND A SPREADING TAMARINDO TREE ON THE NORTH.  FOLLOW RIDGE NE TO SADDLE OF MAIN RIDGE WEST OF A PROMINENT WOODED TOP.  TURN LEFT (NW) AT SADDLE AND CONTINUE ABOUT 300 METERS TO TOP AND STATION.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD TABLET STAMPED PALOMA 1941 AND SET IN CONCRETE MONUMENT.  R.M. NO. 1 IS A CHISELED CROSS ON ROCK 4.72 METERS FROM STATION.  PLANE AZIMUTH 303-54.  R.M. NO. 2 IS A CHISELED CROSS ON ROCK 10.06 METERS FROM STATION.  PLANE AZIMUTH 155-22.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (WCH) STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THE ISLAND OF THAT NAME, LYING E OF FAJARDO.  THE ISLAND IS OPEN AND COVERED WITH GRASS.  BEST APPROACHED FROM THE W SIDE ON ACCOUNT OF HAVING SMOOTH WATER, THOUGH THE HILL SIDE IS VERY STEEP.  MARKED BY AN IRON PIPE SET IN CONCRETE.  A QUADRIPOD SIGNAL WITH 30-FOOT LEGS WAS BUILT HERE AND PILES OF STONE WERE HEAPED AROUND THE LEGS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1902)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1902 (RLF) STATION RECOVERED.  STATION IS MARKED BY A 2-INCH IRON PIPE SET IN A HEAP OF SMALL ROCKS AND CEMENT.  THE PIPE PROJECTS ABOUT 6 INCHES ABOVE THE HEAP OF ROCKS.  MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  ACCESS TO THE STATION IS EASY FROM THE COVE ON THE W SIDE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1902)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1902 (JN) STATION IS ON THE ISLAND OF THE SAME NAME, AND WAS FOUND APPARENTLY INTACT AND A POLE SIGNAL FOR TRIANGULATION PURPOSES WAS PLUMBED OVER IT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (GBG) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN GOOD CONDITION.  ANCHORAGE IN DEEP WATER AT HOUSE AND PALM GROVE AT SW END OF ISLAND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  IT IS 17.4 METERS WEST OF A 6-FOOT WIDE WELL-TRAVELLED PATH RUNNING ALONG THE TOP OF THE RIDGE, AND 3.37 METERS NORTH OF A ONE-FOOT SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WITH A 3 1/4-INCH BRASS DISK STAMPED U.S. ARMY ENGR. DEPT.  BEST APPROACHED FROM WEST SIDE OF ISLAND AS THERE IS A PIER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (ELJ) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED.  A COMPLETE DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  STATION IS LOCATED NEAR THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF PUERTO RICO, ABOUT 5 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF THE TOWN OF FAJARDO, ON ISLA PALOMINOS.  THE STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE ISLAND ON THE CENTER ONE OF THREE SUMMITS.  TO REACH FROM THE DOCK ON THE SOUTHWEST END OF THE ISLAND, WALK THROUGH A PALM GROVE AND BEAR TO THE RIGHT TO A BARNYARD GATE.  GO THROUGH THE GATE UPHILL TO A SMALL SHACK ON THE RIGHT.  TAKE TRAIL TO THE LEFT ABOUT 1/4 MILE TO STATION.  STATION MARK, A 2 INCH PIPE, IS SET IN AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE ABOUT 1-1/2 FEET IN DIAMETER.  THE PIPE PROJECTS ABOUT 6 INCHES.  THERE IS NO UNDERGROUND MARK.  A TIE WAS MADE TO A U.S. ARMY ENGINEERS DEPT. MARK NEAR THE STATION.  THE MARK, A BRONZE DISK, STAMPED U.S. ARMY ENGR. DEPT., IS SET IN CONCRETE FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  NO REFERENCE MARKS OR AZIMUTH MARK WERE SET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE IRREGULAR BASE OF THE MARK WAS COVERED WITH A 1 TO 2 INCH COATING OF CONCRETE.  TWO REFERENCE MARKS WERE SET.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISC STAMPED PALOMINOS NO 1 1900 IS SET IN A MASS OF CONCRETE FLUSH WITH THE GROUND EAST OF THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISC STAMPED PALOMINOS NO. 2 1900 IS SET IN A MASS OF CONCRETE FLUSH WITH THE GROUND NORTH OF THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 2004 PALOMINO'S ISLAND IS AT PRESENT A PRIVATE PROPERTY. TO FIND THE POINT, LOOK FOR THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE ISLAND WHICH IS IN THE CENTER. IT IS RECOMMENDED TO GO UP THROUGH THE SOUTHWEST PART OF THE MOUNTAIN, FOLLOW THE ROAD TO THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE MOUNTAIN. THE POINT IS EXACTLY IN THIS ROAD, ABOUT 15 FEET FROM THE HIGHEST PART OF THE ISLAND.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2004 (GOP) RM1 WAS LOCATED AT LOCATION DESCRIBED BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO IN 2002.  USED RM1 TO LOCATE REMAINS OF STATION MARK.   2 INCH PIPE HAS BEEN DAMAGED BUT REMAINS ARE STILL SURROUNDED BY IRREGULAR CONCRETE UNDER HEAVY COVER OF THORNS.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1-1/2 MILES SOUTHEAST OF YABUCOA, 2-1/2 MILES NORTHEAST OF MAUNABO AND ON THE CERRO SANTA ELENA MOUNTAIN.  THIS IS THE MOST PROMINENT MOUNTAIN IN THE AREA.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN YABACOA, GO EASTERLY FOR 0.65 MILE TO A T ROAD AT AN ESSO SERVICE STATION, TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 3 FOR 0.8 MILE TO A BRIDGE, A HOUSE AND A SIDE ROAD ON THE LEFT JUST BEFORE REACHING KILOMETER POST 101.4, TURN LEFT ON STEEP MOUNTAIN ROAD AND GO EASTERLY FOR 1.6 MILES TO A NARROW GATE AT THE END OF DISTINGUISHABLE ROAD, PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND GO SOUTHERLY ACROSS PASTURE FOR 0.1 MILE TO THE EDGE OF WOODS, TURN LEFT AND GO EASTERLY UP RIDGE FOR 0.5 MILE FOLLOWING POWER LINE TO ITS END AT THE LAST HOUSE ON TOP OF HILL, PASS THROUGH GATES AND TO THE RIGHT OF THE HOUSE THEN NORTHERLY ALONG RIDGE FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE HIGHEST POINT AND THE STATION.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE GRASS COVERED MOUNTAIN.  IT IS A T STAKE SET IN AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE WITH SANTA 195 SCRIBED IN THE CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED PANDA NO 1 1965, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A LARGE AND ONLY BOLDER ON THE HILL.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED PANDA NO 2 1965, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3 INCH SOIL PIPE.  IT IS TO THE NORTHWEST AND SLIGHTLY LOWER THAN THE STATION.
markers.setting: OBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1901 (JEM) THIS STATION IS ON THE SE SUMMIT OF THE MOUNTAIN KNOWN IN MAUNABO AS THE PANDURA.  THE ROAD FROM MAUNABO TO YABUCOA WAS TRACED OUT ON THE WESTERN FLANK OF PANDURA.  THE SIGNAL IS ABOUT 15 FEET FROM THE E EDGE OF THE SUMMIT AND FROM THIS SUMMIT THE DESCENT IS ABRUPT INTO THE BIG VALLEY BETWEEN PANDURA AND SOMBRERO.  THE SIGNAL IS ON A SMALL BARE GRASSY KNOLL WHICH IS NOT THE HIGHEST PART OF PANDURA.  ABOUT 60 FEET DISTANT, ON A MAGNETIC BEARING OF 200 DEG, IS THE SHACK OF LAOS GARAY, WHICH IS ON A LOWER BENCH.  THE E END OF THE RIDGE OF GARAYS ROOF IS IN LINE WITH THE LARGE CHIMNEY OF THE NEW CENTRAL SUGAR FACTORY NEAR MAUNABO.  THE PANDURA MOUNTAIN IS SOMETIMES CALLED EL PIQUA.  STATION IS MARKED BY A WINE BOTTLE PACKED IN EARTH AND CEMENT AND FILLED WITH EARTH AND CEMENT.  BURIED UNTIL ITS TOP IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  A NAIL IN THE CENTER OF THE BOTTOM OF THE SIGNAL POLE WAS SET IN THE CENTER OF THE NECK OF THE BOTTLE.  TO REACH FROM MAUNEBO TAKE THE TRAIL TO YABUCOA AND FOLLOW IT TO A POINT WHERE THE FIRST LONG RIDGE (FLANK) FROM PANDURA COMES TO THE TRAIL.  TAKE THE PATH UP THIS TRAIL AND FOLLOW IT UP THE RIDGE AND IT WILL TAKE YOU TO GARAYS PLACE AND THE STATION.  AT THE POINT WHERE THIS TRAIL LEAVES THE MAUNABO-YABUCOA TRAIL THERE IS A LARGE CEIBU TREE ON THE LEFT SIDE OF THE MAUNABO-YABUCOA TRAIL.  ANOTHER IDENTIFICATION IS THAT IT IS NEAR THE FIRST CABIN (ON LEFT SIDE OF ROAD) WHICH ONE ENCOUNTERS AND THAT IT IS A FEW HUNDRED YARDS S OF WHERE THE MAUNABO-YABUCOA ROAD PASSES BY A GROUP OF GREAT GRANITE BOULDERS.  TWO HOUSES ARE BUILT AMONG THE BOULDERS ON THE S OF THE ROAD.  A HORSE CAN BE RIDDEN ONLY A SHORT DISTANCE UP THE TRAIL THAT FOLLOWS THE RIDGE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1902)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1902 (RLF) SIGNAL WAS NOT VISITED BUT IT WAS SEEN STANDING ON SUMMIT OF MOUNTAIN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1927)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1927 (GCM) SITE OF STATION IS NOW UNDER CULTIVATION AND NO TRACE OF STATION COULD BE FOUND.  PRESENT SQUATTER HAS BEEN IN POSSESSION ABOUT A YEAR AND COULD GIVE NO INFORMATION.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2 MILES TO THE S OF THE YABUCOA AND TO THE N OF THE TOWN OF MAUNABO, ABOUT 2 KILOMETERS TO THE E OF THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE YABUCOA-MAUNABO ROAD, WHICH IS AT KILOMETER 104 H7.  THIS STATION IS ON A GRASS-COVERED HILL.  THE OLD STATION WAS BETWEEN STATION ELENA HILL AND PANDURA 2.  THESE TWO HILLS ARE THE HIGHEST OF THE MOUNTAIN RANGES IN THAT VICINITY.  ELENA HILL SLOPES DOWN TO THE SEA.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD U.S.G.S. BENCH MARK, NOT STAMPED.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A CROSS ON BOULDER 18.0 FEET FROM STATION, IN TRUE AZIMUTH 108 DEG 25 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A CROSS ON BOULDER 13 FEET 8 INCHES FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 176 DEG 19 MIN.  TO REACH THIS STATION DRIVE TO KILOMETER 104 H7, AND TAKE A TRAIL YOU WILL SEE RIGHT IN FRONT OF M.F. CHIQUES PUBLIC SCHOOL.  THIS TRAIL IS DUE E FROM THE ROAD.  THE TRAIL IS VERY STEEP, BUT STATION IS NOT VERY FAR FROM THE ROAD AS IT IS ABOUT 1/2 HOUR WALK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1940)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1940 THE HOLE IN ROCK IN WHICH TABLET HAD BEEN SET WAS FAINTLY DISCERNIBLE AFTER A LONG SEARCH.  R. M. NO. 1 WAS FINALLY RECOVERED AND CHECKED DISTANCE TO THIS DRILL HOLE.  R.M. NO. 2 WAS FOUND REMOVED TO SERVE AS A FENCE CORNER BRACE, AS IT WAS JUST A SMALL BOULDER.  BUT THE HOLE FROM WHICH IT HAD BEEN REMOVED WAS DISCOVERED AND CHECKED THE DISTANCE TO R. M. 2.  A NEW STATION WAS BUILT IN THE PLACE OF THE OLD ONE.  AND TWO NEW REFERENCE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED.  REVISED DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS ABOUT 2.0 MILES S.W. OF YABUCOA AND ABOUT THE SAME DISTANCE NORTH OF MAUNABO, ON A GRASS COVERED MOUNTAIN.  IT IS ABOUT 1-1/4 MILES EAST OF THE HIGHEST POINT ON THE YABUCOA-MAUNABO HIGHWAY WHICH IS AT THE MIGUEL F. CHIQUES SCHOOL.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD TABLET STAMPED PANDURA 2 1934 SET IN TOP OF A CONCRETE POST PROJECTING ABOUT 4 IN ABOVE GROUND, ABOUT 110 FT. S.E. OF BEGINNING OF STEEP SLOPE TO WESTWARD, 40 FT. SOUTH OF STEEP SLOPE TO NORTHWARD, 15 FT. WEST OF STEEP SLOPE TO EASTWARD, 55 FT. EAST OF A SMALL HUT, AND 7 FT. S.E. OF ROUNDED FENCE CORNER.  R.M. NO. 1 IS A NAIL IN TOP OF CONCRETE POST 40 FT. EAST OF HUT, AND 14.78 FT. FROM STATION IN AZIMUTH -- IN FENCE LINE.  R. M. NO. 2 IS 12.84 FT. NORTH OF STATION, NEAR BEGINNING OF STEEP SLOPE TO NORTHWARD, AND 1 FT. EAST OF FENCE.  IT IS A NAIL IN TOP OF CONCRETE POST PROJECTING 4 IN.  R. M. NO. 3 IS A CROSS ON BOULDER FLUSH WITH GROUND, 17.9 FT. DISTANT, FROM STATION IN AZIMUTH 108 DEG 25 MIN.  IT IS ABOUT 10 FT. SOUTH OF FENCE LINE.  TO REACH FROM YABUCOA, TAKE ROAD TO MAUNABO.  AT KM. 104 H 7, WHICH IS AT M. F. CHIQUES PUBLIC SCHOOL, AND ON DIVIDE, TAKE TRAIL OPPOSITE SCHOOL, AND CLIMB TO STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 (CFO) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE REFERENCE MARKS WERE NOT RECOVERED, DUE TO BEING LATE AT TIME OF RECOVERY.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION IS LOCATED 12 AIRLINE MILES SOUTHEAST OF CABO ROJO, 6-1/2 AIRLINE MILES SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF LAJAS AND ON THE TOP OF A LOW BRUSH COVERED HILL.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF HIGHWAYS 116, 117 AND 315 ABOUT 1 MILE SOUTHEAST OF LAJAS, GO SOUTH AND EAST ON HIGHWAY 116 FOR 3.1 MILES TO HIGHWAY 304.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH ON HIGHWAY 324 FOR 1.2 MILES TO HIGHWAY 324.  TURN LEFT AND GO EASTERLY ON HIGHWAY 324 FOR 1.2 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT AT KILOMETER POST 1.9.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.45 MILE TO THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF THE BRUSH COVERED HILL AND THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE PACK EASTERLY UPHILL FOR ABOUT 15 MINUTES TO THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE HILL AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PAPAYO 1966, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3-INCH ROUND CAST IRON SOIL PIPE WHICH PROJECTS 8 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PAPAYO NO 1 1966, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3-INCH ROUND CAST IRON SOIL PIPE WHICH PROJECTS 10 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PAPAYO NO 2 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A ROCK WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (WLM) THIS STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 2004 (UPR) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (JBB) A HYDROGRAPHIC SIGNAL ON THE POINT CALLED BY THAT NAME AND KNOWN LOCALLY AS PUNTA COLORADO.  POINT IS ON THE W SIDE OF ENTRANCE TO GREAT HARBOR.  THE STATION WAS ABOUT 10 METERS FROM THE END OF THE POINT AND WAS NOT MARKED.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (RLS) ABOUT 3 MILES NE OF HUMACAO, ABOUT 2-3/4 MILES WNW OF HUMACAO PLAYA, AT PASTO VIEJO, AT THE CENTRAL OF THE EASTERN SUGAR ASSOCIATION.  A TALL, WHITE, CONCRETE STACK AT THE SUGAR REFINERY.  THE STATION WAS NOT VISITED FOR A MORE COMPLETE DESCRIPTION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JJL) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  NOTE--THE NAME ABOVE IS THE ONE CARRIED ON THE LIST OF GEOGRAPHIC POSITIONS.  ON THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION THE NAME IS PASTO VIEJO STACK.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3 MILES NORTHEAST OF HUMACAO.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 HIGHEST STEEL STACK AT PASTO VIEJO SUGAR MILL, S OF HUMACAO CITY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1942)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1942 (GBG) DESCRIPTION IS MISLEADING.  NOT RECOVERED 1940.

BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1982 (JCL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 9.5 KM (6 MI) NORTHEAST OF PONCE, 8 KM (5 MI) WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE SMALL TOWN OF JUANA DIAZ, AND 0.6 KM (0.4 MI) SOUTH OF THE CERRILLOS DAM SITE.  OWNERSHIP--U.S. ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 14 AND 139 ON THE NORTHEAST SIDE OF PONCE, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 0.5 KM (0.3 MI) TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST AND NORTH ON A WINDING ROAD (HIGHWAY 139) FOR 3.1 KM (1.95 MI) TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 3.7 KM (2.35 MI) TO THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS LABORATORY BUILDING ON THE LEFT. CONTINUE AHEAD NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 0.08 KM (0.05 MI) TO A GATE ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHERLY ACROSS AN OPEN AREA FOLLOWING THE TREE LINE FOR 0.2 KM (0.15 MI) TO THE STATION SITE.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED---PAT 1982---, SET INTO THE TOP OF A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT 25 CM IN DIAMETER RECESSED 30 CM BELOW THE GROUND.  IT IS LOCATED 13.45 METERS (44.1 FT) SOUTHWEST FROM A TRIANGLE BLAZED TREE.  THE UNDERGROUND MARK IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED---PAT 1982---, SET INTO AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 1.3 METERS BELOW THE SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 1 IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED ---PAT NO 1 1982---, CRIMPED TO THE TOP OF A STAINLESS STEEL ROD DRIVEN TO THE DEPTH OF 24 FEET AND SURROUNDED BY A 30 CM DIAMETER CONCRETE POST PROJECTING 3 CM ABOVE THE GROUND.  IT IS LOCATED 6.52 METERS (21.4 FT) NORTH FROM A TRIANGLE BLAZED TREE.  MARK IS ABOVE STATION 0.3 METERS.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 2 IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED ---PAT NO 2 1982---, CRIMPED TO THE TOP OF A STAINLESS STEEL ROD DRIVEN TO THE DEPTH OF 12 FEET AND SURROUNDED BY A 30 CM DIAMETER CONCRETE POST PROJECTING 50 CM ABOVE THE GROUND.  IT IS LOCATED 13.10 METERS (42.9 FT) SOUTH FROM A TRIANGLE BLAZED TREE.  MARK IS ABOVE STATION 0.3 METERS.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN ABOVE THE MARK WAS 2.1 METERS.  A LEVEL TIE WAS MADE TO THIS STATION AND IS INCLUDED IN LEVEL LINE 1A.                            STATION RECOVERY (1982)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1982 9.50 KM (5.90 MI) NE FROM PONCE. THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAY 14 AND 139 ON THE NORTHEAST SIDE OF PONCE, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 0.5 KM (0.3 MI) TO A CROSSROAD, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST AND NORTH ON A WINDING ROAD, HIGHWAY 139 FOR 3.2 KM (2.0 MI) TO A FORK. markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1940 ABOUT 2 MILES S.E. OF PATILLAS AND ONE MILE N.E. OF HACIENDA PROVIDENCIA, ON A LOW HILL COVERED WITH GRASS AND A FEW SCATTERED TREES.  THE MARK IS ABOUT 150 FT. N.E. OF AN ANGLE IN FENCE AT UPPER CORNER OF CLEARED FIELD, AND 100 FT. N.E. OF A LARGE-TRUNKED MANGO, AND ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE HILL.  IT IS A STANDARD TABLET STAMPED PATILLAS 2 1940, SET IN TOP OF A LARGE BOULDER.  R. M. NO. 1 IS A GALVANIZED IRON PIPE SET IN CONCRETE POST (A PROPERTY LINE MARK) ON W. END OF TOP OF HILL.  IT IS 33.8 FT. FROM STATION IN AZIMUTH 62 DEG 20 MIN.  R. M. NO. 2 IS A CHISELED CROSS ON A LARGE ROCK 5.7 FT. IN AZIMUTH 307 DEG 12 MIN FROM THE STATION.  TO REACH FROM PATILLAS, DRIVE S.E. ON HIGHWAY ABOUT 2 MILES TO K124 H8.  TURN LEFT (N.) AT ENTRANCE TO HACIENDA.  JUST E. OF THIS ENTRANCE A RAILROAD CROSSES THE HIGHWAY.  DRIVE 0.1 MILE AND TURN RIGHT.  DRIVE ALONG DIRT ROAD 0.5 MILE TO A U-TURN IN THE ROAD.  LEAVE CAR AND TAKE TRAIL E. UP VALLEY ABOUT 1/2 MILE.  JUST BEFORE REACHING RIDGE, THE TRAIL MAKES A T-JUNCTION.  TAKE LEFT, AND GO NORTH ABOUT 200 METERS TO THE STATION.  NOTE--IT IS EXPECTED THAT PATILLAS 2 WILL BE REOCCUPIED, AND OBS. MADE OF THE ANGLE TUMBAO-YAUREL.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 (CFO) THE STATION MARK DISK HAS BEEN REMOVED.  THE DRILL HOLE IS VERY LEGIBLE.  THE TWO REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED 13 AIRLINE MILES NORTH-NORTHWEST OF PONCE, 4 AIRLINE MILES EAST OF ADJUNTAS AND ON A HIGH BRUSH COVERED HILL.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE PLAZA IN ADJUNTAS, GO SOUTHEAST ON HIGHWAY 10 FOR 3.2 MILES TO HIGHWAY 143.  TURN LEFT AND GO EASTERLY ON HIGHWAY 143 FOR 2.1 MILES TO A FORK.  KEEP LEFT AND CONTINUE EASTERLY ON HIGHWAY 143 FOR 0.5 MILE TO KILOMETER POST 4.3 AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE PACK SOUTH UP A STEEP HILL FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE HILL AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PATRICIO 1966, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  IT IS 13 FEET NORTH OF A POWER POLE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PATRICIO NO 1 1966, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING 4 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PATRICIO NO 2 1966, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING 3 INCHES.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1972)  RECOVERY NOTE BY THOMAS ENG AND SURV 1972 (HBW) PATRICIO 1966 UNDISTURBED.  PATRICIO-NO-2-1966 DESTROYED, CONCRETE POST WITH DISC FOUND 75 METERS WEST OF STATION, APPARENTLY UPROOTED BY DOZER.  PATRICIO-NO1-1966 NOT FOUND, SEE BELOW.  TRIANGULATION STATION IS NOW SITUATED ATOP A PLUG OF EARTH ABOUT 12 FEET (4 METERS) IN DIAMETER AND 8 FEET (3 METERS) HIGH.  RECENT BULLDOZER ACTIVITY IS IN EVIDENCE COMPLETELY AROUND THE PLUG.  IN DRY WEATHER A TWO WHEEL DRIVE VEHICLE MAY BE EASILY DRIVEN TO THE BASE OF THE PLUG FROM A FIELD ENTRANCE ON RT 143 ABOUT 300 METERS WEST OF THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 2004 MARK RECOVERED IN POOR CONDITION.

THIS STATION WILL BE UNDER WATER UPON COMPLETION OF THE CERRILLOS DAM. OWNERSHIP--U.S. ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 14 AND 139 ON THE NORTHEAST SIDE OF PONCE, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 0.5 KM (0.3 MI) TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST AND NORTH ON A WINDING ROAD (HIGHWAY 139) FOR 3.1 KM (1.95 MI) TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 3.7 KM (2.35 MI) TO THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS LABORATORY BUILDING ON THE LEFT.  CONTINUE AHEAD NORTH AND EAST ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 1.0 KM (0.65 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD USE DISK STAMPED---PBR 75 1979---, SET INTO THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 18 CM IN DIAMETER RECESSED 5 CM BELOW THE GROUND.  IT IS LOCATED 18.9 METERS (62.0 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM THE CENTER OF HIGHWAY 139 AND 3.02 METERS (9.9 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM A 18-INCH DIAMETER TREE WITH TRIANGLE BLAZE ON THE SOUTH SIDE.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN ABOVE THE MARK WAS 2.4 METERS. A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION FRANK, USING EDM EQUIPMENT.  NO REFERENCE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1982)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1982 10.0 KM (6.21 MI) NE FROM PONCE. FROM THE JUNCTION OF 14 AND 139 ON THE NORTHEAST SIDE OF PONCE, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 0.5 KM (0.3 MI) TO A CROSSROAD, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST AND NORTH ON A WINDING ROAD (HIGHWAY 139) FOR 3.2 KM (2.0 MI) TO A FORK, TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 3.9 KM (2.4 MI) TO A GATE, AND THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS LABORATORY BUILDING ON THE LEFT CONTINUE AHEAD NORTH AND EAST ON HIGHWAY 139 FOR 1.1 KM (0.7 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT, 19.0 METERS (62.0 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM THE CENTER OF HIGHWAY 139, 3.0 METERS (10.0 FT) SOUTHEAST OF AN 18 INCH DIAMETER TREE WITH A TRIANGLE BLAZE ON THE SOUTH SIDE.  THIS STATION WILL BE UNDER WATER UPON COMPLETION OF THE DAM. THE MARK IS ABOVE LEVEL WITH HIGHWAY.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION IS LOCATED 9 AIRLINE MILES NORTHEAST OF AGUADILLA, 5 AIRLINE MILES WEST OF ISABELA, 1/4 AIRLINE MILE SOUTH OF THE SHORE LINE AND ON THE TOP OF A LOW HILL COVERED WITH COCONUT TREES.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE PLAZA IN ISABELA, GO WEST ON A PAVED STREET FOR 1 BLOCK TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 1 BLOCK TO HIGHWAY 112.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WESTERLY ON HIGHWAY 112 FOR 3.8 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.5 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO WEST ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON A DIM TRACK ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PED 1966, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PED NO 1 1966, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 6 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS AN IRON PEG SET IN THE TOP OF A 3-INCH ROUND IRON PIPE WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  THE PEG HAS NO STAMPING ON IT.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1901 (JN) THIS STATION IS ABOUT 4 MILES W OF THE TOWN OF ISABELA AND 70 METERS FROM THE CREST OF HIGH BLUFF RUNNING PARALLEL WITH THE COAST.  IT IS ABOUT 1/2 MILE E OF A DEEP RAVINE OR CANOS.  IT IS ABOUT 1200 FEET W OF A HIGH COCOANUT GROVE ON THE LAND OF PEDRO GONZALES VEGA.  IT IS 18 FEET S OF HEDGE AND 50 FEET N 70 DEG W FROM A LARGE MANGO TREE.  THE STATION IS ON A LARGE MOUND OF WELL-TAMPED EARTH ABOUT 18 INCHES ABOVE THE GENERAL LEVEL.  THE MARK IS A GALVANIZED IRON PIPE 2 INCHES IN DIAMETER AND 2 FEET LONG, SET IN A BED OF CEMENT.  A 20-PENNY NAIL CEMENTED IN TOP OF PIPE MARKS THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1922)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1922 STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION IS BEST REACHED BY TAKING THE CART ROAD OUT OF ISABELA, WHICH RUNS W ALONG THE N SIDE OF THE RAILROAD, AND WHICH IS NOTED AS BEING VERY SANDY.  FOLLOW THIS ROAD ABOUT 6 KILOMETERS TO A ROAD FORK N JUST BEFORE ENTERING THE QUEBRADA DE LOS CEDROS, WHERE THERE IS A LARGE FRAME HOUSE IN THE NE CORNER OF THE ROAD FORKS WITH A PROMINENT CEMENT COVERED WELL OR CISTERN JUST W OF IT.  TURN N AT THIS FORK AND CONTINUE TO FORKS OF TRAIL E AND W.  TURN W ON TRAIL TO FIRST HOUSE ON THE N SIDE, AND TURN N PAST THIS HOUSE INTO A CULTIVATED FIELD IN THE NW CORNER OF WHICH THE STATION IS LOCATED.  THIS SMALL CULTIVATED FIELD IS ENTIRELY SURROUNDED BY COCOANUT GROVES, WHICH MAKES OBSERVING TO OR FROM THE STATION VERY DIFFICULT AT PRESENT, AND AS THE COCOANUT TREES GROW TALLER, IT WILL BECOME MORE DIFFICULT.  ELEVATION ABOVE SEA LEVEL IS - 75.2 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1952)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US NAVY 1952 THE STATION WAS DESTROYED.  THE PIPE MARKING THE STATION HAD BEEN REMOVED BY A NATIVE AND STORED IN HIS HOME.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (RLS) THIS INTERSECTION STATION IS ABOUT 2-3/4 MILES SSE OF FAJARDO, ABOUT 1-3/4 MILES NNE OF CEIBA, ON TOP OF THE SECOND HILL N OF QUEBRADA CARMELA ON THE W SIDE OF INSULAR HIGHWAY NO.3, ABOUT 125 METERS W OF THE MOST EASTERLY POINT OF THE HIGHWAY AND THE SUMMIT OF THE HIGHWAY GRADE IN THE IMMEDIATE VICINITY, ON A HILL OVERLOOKING MAJAGUA BAY.  THE HILL IS A SHOULDER EXTENDING EASTWARD FROM THE HIGHER HILLS TO THE W.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK SET IN CONCRETE, AS DESCRIBED IN NOTE 1A.  THERE IS NO UNDERGROUND MARK.  STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST POINT AT THE E END OF THE SHOULDER, 37 FEET W OF A FENCE THAT CROSSES THE E SLOPE OF THE HILL AND CURVES W AT A POINT N OF THE STATION, 37 METERS E OF ANOTHER FENCE, AND PROJECTS 8 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  THE ELEVATION OF THE STATION IS ABOUT 55.1 METERS.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS ON THE N SLOPE OF THE HILL, ABOUT 12 METERS N OF THE HIGHEST POINT ON THE FENCE LINE, 0.8 METER E OF THE FENCE, 3.09 METERS LOWER THAN THE STATION, AND IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN CONCRETE IN A DEPRESSION IN A BOULDER PROJECTING ABOUT 12 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS ON THE S SLOPE OF THE HILL, 32 METERS E OF A FENCE, 24 METERS W OF A FENCE, 5.56 METERS LOWER THAN THE STATION, AND IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN A DEPRESSION IN A BOULDER PROJECTING 30 INCHES ABOVE GROUND ON THE LOW SIDE AND 6 INCHES ON THE HIGH SIDE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED EXCEPT THAT THE TWO FENCES REFERRED TO IN THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION NO LONGER EXIST.  R.M. NO. 1 WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED.  IT APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN DESTROYED DURING CONSTRUCTION OF A FIRE BREAK.  R. M. NO. 2 WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  IT HAS BEEN BEAT-UP AND ALL THE WORDS ON THE DISK ARE ILLEGIBLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 (CFO) THIS STATION HAS BEEN DESTROYED BY BUILDING A HOUSE ON THE HILL.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1903 (WEP) THE SIGNAL IS ON THE TOP OF PENONES POINT NEARLY BACK TO THE TREE LINE.  CENTER MARK IS A 2-INCH IRON PIPE SET IN CEMENT.  THE OLD TRIPOD HAD BLOWN DOWN AND WAS REPLACED BY A LARGER SIGNAL.  TO REACH THE SIGNAL BY WATER, LAND OPPOSITE THE SIGNAL IN THE LITTLE BAY TO THE SW, CLIMB TO THE TOP OF THE GRASS KNOLL AND THEN WALK BACK TO THE TREE LINE.  THE SIGNAL WILL BE FOUND ON THE HIGHEST POINT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JMC) SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED.  STATION SHOULD BE CONSIDERED LOST.  DESCRIPTION NOT ADEQUATE FOR RECOVERY.
markers.setting: OBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3 KILOMETERS DIRECTLY SE OF TOWN OF PENUELAS ON HIGHEST PEAK IN VICINITY.  STATION IS NEAR N EDGE OF HIGHEST PART OF TOP, 8.5 FEET N OF AN E AND W FENCE LINE AND ROW OF LARGE AMASIGO TREES.  65 FEET E OF JUNCTION OF THIS FENCE LINE WITH ONE RUNNING N.  TO N AND E OF THESE FENCE LINES IS CLEARED LAND.  S AND W IS COVERED WITH HEAVY BRUSH WHICH OBSTRUCTS VIEW TOWARD COAST.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD TABLET, STAMPED PENUELAS 1934 CEMENTED IN LIMESTONE ROCK SET IN GROUND.  REFERENCE MARKS ARE COPPER NAILS AND WASHERS IN CENTER OF TRIANGULAR BLAZES ON AMASIGO TREES ALONG FENCE LINE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS ON 12-INCH TREE, 12.88 FEET FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 51 DEG 17 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2, IS ON 7-INCH TREE, 17.52 FEET FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 298 DEG 04 MIN.  SIGNAL--QUADRIPOD OF SAWED LUMBER WITH BLACK CROSS-TARGETS ON CENTER POLE.  STATION IS PROBABLY BEST REACHED FROM PENUELAS BY FOLLOWING MAIN HIGHWAY LEADING TO PONCE FOR A DISTANCE OF ABOUT 5 KILOMETERS TO TOP OF GRADE AT POST K 253 H 9 FROM THIS POINT A TRAIL IS FOLLOWED WHICH LEADS IN A SW DIRECTION PAST A HOUSE, JOINS A FENCED CAMINO, OR MAIN TRAIL WHICH IS FOLLOWED TO DIVIDE, THEN LEAVING MAIN TRAIL CONTINUE UP SLOPE THROUGH OPEN PASTURE TO N-S FENCE LINE, THEN S ALONG THIS FENCE LINE ACROSS DRAW, THEN CROSS FENCE AND CONTINUE UP GRADE SW TO TOP.  STATION MAY ALSO BE REACHED BY TRAIL FROM N, WHERE CAR CAN BE TAKEN TO FOOT OF MOUNTAIN ON MUNICIPAL ROAD, BUT THE CLIMB IS RATHER STEEP AND REQUIRES CROSSING A RATHER DEEP DRAW JUST N OF STATION PEAK.
markers.setting: SET IN UNSPECIFIED ROCK OR BOULDER
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 7-1/2 MILES NORTH-NORTHEAST OF LAS MARIAS, 2-3/4 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF SAN SEBASTIAN AND ON THE TOP OF A CONCRETE WATER RESERVOIR THAT IS ON THE PROPERTY OF THE GOVERNMENT OF PUERTO RICO.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE PLAZA IN SAN SEBASTIAN, GO NORTHEASTERLY ON HIGHWAY 119 FOR 3.4 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE LEFT AT KILOMETER POST 24.1.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH AND WEST ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO SOUTH ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PEP 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE WATER RESERVOIR.  IT IS 5.6 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE RESERVOIR AND 4 FEET EAST OF THE WEST SIDE OF THE RESERVOIR.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PEP NO 1 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF THE CONCRETE WATER RESERVOIR.  IT IS 3.6 FEET SOUTH OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE RESERVOIR AND 0.5 FOOT EAST OF THE WEST EDGE OF THE RESERVOIR.  THE U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY BENCH MARK DISK IS UNSTAMPED AND IS SET IN THE TOP OF A ROUND MASS OF CONCRETE THAT PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE TOP OF THE RESERVOIR.  IT IS 19 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE RESERVOIR AND IS IN THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE RESERVOIR.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE.
markers.setting: SET IN THE FOOTINGS OF SMALL/MEDIUM STRUCTURES
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS LOCATED 4.5 KILOMETERS NE OF SAN SEBASTIAN, 250 METERS N OF THE ROAD FROM SAN SEBASTIAN TO GUAJATACA RESERVOIR, CAMUY AND QUEBRADILLAS, ON THE SW END OF A DOUBLE-TOPPED ROCKY KNOLL ON LAND OWNED BY JESUS VARELA, WHO LIVES JUST UNDER THE KNOLL TO THE N.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD TABLET, STAMPED PEPINO 1934, CEMENTED IN TOP OF RECTANGULAR LEDGE OF ROCK WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT ONE FOOT ABOVE PRESENT SURFACE OF GROUND.  REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD REFERENCE MARK TABLETS CEMENTED IN PROJECTING ROCK IN PLACE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS 23.25 FEET FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 116 DEG 41 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS 78.81 FEET FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 236 DEG 26 MIN.  SIGNAL--QUADRIPOD OF SAWED LUMBER WITH BLACK CROSS TARGETS ON CENTER POLE.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1941 V.A. ELEVATION 181-03 METERS.  IN THE SOUTHEASTERN PART OF VIEQUES ISLAND ABOUT 3 KMS. NW OF PUERTO REAL AND 2-1/2 KMS. NE OF PLAYA GRANDE ON A HILL WHICH IS COVERED WITH SCATTERED TREES.  TO REACH THIS STATION FROM PLAYA GRANDE DRIVE EAST TOWARD ISABEL II A DISTANCE OF 2.0 MILES.  TURN LEFT (NO ONTO A DIRT ROAD AND DRIVE 1/2 MILE.  LEAVE CAR AND FOLLOW TRAIL NW TO TOP OF HILL.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD TABLET STAMPED PEREZ AND SET IN A FLAT ROCK WHICH IS ABOUT 3 FT. HIGH AND 6 FT. LONG.  THE TABLET IS ABOUT 4 FT. FROM WEST AND HIGHEST EDGE OF ROCK.  R.M. NO. 1 IS A DRILL HOLE IN TOP OF A ROUND TOPPED ROCK WHICH IS ABOUT 10 FT. HIGH ON ITS EASTERN EDGE.  DISTANCE FROM STATION 4.26 METERS.  PLANE AZIMUTH 450-43.  R.M. NO. 2 IS A DRILL HOLE ON TOP OF A DOME SHAPED ROCK WHICH IS ABOUT 8 FT. HIGH AND WHICH IS THE HIGHEST ROCK ON THE HILL.  DISTANCE FROM STATION 6.28 METERS.  PLANE AZIMUTH 65-22.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) STATION AND R.M.S RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  THE FOLLOWING ADDITION TO DESCRIPTION WILL HELP FIND STATION--  TURN NORTH ON DIRT ROAD (ROAD HAS SHARP CURVE IN CUT AT BEGINNING) 8/10 KILOMETERS WEST, ON ROAD TO PLAYE GRANDE, FROM INTERSECTION OF ROADS TO MONTE SANTO - ESPERANZA.  STATION IS ON LEFT (EAST) MOUNTAIN AT END OF DIRT ROAD, ON HIGHEST PEAK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (MTP) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  A CONFUSING POINT IN NOTE OF 1964 WOULD BE ELIMINATED IF WORD LEFT WAS CHANGED TO RIGHT.  THE SENTENCE WOULD READ STATION IS ON RIGHT (EAST) HILL AT END OF ROAD.  THERE IS A TRAIL LEADING UP AND TO THE EAST AT END OF ROAD.  FOLLOW THIS TRAIL THROUGH GATE INTO PASTURE.  WALK TO N.E. CORNER OF PASTURE, JUMP FENCE AND PROCEED TO CLIMB HILL WITH LARGE BOULDERS TO THE N.W.  STATION IS IN A LARGE BOULDER PAINTED WITH WHITE PAINT JUST WEST OF FENCE RUNNING NORTH - SOUTH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US MARINE CORPS 1970 STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION, BUT FACE OF STATION DISK WAS STILL BADLY SCARRED.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (RLS) STATION IS ABOUT 5 MILES ESE OF CEIBA, ON A SMALL ISLAND TO THE EASTWARD OF PINEROS ISLAND KNOWN AS CABEZA DE PERRO, ABOUT 70 METERS E OF THE W END OF THE ISLAND, ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE WESTERLY HILL ON THE ISLAND (THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE ISLAND IS ABOUT AT THE CENTER AND ABOUT 200 METERS E OF THE STATION), 5 METERS N OF THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE LARGEST AND HIGHEST BOULDER IN A GROUP OF LARGE BOULDERS ON TOP OF THE HILL, AND PROJECTS ABOUT 10 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  THE ELEVATION OF THE STATION IS ABOUT 72 FEET.  STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE, AS DESCRIBED IN NOTES 1A AND 11A.  NO UNDERGROUND MARK.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS ON A NEARLY FLAT SPOT ON THE SW SLOPE OF THE HILL, ABOUT MIDWAY BETWEEN 2 GROUPS OF BOULDERS, 2.08 METERS LOWER THAN THE STATION, AND PROJECTS ABOUT 10 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS ON A NEARLY FLAT SPOT ON THE S SLOPE OF THE HILL, 28-1/2 METERS NW OF A LONE LARGE ROUND TOP BOULDER, 28.0 METERS E OF REFERENCE MARK NO.1, 2.39 METERS LOWER THAN THE STATION, AND PROJECTS ABOUT 10 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND ARE IN GOOD CONDITION.  STATION IS TWO-FEET NORTH OF A 4 X 4 WITNESS POST WHICH STANDS 3-FEET HIGH.  GRASS 3-FEET HIGH SURROUNDS THE STATION AREA.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK NO.1, AND REFERENCE MARK NO.2 WERE FOUND AS DESCRIBED AND IN EXCELLENT CONDITION.  NO CHANGES ARE REQUIRED TO THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION AS IT IS QUITE ADEQUATE AND COMPLETE.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY US AIR FORCE 1954 (JOP) STATION IS LOCATED NEAR THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE TOP BASTION OF FORT DON FELIPE DEL MORRO, WHICH IS WITHIN THE AREA OF FORT BROOKE A U.S. ARMY BASE.  IT IS 18 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE FLAGPOLE, AND 3.6 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST EDGE OF THE BLOCKHOUSE ON WHICH THE FLAGPOLE IS SITUATED.  MARK IS A STANDARD U.S.A.F. SHORAN DISK SET IN A DRILLHOLE IN THE SLOPE OF THE WALL OF THE TOP BASTION AND IS STAMPED PETE.  MORRO LIGHTHOUSE IS A U.S.C. AND G.S. TRIANGULATION STATION AND IT IS THE MORRO LIGHTHOUSE WHICH IS LOCATED NEAR THE SOUTHEAST CORNER AND ON THE TOP BASTION OF THE FORT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (GD) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION ON PARAPET WALL OF EL MORRO FORTRESS, SAN JUAN, PUERTO RICO.  SIGNAL LIGHT HAS BEEN REMOVED.  DISTANCE MEASURED TO CENTER OF BOLT HOLES IS APPROXIMATELY 13.9 FEET.  FLAG POLE HAS BEEN MOVED.  DISTANCE TO OLD LOCATION IS APPROXIMATELY 21.4 FEET.  DISTANCE TO CORPORATION OF ENGINEERING DISC (1943) IS 166.3.  COULD NOT FIND MORRO 1941.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) THIS STATION IS CONNECTED TO THE PAA TRIANGULATION IN SAN JUAN.  IT IS ON THE PARAPET WALL OF EL MORRO FORTRESS.  IT IS 13.9 FEET FROM BOLT HOLES, 21.4 FEET FROM PLACE WHERE THERE WAS A FLAG POLE AND 166.3 FEET FROM USED DISC, 1943.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JJL) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN 1954 WITH THE EXCEPTION OF ONE DISCREPANCY, THAT BEING THE DISK IS STAMPED PETE USAF INSTEAD OF PETE.  THIS IS THE SAME STATION BEING LISTED AS DESCRIBED IN 1954 AND RECOVERED IN 1961 AND 1964.  THIS STATION WAS USED AS A REFERENCE MARK FOR MORRO LIGHTHOUSE ECC (USE) 1964.                            STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1977 (MS) PETE USAF RECOVERED GOOD.  RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--1 KM W. OF OLD SAN JUAN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1985)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1985 (GWM) STATION MARK SHORAN STATION FOUND GOOD.  WHILE IN OLD SAN JUAN, PUERTO RICO I FOUND THIS MARK IN THE PARAPET WALL OF EL MARRO FORT.

BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1982 3.0 KM (1.86 MI) SOUTH FROM PONCE. FROM THE INTERSECTION OF HIGHWAY 2 AND HIGHWAY 14 SOUTH OF PONCE, THENCE SOUTH ON HIGHWAY 14 ABOUT 3.2 KM (2.0 MI) THROUGH A GATE TO MUELLE DE PONCE, A PIER AND WAREHOUSE, SET IN THE SEAWARD END OF THE WHARF NEAR WAREHOUSE NO. 4, 34.4 METERS (113 FT) SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF WAREHOUSE NO. 4, 3.6 METERS (12.0 FT) NORTHEAST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE PIER, AND 0.8 METERS (2.6 FT) FROM THE EDGE OF THE PIER. THE MARK IS 113 FT  SW FROM  WAREHOUSE 4 THE MARK IS ABOVE LEVEL WITH CONCRETE PIER.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY RLDA SURVEYING AND MAPPING 2008 (RLD) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF PR-52 AND PR-12 IN THE SOUTH PART OF PONCE, GO SOUTH ON PR-12 FOR 1.51 MI (2.4 KM) TO A SECURITY GATE FOR THE PONCE PORT AUTHORITY.  CONTINUE THROUGH THE GATE AND GO ACROSS THE PARKING LOT TO THE EDGE OF BULKHEAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO WEST ALONG THE BULKHEAD TO THE END OF THE PIER AND THE STATION AS DESCRIBED.   THE MARK IS 34.60 M (113.5 FT) NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF STORAGE BUILDING B, 4.48 M (14.7 FT) NORTHEAST OF A SHIP TIE-UP BULLARD, 3.97 M (13.0 FT) WEST OF A BULLARD AND 3.91 M (12.8 FT) EAST OF THE WEST EDGE OF THE PIER.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (RLS) THIS INTERSECTION STATION IS ABOUT 4 MILES E OF CEIBA, ON THE ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL RESERVATION, ON PINEROS ISLAND, ON THE NORTHEASTERLY POINT OF THE ISLAND, ABOUT 45 METERS S OF THE HIGH-WATER LINE AT THE N END OF THE POINT, ABOUT 30 METERS S OF THE TOP OF A STEEP, ROCKY BLUFF, 8-1/2 METERS S OF THE LARGEST AND HIGHEST BOULDER ON TOP OF THE HILL, AND ON TOP OF A LARGE BOULDER ABOUT 12 FEET IN DIAMETER.  THERE ARE SEVERAL OTHER LARGE BOULDERS ON TOP OF THE HILL, SOME OF WHICH ARE HIGHER THAN THE ONE THE STATION IS ON.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK SET IN CONCRETE IN A DEPRESSION IN A BOULDER.  NO UNDERGROUND MARK.  WITNESS MARK IS A TRIANGULAR BLAZE ON THE SE SIDE OF A 12-INCH ALMACIGO TREE, THE LARGEST TREE ON TOP OF THE HILL.  IT IS ABOUT 2 FEET HIGHER THAN THE STATION, IS DISTANT 1.90 METERS (SLOPE DISTANCE) FROM STATION, IN AZIMUTH APPROXIMATELY 155 DEG.  THERE ARE NO REFERENCE MARKS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND IS IN EXCELLENT CONDITION.  IT IS NOW COVERED WITH A SMALL CAIRN OF ROCKS.  WITNESS TREE IS NOW 18-INCHES IN DIAMETER.

A SMALL QUADRIPOD SIGNAL WAS ERECTED OVER THE MARK.  THE TWO REFERENCE MARKS ARE CROSSES CHISELED IN ROCKS AT THE EDGE OF THE CLIFF. A HOLE ABOUT 1 FOOT DEEP WAS FOUND WHERE THE STATION SHOULD BE.  A NEW STATION, PINERITA 2, WAS ESTABLISHED IN THE SAME PLACE.
