markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 9-1/2 MILES WEST OF PONCE, 3-1/2 MILES EAST-SOUTHEAST OF GUAYANILLA AND ON THE GROUNDS OF THE PROCON REFINERY PLANT.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE PLAZA IN GUAYANILLA, GO EASTERLY ON HIGHWAY 2 FOR 4 MILES TO THE PROCON REFINERY PLANT AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT, NORTH, SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY.  THE TANK IS A CYLINDRICAL, STEEL STRUCTURE THAT SETS INSIDE OF AND IS SUPPORTED BY A LARGE STEEL TOWER THAT IS PAINTED ALTERNATELY RED AND WHITE AND IS ABOUT 250 FEET HIGH.  THIS IS THE MOST WESTERLY TANK OF TWO IDENTICAL TANKS.  POINT INTERSECTED IS THE RED OBSTRUCTION LIGHT ATOP THE TANK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (JKW) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE TANK IS A CATALYST RETAINER, CYLINDRICAL IN SHAPE AND PAINTED IN RED AND WHITE CHECKS, WHICH SETS ON TOP OF A LARGE BLACK CRACKING TOWER ON THE GROUNDS OF THE COMMONWEALTH OIL REFINING COMPANY, LOCALLY KNOWN AS CORCO.  THE CRACKING TOWER IS ABOUT 289 FEET HIGH.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MARINA STREET AND PONCE BYPASS IN PONCE, GO WEST ON PONCE BYPASS (HWY 2) FOR 8.2 MILES, TO THE TALLABOA EXIT (HWY 127 AND OLD HWY 2), TAKE EXIT AND CONTINUE 1.9 MILES TO THE MAIN GATE OF CORCO.  THE STATION IS APPROX 0.4 MILE WEST OF THE MAIN GATE.  IT IS NECESSARY TO OBTAIN PERMISSION FROM CORCO OFFICIALS TO VISIT THE STATION.  THIS IS THE WESTERLY AND LOWER OF THE TWO IDENTICAL CRACKING TOWERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1970 (KAM) STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  RECOVERY NOTE BY J.K.W. 1969 IS COMPLETE AND ADEQUATE.  THIS TOWER AND TANK ARE SCHEDULED FOR DISMANTLING IN 1972.                            STATION RECOVERY (1971)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1971 (EKM) STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  DESCRIPTIONS BY JJL IN 1966 AND JKW IN 1969 ARE ADEQUATE.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE MERCEDITA AIRPORT AT THE EAST END OF THE AIRPORT EAST OF RUNWAY END 30, IN PONCE. TO OBTAIN ACCESS TO THE AIRPORT AND THE STATION CONTACT MR. MIGUEL CASIUAS, MERCEDITA AIRPORT, MERCEDITA, PUERTO RICO 00715-1305, PHONE 809-842-6292. THE STATION IS AT THE EAST SIDE OF THE AIRPORT 71.2 M (233.6 FT) SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF GATE 6 OF THE PERIMETER FENCE AND 11.6 M (38.1 FT) WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE EAST PERIMETER FENCE. THE STATION IS A STANDARD NOS DISK SET IN THE NORTH CORNER OF A MANHOLE COVER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1993)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED AT THE EAST END OF THE AIRPORT IN A DRAIN NEAR THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE PERIMETER FENCE.  IT IS 628.9 FT (191.7 M) EAST OF THE CL END RWY 30 (A 3/8 INCH RE-BAR MARKING THE CL END OF THE 150 FT (45.7 M) WIDTH), 290 FT (88.4 M) NORTH-NORTHEAST OF THE PROJECTED CENTERLINE OF THE RUNWAY, AND 37.6 FT (11.5 M) WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE 6 FT (1.8 M) CHAINLINK PERIMETER FENCE.  IT IS AN NOS DISK STAMPED PSE D 1993 SET IN A DRIL HOLE AT THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF A 6 FT (1.8 M) X 6 FT (1.8 M) CONCRETE SEWER MANHOLE FLUSH WIT THE GROUND IN A LOW MOUND.
markers.setting: SET IN A LIGHT STRUCTURE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1996 (AJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED NEAR THE SOUTH COAST OF PUERTO RICO, ABOUT 3.0 MI (4.8 KM) EAST OF PONCE, AT THE MERCEDITA INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT AND SET INTO THE SOUTH CORNER OF A IRREGULAR SHAPED STORM SEWER DRAIN (APPROXIMATELY 7 FT (2.1 M) SQUARE) .  OWNERSHIP--MERCEDITA INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT, PONCE, PUERTO RICO.  AIRPORT MANAGER IS MR. MYGUEL CASILOS, PHONE (787) 842-6292.  THIS IS A CONTROLLED AIRPORT AND PERMISSION IS REQUIRED TO ENTER THE AIRPORT COMPOUND.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE GATE ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE FIRE STATION GO SOUTHERLY ON THE APRON FOR 0.05 MI (0.08 KM) TO A PARALLEL TAXIWAY, TURN LEFT AND GO EASTERLY ON THE PARALLEL TAXIWAY FOR 0.25 MI (0.40 KM) TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  THE STATION IS 172.4 FT (52.5 M) NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST EDGE OF THE RUNWAY PAVEMENT AND 90.5 FT (27.6 M) SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF THE TAXIWAY PAVEMENT. THIS IS THE PRIMARY AIRPORT CONTROL STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY PBS&J 2008 (RM) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2011)  RECOVERY NOTE BY JAVIER E. BIDOT AND ASSOC. 2011 (JEB) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (2012)  RECOVERY NOTE BY AERO-METRIC ENGINEERING INCORPORATED 2012 (CPF) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.setting: SET IN THE FOOTINGS OF SMALL/MEDIUM STRUCTURES
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1996 (AJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED NEAR THE SOUTH COAST OF PUERTO RICO, ABOUT 3.0 MI (4.8 KM) EAST OF PONCE, AT THE MERCEDITA INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT AND SET INTO THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A CONCRETE PAD FOR A TAXIWAY IDENTIFIER SIGN.  OWNERSHIP--MERCEDITA INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT, PONCE, PUERTO RICO.  AIRPORT MANAGER IS MR.  MYGUEL CASILOS, PHONE (787) 842-6292.  THIS IS A CONTROLLED AIRPORT AND PERMISSION IS REQUIRED TO ENTER THE AIRPORT COMPOUND.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE GATE ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE FIRE STATION GO SOUTHERLY ON THE APRON FOR 0.05 MI (0.08 KM) TO A PARALLEL TAXIWAY, TURN LEFT AND GO EASTERLY ON THE PARALLEL TAXIWAY FOR 0.5 MI (0.8 KM) TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT. THE STATION IS 167.3 FT (51.0 M) NORTHEAST FROM THE NORTHEAST EDGE OF THE RUNWAY PAVEMENT, 61.1 FT (18.6 M) WEST-NORTHWEST FROM THE EDGE OF THE TAXIWAY AT THE HOLD BAR AND 2.4 FT (0.7 M) SOUTHWEST OF THE TAXIWAY IDENTIFIER SIGN (A) .  THIS IS A SECONDARY AIRPORT CONTROL STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY PBS&J 2008 (RM) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY RLDA SURVEYING AND MAPPING 2008 (RLD) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (2011)  RECOVERY NOTE BY JAVIER E. BIDOT AND ASSOC. 2011 (JEB) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (2012)  RECOVERY NOTE BY AERO-METRIC ENGINEERING INCORPORATED 2012 (CPF) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1941 (PR) V.A. ELEVATION--149.41 METERS.  IN THE NORTHWESTERN PART OF VIEQUES ISLAND ABOUT 6 KMS. EAST OF PUNTA ARENAS AND 1 KM. SOUTH OF MOSQUITO LANDING ON A GRASSY TOP WHICH IS ON THE MAIN DIVIDE OF THE ISLAND.  THE STATION IS 25 METERS NW OF THE MOST NORTHERNLY OF A PAIR OF SIMILAR TOPS WHICH ARE ABOUT 50 METERS APART.  STATION MARK--STANDARD TABLET STAMPED PT ARENAS 12 AND SET IN A ROCK ABOUT 1 FT. HIGH.  R.M. 1 CHISELED CROSS ON THE WEST FACE OF A ROCK ABOUT 2 FT. ABOVE THE GROUND.  DISTANCE FROM STATION--6.46 METERS.  PLANE AZIMUTH--194-12.  R.M. 2 CHISELED CROSS ON THE TOP OF A 4 FT. BOULDER.  DISTANCE FROM STATION--13.01 METERS.  PLANE AZIMUTH--269-12  SIGNAL--FLAG CENTERED OVER THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  ONE ADDITION TO DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  DRIVE JEEP TO WITHIN 200 METERS OF STATION UP WEST SLOPE OF HILL STARTING AT BUILDING 1AT2 OF NAVAL AMMUNITION DUMP.                            STATION RECOVERY (1967)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1967 (SCM) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE REFERENCE MARKS WERE NOT SEARCHED FOR AND A NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE NORTH COAST OF VIEQUES ISLAND APPROXIMATELY 6.1 MILES SOUTHWEST OF ISABEL SEGUNDA.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POLICE STATION AT THE PLAZA IN THE CENTER OF ISABEL SEGUNDA, PROCEED SOUTH FOR ONE BLOCK AND TURN LEFT AND GO EAST FOR ONE BLOCK, TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH FOR 0.25 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.10 MILES TO A FORK.  TAKE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE WESTERLY ON THE MAIN ROAD BETWEEN ISABEL SEGUNDA AND PT. ARENAS FOR 0.50 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD 0.20 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  CONTINUE WESTERLY ON MAIN ROAD FOR 0.50 MILE TO CROSSROADS.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.8 MILE TO THE JOB CORPS CENTER ON LEFT AND CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 1.35 MILES TO THE EAST END OF THE RUNWAY OF THE NEW VIEQUES AIRPORT ON THE RIGHT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.50 MILE TO A FARM ROAD LEFT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.75 MILE TO MILEPOST K7H3 AND FARM ROAD LEFT AND A CORRAL ON LEFT.  CONTINUE WESTERLY FOR 0.30 MILE TO THE MAIN GATE OF U. S. NAVAL AMMUNITION FACILITY.  PASS THROUGH GATE AND CONTINUE WESTERLY FOR 0.50 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT. CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.60 MILE AND SIDE ROAD LEFT. TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH FOR 0.2 MILE TO A FORK IN ROAD.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND CONTINUE ON MAIN TRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.10 MILES TO TOP OF HILL AND SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH AND EAST FOR 0.15 MILE TO A REVERSE Y INTERSECTION AND MAGAZINE NUMBER 1AT1 ON LEFT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.15 MILES TO MAGAZINE NUMBER 1AT2 ON LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND PROCEED NORTH FOR 0.10 MILES TO TOP OF THE RIDGE.  TURN EAST AND FOLLOW RIDGE TO END OF TRUCK TRAVEL (APPROXIMATELY 200 YARDS).  PROCEED ALONG RIDGE ANOTHER 150 YARDS TO TOP OF HILL AND STATION.  PASSAGE TO THE STATION CAN BE MADE IN A FOUR-WHEEL DRIVE VEHICLE.  STATION MARK, A STANDARD U. S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY BENCH MARK DISK, IS SET IN A 2 X 3 FOOT BOULDER WHICH PROJECTS 1 FOOT AND IS STAMPED PT ARENAS 12.  THE STATION IS 5 FEET NORTHWEST OF A 3 X 4 FOOT BOULDER WHICH PROJECTS 2 FEET.  IT IS 42 FEET WEST OF A 4 X 10 FOOT BOULDER WHICH PROJECTS 4 FEET.  IT IS 78 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF A CLUSTER OF SMALL BOULDERS WHICH PROJECT 5 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US MARINE CORPS 1970 STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION, BUT REFERENCE MARKS COULD NOT BE FOUND.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1941 V.A. ELEVATION (CONCRETE ROOF OF SUPER STRUCTURE ABOUT 12 FT. ABOVE ROOF OF MAIN BUILDING.  ON TOP OF THIS ROOF THERE IS A CONCRETE BLOCK ABOUT 2 FT. HIGH TO WHICH THE FRAMEWORK OF THE LIGHT IS BOLTED) 20.16 METERS.  STATION IS ON THE SOUTH COAST OF VIEQUES ISLAND ABOUT 5 KMS. EAST OF PUERTO REAL AND ON THE WEST SIDE OF PORT FERRO.  THE LIGHT IS ON TOP OF AND IN THE CENTER OF A LARGE CONCRETE BUILDING.  C AND G.S. STATION PORT FERRO LT. WAS NOT OCCUPIED OR DESCRIBED AND IT COULD NOT BE DETERMINED WHETHER THERE HAD BEEN ANY CHANGE IN THE ORIGINAL LIGHT.  AS THERE IS A DISCREPANCY BETWEEN THE OLD AND NEWLY DETERMINED COORDINATES FOR THE STATION IT IS REPORTED AS PORT FERRO 2.  STATION MARK--CENTER OF LIGHT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (MTP) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  STATION CAN BE REACHED BY CAR.  TO DRIVE TO STATION TAKE EAST BRANCH OF FORK IN ROAD AT ENTRANCE TO AMMO DUMP AT CAMP GARCIA, STOP AT GUARD SHACK, GET KEY TO REAR GATE, CONTINUE ON EASTERLY ROAD THROUGH DUMP, OUT BACK GATE TO LIGHT HOUSE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US MARINE CORPS 1970 STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION MARK IS A 1/2-INCH IRON BOLT SET IN AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND HAS THE LEGEND PTA GORDA 2 ACROSS ITS TOP.  IT IS THE SAME ELEVATION AS STATION GORDA.
markers.setting: OBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY US NAVY 1964 (GWM) THE STATION IS ON THE ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL RESERVATION, ABOUT 4-1/4 MILES SE OF CEIBA, AND 1-1/4 MILES N OF CABRAS ISLAND LIGHT, ON THE HIGHEST HILL ON PUERCA POINT, 66.5 FEET E OF A BUILDING.  IT IS A ROUND DISC STAMPED, U.S. NAVY, SET IN A CONCRETE POST 14 INCHES SQUARE.  TO REACH THE STATION, TAKE THE ANTIETAM ROAD TO THE SUMMIT OF THE HIGHEST HILL ON PUERCA POINT, AND A DIRT ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO N 1/4 MILE TO THE TOP OF HILL AND STATION ON RIGHT.  A METAL PIPE TRIPOD HAS BEEN PLACED OVER THE MARK.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS A STANDARD DISC STAMPED, PUERCA 2 NO.1, 1964 IN A DRILLED HOLE IN THE SE CORNER OF A CONCRETE ROOF SLAB, ON THE NW SLOPE OF THE HILL.  THE ROOF SLAB PROJECTS 2-1/2 FEET.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS A STANDARD DISC STAMPED, PUERCA 2 NO. 2, 1964, SET IN A MASS OF CONCRETE ON THE N SLOPE OF THE HILL.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 12 AIRLINE MILES EAST OF NAGUABO, ABOUT 9-1/4 AIRLINE MILES SOUTHEAST OF FAJARDO AND IN THE EAST EDGE OF ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL RESERVATION.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON A POINT OF LAND WHICH IS LOCALLY KNOWN AS PUNTA PUERCA.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM GUARD GATE NUMBER 1 AT THE ENTRANCE TO ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL RESERVATION, GO EASTERLY ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A FORK.  KEEP LEFT AND CONTINUE EASTERLY ON A PAVED ROAD CROSSING A RUNWAY FOR 1.7 MILES TO A FORK.  KEEP LEFT AND GO EAST ON FORRESTAL DR. FOR 0.6 MILE TO A FORK, KEEP RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON FORRESTAL DR. FOR 0.3 MILE TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON BOSTON STREET FOR 0.25 MILE TO A FORK JUST NORTHEAST OF THE PUBLIC WORKS DEPARTMENT.  BEAR RIGHT AND GO EASTERLY AND NORTH ON BARINES STREET FOR 0.4 MILE TO A T-INTERSECTION.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON ANTIETAN ROAD FOR 0.5 MILE TO A FORK.  KEEP RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON ANTIETAN ROAD FOR 0.35 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT, CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD AND GO EAST, NORTH AND WEST ON A WINDING PAVED ROAD FOR 1.0 MILE TO A REVERSE Y FORK.  TURN SHARP LEFT AND GO EAST UPHILL ON A BLADED ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE TOP OF A LOW HILL AND A CONCRETE PUMP HOUSE ON THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE HILL AND THE STATION IN THE ROOF OF THE PUMP HOUSE.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PUERCA 3 1965, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE ROOF OF THE PUMP HOUSE WHICH PROJECTS 1 FOOT.  IT IS 2 FEET EAST OF THE WEST EDGE OF THE PUMP HOUSE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK WITH THE ARROW POINTING TO THE SOUTHEAST STAMPED PUERCA 2 1964, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE ROOF OF THE PUMP HOUSE WHICH PROJECTS 1 FOOT.  IT IS 1 FOOT WEST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE PUMP HOUSE.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PUERCA 3 1965, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE PUMP HOUSE ROOF WHICH PROJECTS 1 FOOT.  IT IS 1/2 FOOT WEST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE PUMP HOUSE ROOF.  NO SUITABLE PLACE TO SET AN AZIMUTH MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1973)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1973 (JGC) ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  HOWEVER, DUE TO ROAD CHANGES, A NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  TO REACH THE STATION FROM GATE NUMBER 1 AT ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL STATION, GO SOUTH FOR 0.1 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO SOUTHEAST FOR 0.75 MILE TO A T-INTERSECTION.  TURN LEFT ONTO TARAWA DRIVE AND CONTINUE FOR 1.7 MILES TO A FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO SOUTHEAST ON FORRESTAL DRIVE FOR 0.6 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND CONTINUE SOUTHEAST ON ANTIETAM ROAD FOR 0.8 MILE TO AN INTERSECTION.  TURN LEFT AND CONTINUE SOUTHEAST ON ANTIETAM ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND PROCEED FOR 0.85 MILE TO ANOTHER FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO 0.4 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO 0.2 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE UP THE HILL, FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE TOP.  THE STATION IS IN THE ROOF OF A PUMP HOUSE ON THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE HILL.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PUERCA 3 1965, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE ROOF OF THE PUMP HOUSE WHICH PROJECTS 1 FOOT.  IT IS 2 FEET EAST OF THE WEST EDGE OF THE PUMP HOUSE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK WITH THE ARROW POINTING TO THE SOUTHEAST STAMPED PUERCA 2 1964, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE ROOF OF THE PUMP HOUSE WHICH PROJECTS 1 FOOT.  IT IS 1 FOOT WEST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE PUMP HOUSE.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PUERCA 3 1965, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE PUMP HOUSE ROOF WHICH PROJECTS 1 FOOT.  IT IS 1/2 FOOT WEST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE PUMP HOUSE ROOF.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1.45 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (WFP) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK 2 AND REFERENCE MARK 3 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  DISTANCES AND DIRECTIONS TO THE REFERENCE MARKS COMPARED FAVORABLY WITH THE 1965 DESCRIPTION.  THE STATION MARK WAS USED AS THE ANTENNA SITE FOR GEOCEIVER STATION 51193.  DUE TO ROAD CHANGES, A NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 9 MILES SOUTHEAST OF FAJARDO, IN THE EAST EDGE OF ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL BASE AND AT THE FLTAC FIELD OFFICE.  IT IS LOCATED ON A POINT OF LAND WHICH IS KNOWN LOCALLY AS PUNTA PUERCA.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM GUARD GATE 1 AT THE ENTRANCE TO ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL BASE, GO EASTERLY ON PAVED ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A FORK, KEEP LEFT AND CONTINUE EASTERLY ON PAVED ROAD FOR 0.8 MILE TO A T-INTERSECTION.  TURN LEFT AND GO EAST AND SOUTH ON PAVED WINDING ROAD FOR 1.9 MILE TO A T-INTERSECTION.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEASTERLY ON PAVED ROAD FOR 0.6 MILE TO A FORK, KEEP LEFT AND CONTINUE SOUTHEASTERLY FOR 0.8 MILE TO A FORK.  KEEP LEFT ON MAIN ROAD, SOUTHEASTERLY, FOR 0.4 MILE TO A FORK AND A SIGN SAYING FLTAC FIELD OFFICE.  KEEP LEFT FORK AND CONTINUE SOUTHEAST ON ANTIEDAM FOR 0.3 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF BARNES ST.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD ON WINDING PAVED ROAD FOR 0.5 MILE TO A FORK AND A SIGN SAYING FLTAC FIELD OFFICE. TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO DOWNHILL ON ANTIEDAM FOR 0.45 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT AND A SIGN SAYING FLTAC FIELD OFFICE. TURN LEFT AND GO UPHILL ON WINDING ROAD FOR 0.2 MILES TO A FORK. TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE UPHILL 0.2 MILES THROUGH THE ENTRANCE GATE TO THE FLTAC FIELD OFFICE TO THE TOP OF THE HILL AND THE STATION IN THE ROOF OF THE PUMP HOUSE.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISC STAMPED PUERCA 3 1965, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE ROOF OF THE PUMP HOUSE, WHICH PROJECTS 1 FOOT ON THE EAST EDGE AND 5 FEET ON THE WEST EDGE.  IT IS 143.5 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE FLTAC FIELD OFFICE BUILDING, AND 2 FEET EAST OF THE WEST EDGE OF THE PUMP HOUSE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK WITH THE ARROW POINTING TO THE SOUTHEAST STAMPED PUERCA 2 1964, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE ROOF OF THE PUMP HOUSE.  IT IS 1 FOOT WEST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE PUMP HOUSE.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PUERCA 3 1965, CEMENTED IN A DRILLHOLE IN THE ROOF OF THE PUMP HOUSE.  IT IS 0.5 FOOT WEST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE PUMP HOUSE ROOF.  THERE WAS NO SUITABLE PLACE TO SET AN AZIMUTH MARK.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--ABOUT 9 MILES SOUTHEAST OF FAJARDO.                            STATION RECOVERY (1978)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DEFENSE MAP AGENCY 1978 (EAW) PUERCA 3 1965 SAME AS PREVIOUSLY DESCRIBED.  LAST SENTENCE--TURN SHARP LEFT AND GO EAST UPHILL ON A PAVED ROAD, THROUGH A CHAIN LINK FENCE GATE WHICH SURROUNDS THE AFTAC TELEMETRY SITE, FOR 0.15 MI. TO THE TOP OF A LOW HILL ETC. ETC......                            STATION RECOVERY (1978)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DEFENSE MAP AGENCY 1978 (WVM) PUERCA-3 1965 GOOD.  PUERCA-2 1964 REFERENCE MARK GOOD.  PUERCA-3 1965 REFERENCE MARK GOOD.  SEVERAL TELEMETORY VANS BLOCK LINES OF SIGHT TO THE EAST.
markers.setting: SET IN THE FOOTINGS OF SMALL/MEDIUM STRUCTURES
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (WCH) STATION IS VERY NEARLY ON THE SUMMIT OF THE WOODED HILL FORMING PUERCA POINT.  BY WORKING AROUND ON THE W SIDE OF THE WOODS NEARLY TO THE TOP OF THE RIDGE, AN OLD ROAD LEADS NEARLY TO THE STATION.  THE VIEW TO THE EASTWARD WAS OPEN BUT SOME CUTTING HAD TO BE DONE IN OTHER DIRECTIONS.  STATION MARKED BY AN IRON PIPE SET IN CEMENT.  A QUADRIPOD SIGNAL WITH 30-FOOT LEGS WAS BUILT HERE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1922)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1922 (FTS) ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION SUFFICIENTLY GOOD.  SUMMIT OF POINT AROUND SIGNAL HAD HEAVY GROWTH OF SCRUB TREES AND UNDERBRUSH AND CONSIDERABLE CUTTING HAD TO BE DONE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1926)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION GOOD.  UNDERBRUSH NOT VERY HEAVY.  SMALL AMOUNT OF CLEARING NECESSARY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1940)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1940 STATION RECOVERED.  MARKED BY 2 IN IRON PIPE SET IN CONCRETE POST.  LOCATED ON HIGH, ROUNDED SUMMIT OF PUNTA PUERCA.  THE POINT IS BARE OF TREES BUT IS COVERED WITH HIGH GRASS.  THE STATION IS 19 FEET NORTH OF A BIG ROCK ABOUT 7 FT. HIGH.  AND THE ROCK IS 6 FT. EAST OF A TAMARINDO STUMP.  THERE IS NO WELL DEFINED TRAIL TO THE STATION.  BUT THE HILL IS PROMINENT.  AND THE ASCENT CAN BE MADE EASILY FROM THE BEACH ON THE SOUTH SIDE.  BOAT CAN BE OBTAINED AT ENSENADA HONDA.  THE STATION IS ON PROPERTY OF CENTRAL PASTO VIEJO.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (RLS) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  THE MARK WAS FOUND IN POOR CONDITION BUT SOLID IN THE GROUND AND APPARENTLY IN ITS ORIGINAL POSITION.  THE OLD MARK WAS REMOVED AND THE STATION WAS RE-MARKED BY A STANDARD DISK IN CONCRETE, NOTE 1A.  THE DISK IS STAMPED PUERCA 1900 USGS 1940-1941.  THE STATION IS ABOUT 4-1/4 MILES SE OF CEIBA, ABOUT 1-1/4 MILES N OF CABRAS ISLAND LIGHT, ON THE ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL RESERVATION, ON POINT PUERCA, ON THE HIGHEST HILL ON THE POINT, NEAR THE SE END OF THE NEARLY FLAT TOP OF THE HILL, 5.9 METERS NNE OF THE N SIDE OF A LARGE BOULDER AT THE SW EDGE OF THE TOP OF THE HILL, AND PROJECTS 5 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  THE ELEVATION OF THE STATION IS ABOUT 62.2 METERS.  TWO REFERENCE MARKS WERE SET.  NO.1 IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK SET IN CONCRETE, NOTE 11A, AND IS ON A NEARLY FLAT SPOT ON THE SW SLOPE OF THE HILL, 3.39 METERS LOWER THAN THE STATION, AND PROJECTS 8 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK SET IN CONCRETE, NOTE 11A, AND IS ON THE CREST OF THE RIDGE SLOPING SE FROM THE STATION, 2.38 METERS LOWER THAN THE STATION, AND PROJECTS 8 INCHES.  CONSTRUCTION IS PROPOSED AT THE STATION SITE AND THE STATION MAY BE DESTROYED IN THE NEAR FUTURE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1958)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 A SEARCH WAS MADE IN THE AREA BUT NO STATION COULD BE FOUND.  CONSTRUCTION HAS BEEN DONE IN THE AREA AND STATION IS BELIEVED LOST.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) STATION IS BELIEVED TO HAVE BEEN DESTROYED WHEN A CONCRETE PILL BOX WAS CONSTRUCTED IN THE VICINITY.  PUERCA 2 - 1964 WAS ESTABLISHED NEAR THE OLD STATION SITE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JJL) THE STATION WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT THE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARK 1 WERE NOT FOUND.  IT IS BELIEVED THE STATION WAS DESTROYED DURING THE CONSTRUCTION OF A LARGE BUILDING ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE HILL.  REFERENCE MARK 2 STILL REMAINS INTACT ON THE ROOF OF A PUMPHOUSE.  A NEW STATION PUERCA 3 WAS ESTABLISHED, SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1901 (JN) THIS STATION IS SITUATED ON THE SUMMIT OF A BARE CORAL ISLAND AT POINT PUERTO NEUVE, ABOUT 50 METERS FROM THE MAIN SHORE.  THE WATER BETWEEN THE ISLAND AND SHORE IS VERY SHALLOW AND IT CAN BE REACHED WITHOUT TROUBLE OR DANGER.  THIS POINT IS ABOUT 10 OR 15 FEET W OF WHAT WAS SUPPOSED TO BE AN OLD SPANISH TRIANGULATION POINT.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A COPPER BOLT CEMENTED IN THE CORAL ROCK.  THE BOTTOM IS FIXED WITH SHEET LEAD.  THE TOP OF THE BOLT IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE ROCK AND ALL EXCEPT THE ROUND TOP OF THE BOLT IS COVERED WITH CEMENT TO SECURE PRESERVATION OF THE MARK.  THE CENTER OF THE TOP OF THE BOLT MARKS THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1931)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1931 STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  IRON ROD IN A CONCRETE BED REPLACED THE COPPER BOLT WHICH HAD DISAPPEARED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  AN AZIMUTH MARK, REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 AND REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 WERE ESTABLISHED.  A COMPLETE DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 7-1/2 MILES NORTHEAST OF MANATI, 3-1/2 MILES NORTH OF VEGA BAJA AND ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF A BARE POINT OF LAND KNOWN AS PUNTA PUERTO NUEVO.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 2 AND 686 AT THE NORTH EDGE OF VEGA BAJA, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 686 FOR 3.5 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  THIS IS JUST BEFORE REACHING A BEACH.  (TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THIS POINT, TURN LEFT AND GO WEST AND SOUTHWEST FOR 0.1 MILE TO THE MARK ON THE RIGHT, NORTHWEST, SIDE OF THE ROAD.) CONTINUE NORTHERLY FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL AT THE BEACH.  PACK NORTHERLY ALONG THE BEACH FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO A CORAL RIDGE.  BEAR LEFT AND GO WESTERLY ALONG THE RIDGE FOR ABOUT 50 YARDS TO THE HIGHEST POINT AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A CENTER-PUNCHED IRON PIN THAT IS 1-1/2 INCHES IN DIAMETER AND IS SET IN THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE.  THE MARK PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  USC AND GS 1931 IS INSCRIBED IN THE CONCRETE.  IT IS 4 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF A PYRAMID-SHAPED CONCRETE POST THAT PROJECTS 3 FEET.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, STAMPED PUERTO NO 1 1931, IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN BEDROCK AND IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  IT IS 25 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE PYRAMID-SHAPED CONCRETE POST.  (NOTE 12A)  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, STAMPED PUERTO NO 2 1931, IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN BEDROCK AND IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  IT IS 22 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE PYRAMID-SHAPED CONCRETE POST.  (NOTE 12A)  THE AZIMUTH MARK, STAMPED PUERTO 1931, IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A CONCRETE SEA WALL.  IT IS 28 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD AND 9 FEET NORTHEAST OF A SET OF STEPS LEADING TO THE BEACH.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3-1/2 MILES NORTH OF VEGA BAJA.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1941 A SMALL BLACK STEEL CHIMNEY NEAR THE BEACH AT THE VILLAGE OF PUERTO REAL ON THE SOUTH COAST OF VIEQUES ISLAND.  THIS IS THE CHIMNEY OF A SMALL STEAM PLANT WHICH IS LOCATED JUST WEST OF THE SHORE END OF THE WHARF.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) STATION DESTROYED.  NO EVIDENCE OF CHIMNEY BUT STEAM PLANT REMAINS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (MTP) STATION DESTROYED IN 1947 WHEN STACK WAS REMOVED.  IT WAS DETERMINED BY TALKING TO MR. JUAN PEREZ, MANAGER OF THE SUGAR CANE WHARF THAT THE STACK SAT ON FOUR CONCRETE FOOTINGS SOUTH OF THE BOILERS.  THE CENTER OF THESE FOUR FOOTINGS WAS USED THIS YEAR AS A PHOTO CONTROL STATION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3-1/2 MILES NORTH OF CABO ROJO AND AT THE PUERTO RICAN GOVERNMENT RUM STORAGE PLANT.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 103 AND 104 ON THE EAST SIDE OF CABO ROJO, GO NORTH ON HIGHWAY 104 FOR 4.0 MILES TO THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 104 AND 114.  BEAR LEFT AND GO NORTHWEST ON HIGHWAY 114 FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT, SOUTHWEST, SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY.  THE TANK IS A CYLINDRICAL, STEEL STRUCTURE, SILVER IN COLOR, SUPPORTED BY FOUR STEEL LEGS AND IT IS ABOUT 85 FEET HIGH.  POINT INTERSECTED IS THE SMALL ROUND BALL ATOP AND CENTER OF THE TANK.

BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1997 STATION IS A GPS CORS.  LATEST INFORMATION INCLUDING POSITIONS AND VELOCITIES ARE AVAILABLE IN THE COORDINATE AND LOG FILES ACCESSIBLE BY ANONYMOUS FTP OR THE WORLDWIDE WEB.    https://geodesy.noaa.gov/corsdata/coord/coord_14     https://geodesy.noaa.gov/corsdata/station_log     https://geodesy.noaa.gov/CORS

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED AT THE ISLA VERDE INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT, ATOP THE ADMINISTRATION BUILDING AND ABOUT 50 FEET EAST OF THE AIRPORT CONTROL TOWER.  THE DOME IS A ROUND, FIBERGLASS STRUCTURE, PAINTED GRAY AND IS ABOUT 15 FEET HIGH.  POINT INTERSECTED IS THE VENT ATOP AND CENTER OF THE DOME.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS ABOUT 11 KILOMETERS BY ROAD AND TRAIL W OF AIBONITA AND ABOUT 5 KILOMETERS DIRECT S OF BARRANQUITAS, ON A PROMINENT BRUSHY PEAK, AND 2 KILOMETERS NW OF HACIENDA SUCCESION DE GARATINI.  IT IS IN BARRIO PULGUILLA AND THE MAIN TRAIL OR CAMINO TO COAMO PASSES OVER THE PEAK 60 FEET TO THE W OF THE STATION.  THE STATION IS 5 FEET S OF FENCE LINE BETWEEN PROPERTIES OF MICAELA ESPADA AND SANTIAGO PEREZ GOMEZ.  THE PEAK IS BRUSH-COVERED. THE TOP WAS CLEARED FOR OBSERVING.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD TABLET, STAMPED PULGUILLA-1934, CEMENTED IN ROCK SET IN GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS COPPER NAIL AND WASHER IN TRIANGULAR BLAZE ON CUERO SAP STUMP, 27.80 FEET FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 98 DEG 12 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS COPPER NAIL AND WASHER IN BLAZE ON STUMP OF GUAMA TREE 0.7 FOOT FROM STATION MARK IN TRUE AZIMUTH 199 DEG 50 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS COPPER NAIL AND WASHER IN TRIANGULAR BLAZE ON GUAMA STUMP 10.9 FEET FROM STATION MARK IN TRUE AZIMUTH 300 DEG 27 MIN.  SIGNAL--QUADRIPOD OF LUMBER WITH BLACK CROSS-TARGETS ON CENTER POLE.  TO REACH STATION FROM AIBONITO, FOLLOW MAIN CARRETERA TOWARDS COAMO FOR ABOUT 3 KILOMETERS TO K 85 H 1, WHICH IS NEAR THE CASILLA OR HOUSE WHERE THE CAMINERO LIVES, TURN RIGHT (W) ON MUNICIPAL ROAD AND FOLLOW TO HACIENDA GARATINI, WHERE IT INTERSECTS THE CAMINO OR MAIN TRAIL FROM BARRIO PULGUILLA TO COAMO.  TURN RIGHT N ON THIS CAMINO WHICH PASSES OVER TOP OF STATION PEAK.
markers.setting: SET IN UNSPECIFIED ROCK OR BOULDER
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (RLS) ABOUT 1-1/4 MILES SE OF NAGUABO PLAYA, ON POINT LIMA, WITHIN THE PROPOSED BOUNDARY OF THE ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL RESERVATION, AT THE EXTREME S END OF POINT LIMA, ON THE WESTERLY OF 2 ROCKY POINTS, ABOUT 20 FEET ABOVE THE WATER, ABOUT 8 FEET LOWER THAN THE HIGHEST ROCKS ON THE POINT.  ON THE FLAT FACE OF THE ROCK SLOPING UP AND NORTHWARD FROM THE STATION ARE 2 PICTURES OF HUMAN HEADS WHICH WERE REPORTED TO HAVE BEEN PUT THERE BY INDIANS.  ON THE SAME ROCK BUT FARTHER E IS ANOTHER SIMILAR PICTURE, SMALLER AND LESS DISTINCT.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN CONCRETE IN A DEPRESSION IN A BOULDER.  THERE ARE NO REFERENCE MARKS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  THE MARK HAS BEEN BATTERED QUITE BADLY AND NO LETTERS ARE DISTINGUISHABLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) STATION MARK RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1994)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1994 MARK RECOVERED IN POOR CONDITION.
markers.setting: UNSPECIFIED SETTING

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 11 MILES NORTH OF PONCE, 6-1/2 MILES NORTHWEST OF VILLALBA, 3 MILES SOUTH OF JAYUYA AND ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE HIGHEST MOUNTAIN IN PUERTO RICO WHICH IS LOCALLY KNOWN AS CERRO DE PUNTA AND IS LOCATED IN THE TORO NEGRO NATIONAL FOREST.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 149 AND 143 IN THE VILLAGE OF DIVISORIA, GO WEST ON HIGHWAY 143 FOR 7.65 MILES TO A LARGE, PAVED PARKING AREA ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT, CROSS THE PARKING AREA AND GO 0.05 MILE TO A LOCKED GATE.  (PERMISSION TO ENTER AND A KEY FOR THE LOCKED GATE WAS OBTAINED FROM THE RADIOTELEPHONE COMMUNICATORS OF PUERTO RICO INC. IN SAN JUAN, P.R.).  PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND FOLLOW A MOUNTAIN ROAD NORTH FOR 0.65 MILE TO A MICRO-WAVE TOWER AT THE END OF THE ROAD AND THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE PACK WEST FOR 50 YARDS TO THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE MOUNTAIN AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PUNTA 1966, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3-INCH CAST IRON PIPE THAT PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  IT IS 19 FEET SOUTH OF THE EDGE OF A CUT BANK.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PUNTA NO 1 1966, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3-INCH CAST IRON PIPE THAT PROJECTS 8 INCHES.  IT IS 30 FEET SOUTH OF THE EDGE OF THE CUT BANK AND 1 FOOT LOWER IN ELEVATION THAN THE STATION MARK.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A 1/4-INCH STEEL REINFORCEMENT ROD THAT IS CEMENTED IN AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE THAT PROJECTS 1 INCH.  IT IS 18 FEET SOUTH OF THE EDGE OF THE CUT BANK AND THE SAME ELEVATION AS THE STATION MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1999)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 1999 (JMC) THE BRONZE PLATE WAS REMOVED, THE ONLY THING LEFT WAS THE SQUARE CEMENT BASE AND THE STEEL ROD.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 THIS STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST AND MOST PROMINENT PART OF THE ISLAND.  ABOUT 8 MILES S OF JAYUYA, ON THE LIMITS OF PROPERTIES OF JACINTO REYES AND HACIENDA CARMELITA, BELONGING TO THE GOVERNMENT OF PUERTO RICO.  IT IS WOODED ON ALL SIDES AND BARE AT TOP.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD BENCH MARK CEMENTED OVER A PROPERTY CORNER AND STAMPED.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A CROSS ON E FACE OF CONCRETE PROPERTY CORNER, 4.98 METERS FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 145 DEG 44 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A GALVANIZED NAIL ON TRIANGLE BLAZED ON A HOJA MENUDA TREE, 10.13 METERS FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 187 DEG 03 MIN.  SIGNAL--QUADRIPOD AND BLACK CROSS-TARGETS.  IT IS REACHED FROM K 4 H 5 OF PONCE-JAYUYA ROAD, WHICH STARTS S ON K 7 OF ADJUNTAS-JAYUYA ROAD.  FROM HERE FOLLOW TRAIL TO HACIENDA JOUCA, PROPERTY OF SERRALLES, THROUGH HACIENDA RETIRO TO A GRASS HILL ON W FRONT OF PUNTA, HERE FOLLOW RIDGE E TO TOP OF MOUNTAIN.
markers.setting: UNSPECIFIED SETTING

markers.description: PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1941 SUGAR CANE LOADING DERRICK ABOUT 4 KMS. EAST OF PUNTA ARENAS AND 100 FT. NORTH OF ISABEL II-PUNTA ARENAS HIGHWAY AT K 1 H 5.  STATION MARK--CHISELED CROSS IN EAST EDGE OF CONCRETE BASE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) STATION DESTROYED.  NO EVIDENCE OF DERRICK BUT CONCRETE BASE, WITH CROSS, WAS FOUND IN OVERTURNED CONDITION.

STATION MARK--CHISELED CROSS IN SW CORNER OF CONCRETE BASE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) STATION DESTROYED.  NO EVIDENCE OF DERRICK OR CONCRETE BASE.  ALL BUILDINGS IN AREA DESTROYED.

markers.description: BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1965 (JJL) RECOVERED BY PRS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 5 MILES NORTH-NORTHEAST OF CEIBA, 3 MILES SOUTHEAST OF FAJARDO, AT THE EAST END OF A RIDGE, ON A RED BLUFF THAT OVERLOOKS THE OCEAN AND ABOUT 1/4 MILE EAST OF THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE RIDGE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE FAJARDO PLAZA, GO EAST AND SOUTH ON HIGHWAY 195 FOR 0.75 MILES TO A Y FORK AT THE JUNCTION WITH HIGHWAY 3.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO SOUTH FOR 0.05 MILE TO A T ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO EAST ON A DIRT ROAD THROUGH A CANE FIELD FOR 0.2 MILE TO A LARGE CRANE.  CONTINUE EAST PASSING TO THE RIGHT OF THE CRANE AND GO 0.15 MILE TO A DIAGONAL CROSSROAD AND A RAILROAD CROSSING.  CROSS THE RAILROAD TRACKS AND CONTINUE EAST ON THE DIRT ROAD FOR 0.6 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND FOLLOW A FIELD ROAD NORTH, EAST AND NORTH FOR 0.45 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO EAST ON A FIELD ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO A FORK AND THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL FOR A 2-WHEEL DRIVE VEHICLE.  FROM THIS POINT, PACK EAST ACROSS A CANE FIELD TO A TRAIL THAT LEADS INTO THE BRUSH.  FOLLOW THE TRAIL EASTERLY TO AN OPENING IN A WIRE FENCE.  PASS THROUGH THE OPENING AND CONTINUE ON THE TRAIL SOUTHEASTERLY TO THE TOP OF A RIDGE.  CONTINUE ON THE TRAIL, EASTERLY FOR ABOUT 1/4 MILE TO THE STATION ON A LOWER POINT.  NOTE--A 15 MINUTE PACK.  THE STATION MARK IS A 1/2 INCH IRON PIPE, CEMENTED IN A 1-1/2 INCH CAST IRON PIPE THAT IS SET IN A ROUND MASS OF CONCRETE WITH THE LEGEND PUNTA HARRANCA 47 ETCHED IN THE TOP OF THE CONCRETE.  IT IS 7 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A NORTH-SOUTH FENCE, 12 INCHES IN DIAMETER AND PROJECTS 1 INCH.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PUNTA BARRANCA NO 1 1965, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3-INCH CAST IRON PIPE THAT PROJECTS 10 INCHES.  IT IS 12 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE NORTH-SOUTH FENCE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PUNTA BARRANCA NO 2 1965, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3-INCH CAST IRON PIPE THAT PROJECTS 10 INCHES.  IT IS 45 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE NORTH-SOUTH FENCE.  NO SUITABLE PLACE WAS FOUND FOR AN AZIMUTH MARK.
markers.setting: UNSPECIFIED SETTING

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1901 (JN) THIS STATION IS ON PUNTA GORDA, ABOUT 3/4 MILE E OF BORINQUEN LIGHTHOUSE N 68 DEG 30 MIN E.  IT IS ON THE HIGHEST POINT IN THIS VICINITY AND ABOUT 200 METERS SW FROM NEAREST PART OF THE COAST. IT IS ON THE LAND OF PANTALEON CRUZ.  A TRIPOD AND SCAFFOLD SIGNAL 30 FEET HIGH WAS ERECTED OVER THIS STATION.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A BRASS BOLT 4 INCHES LONG CEMENTED IN SOLID ROCK.  THE BED OF CEMENT IS ABOUT 1 FOOT SQUARE ON THE SURFACE AND THE TOP OF THE BOLT IS FLUSH WITH THE CEMENT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1947)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US AIR FORCE 1947 (WHH) LETTERS FROM COL. W.H. HANSON, HEADQUARTERS, BORINGUEN A.A.F., PUERTO RICO, DATED JUNE 6, 1947 AND FROM MR. R.M. WILSON, U.S.G. AND G.S., SAN JUAN MAGNETIC OBSERVATORY, SANTURCE, PUERTO RICO, DATED JULY 22, 1947--  STATION HAS BEEN DESTROYED DUE TO THE GRADING OF THE AREA.  A NEW STATION WAS ESTABLISHED BY THE DISTRICT ENGINEER IN SAN JUAN, ABOUT 1 MILE IN A SW DIRECTION FROM THE OLD STATION PUNTA GORDA AND IS OFF THE MILITARY RESERVATION.  THE NEW STATION IS ON FAIRLY HIGH GROUND AND THE AREA IS BARREN AND ROCKY SO THAT FUTURE DISTURBANCE SEEMS RATHER UNLIKELY.  THE NEW STATION IS MARKED BY AN IRON BOLT SET IN CONCRETE ON AN OUTCROP OF SOLID ROCK.  THE EXPOSED SURFACE OF CONCRETE IS ROUGHLY 1 FOOT SQUARE AND IS MARKED USGS 47 PUNTA GORDA II BY SCRATCHING THE LETTERS IN THE CONCRETE BEFORE IT WAS SET.  OBSERVATIONS WERE MADE TO STATIONS VIRGIA (U.S.G.S.) AND TANK (U.S.E.), WHICH WE DO NOT HAVE ANY DATA ON.                            STATION RECOVERY (1952)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US AIR FORCE 1952 LETTER OF LT. COL. B.B. HUNKAPILLER, 1ST COMPUTATIONS TECHNICAL SQUADRON, RAMEY AIR FORCE BASE, P.R., DATED 10 APRIL 1952--  STATION HAS BEEN DESTROYED BY CONSTRUCTION, AND THE SITE IS NOW COVERED BY A BUILDING.
markers.setting: SET IN UNSPECIFIED ROCK OR BOULDER
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1903 (WEP) THE REMAINS OF AN OLD SIGNAL WERE FOUND ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE BLUFF AT POINT MOLINO, ABOUT 150 METERS FROM THE END OF THE POINT AND 5 METERS FROM THE EDGE OF THE BLUFF.  NO CENTER MARK WAS FOUND, BUT THE PLACE WHERE THE CENTER POLE HAD STOOD WAS MARKED BY A HOLE AND PILE OF STONES.  A NEW SIGNAL WAS ERECTED OVER THIS SPOT.  TO REACH THE SIGNAL BY WATER, LAND ON THE GRAVEL BEACH E OF THE POINT AND TAKE THE TRAIL LEADING TO THE POINT.  MARIANO PARON AND LUIS RAMOS OF PARGUERO WERE WITH THE PARTY WHEN ALL THESE SIGNALS WERE RECOVERED AND CAN PROBABLY POINT OUT THE SPOTS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1904)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1904 (JCL) HOLE AND PILE OF STONES FOUND AS ABOVE.  NEW SIGNAL ERECTED.  BEST WAY TO REACH BY WATER IS TO LAND ON SHORE OF SURIA BAY WHERE SHELTERED BY THE POINT.
BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1939 (HAC) SEE LIGHT LIST, U.S. LIGHTHOUSE SERVICE.
BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1939 (HAC) SEE LIGHT LIST, U.S. LIGHTHOUSE SERVICE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) A CONCRETE BLOCK ATOP SMALL HILL WEST OF PUERTO YABUACO WAS FOUND SUPPORTING PUERTO YABUCOA REAR RANGE DAYBEACON.  THIS APPEARED TO BE THE STATION AS LOCATED BY (USGS) IN 1940.

BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2002 (JMW) 16.7 KM (10.4 MI) WESTERLY ALONG STATE HIGHWAY 22 FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 2 IN SAN JUAN, IN TOP OF AND 1.0 M SOUTH OF THE NORTH END OF THE EAST CONCRETE ABUTMENT OF THE HIGHWAY OVERPASS OF STATE HIGHWAY 165, 11.7 M NORTH OF AND LEVEL WITH THE CENTER OF THE WESTBOUND HIGHWAY,  AND 0.2 M EAST OF THE EAST END OF THE BRIDGE DECK.  NOTE--THE MARK IS ON THE HIGHWAY RIGHT-OF-WAY.

NOTE--THE MARK IS ON THE HIGHWAY RIGHT-OF-WAY.

NOTE--THIS MARK WAS SET AS A REPLACEMENT FOR GPS STATION MONTEREY WHICH WILL BE DESTROYED BY HIGHWAY CONSTRUCTION.  THE MARK IS ON THE HIGHWAY RIGHT-OF-WAY. markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS SITUATED ON A PROMINENT HILL W OF CAMUY RIVER IN THE PLACE KNOWN AS SUMIDEROS OF CAMUY AND 2 KILOMETERS N AND 1 KILOMETER E OF THE SITE WHERE THIS RIVER CEASED TO RUN UNDERGROUND.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD TABLET CEMENTED ON NATURAL ROCK, STAMPED.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD REFERENCE TABLET CEMENTED ON NATURAL ROCK, 3.64 METERS FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 162 DEG 33 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD REFERENCE TABLET CEMENTED ON NATURAL ROCK, 3.78 METERS FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 277 DEG 48 MIN.  TO REACH THE STATION BY THE CIBAO ROAD (THAT STARTS FROM KILOMETER 19 H 7 OF LARES-ARECIBO ROAD) FOLLOW IT 1.2 MILES W, THEN NW ON THE QUEBRADAS ROAD 0.8 MILE TO A LARGE TWO ROOM SCHOOL, CONTINUE N 0.9 MILE TO CAR TRAIL NEAR SANTIAGO JIMENEZ HOUSE.  FROM IT FOLLOW A FOOT TRAIL NW THROUGH THE HILLS TO THE STATION, WHICH IS THE THIRD AND MOST PROMINENT HILL W OF RIVER.  IT IS ON LAND OF SIMPLICIO RIVERA.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (GBG) SITUATED ON A PROMINENT HILL W OF THE CAMUY RIVER.  2 KILOMETERS N AND 1 KILOMETER E OF THE PLACE WHERE THE RIVER EMERGES FROM UNDER GROUND.  THE HILL IS DISTINGUISHED BY APPEARING AS A LONG, PERFECTLY FLAT RIDGE, WITH VERTICAL, OR OVERHANGING, ENDS AS SEEN FROM THE E AND S.  IT IS THE THIRD TOP W OF THE RIVER.  AND THE HIGHEST IN THE VICINITY.  THE TOP IS COVERED WITH THICK BRUSH. AND IS A NARROW LIMESTONE RIDGE.  STATION IS CLOSER TO THE N END.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD TABLET STAMPED QUEBRADA 1934, SET IN A LARGE ROCK LEDGE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD REFERENCE-MARK TABLET CEMENTED TO ROCK, 3.64 METERS FROM THE STATION, IN AZIMUTH 162 DEG 33 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD REFERENCE-MARK TABLET CEMENTED TO ROCK, 3.78 METERS FROM STATION, IN AZIMUTH 277 DEG 48 MIN.  TO REACH FROM ARECIBO, TAKE THE ROAD TO LARES TO KM. 19.7.  TURN SHARP RIGHT (N) ON IMPROVED DIRT ROAD, AND GO 0.8 MILE WHERE TAKE LEFT FORK AND CONTINUE 0.95 MILE TO CEMETERY.  HERE TAKE RIGHT FORK AND GO FOR ABOUT A MILE TO TRAIL LEADING TO HOUSE OF RUFINO PAGAN SANTIAGO.  PASS THIS HOUSE AND CONTINUE STRAIGHT ON TRAIL THROUGH CANE FIELDS, VEERING GRADUALLY RIGHT UP TO BASE OF CLIFF.  FOLLOW TRAIL, RIGHT, AROUND CLIFF TO SADDLE.  HERE TURN SHARP LEFT, AND FOLLOW SHARP RIDGE TO STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK 1 AND REFERENCE MARK 2 WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 10 MILES SOUTHWEST OF ARECIBO, 7 1/2 MILES NORTH-NORTHEAST OF LARES, 2 MILES NORTHWEST OF BAYANEY AND ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF A PROMINENT LIMESTONE PEAK WITH SHEER ROCK CLIFFS ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE PEAK.  THIS PEAK LIES WITHIN A RANGE OF HILLS KNOWN AS THE GUARIONEX MOUNTAINS.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAY 2 AND HIGHWAY 129 IN THE WEST SIDE OF ARECIBO, GO SOUTH ON HIGHWAY 129 FOR 12.5 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT AT KILOMETER POST 23.5.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WESTERLY ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 1.25 MILES TO A Y-FORK. KEEP THE RIGHT FORK AND GO NORTHWEST FOR 0.95 MILE TO A Y-FORK AT THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF A CEMETARY.  KEEP THE RIGHT FORK AND GO NORTHERLY FOR 0.65 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT INTO A CANE FIELD.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHWEST FOR 0.55 MILE TO A HOUSE ON THE LEFT AND THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL. NOTE--PERMISSION TO ENTER THE PROPERTY MAY BE OBTAINED HERE. PACK NORTHERLY UP THE TRAIL FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO A FENCE ON THE RIDGE.  BEAR TO THE RIGHT AND GO NORTHERLY ALONG THE RIDGE FOR ABOUT 200 YARDS TO A FENCE CORNER.  TURN LEFT AND PACK WEST UP THE STEEP SLOPE, ALONG THE FENCE FOR ABOUT 100 FEET TO A FLAT, GRASSEY BENCH ON THE RIDGE.  TURN RIGHT AND PACK NORTHERLY ALONG THE BASE OF A STEEP LIMESTONE CLIFF FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO A POINT WHERE THE CLIFF ENDS.  BEAR TO THE LEFT AND PACK WEST UP THE STEEP, BRUSHEY SLOPE ONTO THE RIDGE.  BEAR TO THE LEFT AND PACK SOUTHWEST AND NORTHWEST ALONG THE RIDGE TO THE HIGHEST POINT ON THE HILL AND THE STATION.  A 25 MINUTE PACK.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY DISK, STAMPED QUEBRADA 1934, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK THAT PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  IT IS LOCATED ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE HILL.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY DISK, NO STAMPING, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK THAT PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY DISK, NO STAMPING, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK THAT PROJECTS 1 INCH.  AN AZIMUTH MARK WAS NOT ESTABLISHED.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2 MILES NORTHWEST OF BAYANEY.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 POINT SIGHTED UPON WAS CENTER OF CROSS.  NO CHECK ON THIS POSITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1901 (JN) THIS STATION IS ON THE PROPERTY OF FRANCISCO DELGRO, ABOUT 3 MILES W OF ARECIBO.  IT IS ON A HIGH BLUFF ABOUT 75 FEET FROM THE EDGE OF A ROCKY BLUFF AND ABOUT 50 FEET ABOVE HIGH WATER.  IT IS ABOUT 250 YARDS FROM THE RAILROAD AND WAGON ROAD BETWEEN ARECIBO AND CAMUY.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A GALVANIZED-IRON PIPE 2 FEET BY 2 INCHES SET IN A BED OF CEMENT, THE TOP OF THE PIPE PROJECTING ABOUT 2 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  THE PIPE IS FILLED WITH CEMENT AND THE CENTER OF THE HEAD OF A 20-PENNY NAIL DRIVEN IN THIS MARKS THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1940)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1940 THIS STATION IS ON THE SAME HILL AND ON TOP OF A CONCRETE SHELL OR BASE WITH A PIECE OF 2-FOOT PIPE, BROKEN, WHICH CONFORMED WITH THE DESCRIPTION OF 1901.  IN 1931 THE CONCRETE AND BROKEN PIPE WERE RECOVERED AND THE STATION REMARKED WITH A PIECE OF IRON ROD CENTERED MORE OR LESS IN THE PIPE HOLDING IT WITH A BETTER BASE OF CONCRETE AND SIGNALED WITH A TRIPOD CENTERED OVER THE STATION.  NOW WE RECOVERED THE ROD AND CONE IN GOOD CONDITION AND PLACED CENTERED OVER THE ROD A TABLET ENLARGING THE MONUMENT TO A HEIGHT ABOVE GROUND OF NEARLY 14 INCHES, WITH A DIAMETER OF 18 INCHES AND A FOUNDATION OF 24 INCHES.  IT WAS DONE IN AN EFFORT TO SAVE THE STATION AS NO REFERENCES COULD BE ESTABLISHED.  IT WAS SIGHTED FROM DELGARDO AND MALD IN 1934 BUT AS THE TRIPOD WAS NAKED PROBABLY THE POINTING FROM MALD WAS BAD.  STATION MARK-STANDARD B.M. TABLET CENTERED OVER IRON ROD OF 1931 MONUMENT EMBEDDED IN A CONE MONUMENT 18 INCHES IN DIAMETER, 14 INCHES ABOVE GROUND, WITH A 24-INCH FOUNDATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS 1946 LETTER FROM MR. E.G. RUBIO, HQ. ANTILLES DEPT., OFFICE OF DEPT. ENGR., A.P.O. 851, C/O P.M., MIAMI, FLORIDA, DATED OCTOBER 30, 1946--  THE PIPE FOUND IN PLACE.  CONCRETE MONUMENT BUILT IN 1939 OR 1940 WITH BRONZE TABLET CENTERED IN THE PIPE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  TWO REFERENCE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED 5 AIRLINE MILES EAST OF HATILLO, 2-1/2 AIRLINE MILES NORTHWEST OF ARECIBO, 1/4 AIRLINE MILE SOUTH OF THE SHORE LINE AND ON THE TOP OF A LOW GRASS COVERED HILL.  THE PROPERTY IS OWNED BY SR. JUAN SIVERIO WHO LIVES ABOUT 100 YARDS WEST OF THE STATION.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF HIGHWAYS 2 AND 129 IN THE WEST EDGE OF ARECIBO, GO WESTERLY ON HIGHWAY 2 FOR 2.3 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL AT SEVERAL BUILDINGS.  FROM HERE PACK EAST UPHILL FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO THE TOP OF THE GRASS COVERED HILL AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY BENCH MARK DISK STAMPED QUEBRAS 1901, SET IN THE TOP OF A MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH PROJECTS 1 FOOT.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED QUEBRAS NO 1 1901 1966, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3-INCH ROUND CAST IRON SOIL PIPE WHICH PROJECTS 10-INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED QUEBRAS NO 2 1901 1966, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3-INCH ROUND CAST IRON SOIL PIPE WHICH PROJECTS 3-INCHES.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2-1/2 MILES NORTHWEST OF ARECIBO.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1910 (NHH) THIS STATION IS ON A WOODED HILL OF MODERATE HEIGHT JUST E OF MAYAGUEZ, AND N OF MESA HILL, ON LAND BELONGING TO JULIO M. AGOSTINI.  IT IS ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THE HILL AND IN THE MIDDLE OF A SMALL CLEARING AND ABOUT 10 FEET E OF A TRAIL PASSING OVER THE HILL.  THE STATION MARK IS A 2 1/2-INCH IRON PIPE SET IN CEMENT AND PROJECTING 1 FOOT ABOVE THE GROUND.  A NAIL SET IN THE CEMENT WITH WHICH THE PIPE IS FILLED MARKS THE POINT.  THE STATION IS REACHED BY TAKING THE LAS MARIAS ROAD FROM MAYAGUEZ TO A POINT ABOUT 1/4 MILE FROM THE BRIDGE OVER THE MAYAGUEZ RIVER.  FOLLOW A ROAD TO THE RIGHT, WHICH LEAVES THE MAIN ROAD OPPOSITE A LARGE YELLOW STORE BUILDING, AND LEADS DIRECTLY TO THE HILL, CROSSING THE MAYAGUEZ RIVER BY FORDING.  THIS ROAD IS FOLLOWED TO THE RESERVOIR.  THE TRAIL LEADS DIRECTLY UP THE HILL FROM A POINT JUST OPPOSITE THE RESERVOIR.  IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT THE NAME QUEMADO HILL, IS NOT LOCALLY APPLIED TO THIS HILL, BUT TO A HIGHER HILL TO THE NORTHWARD.  THE NAME IS USED FOR THE STATION, AS IT IS THE NAME WHICH APPEARS IN THE U. S. COAST PILOT, WEST INDIES.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND

THE STATION IS 27.44 M (90.0 FT) EAST OF A CONCRETE POWER POLE, 20.08 M (65.9 FT) WEST OF A WOOD POWER POLE, 12.75 M (41.8 FT) WEST OF KM POST 9.3, 6.0 M (19.7 FT) NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF PR-111 AND 0.95 M (3.1 FT) NORTHWEST OF THE END OF METAL GUARD RAIL.

TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF PR-111 AND PR-10 1.2 MI (1.9 KM) WEST OF UTUADO, GO NORTHERLY ON PR-10 FOR 5.7 MI (9.2 KM) TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT AT THE SOUTHEAST END OF A CONCRETE BRIDGE.   THE STATION IS 8.60 M (28.2 FT) EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF PR-10, 5.64 M (18.5 FT) NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHEAST END OF CONCRETE BRIDGE RAIL, 1.90 M (6.2 FT) NORTHWEST OFF THE NORTH END OF METAL GUARD RAIL FASTENED TO BRIDGE RAIL AND 0.4 M (1.3 FT) WEST OF THE CONCRETE BRIDGE RAIL.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) STATION MARK IS AN X-ED COPPER PIN SET IN THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE THAT PROJECTS 1 INCH.  R 21 IS INSCRIBED IN THE CONCRETE.  STATION IS USED AS RM 3 FOR SURF 2, 35.45 FEET AWAY.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 5 KILOMETERS TO THE W OF THE CIDRA-CAMERIO ROAD ON A BARE HILL HAVING THE S AND N FLANKS RATHER PROLONGED.  TO THE W THERE IS ANOTHER BARE HILL WHICH IS LOWER THAN THIS ONE AND WHICH AT PRESENT IS UNDER SWEET POTATO CULTIVATION.  THE PRESENT OWNERS OF THE PROPERTY ARE THE SUCESIAN MENDOZA.  STATION IS MARKED BY A STANDARD BENCH MARK SET ON A BOULDER BURIED IN THE GROUND, STAMPED 1934 BUT NOT RABANAL.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD TABLET, 15 FEET 2 INCHES FROM STATION, IN TRUE AZIMUTH 116 DEG 44 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD TABLET 13 FEET 3-1/4 INCHES FROM STATION, IN TRUE AZIMUTH 205 DEG 37 MIN.  TO REACH THIS STATION STOP AT KILOMETER 11 H 1 AND TAKE THE PATH THAT STARTS IN A WESTERLY DIRECTION AND WHICH WILL TAKE YOU DIRECTLY TO THE STATION OVER THE RIDGE WHICH IS N OF THE RIVER.  SIGNAL--WHITE QUADRIPOD AND BLACK CROSS TARGETS ON CENTER POLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AND ALL MARKS WERE FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 8 AIRLINE MILES NORTHEAST OF AIBONITO, ABOUT 7 AIRLINE MILES NORTHWEST OF CAYEY AND IT IS ON THE TOP OF A HIGH HILL WHICH IS THE HIGHEST POINT IN THE IMMEDIATE VICINITY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE PLAZA IN CIDRA, GO WESTERLY ON HIGHWAY 173 FOR 2.6 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT AT KILOMETER POST 8.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH AND NORTHWEST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 1.2 MILES TO A FORK AND A BOARD GATE ON THE LEFT.  PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND GO WEST ON A BLADED ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO A T-INTERSECTION.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHERLY ON A BLADED ROAD FOR 0.6 MILE TO A WIRE GATE ON THE LEFT AND A DIM BLADED ROAD JUST BEYOND THE GATE.  TURN LEFT AND PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND GO WEST AND NORTHEAST ON THE DIM BLADED ROAD FOR 0.7 MILE TO THE TOP OF THE HIGH HILL AND STATION.  A 4 WHEEL DRIVE IS REQUIRED FOR THE LAST 1.35 MILES.  THE STATION MARK IS A IRON PEG SET IN THE TOP OF A IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH PROJECTS 1 INCH.  IT IS 8 FEET NORTHWEST OF A FENCE CORNER.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A USGS REFERENCE MARK DISK WITH NO STAMPING.  IT IS CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 16 FEET NORTH OF THE FENCE CORNER.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A USGS REFERENCE MARK DISK WITH NO STAMPING.  IT IS CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH PROJECTS 2 FEET.  IT IS 23 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE FENCE CORNER.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2-1/2 MILES WEST OF CIDRA.
markers.setting: SET IN A BOULDER
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1956 (EAT) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2.5 MILES SOUTHWEST OF AGUADILLA, 1.5 MILES NORTHEAST OF AGUADA, AND AT THE RECEIVING ANTENNA CENTER OF THE TRANS GLOBE COMMUNICATION INSTALLATIONS.  THE STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK SET IN A CONCRETE MONUMENT, PROJECTS 6 INCHES, AND THE DISK IS STAMPED RAC 1956.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, A STANDARD DISK SET IN A CONCRETE MONUMENT, PROJECTS 6 INCHES, AND THE DISK IS STAMPED RAC NO 1 1956.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, A STANDARD DISK SET IN A CONCRETE MONUMENT, PROJECTS 6 INCHES, AND THE DISK IS STAMPED RAC NO 2 1956.  THE AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK SET IN A CONCRETE MONUMENT, PROJECTS 6 INCHES, AND THE DISK IS STAMPED RAC 1956.  THIS MARK IS APPROXIMATELY 0.5 MILE WEST (TRUE) OF THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 (CFO) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS OR THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE NOT RECOVERED.  DESCRIPTION NOT ADEQUATE, NO ONE IN THE AREA OR THE ENGINEERS AT RAMEY AIRFORCE BASE KNOW ANYTHING OF THE LOCATION OF ANY OF THE MARKS.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1966 (JWC) RECOVERED BY PRS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 6 AIRLINE MILES NORTH-NORTHWEST OF CABO ROJO, 5 AIRLINE MILES SOUTH OF MAYAGUEZ AND ON THE TOP OF A LOW BRUSH COVERED HILL.  THE PROPERTY IS OWNED BY THE U.S. AIR FORCE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE VIADUCT AT THE INTERSECTION OF CALLE VIEGO AND HIGHWAY 2 IN MAYAGUEZ, GO SOUTH ON HIGHWAY 2 FOR 0.9 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO A T-INTERSECTION.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 102 FOR 2.95 MILES TO THE TOP OF THE LOW BRUSH COVERED HILL AND THE STATION ON THE RIGHT, WEST SIDE OF THE ROAD.  THE STATION MARK IS AN IRON PEG SET IN THE TOP OF A MASS OF CONCRETE.  THE CONCRETE HAS RADAR 1958 INSCRIBED IN THE TOP OF THE MONUMENT.  IT IS 150 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF HIGHWAY 102 AND 76 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF A PAVED ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RADAR PRS NO 1 1966, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING 4 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RADAR PRS NO 2 1966, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING 3 INCHES.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.
markers.setting: UNSPECIFIED SETTING

IT IS A STANDARD U.S. AIR FORCE SHORAN TRIANGULATION STATION DISK, STAMPED RAMEY 1953 USAF AND CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION IS LOCATED AT RAMEY AIR FORCE BASE AND JUST NORTH OF THE RUNWAY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE SOUTH GATE AT RAMEY AIR FORCE BASE, GO NORTH ON BORINGUEN STREET FOR 1.1 MILES TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO EASTERLY ON G STREET FOR ABOUT 1/2 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  THE BEACON IS A ROTATING LIGHT THAT ALTERNATELY FLASHES GREEN AND WHITE.  IT IS SUPPORTED BY A FOUR-LEGGED STEEL TOWER THAT IS ALTERNATELY PAINTED RED AND WHITE AND IS ABOUT 40 FEET HIGH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (JBS) STATION DESTROYED.  THE TOWER HAS BEEN TORN DOWN.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION IS LOCATED AT RAMEY AIR FORCE BASE AND JUST NORTH OF THE RUNWAY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE SOUTH GATE AT RAMEY AIR FORCE BASE, GO NORTHERLY ON BORINQUEN STREET FOR 1.0 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  THE TANK IS A ROUND, STEEL STRUCTURE, PAINTED ALTERNATELY RED AND WHITE, SUPPORTED BY FOUR STEEL LEGS AND IT IS ABOUT 120 FEET HIGH.  POINT INTERSECTED IS THE VENT ATOP AND CENTER OF THE TANK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (JDS) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1966 DESCRIPTION AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (JBB) STATION IS ON THE NORTHEASTERN POINT OF RAMOS ISLAND ON SAND BEACH SOME 15 METERS FROM BOTH N AND E SHORE AND ABOUT MIDWAY BETWEEN HIGH-WATER MARK AND TREE LINE.  A PIECE SOME 5 INCHES LONG WAS BROKEN OFF THE BOTTOM OF THE CEMENT STONE, IN SETTING THE MARK, BUT WAS AFTERWARDS PUT IN POSITION BEFORE THE SETTING, UNDER THE MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1902)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1902 (RLF) STATION RECOVERED.  SIGNAL STANDING, BUT STATION MARK HAS BEEN WASHED AWAY.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND
