markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1901 (JN) STATION IS ABOUT 0.8 MILE DISTANT AND BEARS S 6 DEG W FROM THE TOWN OF CAMUY, ON LAND BELONGING TO LORENZO RAMOS.  IT IS 120 FEET N OF AN E-W LINE OF PROPERTY OF JOSE SANCHEZ, AND 150 FEET E OF A N-S LINE OF PROPERTY OF LUIS URUCIA.  IT IS ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF A ROCKY KNOLL IN A FIELD.  THE CENTER OF THE HEAD OF A BRASS BOLT SET IN CEMENT MARKS THE STATION.  THE STATION IS ABOUT 1 MILE S OF THE COAST LINE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US NAVY 1964 THE STATION WAS NOT FOUND.  THE MARK WAS COVERED WITH A CONCRETE BLOCK APPROXIMATELY 3 FEET SQUARE.  IT WAS USED AS A SHORAN STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION MARK WAS FOUND AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  NO REFERENCE MARKS WERE FOUND.  REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2-1/2 MILES SOUTHWEST OF HATILLO, 1 MILE SOUTH OF CAMUY, 1/2 MILE SOUTH OF ALCANTARILLA AND ON THE PROPERTY OF MR. GILBERTO MOREL WHO LIVES IN CAMUY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 2 AND 119 IN THE VILLAGE OF ALCANTARILLA, GO SOUTH AND SOUTHWEST ON HIGHWAY 119 FOR 0.25 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH ON HIGHWAY 486 FOR 0.15 MILE TO A SMALL HILL ON THE LEFT AND A FENCE CORNER.  TAKE THE FENCE DOWN AND GO SOUTHEAST UP THE HILL ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE HILL AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A 1/2-INCH IRON BOLT SET IN THE TOP OF A MASS OF CONCRETE THAT IS 2 FEET SQUARE AND PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  THE BOLT IS RECESSED ABOUT 1-1/2 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE CONCRETE AND THE CONCRETE IS INSCRIBED RAMOS.  IT IS 17 FEET NORTH OF A WIRE FENCE.  NOTE--DESC.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RAMOS NO 1 1901 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A ROCK OUTCROP THAT PROJECTS 6 INCHES.  IT IS 34 FEET NORTH OF THE WIRE FENCE AND ON THE EAST SLOPE OF THE HILL.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RAMOS NO 2 1901 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A ROCK OUTCROP THAT PROJECTS 6 INCHES.  IT IS 17 FEET NORTH OF THE WIRE FENCE AND ON THE WEST SLOPE OF THE HILL.  NO SUITABLE PLACE WAS FOUND FOR AN AZIMUTH MARK.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 1/2 MILE SOUTH OF ALCANTARILLA.
markers.setting: OBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) STATION RECOVERED.  MARK IN GOOD CONDITION, BUT SAND HAS BEEN WASHED AWAY, LEAVING MARK STICKING OUT OF THE GROUND 2-1/2 FEET, MAKING IT UNSTEADY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) STATION WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED.
markers.setting: UNSPECIFIED SETTING

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1967 (SCM) THE STATION IS LOCATED APPROXIMATELY 4-1/2-MILES WEST OF ISABEL SEGUNDA ON THE NORTH COAST OF VIEQUES ISLAND.  NO REFERENCE MARKS WERE SET.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POLICE STATION AT THE PLAZA IN THE CENTER OF ISABEL SEGUNDA, PROCEED SOUTH FOR ONE BLOCK AND TURN LEFT AND GO EAST FOR ONE BLOCK, TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH FOR 0.25 MILES TO THE SIDE ROAD LEFT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.10 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE WESTERLY ON THE MAIN ROAD BETWEEN ISABEL SEGUNDA AND PT. ARENAS FOR 0.50 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD 0.20 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  CONTINUE WESTERLY ON MAIN ROAD FOR 0.50 MILE TO CROSSROADS.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.8 MILE TO THE JOB CORPS CENTER ON LEFT AND CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 1.35 MILES TO THE EAST END OF THE RUNWAY OF THE NEW VIEQUES AIRPORT ON THE RIGHT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.50 MILES TO A FARM ROAD LEFT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.75 MILE TO MILEPOST K7H3 AND FARM ROAD LEFT AND A CORRAL ON LEFT. CONTINUE WESTERLY FOR 0.30 MILES TO MAIN GATE OF U. S. NAVAL AMMUNITION FACILITY.  PASS THROUGH GATE AND CONTINUE WESTERLY FOR 0.50 MILE AND SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH ON PAVED ROAD OUT ON TO ROCK FILLED CAUSEWAY KNOWN AS MOSQUITO PIER.  PROCEED FOR 1.3 MILES TO A FINGER PIER ON LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO WEST FOR 0.1 MILES AND END OF FINGER PIER, AND STATION ON LEFT.  STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE CONCRETE OF A BALLARD SUPPORT, STAMPED RAT 1967 IS 2 FEET EAST OF MOST WESTERLY BALLARD ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF PIER.  IT IS 19 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE PIER, AND 17 FEET FROM THE WEST END OF THE PIER.  THE STATION IS SET FLUSH.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY INDIVIDUAL CONTRIBUTORS 2004 (MA) THE STATION WAS EAISLY FOUND BY THE DESCRIPTION.  THE DISK HAS BEEN TAKEN, LEAVING ONLY A LIGHTENED DEPRESSION IN THE CONCRETE WITH A METAL SPIKE IN THE MIDDLE AT THE LOCATION.  THIS ENTIRE STRUCTURE IS NOW COMMONLY CALLED MOSQUITO PIER AND WILL BE THE NEW FERRY TERMINAL FACILITY WITHIN 2 YEARS OF THIS DATE (PROJECTED).  WORK IS CURRENTLY BEING DONE ON THE PIER SO THE FUTURE OF THIS SITE IS UNCERTAIN.
markers.setting: SET IN A MAT FOUNDATION OR CONCRETE SLAB OTHER THAN
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE EXTREME EAST END OF THE MOST EASTERLY ONE OF THE RATONES ISLANDS, ABOUT 3 MILES SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF SALINAS, 2 MILES SOUTHEAST OF PLAYA DE SALINAS AND ON A BUILDING THAT IS 10 FEET HIGH AND UNDER A STEEL TOWER THAT SUPPORTS THE BAHIA DE JOBOS LIGHT ON CAYOS DE RATONES.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE SOUTH EDGE OF PLAYA DE SALINAS, GO SOUTH-SOUTHEAST BY BOAT FOR ABOUT 3 MILES TO THE EAST END OF THE ISLAND OF RATONES AND THE STATION.  THE BOAT WAS RENTED FROM MR. ALFONSO TORRIS NAVOINA WHO LIVES AT D55 IN CENTRAL AGUIRRE, PUERTO RICO.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RATONES 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE ROOF OF A SMALL BUILDING WHICH SETS UNDER THE STEEL TOWER.  NO REFERENCE MARKS WERE SET.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS SET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RMB) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED.  THE STEEL TOWER ATOP THE BUILDING HAS BEEN REBUILT AND IS NO LONGER OVER THE MARK.  THE CENTER OF THE NEW TOWER AND LIGHT IS 1.5 FEET SOUTH OF THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2003)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 2003 (GZH) RECOVERY NOTE BY THE UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ (GZH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED. ITS POSITION IS THE SAME.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE NAUTIC CLUB OF GUAYAMA GO WEST INTO BAHIA DE JOBOS BY BOAT FOR ABOUT 2 KILOMETERS UNTIL REACHING PUNTA RODEO. THEN GO SOUTH FOR ABOUT 3 KILOMETERS AND BEFORE REACHING CAYOS DE BARCA GO WEST AGAIN FOR ABOUT 6 KILOMETERS UNTIL ARRIVING TO THE EASTERLY ISLAND OF CAYOS DE RATONES IN SALINAS, PUERTO RICO. AFTER ARRIVING, WALK TO THE EXTREME EAST OF THE ISLAND. THE STATION IS IN THE TOP OF THE ROOF OF A SMALL BUILDING THAT SUPPORTS THE LIGHTHOUSE OF BAHIA DE JOBOS. THE NAUTIC CLUB OF GUAYAMA IS LOCATED IN BO. POZUELO, SECTOR FINAL, GUAYAMA, PUERTO RICO TO TAKE A BOAT THERE CONTACT THE COMMODORE.
markers.setting: SET IN THE FOOTINGS OF SMALL/MEDIUM STRUCTURES
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1899 (WCH) THIS STATION IS ON THE SE END OF RATONES ISLAND, WHICH IS ABOUT 3 MILES W OF CARDONA ISLAND LIGHTHOUSE.  A SMALL TRIPOD AND SCAFFOLD WERE BUILT HERE.  STATION IS MARKED BY AN IRON PIPE SET IN CEMENT.
markers.setting: OBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (JN) THE SIGNAL IS ON THE EASTERLY ONE OF THE TWO RATONES ISLETS.  IT IS ABOUT 30 YARDS FROM THE POINT OF THE ISLAND NEAREST TO CAVE.  THE POINT IS ABOUT 14 YARDS WIDE AT THE SIGNAL.  STATION IS 4 YARDS FROM INLET AND 10 YARDS FROM SEASIDE.  A 2-INCH IRON PIPE WAS BURIED FOR A STATION MARK.  IT WAS DRIVEN INTO THE SAND FOR ABOUT 18 INCHES AND THEN A MASS OF CONCRETE WAS MOULDED AROUND IT AND FILLED UP THE CENTER OF THE TUBE.  THIS IS A NEW STATION SELECTED IN DECEMBER 1899.  RATONES COULD NOT BE RECOVERED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1901)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1901 (GLF) FOUND THE REMAINS OF A SCAFFOLD AND TRIPOD STANDING.  THE TRIPOD WAS IN POSITION.  THE STATION MARK WAS GONE.  IT RE-MARKED STATION BY BURYING A 1/2-INCH IRON BOLT, ABOUT A FOOT LONG, IN THE SAND WITH ITS HEAD ABOUT 6 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE AND PLACED A SHOVEL FULL OF ANTHRACITE COAL OVER IT AND FILLED IN WITH SAND.
markers.setting: OBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED 7 AIRLINE MILES SOUTHWEST OF CIALES, 7 AIRLINE MILES SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF FLORIDA AND ON THE TOP OF A HIGH BRUSH COVERED HILL WHICH IS THE HIGHEST POINT IN THE VICINITY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE PLAZA IN CIALES, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 149 FOR 0.65 MILE TO HIGHWAY 146.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHWEST ON HIGHWAY 146 FOR 6.6 MILES TO A FORK.  KEEP LEFT AND GO SOUTH AND EAST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 2.2 MILES TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE LEFT AT KILOMETER POST 2.9.  CONTINUE EAST ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.5 MILE TO A FORK, CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD AND GO EAST ON A BLADED ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE TOP OF A HILL AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE PACK NORTH UP A STEEP HILL FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO THE TOP OF THE HILL AND STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RAYNES 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RAYNES NO 1 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RAYNES NO 2 1966, SET IN THE TOP OF A IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RAYNES 1966, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3 INCH ROUND CAST IRON SOIL PIPE WHICH PROJECTS 5 INCHES.  IT IS 23 FEET SOUTH OF KILOMETER POST 2.9, 18 FEET EAST OF A POWER POLE AND 17 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.
PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (WCH) THIS STATION IS ON THE SUMMIT OF A CONSPICOUSLY RED BLUFF WHICH STANDS OUT VERY PROMINENTLY, ABOUT 2 MILES S OF THE PORT OF FAJARDO, E COAST OF PUERTO RICO.  THE STATION IS ABOUT 20 FEET FROM THE EDGE OF THE BLUFF, AND IS ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THE SAME, THE GROUND SLOPING DOWN TO THE WESTWARD.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A PIECE OF 2-INCH IRON PIPE SET VERTICALLY IN A BED OF ROCKS AND CEMENT, WITH ABOUT 3 INCHES PROJECTING ABOVE THE SURFACE.  TRIPOD SIGNAL, TOP OF POLE 30 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1901)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1901 (JBB) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  SIGNAL WAS STILL STANDING.                            STATION RECOVERY (1902)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1902 (RLF) STATION IS ON A PROMINENT RED BLUFF ABOUT A MILE S OF PLAYA DE FAJARDO.  STATION MARK IS IN PLACE AND IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  DESCRIPTION ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1921)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1921 (JHP) STATION RECOVERED READILY AND IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) STATION SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) STATION IS THE W GABLE OF SMALL RED-ROOFED HOUSE APPROXIMATELY 1/3 MILE W OF ARROYO.  THE HOUSE SETS ON THE EDGE OF THE BANK ABOVE THE BEACH.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 THIS IS A NEW SQUARE WHITE, RED-ROOFED SCHOOLHOUSE WITH PROMINENT HIGH CEMENT STEPS, ON A HIGH BARE RIDGE LYING TO THE S OF CIALES AND E OF THE RIO BANTA.  (THERE ARE MANY SUCH SCHOOLHOUSES IN THIS VICINITY AND ONLY A CHECK OF DISTANCES WILL DETERMINE IF SAME ONE WAS SIGHTED FROM ALL STATIONS).
markers.setting: UNSPECIFIED SETTING

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1925 (GCM) STATION IS MARKED BY A BRASS SCREW CEMENTED IN PROMINENT ROCK 5 FEET W OF EDGE OF BLUFF WHICH DROPS SHEER FOR ABOUT 80 FEET TO ROCK LEDGES BELOW.  IT IS 5 FEET N AND 1/2 FOOT LOWER THAN THE HIGHEST OF EASTERLY PART OF BLUFF.  THE BLUFF IS MOST EASTERLY OF 3 DOME LIKE BLUFFS ABOUT 100 FEET HIGH.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS THE HIGHEST POINT ON PROMINENT BLACK ROCK ON W EDGE OF BLUFF.  THIS IS 1 FOOT HIGHER THAN STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (MTP) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED EXCEPT BRASS SCREW NO LONGER IN PLACE.  WAS REMAINS OF OLD CEMENT ON ROCK WHERE IT WAS ASSUMED THAT ORIGINAL STATION WAS PLACED.  DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM R.M. 1 CHECKED.

BY RLDA SURVEYING AND MAPPING 2010 (RLD) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 6.9 MI (11.1 KM) NORTHEAST OF BAYANEY, 5.1 MI (8.2 KM) SOUTH OF ARECIBO, 4.4 MI (7.1 KM) NORTHWEST OF VARELA AND 1.9 MI (3.1 KM) SOUTHWEST OF BAJADERO, PUERTO RICO.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF PR-621 AND PR-10 4.7 MI (7.6 KM) NORTHEAST OF CAYUCO, GO NORTHERLY ON PR-10 FOR 5.3 MI (8.5 KM) TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT, EAST SIDE OF PR-10.   THE STATION IS 32.90 M (107.9 FT) NORTH OF A METAL SIGN, 22.13 M (72.6 FT) SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF A PAVED ROAD RIGHT AND 18.71 M (61.4 FT) EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF PR-10.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (JBB) STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST HILL IN THE RESACA RANGE, CALLED THE MOUNT.  THIS IS ALSO THE HIGHEST HILL ON CULEBRA AND IS ABOUT 660 FEET ABOVE THE SEA LEVEL.  THE SIGNAL CONSISTS OF A POLE NAILED INTO A TREE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1900)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (WCH) STATION IS A FLAG IN A TREE PUT UP BY ASSISTANT BOUTELLE ON THE HIGHEST HILL IN CULEBRA, CALLED THE MOUNT.  THINKING IT WELL TO PRESERVE THIS POINT, I SENT UP AND HAD IT MARKED AS USUAL.                            STATION RECOVERY (1914)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1914 (GWC) REMAINS OF CEMENT FOUND, BUT NOT PIPE, HENCE STATION IS LOST.  STATION RESACA 2 ESTABLISHED.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1914 (GDC) THE STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST PART OF MT. RESACA ON THE TOP OF A GRANITE ROCK NEAR THE LOCATION OF THE OLD STATION AND JUST NORTH OF THE TRAIL OVER THE HILL.  THE ROCK IS FLAT AND ABOUT SEVEN FEET ACROSS AND IS TRAVERSED BY THREE VEINS OF LIGHTER ROCK MATERIAL.  TEN METERS NORTH OF THE STATION IS A ROCK WITH PERPENDICULAR SIDES ON WHICH IS PAINTED OMEGA OIL FOR CHILLBLAINS.  THE STATION MARK IS A CROSS IN A TRIANGLE CUT IN THE ROCK AND IS NEAR THE CENTER AND 7 IN FROM THE NORTHEAST VEIN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1957)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1957 (RCD) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  WEATHER EROSION HAS MADE THE CHISELED TRIANGLE AND CROSS BARELY VISIBLE.  THE SIGN OMEGA OIL FOR CHILLBAINS IS NO LONGER LEGIBLE, BUT FAINT PAINT MARKS ARE STILL VISIBLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (MTP) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF MT. RESACA.  THE OLD STATION MARK, A CROSS INSIDE A TRIANGLE ETCHED IN A ROCK, WAS NOT FOUND.  IN ITS PLACE WAS A 12 IN X 12 IN CONCRETE BLOCK, 4 IN THICK CEMENTED TO A FLAT BOULDER SEVEN FEET ACROSS.  IN THE SOUTHEAST QUADRANT OF THE CONCRETE BLOCK WAS A 1/2 IN DIAMETER STEEL BAR WITH A CROSS PUNCHED IN ITS CENTER.  THE WORDS TRIANGULATION USED - EL VIGIA WERE WRITTEN IN THE SLAB.  A ROCK WITH PERPENDICULAR SIDES WAS FOUND SIX METERS NORTH OF THE STATION, INSTEAD OF TEN METERS AS PREVIOUSLY DESCRIBED.  THE SIGN OMEGA OIL FOR CHILLBAINS WAS NOT VISIBLE.  APPROXIMATELY 30 MINUTES ARE REQUIRED TO HIKE TO THE SUMMIT ALONG THE MOUNTAINS SOUTH SIDE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND IN POOR CONDITION.  THE CHISELED CROSS AND TRIANGLE HAVE ABOUT WEATHERED AWAY.  A HOLE WAS DRILLED IN THE CHISELED CROSS AND A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED RESACA 1914 1966, WAS CEMENTED IN THE HOLE.  A NUMERAL 2 SHOULD ALSO HAVE BEEN STAMPED ON THE DISK BUT IT WAS INADVERTENTLY LEFT OFF.  THIS MARK WAS USED AS A REFERENCE MARK FOR EL VIGIA (USE).  SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1941 IN THE NORTHWESTERN PART OF VIEQUES ISLAND ABOUT 2-1/2 KMS. SE OF PUNTA ARENAS 1/2 KM. SOUTH OF THE COAST AND 1 KM. WEST OF A SMALL SETTLEMENT KNOWN AS RESOLUCION.  WEST OF THIS HILL THE GROUND DROPS OFF TO A SWAMP.  NORTH OF THE HILL THE GROUND DROPS OFF TO A FLAT GRASSLAND WHICH CONTINUES TO THE COAST.  STATION MARK--STANDARD TABLET STAMPED RESOLUCION AND SET IN A BLOCK OF CONCRETE FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  SIGNAL--FLAG CENTERED OVER THE STATION.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 7 MILES SOUTHEAST OF PENUELAS, 5 MILES SOUTHWEST OF PONCE, 1/4 MILE NORTH OF HIGHWAY 2, ON THE SOUTH SLOPE OF AN EAST-WEST RIDGE AND ABOUT 150 YARDS SOUTH OF THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE RIDGE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 133, 1 AND HIGHWAY 2 BY-PASS AT THE EAST EDGE OF PONCE, GO SOUTH AND WEST ON HIGHWAY 2 BY-PASS, WHICH LATER BECOMES HIGHWAY 2, FOR 6.0 MILES TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE LEFT IN THE MEDIAN OF HIGHWAY 2 AT KILOMETER POST 254.4.  CONTINUE WEST ON HIGHWAY 2 FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE ENTRANCE TO THE EL TUQUE BEACH ON THE LEFT.  CONTINUE WEST ON HIGHWAY 2 FOR 0.15 MILE TO A WIRE GATE ON THE RIGHT. PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND GO NORTH FOR 0.05 MILE.  (A 4-WHEEL DRIVE VEHICLE IS REQUIRED TO REACH THE STATION FROM THIS POINT).  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST THROUGH A GRAVEL PIT FOR 0.15 MILE TO A TRACK ROAD AT THE BASE OF A RIDGE.  FOLLOW THE TRACK ROAD UP HILL FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED REY 1966, SET IN THE TOP OF A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS 12 INCHES IN DIAMETER AND PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED REY NO 1 1966, SET IN THE TOP OF A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS 12 INCHES IN DIAMETER AND PROJECTS 12 INCHES.  IT IS ON THE EAST SLOPE OF THE HILL AND 1 FOOT LOWER IN ELEVATION THAN THE STATION MARK.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS AN IRON PLUG THAT IS 1/2-INCH SQUARE, SET IN THE TOP OF A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS 10 INCHES IN DIAMETER AND PROJECTS 1 INCH.  IT IS ON THE SOUTH SLOPE OF THE HILL AND 1 FOOT LOWER IN ELEVATION THAN THE STATION MARK.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED REY 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE FOUNDATION OF A SEWER MAN-HOLE.  IT IS 1 FOOT EAST OF A MAN-HOLE COVER AND 14 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE EAST BOUND LANE OF TRAFFIC OF THE 4 LANE HIGHWAY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1971)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1971 (EKM) STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  ADD THE FOLLOWING CHANGES TO HOW TO REACH--  ...CONTINUE WEST ON HWY 2 FOR 0.15 MILE TO KILOMETER POST 253.7 AND AN OPENING IN BARBED WIRE FENCE.  PASS THROUGH OPENING AND GO NORTH.......  CHANGE DESCRIPTION OF REFERENCE MARK 2 AS FOLLOWS--  ...THAT IS 1/2 INCH SQUARE, SET IN THE TOP OF A PATCH OF CONCRETE ABOUT 10 INCHES IN DIAMETER AND FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1922 (FTS) NOT RECOVERED.  POSITION WAS PLOTTED ON TOPOGRAPHIC SHEET, AND SEARCH MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THIS.  HILLOCK UPON WHICH STATION HAD BEEN PLACED WAS COVERED WITH A THICK GROWTH OF CANE AT TIME OF SEARCH.  NO EVIDENCE OF STATION MARK COULD BE FOUND AFTER A THOROUGH SEARCH.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS LOCATED 14.75 KILOMETERS SW OF CAMUY, 0.5 KILOMETER N OF GUAJATACA DAM AND ABOUT 200 METERS NW OF WASHINGTON SCHOOLHOUSE, ON A SHARP BARE PEAK.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD TABLET, STAMPED RIEGO 1934, CEMENTED IN A PROMINENT PROJECTING ROCK.  REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD TABLETS CEMENTED IN LIMESTONE LEDGES.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS 13.92 FEET FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 62 DEG 20 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS 12.38 FEET FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 286 DEG 48 MIN.  SIGNAL--A QUADRIPOD OF SAWED LUMBER WITH BLACK CROSS-TARGETS AND WHITE FLAG ON CENTER POLE.  TO REACH THE STATION TAKE ROAD FROM CAMUY OR QUEBRADILLAS, WHICH LEADS TO GUAJATACA RESERVOIR, AND FOLLOW TO WASHINGTON SCHOOL AT KILOMETER 13 H 2 1/2, LEAVE ROAD HERE AND GO N PAST HOUSE TO DIVIDE BETWEEN ROAD AND FIRST QUEBRADA OR SINK HOLE, TURN LEFT, W, AND GO TO TOP OF RIDGE, THEN NORTHWARD TO TOP OF FIRST PEAK.  THE SIGNAL CAN BE SEEN FROM THE ROAD BETWEEN SCHOOLHOUSE AND DWELLING HOUSE, LOOKING N THROUGH DIVIDE.  THE STATION IS NEAR THE CENTER OF THE TOP OF THE PEAK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (GBG) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED, IN GOOD CONDITION.  A POWER LINE CROSSES THIS TOP ON A TWO-POLE SUPPORT.  STATION IS 8.3 FEET NE OF ONE POLE, AND 9.8 FEET WNW OF THE OTHER.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS 5.3 FEET SW OF POLE.  AND REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 2.5 FEET NE OF THE OTHER POLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AND ALL MARKS WERE FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED 9 AIRLINE MILES SOUTHWEST OF CAMUY, 7 AIRLINE MILES NORTHEAST OF SAN SEBASTIAN, 6 AIRLINE MILES SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF QUEBRADILLAS AND ON THE TOP OF A LOW HILL.  THE STATION IS REACHED FROM THE INTERSECTION OF HIGHWAYS 119 AND 2 IN CAMUY, GO SOUTHWEST ON HIGHWAY 119 FOR 8.4 MILES TO A SCHOOL ON THE RIGHT AND THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE PACK NORTHERLY ON A TRAIL FOR ABOUT 30 MINUTES TO THE TOP OF THE HILL AND THE STATION JUST NORTH-EAST OF A DOUBLE POWER POLE.  THE STATION MARK IS A U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY BENCH MARK DISK STAMPED RIEGO 1934, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH PROJECTS 2 FEET.  IT IS 10 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE WEST ONE OF TWO POWER POLES.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED NO 1, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH PROJECTS 2 FEET.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED NO 2, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH 4 INCHES.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 6 MILES SSE OF QUEBRADILLA.                            STATION RECOVERY (1999)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 1999 THE STATION MARK IS LOCATED AT THE MIDDLE OF THE POWER POLE AND ITIS IN GOOD CONDITION AS THE SAME THE REFERENCE MARK. THE REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 1 IS LOCALIZAD 4.25 METERS TO THE STATATION MARK AND HAS 0.90 METERS OF HEIGHT. THE REFERENCE NUMBER 2 IS LOCALTED 3.85 METERS TO THE STATION MARK AND HAS 0.125 METER OF HEIGHT, FINALLY THE STATION MARK IS 0.30 METER OF HEIGHT.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1900 (JN) STATION IS ON A BARE TOPPED HILL WHOSE SUMMIT IS ABOUT 1/4 MILE S OF POINT JIGUERO LIGHTHOUSE.  THE STATION IS ALMOST ON LINE BETWEEN THE LIGHTHOUSE AND ATALAYA.  THE STATION MARK IS A 1 1/2-INCH IRON PIPE SUNK IN THE GROUND ABOUT 16 INCHES AND LEAVING ABOUT 2-1/2 INCHES EXPOSED ABOVE THE CEMENT.  IT IS FASTENED IN PLACE WITH CEMENT AND THE SAME MATERIAL FILLS THE INTERIOR TO WITHIN AN INCH OF THE TOP.  A NAIL WAS SET IN THE CENTER OF THE PIPE (IN THE CEMENT) AND ITS HEAD IS THE STATION MARK.  THE SIGNAL HERE WAS A BRACED POLE.  TWO OTHER BRACED POLES WERE SET UP IN THE VICINITY, BUT THEY ARE BOTH ALMOST ON THE BENCH.  THE ONE ON THE HILL N OF US IS ON A LOW HILL OVERLOOKING THE RAILROAD TRACK AND IS BEYOND THE LIGHTHOUSE (IN THE DIRECTION OF AGUADILLA).  TO REACH THE STATION, ONE SHOULD LEAVE THE TRAIN ABOUT 400 METERS BACK, (TOWARD MAYAGUEZ), OF THE LIGHTHOUSE AND FROM THERE IT IS AN OPEN EASY WAY TO THE TOP.  THE LAND BELONGS TO JOSE VIVA, WHO LIVES ABOUT 70 METERS E OF THE SIGNAL.  HIS CABIN IS JUST BEYOND A FINE MAMEY TREE AND STANDS ON A LITTLE NECK CONNECTING THIS HILL WITH A HIGHER ONE E OF US.                            STATION RECOVERY (1901)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1901 (JEM) STATION POLE AND SURFACE MARK FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION, NEITHER HAVING BEEN DISTURBED IN ANYWAY.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS LOCATED 2 KILOMETERS BY ROAD NE OF THE VILLAGE OF RINCON, ON A SMALL BARE PEAK JUST ABOVE THE MAIN HIGHWAY N OF KILOMETER POST K159-H8.  IT IS E OF A MUNICIPAL ROAD WHICH LEAVES THE HIGHWAY NEAR DIVIDE AND TWO TIENDAS AND IS ABOUT 150 METERS E OF A SCHOOLHOUSE ON LAND OWNED BY SANTIAGO ROSADO, WHO LIVES AT AGUADILLA.  THIS STATION IS ABOUT 0.5 MILE SE OF THE LOCATION OF U.S.C. AND G.S. STATION LA PUNTA WHICH COULD NOT BE RECOVERED AS A HOUSE HAS BEEN BUILT ON THE LOCATION AND, HAVING MANY TREES AND SHRUBBERY ABOUT IT, THE SITE WAS NOT SUITABLE FOR A NEW STATION.  THIS STATION SHOULD NOT BE CONFUSED WITH U.S.C. AND G.S. STATION RINCON, WHICH IS W AND NEAR THE COAST.  AS THE LAND ABOUT THIS STATION IS SOMETIMES CULTIVATED, AN UNDERGROUND MARK WAS ALSO ESTABLISHED.  THE UNDERGROUND MARK IS A BROWN GLASS BOTTLE FILLED WITH SAND AND BURIED WITH TOP OF NECK ABOUT 18 INCHES BENEATH THE SURFACE MARK.  SURFACE MARK IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK STAMPED, RINCON 1934 SET IN TOP OF A RECTANGULAR ROCK SET IN GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK IS A SPIKE NAIL DRIVEN IN BLAZE ON MANGO TREE, 68.68 FEET (INCLINED DISTANCE) FROM STATION MARK IN TRUE AZIMUTH 81 DEG 36 MIN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1952)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1952 (JOP) STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN GOOD CONDITION.  TWO NEW REFERENCE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS ABOUT 6 FT. LOWER THAN THE STATION, ON THE E SLOPE OF A HILL.  IT IS A STANDARD REFERENCE-MARK DISK, STAMPED RINCON 2 NO 1 1934 AND CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS ABOUT 10 FT. LOWER THAN THE STATION, ON THE N SLOPE OF A HILL.  IT IS A STANDARD REFERENCE-MARK DISK, STAMPED RINCON 2 NO 2 1934 AND CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  THE ROUTE FROM THE PLAZA IN AGUADA IS AS FOLLOWS--GO S ON HIGHWAY 2 FOR 4.85 MI. TO FORKS JUST BEFORE REACHING A SERVICE STATION AND STORE AT THE TOP OF A HILL.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK UPHILL FOR 0.15 MI. TO A HOUSE ON THE RIGHT AND YOUR END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  PACK THROUGH THE FRONT YARD OF THE HOUSE ON THE RIGHT.  CONTINUE ON A PATH PASSING THE SECOND HOUSE TO A BARBED-WIRE FENCE.  CONTINUE TO TOP OF A STEEP GRASSY KNOLL AND STATION.  ABOUT A 400 YD. PACK.  NOTE--STATION MARK IS STAMPED RINCON.  THERE IS NO NUMERAL 2.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 (CFO) THE STATION MARK RECOVERED WAS A RECTANGULAR ROCK SET ABOUT FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AS PREVIOUSLY DESCRIBED.  IT IS NOW MARKED WITH A METAL PIN IN THE CENTER OF THE ROCK, INSCRIBED IN THE CEMENT RINCON 3 1957, AND THE MARK APPEARS TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION, WITH THE DISK BEING REMOVED AND THE DESCRIBED PIN BEING SET IN THE SAME ROCK.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1, ESTABLISHED IN 1952 WAS NOT RECOVERED.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2, ESTABLISHED IN 1952 WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION, AND THE DISTANT MEASUREMENT TO THE STATION CHECKED.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 9 MILES NORTH-NORTHWEST OF MAYAGUEZ, 4 MILES SOUTHEAST OF RINCON AND ON A PROMINENT EAST-WEST RIDGE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE PLAZA IN RINCON, GO SOUTH FOR 1 BLOCK.  TURN LEFT AND GO EAST AND SOUTHEAST ON HIGHWAY 412 FOR 5.3 MILES TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO SOUTH-EAST FOR 0.3 MILE TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO SOUTHEAST FOR 0.05 MILE TO A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO 0.1 MILE TO THE STATION.  THE MAST IS A STEEL-TRUSS STRUCTURE, PAINTED ALTERNATELY RED AND WHITE, SUPPORTED BY GUY WIRES AND IT IS 71 FEET HIGH.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION CHANNEL, THE DISTANCE BEING 29.90 FEET OR 9.111 METERS EAST-SOUTHEAST OF STATION CHANNEL.                            STATION RECOVERY (2000)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2000 (RVH) REFERENCE 'WAPA' OBSOLETE SINCE STATION IS NOW KNOWN AS 'CHANNEL 12'.   FROM SOUTHEAST CORNER OF PLAZA IN RINCON, GO SOUTH 1 BLOCK.TURN LEFT AND GO EAST AND SOUTHEAST ON HWY. 412 FOR 5.3 MI., AND 300' PAST JUNCTION WITH HWY.411 TO A Y-FORK. BEAR LEFT AND GO 0.3 MI. SOUTH, UP A STEEP HILL TO A Y-FORK. BEAR RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEAST 0.05 MI TO Y-FORK. BEAR LEFT AND TRAVEL PAST GATE, 0.1 MI. TO STATION.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 CROSS ON TOP OF CHURCH BELFRY IN VILLAGE OF RIO GRANDE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (GBC) THE CROSS ON TOP OF THE CHURCH BELFRY.  THE BELFRY HAS A PEAKED, TIN ROOF.  LOCATED IN TOWN OF RIO GRANDE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) ACCORDING TO THE LOCAL PEOPLE IN RIO GRANDE THE CHURCH BELFRY WAS BLOWN OFF IN A HURRICANE IN 1928.  THE BELFRY WAS PROBABLY REBUILT IN THE SAME POSITION AND IS NOW THE SAME AS U. S. G. S. STATION RIO GRANDE CHURCH, 1934.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  THE ROOF ON THE BELFRY IS NOW RED TILE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE SOUTHWEST PART OF RIO PIEDRAS AND AT THE UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO MEDICAL CENTER.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 21 AND 41 IN RIO PIEDRAS, GO WEST ON HIGHWAY 21 FOR 0.3 MILE, THENCE TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE STATION.  THE WATER TANK IS A ROUND STEEL STRUCTURE, PAINTED A BLUE-GREEN COLOR AND IS SUPPORTED BY 6 LEGS PAINTED WHITE.  THE WATER TANK IS APPROXIMATELY 205 FEET HIGH.  POINT INTERSECTED IS THE VENT ATOP AND CENTER OF THE TANK.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1939 (HAC) STATION IS THE FRANKLIN D. ROOSEVELT TOWER OF THE UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT RIO PIEDRAS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1942)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1942 (GBG) THE CENTER OF THE KNOB ON TOP OF THE MAIN TOWER OF THE UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT RIO PIEDRAS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (MLO) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) THE DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1994)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1994 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) STATION IS IN THE VICINITY OF SANTA ISABEL, 100 METERS E OF THE MOUTH OF JACAGUAS RIVER.  STATION MARKED BY A 2-INCH PIPE SET IN CONCRETE.  PIPE DRIVEN INTO GRAVEL BEACH AT HIGH-WATER LINE SHOWING 4 INCHES ABOVE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN IRREGULAR MASSES OF CONCRETE.  HEIGHT OF SIGNAL ABOVE STATION MARK - 3 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1971)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1971 (EKM) A THOROUGH SEARCH WAS MADE FOR THE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS WITH NO SUCCESS.  STATION DESTROYED.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1993 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON PORT AUTHORITY PROPERTY ABOUT 1.5 MILES NE OF ARECIBO, PR ON PUNTA MORRILLOS. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE VICINITY OF ARECIBO PROCEED EAST ON PR HIGHWAY 2 TO PR HIGHWAY 681 GO NORTH ON HIGHWAY 681 FOR 1 BLOCK THEN TURN EAST ON A NAMELESS ROAD AND GO FOR 1 MI (1.6 KM) TO HIGHWAY 655, TURN LEFT, NORTH AND GO FOR 0.4 MI (0.6 KM) TO THE PORT AUTHORITY GATE.  PARK IN THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE PARKING LOT INSIDE THE FENCE AND PROCEED NORTHEAST ON FOOT THROUGH A MISSING SECTION OF A CONCRETE WALL UP A ROCK SLOPE ABOUT 50 M (164.0 FT) TO A CONCRETE ROAD ON TOP OF BREAKWATER AND THE STATION. THE STATION IS AN UNSTAMPED COE DISK CEMENTED FLUSH IN THE CENTER OF THE CONCRETE ROAD SURFACE RUNNING DOWN THE ROCK BREAKWATER.  THE STATION IS ON THE CENTERLINE OF THE ROADWAY ABOUT 15 M (49.2 FT) EAST OF THE LINE OF THE CONCRETE WALL.  A NAVIGATION LIGHT IS ON A 102 DEGREE MAGNETIC BEARING FROM THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2002)  RECOVERY NOTE BY PUERTO RICO DEPT TRANS 2002 (HS) REPORTED DESTROYED.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1923 (FTS) STATION LOCATED ON SMALL HILL, ABOUT 200 FEET IN ELEVATION, TOPPED BY CLUMP OF SMALL TREES AND A PILE OF LARGE BOULDERS, NEAR POINT QUEBRADA HONDA.  THE ROAD PARALLELING THIS PART OF THE COAST PASSES CLOSE BY.  THE BEST LANDING PLACE FOR A SMALL BOAT NEARBY WILL BE FOUND AT THE SOUTHERN EXTREMITY OF THE LONG SANDY BEACH WHERE A ROCKY POINT FORMS A SLIGHT COVE.  THE STATION IS ON A FLAT LEVEL TOP OF A BOULDER, 4 FEET BY 9 FEET, WHICH IS IN A SEAWARD DIRECTION FROM A SHAFT OF ROCK STANDING 20 FEET UPRIGHT ON THE SUMMIT.  THE LARGE YELLOW-COLORED ROCK FORMING POINT NEARBY APPEARS JUST TO THE RIGHT OF A DOME-SHAPED ROCK 50 FEET AWAY.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK WITH SHANK SET IN AN ORIGINAL DRILL HOLE 1/2 INCH DEEP, SURROUNDED BY CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK IS A 1-INCH DRILL HOLE 1-1/2 INCHES DEEP PLACED ON ROCK UPON WHICH THE LARGE SHAFT OF ROCK RESTS.  IT IS THE ONLY RIGID ROCK ON WHICH TO ESTABLISH A REFERENCE MARK TO WHICH A DIRECT MEASUREMENT COULD BE OBTAINED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1927)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1927 (GCM) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  CAN BE REACHED BY ROAD FROM YABUCOA, WHICH SKIRTS LOWER PART OF HILL.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED BUT BRONZE DISK HAS BEEN REMOVED.  THE 1/2 INCH DEEP DRILL HOLE WITH CEMENT REMAINS AROUND IT WAS FOUND.  R.M. WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 (CFO) THE STATION DISK HAS BEEN DESTROYED, PART OF THE DRILL HOLE MADE FOR THE DISK IS STILL VISIBLE.  THE R.M. WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) STATION WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED.  IT IS BELIEVED TO HAVE BEEN DESTROYED BY WAVE ACTION OR OTHER MEANS AS THE LIMESTONE IS HEAVILY ERODED.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (ELJ) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE LARGEST AND EASTERLY OF A GROUP OF ROCKS CALLED ARRECIFE BARRILES.  THE MARK IS LOCATED ON TOP OF THE ROCK AT ABOUT 18 FEET IN ELEVATION.  THE REEF IS COMPRISED OF FOURTEEN ROCKS AWASH, THE STATION BEING ON THE NEXT TO THE LAST IN AN EASTERLY DIRECTION.  THE BEST APPROACH TO THE STATION BY SMALL BOAT IS FROM THE SOUTHWEST TO AVOID PREVAILING SWELLS FROM THE NORTHEAST.  A SHARP LIMESTONE LEDGE AT THE SOUTHWEST POINT CAN BE LANDED ON WITH CARE.  THE STATION MARK IS SET IN A LIMESTONE DEPRESSION ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE ROCK.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ROCK 2 1962.  NO REFERENCE MARKS WERE SET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1923 (FTS) STATION IS THE LARGEST AND HIGHEST OF A GROUP OF THIRTEEN ROCKS WHICH ARE BARE AT LOW WATER, BUT MOST OF WHICH APPEAR TO BE AWASH ON ACCOUNT OF SEAS BREAKING OVER THEM AND SHOW ON THE CHARTS BARRILES REEF ON THE NORTHERN EDGE OF VIEQUES SOUND.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS SITUATED ON A PROMINENT SHARP PEAK THAT SPURS S OF MAIN RIDGE E OF DUCY RIVER, ABOUT 8 MILES N OF YAUCO.  HILL IS BARE AND STEEP TO S AND PARTLY COVERED BY BRUSH ON THE VERY TOP.  TO THE N, E, AND W THE TOP IS ROCKY, FULL OF HOLES, AND BOULDERS.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD TABLET SET ON NATURAL ROCK (NOT A BOULDER) BY CEMENT, STAMPED RODADERO 1934.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A CROSS ON A NATURAL ROCK FACING THE STATION FROM NE, 2.57 METERS FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 218 DEG 08 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A CROSS ON NATURAL ROCK FACING STATION FROM SE, 4.73 METERS FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 284 DEG 43 MIN.  TO REACH STATION, FOLLOW DUCY MUNICIPAL ROAD (FROM KILOMETER 2 YAUCO-LARES ROAD) 6.1 MILES N, THEN TAKE HORSE TRAIL E TO LUIS PIARALDY FARMHOUSE AND ON S LIMITS OF FARM IS THE HILL.
markers.setting: SET IN UNSPECIFIED ROCK OR BOULDER
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) STATION IS LOCATED ON THE ROOF OF THE BUCARE APARTMENTS IN SANTA TERESTA, PUERTO RICO.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD TRIANGULATION DISC, STAMPED ROIG 1964, SET IN A DRILLED HOLE IN THE SE SECTION OF THE CONCRETE ROOF.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF HIGHWAY 3 AND CALLE PROVIDENCIA, GO N ON CALLE PROVIDENCIA FOR 1.5 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION AND RED LIGHT.  TURN RIGHT ON CALLE LOIZA AND GO 4.5 MILES TO A SIDE STREET.  TURN RIGHT ON CALLE BUCARE AND GO 0.1 MILE TO BUCARE APARTMENTS AND STATION ON THE ROOF OF A FOUR STORY BUILDING.  REFERENCE MARK NO 1 IS A STANDARD DISC STAMPED ROIG RM NO 1 1964, SET IN A DRILLED HOLE IN THE NE CORNER OF THE BUILDING WALL.  REFERENCE MARK NO 2 IS A STANDARD DISC STAMPED ROIG RM NO 2 1964, SET IN A DRILLED HOLE IN THE SW SECTION OF THE ROOF.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED.
markers.setting: SET IN A LARGE STRUCTURE WITH DEEP FOUNDATIONS
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED 7 AIRLINE MILES SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF FAJARDO AND ON THE TOP OF A LOW BRUSH COVERED HILL.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM GUARD GATE NUMBER 1 AT THE ENTRANCE TO ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL STATION, GO SOUTHEAST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A FORK.  KEEP LEFT AND GO EAST AND SOUTH ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 1.7 MILES TO A FORK.  KEEP LEFT AND GO EASTERLY ON FORRESTAL DRIVE FOR 0.6 MILE TO A FORK, KEEP LEFT AND GO EASTERLY ON ANTIETAM DRIVE FOR 0.8 MILE TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A T-INTERSECTION, TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH AND WEST ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE OFFICERS CLUB ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH AND SOUTHEAST PASSING BETWEEN THE OFFICERS CLUB AND A SMALL GARAGE ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE TOP OF THE BRUSH COVERED HILL AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A IRON PEG SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING 6 INCHES.  THE PEG HAS BEEN BATTERED ON THE TOP AND THE STAMPING IS VERY POOR.  ROLON 1941 CAN BE SEEN VERY FAINTLY.  IT IS 30 FEET EAST OF THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF A LARGE REFLECTOR.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ROLON NO 1 1941, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING 4 INCHES.  IT IS 26 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF THE LARGE REFLECTOR.  (NOTE 11A)  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ROLON NO 2 1941, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF THE LARGE REFLECTOR.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.  OFFICE NOTE--THE 1966 OBSERVATIONS FOR STATION ROLON 1941 INDICATE MOVEMENT OF THE DISK.  THEREFORE A NEW POSITION WAS COMPUTED FOR THE OLD MARK IN 1966.  STAMPING ON DISK WAS NOT CHANGED.  (SEE G-16362)  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 8 MILES ENE OF NAGUABO.                            STATION RECOVERY (1967)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1967 (SCM) STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED 7 AIRLINE MILES SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF FAJARDO, 8 AIRLINE MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF NAGUABO AND ON THE TOP OF A LOW BRUSH COVERED HILL IN THE EAST EDGE OF ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL STATION.  TO REACH FROM GUARD GATE NUMBER 1 AT THE ENTRANCE TO ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL STATION, GO EASTERLY ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A FORK.  KEEP LEFT AND GO EASTERLY ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 1.7 MILES TO A FORK JUST AFTER CROSSING RUNWAY NUMBER 6.  KEEP LEFT AND GO EASTERLY ON FORRESTAL DRIVE FOR 0.6 MILE TO A FORK.  KEEP LEFT AND GO EASTERLY ON ANTIETAM DRIVE FOR 0.8 MILE TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWEST ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A T-INTERSECTION.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH AND WEST ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE OFFICERS CLUB ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH AND SOUTHWEST PASSING BETWEEN THE OFFICERS CLUB AND A SMALL GARAGE ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE TOP OF THE BRUSH COVERED HILL AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED ROLON NO 1 1941, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING 4 INCHES.  IT IS 26 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF A LARGE REFLECTOR.                            STATION RECOVERY (1967)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1967 (SCM) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (RLS) STATION IS ON THE ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL RESERVATION, ABOUT 1/2 MILE NE OF THE NE SIDE OF ENSENADA HONDA, ABOUT 1/2 MILE NW OF THE NW END OF THE DRY DOCK SITE IN PUERCA BAY, ABOUT 50 METERS NE OF THE EXTENSION OF THE PROPOSED CENTER LINE OF THE DRY DOCK, AT THE SITE OF FAMILY RESIDENCES FOR CONSTRUCTION PERSONNEL, 5.7 METERS NW OF THE SW CORNER OF THE THIRD HOUSE FROM THE W IN THE N ROW OF HOUSES, 10.4 METERS SW OF THE NW CORNER OF THE FRONT PORCH OF THE SAME HOUSE, AND 13.8 METERS ENE OF THE E CORNER OF THE SECOND HOUSE FROM THE W.  THE ELEVATION OF THE STATION IS ABOUT 126 FEET.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A 2-INCH DIAMETER IRON PIPE 2 FEET LONG WITH A CAP ON TOP AND SET IN A CONCRETE POST 12 INCHES SQUARE AT THE TOP.  THE TOP OF THE CAP HAS A CHISELED TRIANGLE NEAR THE CENTER AND A DRILL HOLE AT THE CENTER OF THE TRIANGLE MARKING THE STATION.  THE TOP OF THE CAP IS STAMPED USC AND GS ROLONCITO 1941.  THE MARK PROJECTS ABOUT 4 INCHES ABOVE GROUND AND THE CAP ON THE PIPE PROJECTS ABOUT 1/2 INCH ABOVE THE CONCRETE.  NO UNDERGROUND OR REFERENCE MARKS WERE SET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  ALL HOUSES HAVE BEEN TORN DOWN ON TOP OF THE HILL.  THE STATION IS ON THE NORTH SLOPE OF THE HILL AND ABOUT ONE FOOT LOWER THAN THE HIGHEST POINT.  STATION IS 11.4 METERS SOUTH OF FIRE HYDRANT NO. 6, 17.6 METERS SOUTH OF CENTERLINE OF ROAD ON NORTH EDGE OF HILL, 44.2 METERS NORTH OF CENTERLINE OF ROAD ON SOUTH EDGE OF HILL, AND 20.1 METERS SE OF THE MIDDLE AND LARGEST OF THREE PALM TREES WHICH MAKE A LINE RUNNING GENERALLY EAST-WEST.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED, BUT A NEW DESCRIPTION WOULD BE MORE UP-TO-DATE.  STATION IS ON THE ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL RESERVATION AND MAY BE REACHED BY FOLLOWING SICILY CIRCLE ROAD TO THE NORTH SIDE OF THE HILL TOP AND THE CONCRETE STEPS LEADING SOUTH.  THE STATION IS ABOUT 1/2 MILE NW OF THE NW END OF THE DRYDOCK SITE IN PUERCA BAY, 58 FT. S OF CENTERLINE OF ROAD, 56.3 FT. SW OF SW CORNER OF CONCRETE STEPS TO A HOUSE WHICH HAS BEEN REMOVED. 49.4 FT E OF A CONCRETE HOUSE FOUNDATION PROJECTING 18 INCHES, 34.7 FT NE OF CONCRETE HOUSE PROJECTING 5 INCHES.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A 2 INCH DIAMETER IRON PIPE 2 FEET LONG WITH A CAP ON TOP AND SET IN A CONCRETE POST 12 INCHES SQUARE AT THE TOP.  THE TOP OF THE CAP HAS A CHISELED TRIANGLE NEAR THE CENTER AND A DRILL HOLE AT THE CENTER OF THE TRIANGLE MARKING THE STATION.  THE TOP OF THE CAP IS STAMPED, USC AND GS ROLONCITO 1941.  THE MARK PROJECTS ABOUT 4 INCHES ABOVE GROUND AND THE CAP ON THE PIPE PROJECTS ABOUT 1/2 INCH ABOVE THE CONCRETE.  NO UNDERGROUND OR REFERENCE MARKS WERE SET.  A METAL PIPE TRIPOD HAS BEEN PLACED OVER THE MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1979)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US AIR FORCE 1979 ENTIRE TOP OF THE HILL HAS CHANGED.  THERE IS NOW A PERMANENT BUILDING WHICH HOUSES A CLUB.  THERE IS ALSO A LARGER PARKING LOT.  STATION IS DESTROYED.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) NO DESCRIPTION WAS FOUND FOR THIS STATION BUT NO STACK EXISTS IN THIS GENERAL AREA.  STATION IS ASSUMED LOST.

BY RLDA SURVEYING AND MAPPING 2010 (RLD) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 4.7 MI (7.6 KM) SOUTHWEST OF JUANITA DIAZ, 3.0 MI (4.8 KM) NORTHEAST OF PONCE, 2 MI (3.2 KM) SOUTHWEST OF COTO LAUREL AND ON THE WEST SIDE OF EXIT RAMP FROM PR-10 SOUTH TO PR-52 TO PONCE, PUERTO RICO.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF PR-14 AND PR-10 2.4 MI (3.9 KM) NORTHEAST OF PONCE.  GO SOUTHEAST ON PR-10 FOR 1.2 MI (1.9 KM) TO THE EXIT RAMP TO PR-52 TO PONCE, TAKE THE EXIT RAMP FOR ABOUT 0.1 MI (0.2 KM) TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.   THE STATION IS 41.55 M (136.3 FT) NORTH OF THE SOUTHWEST END OF A METAL GUARD RAIL, 18.53 M (60.8 FT) NORTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF EXIT RAMP, 13.90 M (45.6 FT) WEST OF THE METAL GUARD RAIL, 8.0 M (26.2 FT) WEST OF THE EAST END OF CONCRETE BOX CULVERT AND 2.92 M (9.6 FT) EAST OF A 6-INCH (15 CM) TREE.
markers.setting: SET IN A RETAINING WALL OR CONCRETE LEDGE
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL STATION, ABOUT 2-1/2 MILES SOUTHEAST OF CEIBA, 1/2 MILE SOUTHEAST OF THE ROOSEVELT ROADS CONTROL TOWER AND ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF A LOW, BRUSHY HILL.  THE BEACON IS A ROTATING LIGHT THAT ALTERNATELY FLASHES GREEN AND WHITE.  IT IS SUPPORTED BY A 4-LEGGED STEEL STRUCTURE THAT IS PAINTED ALTERNATELY RED AND WHITE AND IS ABOUT 6 FEET HIGH.
PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 THIS STATION IS SITUATED ON THE HIGHEST PEAK OF THE RIDGE OF MOUNTAINS RUNNING TOWARD THE N FROM MAIN RIDGE W OF TORO NEGRO RIVER AND OF THE CIALES-VILLALBA ROAD.  THE PEAK IS NE OF EL GUINEO DAM.  IT IS WOODED ON ALL SIDES.  IT IS ON LAND OWNED BY INSULAR GUT, AND IS A FOREST RESERVE.  IT IS ON THE LIMITS OF THE MUNICIPALITIES OF CIALES AND JAYUYA.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD U.S.G.S. TABLET SET ON A ROCK, STAMPED ROSA 1934.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A BRONZE NAIL AND WASHER ON TOP OF HUESO STUMP, 1.44 METERS FROM STATION IN AZIMUTH 219 DEG 08 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS GALVANIZED NAIL AND WASHER ON TRIANGLE BLAZE ON HUESO STUMP, 2.445 METERS FROM STATION, IN AZIMUTH 342 DEG 58 MIN.  TO REACH STATION TAKE TRAIL TO EL BALDIO STARTING W FROM KILOMETER 43 H 1 OF VILLALBA-CIALES ROAD.  SIGNAL--A QUADRIPOD CENTERED OVER STATION MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  TWO NEW REFERENCE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED 14 AIRLINE MILES NORTH-NORTHEAST OF PONCE, 6 AIRLINE MILES SOUTHEAST OF JAYUYA AND ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF A HIGH BRUSH COVERED RIDGE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE PLAZA IN VILLALBA, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 149 FOR 6.4 MILES TO HIGHWAY 143 AT A FILLING STATION.  TURN LEFT AND GO WESTERLY ON HIGHWAY 143 FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH AND WEST ON A BLADED ROAD FOR 1.25 MILES TO A FORK.  KEEP RIGHT AND GO NORTHWEST ON A BLADED ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A REVERSE Y FORK, TURN SHARP RIGHT AND GO NORTHEAST AND NORTH ON A BLADED ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A TRAIL ON THE LEFT AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL. FROM HERE PACK WESTERLY ON THE TRAIL FOR ABOUT 40 MINUTES TO A SMALL STREAM.  CROSS THE STREAM AND PACK WESTERLY ON THE TRAIL FOR ABOUT 20 MINUTES TO A FORK.  KEEP LEFT AND PACK SOUTHERLY ALONG THE WEST SIDE OF A BRUSH COVERED HILL FOR ABOUT 30 MINUTES TO A SMALL STREAM.  TURN RIGHT AND PACK NORTHWEST UP A STEEP HILL FOR ABOUT 1/2 MILE TO THE TOP OF THE RIDGE.  TURN RIGHT AND PACK NORTH ACROSS THE RIDGE FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE RIDGE AND THE STATION.  A 3 HOUR PACK.  THE STATION MARK IS A U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY BENCH MARK DISK STAMPED ROSA 1934, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ROSA USGS NO 3 1934, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3-INCH ROUND CAST IRON SOIL PIPE WHICH PROJECTS 8 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 4 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ROSA USGS NO 4 1934, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3-INCH ROUND CAST IRON SOIL PIPE WHICH PROJECTS 5 INCHES.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 5 MILES NORTHWEST OF VILLALBA.
markers.setting: SET IN UNSPECIFIED ROCK OR BOULDER
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION LOCATED 7 KILOMETERS E OF MAYAGUEZ AND ABOUT 3 KILOMETERS N OF THE VILLAGE OF ROSARIO, ON THE EASTERN END OF THE HIGH RIDGE EXTENDING EASTWARD FROM MAYAGUEZ AND KNOWN GENERALLY AS LAS MESA.  THE SUMMIT OF THE RIDGE IS QUITE FLAT AND LARGE IN EXTENT, THE STATION BEING AT THE SOUTHEASTERN END ON A BARREN PART OF THE RIDGE THAT IS SEPARATED SOMEWHAT FROM THE MAIN RIDGE BY A DRAIN.  IT IS ABOUT 10 FEET W FROM A SHORT, STEEP, GRADE WHERE THE RIDGE DROPS OFF ABRUPTLY TO A LOWER LEVEL.  ABOUT 0.5 KILOMETER TO THE N IS A HIGH POINT ABOUT SAME ELEVATION, WHICH IS COVERED WITH COFFEE AND ACCOMPANYING GROWTH OF SHRUBBERY FOR SHADE.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD TABLET, STAMPED ROSARIO 1934, CEMENTED IN A LARGE BOULDER SET IN THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A DOUBLE GUAMA BUSH APPROXIMATELY 215 FEET DISTANT IN TRUE AZIMUTH 118 DEG 08 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A YOUNG MANGO TREE APPROXIMATELY 210 FEET DISTANT IN TRUE AZIMUTH 139 DEG 51 MIN.  SIGNAL--A QUADRIPOD OF SAWED LUMBER WITH BLACK CROSS-TARGETS AND WHITE FLAG ON CENTER POLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1952)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1952 (JOP) STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND WAS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS STAMPED ROSARIO 1934 5ER 1938.  TWO NEW REFERENCE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS ABOUT THE SAME ELEVATION AS THE STATION, AND N OF THE STATION.  IT IS A STANDARD REFERENCE-MARK DISK, STAMPED ROSARIO NO 1 1934.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS ABOUT THE SAME ELEVATION AS THE STATION, AND N-NW OF THE STATION.  IT IS A STANDARD REFERENCE-MARK DISK, STAMPED ROSARIO NO 2 1934.
markers.setting: SET IN A BOULDER
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1956 (EAT) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 5 MILES E OF MAYAGUEZ, 1.5 MILES N OF ROSARIO, AND AT THE U.S. AIR FORCE MISSILE TEST CENTER RESERVATION AT THE EASTERN END OF A HIGH RIDGE EXTENDING EASTWARD FROM MAYAGUEZ AND KNOWN GENERALLY AS LAS MESA.  THE STATION MARK IS 76 FEET N OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF A PAVED DRIVE LEADING TO THE LIVING QUARTERS ON THE RESERVATION, 67 FEET S OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE CENTRAL CONTROL BUILDING, AND 29 FEET SW OF CABLE LINE MARKER POST NO. 124.  THE DISK IS STAMPED ROSARIO 2 1956, AND PROJECTS 6 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE PLATFORM AT THE SOUTH ENTRANCE OF THE CENTRAL CONTROL BUILDING.  THE DISK IS STAMPED ROSARIO 2 NO 3 1956.  REFERENCE MARK 4 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE CASING AROUND A SEWER MANHOLE COVER.  THE MARK IS STAMPED ROSARIO 2 NO 4 1956.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO THIS MARK.  ROSARIO REPLACED USED IS A STANDARD USED DISK SET IN A CONCRETE MONUMENT, 61 FEET E OF THE EASTERN ENTRANCE OF THE CENTRAL CONTROL BUILDING AND 45 FEET NW OF A FLAGPOLE.  THE MARK WAS SET BY THE U.S.E.D. TO REPLACE ROSARIO USGS 1934 AND THE DISK IS NOT STAMPED.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO THIS MARK.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE SECOND CONCRETE PLATFORM AT THE SOUTHERN ENTRANCE TO BUILDING NO. NFP 8.  THE DISK IS STAMPED ROSARIO 2 1956.  NOTE--THE UNDERGROUND DISK IS A STANDARD USC AND GS BENCH MARK DISK SET DIRECTLY BENEATH THE SURFACE MARK.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1.5 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN 1956 AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A DIFFERENCE OF 5.4 SECONDS IN THE DIRECTION TO THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS NOTED AND CHECKED IN THE FIELD.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1956 (EAT) THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD USED DISK SET IN A CONCRETE MONUMENT, 61 FEET E OF THE EASTERN ENTRANCE OF THE CENTRAL CONTROL BUILDING AND 45 FEET NW OF A FLAGPOLE.  THE MARK WAS SET BY THE U.S.E.D. TO REPLACE ROSARIO USGS 1934 AND THE DISK IS NOT STAMPED.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO THIS MARK FROM STATION ROSARIO 2.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) STATION IS THE E GABLE OF LARGE LOW HOUSE WITH A RED ROOF.  HOUSE IS LOCATED ABOUT 150 METERS BACK FROM BEACH, AT THE HEAD OF GREAT HARBOR.  HOUSE IS ON THE W SIDE OF ROAD LEADING N OF THE TOWN OF CULEBRA.  THERE IS A WINDMILL BACK OF THE HOUSE.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 9 MILES NORTH-NORTHWEST OF YAUCO, 8 MILES NORTHEAST OF SABANA GRANDE AND ON THE TOP OF A CONCRETE WATER TANK.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 2 AND 128 IN YAUCO, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 128 FOR 5.9 MILES TO THE ANTONIO LUCCHETTI DAM.  CROSS THE DAM AND GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 128 FOR 9.1 MILES TO THE JUNCTION WITH HIGHWAY 374.  CONTINUE NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 128 FOR 0.75 MILE TO THE JUNCTION WITH HIGHWAY 105.  TURN SHARP RIGHT, LEAVING THE PAVED ROAD AND GO SOUTHERLY UP A HILL ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO A REVERSE Y-FORK.  TURN SHARP RIGHT AND GO 50 YARDS ON A DIRT ROAD TO THE STATION ON THE TOP OF A CONCRETE WATER TANK.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RUB 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE WATER TANK.  IT IS 15 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE WATER TANK AND 9 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE WATER TANK.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RUB NO 1 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF THE CONCRETE WATER TANK.  IT IS 20 FEET WEST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE WATER TANK.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RUB NO 2 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF THE CONCRETE WATER TANK.  THE BENCH MARK IS A U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY BENCH MARK DISK STAMPED, RUBIAS 1934, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A SMALL BOULDER.  IT IS 78 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE CONCRETE WATER TANK AND 14 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF A CUT BANK.
markers.setting: SET IN A MASSIVE STRUCTURE
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 8 MILES NORTH OF YAUCO, 8 MILES EAST-SOUTHEAST OF MARICAO AND ON A PROMINENT MOUNTAIN.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE PLAZA IN YAUCO, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 128 FOR 11.5 MILES TO THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 128 AND 374.  TURN SHARP RIGHT AND GO SOUTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 374 FOR 0.4 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT, EAST, SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY.  THE MAST IS A STEEL-TRUSS STRUCTURE, PAINTED ALTERNATELY RED AND WHITE, SUPPORTED BY GUY WIRES AND IT IS ABOUT 140 FEET HIGH.  POINT INTERSECTED IS THE TOP AND CENTER OF THE MAST.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 8 MILES NORTH OF YAUCO, 8 MILES EAST-SOUTHEAST OF MARICAO AND ON A KNOLL ON A PROMINENT MOUNTAIN.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE PLAZA IN YAUCO, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 128 FOR 11.5 MILES TO THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 128 AND 374.  TURN SHARP RIGHT AND GO SOUTH AND SOUTHEAST ON HIGHWAY 374 FOR 0.5 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN SHARP LEFT AND GO NORTH, WEST AND SOUTH FOR 0.3 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  THE TOWER IS A THREE-LEGGED, SELF-SUPPORTING STEEL-TRUSS STRUCTURE, ALUMINUM IN COLOR AND IT IS ABOUT 75 FEET HIGH.  POINT INTERSECTED IS THE TOP AND CENTER OF THE TOWER.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS ON MAIN RIDGE THAT RUNS E FROM JUNCTION OF MARICAO-INDIERA ROAD AND YAUCO-LARES ROAD AT KILOMETER 22 OF THE LATTER.  IT IS ABOUT 300 METERS FROM JUNCTION ON LAND OWNED BY GUANICA CANTRAL AND N OF A HOUSE USED BY MR. ONEILL AS A SUMMER RESORT HOUSE.  STATION IS ON RIDGE AT FIRST PROMINENT POINT.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD U.S.G.S. TABLET SET ON A ROCK.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS BRASS NAIL AND WASHER ON 6-INCH TRIANGLE CUT 1.45 METERS ABOVE GROUND ON A GUAVAGRAO STUMP, 17.32 METERS SE OF STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 36 DEG 27 MIN.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS NE OF CORNER OF SERVANTS HOUSE OF SUMMER RESORT PROPERTY OF MR. ONEILL, 31.005 METERS SW OF STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 105 DEG 44 MIN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION MARK WAS FOUND AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK 1, 2 AND 3 WERE NOT FOUND.  THE STATION WAS NOT OCCUPIED AT THIS DATE.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOW--  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 9 MILES NORTH-NORTHWEST OF YAUCO, 8 MILES NORTHEAST OF SABANA GRANDE AND ON A LOW, GRASS COVERED HILL THAT IS OCCUPIED BY A CONCRETE WATER RESERVOIR.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 2 AND 128 IN YAUCO, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 128 FOR 5.9 MILES TO THE ANTONIO LUCCHETTI DAM.  CROSS THE DAM AND GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 128 FOR 9.1 MILES TO THE JUNCTION WITH HIGHWAY 374.  CONTINUE NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 128 FOR 0.75 MILE TO THE JUNCTION WITH HIGHWAY 105.  TURN SHARP RIGHT, LEAVING THE PAVED ROAD AND GO SOUTHERLY UP A HILL ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO A REVERSE Y-FORK.  TURN SHARP RIGHT AND GO 50 YARDS TO A CONCRETE WATER RESERVOIR AND THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  PACK EASTERLY FOR 50 YARDS TO THE TOP OF A LOW HILL AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY BENCH MARK DISK STAMPED RUBIAS 1934, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A SMALL BOULDER.  IT IS 78 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF A CONCRETE WATER RESERVOIR AND 14 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF A CUT BANK.  NOTE--DESC.  A TIE WAS MADE FROM STATION RUB.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 8 MILES NORTHEAST OF SABANA GRANDE.

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 NO CHECK ON THIS POSITION.  STATION IS THE CROSS ON PROMINENT STEEPLE ON THE ROMAN CATHOLIC CHURCH OF THE TOWN OF SABANA GRANDE.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS SITUATED ON SAGRADO CORAZON SCHOOL, ON STOP 27, SANTURCE.  STATION IS THE CENTER OF BELL STEEPLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (GBG) RECOVERED.  CENTER OF THE BELL STEEPLE ON THE LARGE BUILDING OF THE SAGRADO CORAZON SCHOOL, STOP 27, SANTURCE.  DO NOT CONFUSE WITH SAGRADO CORAZON AT STOP 19.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (VES) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 THIS STATION IS ON A LIMESTONE HILL ABOUT 5 KILOMETERS S OF MANATI, ON LAND OWNED BY JAIME CALAF, DEVOTED TO GRAZING.  ITS SIDES ARE STEEP AND COVERED BY BRUSH.  ENTER E A MUNICIPAL ROAD 0.5 MILE TAKE CART ROAD ANOTHER 0.5 MILE TO PROPERTY OF ROMON SIRAGUZA FOLLOW N A SERIES OF RIDGES TO STATION.  JUNCTION OF MUNICIPAL ROAD IS ON K 6 H 5 NEAR A TWO-ROOM SCHOOLHOUSE.  AT END OF CART ROAD IS THE HOUSE OF REGINO ORTIZ.  STATION MARK IS A U.S.G.S. STANDARD TABLET CEMENTED ON A CORAL ROCK ON HIGHEST PART OF HILL.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD TABLET CEMENTED ON ROCK, 5.785 METERS, TRUE AZIMUTH 57 MIN 30 SEC.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD TABLET CEMENTED ON ROCK, 3.06 METERS, TRUE AZIMUTH 210 DEG 57 MIN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (GBG) STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  HOWEVER, THE HILL DOES NOT APPEAR EVER TO HAVE BEEN DEVOTED TO GRAZING.  IT IS A SHARP CORAL LIMESTONE HILL COVERED WITH DENSE BRUSH.  THE STATION IS A BRONZE DISK SET IN ROCK ON THE HIGHEST POINT.  AND IS ABOUT 400 METERS N OF THE HOUSE OF PABLO ROBLES, AND 400 METERS NW OF THE HOUSE OF JULIA RIVERE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM MANATI (JUNCTION OF ROAD TO CIALES WITH ARECIBO ROAD) GO S ON ROAD TO CIALES 4.1 MILES (K6 H5).  TURN E ON MUNICIPAL ROAD AND GO 0.55 MILE.  TURN LEFT ON ROCK ROAD AND GO 0.35 MILE.  TAKE RIGHT FORK AND GO 0.1 MILE TO HOUSE OF FERMIN COLLASE, WHERE LEAVE CAR.  FROM HERE TAKE WIDE, GRADED TRAIL NORTHWARD OVER HILLS ABOUT A KILOMETER TO A POINT WHERE IT GOES TO THE HIGHEST POINT OF A HIGH HILL.  HERE THE STATION HILL IS PLAINLY SEEN AS A WOOD-COVERED, HIGH, E-W RIDGE WITH HIGH POINT AT W, AND WITH AN ESCARPMENT AT BASE.  FROM HERE TAKE TRAIL SHARPLY DOWN HILL TO LEFT, AND FOLLOW GENERALLY NORTHWARD TO RANCH HOUSE OF JOSE CLA.  AND ON TO HOUSE OF JULIA RIVERE.  THENCE HEAD TOWARDS STATION ON STEEP TRAIL UP THROUGH CLEARED FIELDS TO ESCARPMENT.  THENCE ALONG SAME TO DIM TRAIL WHICH LEADS UP TO STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AND ALL MARKS WERE FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 9 AIRLINE MILES SOUTHWEST OF VEGA BAJA AND ON THE TOP OF A HIGH BRUSH COVERED RIDGE WHICH IS THE HIGHEST POINT IN THE VICINITY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF HIGHWAYS 2 AND 149 IN THE NORTH EDGE OF MANATI, GO SOUTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 149 FOR 4.4 MILES TO HIGHWAY 643.  TURN LEFT AND GO EASTERLY ON HIGHWAY 643 FOR 0.55 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHERLY UPHILL ON A WINDING PAVED ROAD FOR 0.6 MILE TO A COCONUT TREE ON THE RIGHT AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE PACK EAST UP A DRAW FOR ABOUT 0.1 MILE TO A HOUSE IN A LOW SADDLE.  BEAR LEFT AND FOLLOW A WELL TRAVELED TRAIL NORTHEAST FOR ABOUT 1/4 MILE TO A FORK AND A RIDGE ON THE LEFT.  BEAR RIGHT AND GO EAST ALONG THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE RIDGE FOR ABOUT 1/4 MILE TO A FENCE LINE.  CROSS THE FENCE AND GO EAST, NORTH AND NORTHWEST ON A DIM TRAIL FOR ABOUT 1/4 MILE TO THE TOP OF THE RIDGE AND THE STATION.  A 45 MINUTE PACK.  THE STATION MARK IS A USGS BENCH MARK STAMPED SALIENTE 1934, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A USGS REFERENCE DISK STAMPED NO.1, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH PROJECTS 2 FEET.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A USGS REFERENCE DISK STAMPED NO.2, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH PROJECTS 2 FEET.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3 MILES SOUTH OF MANATI.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 2004 (YRR) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1901 (JBB) ON S END AND HIGHEST POINT OF SANTIAGO CAY, OPPOSITE THE PLAYA DE HUMACAO.  STATION IS MARKED BY A CEMENT POST 18 INCHES LONG BY 6 INCHES SQUARE WITH A NAIL IN THE CEMENT MARKING THE CENTER.  CEMENT BLOCK MARKED U.S. ON TOP.                            STATION RECOVERY (1922)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1922 (FTS) STATION MARK RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  STATION IS ON HIGHEST POINT OF SANTIAGO CAY AND EASILY RECOVERED.  REFERENCE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED AS FOLLOWS, EACH CONSISTING OF STANDARD BRONZE DISK CEMENTED INTO A CONCRETE POST, PROJECTING 4 INCHES ABOVE SURFACE.  R.M.NO.1, STAMPED SAN NO.1 IS 19.52 METERS DISTANT.  R.M.NO.2, STAMPED SAN NO.2 IS 10.77 METERS DISTANT.  BOTH REFERENCE MARKS ARE ON RANGE 306 DEG 06 MIN TO THE RIGHT OF CABRAS ISLAND LIGHTHOUSE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1926)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1926 (GCM) STATION MARK RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  NO ATTEMPT WAS MADE TO RECOVER REFERENCE MARKS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1940)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1940 RECOVERED STATION AND R. M. NO. 1 AS DESCRIBED.  R. M. NO. 2 NOT SEARCHED FOR.  STATION IS ON HIGHEST PART OF CAYO SANTIAGO, NEAR S.W. END, IN HEAVY GROWTH OF LOW BUSHES.  SMALL TREES GROW IMMEDIATELY TO THE NORTHWARD.  THE ISLAND IS NOW USED AS A BREEDING GROUND FOR MONKEYS.  AND A DURABLE SIGNAL MUST BE USED.  A TRAIL LEADS UP FROM THE DOCK, ON WEST SIDE OF ISLAND, PAST CARETAKERS HOUSE, TO THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JJL) ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE STATION WAS VISITED BY A BUILDING PARTY ONLY AND A SIGNAL WAS ERECTED FOR INTERSECTION PURPOSES.  THE ISLAND THE STATION IS LOCATED ON IS NOW USED FOR THE RAISING OF MONKEYS AND IS UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF THE US PUBLIC HEALTH AND WELFARE SERVICE.  PERMISSION MUST BE OBTAINED FROM THE U.S. PUBLIC HEALTH AND WELFARE SERVICE BEFORE VISITING THE STATION.  ARRANGEMENTS MAY ALSO BE MADE WITH THEM FOR BOAT TRANSPORTATION TO THE ISLAND.  A COMPLETE DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 7 MILES EAST OF HUMACAO, 1 MILE SOUTHEAST OF PLAYA DE HUMACAO AND ON THE SOUTH END AND HIGHEST POINT OF AN ISLAND KNOWN AS SANTIAGO CAY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE BOAT DOCK ON SANTIAGO CAY, PACK SOUTHERLY ALONG THE TRAIL FOR ABOUT 0.1 MILE TO THE HIGHEST POINT AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A NAIL SET IN THE TOP OF A 6-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  THE LETTERS U.S. ARE INSCRIBED ON THE TOP OF THE CONCRETE MONUMENT.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, STAMPED SAN NO 1, IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 6-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 6 INCHES.  (NOTE 11A)  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, STAMPED SAN NO 2, IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 6-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  (NOTE 11A)
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION LOCATED 6.0 KILOMETERS S OF QUEBRADILLAS IN BARRIO SAN ANTONIO, ON A PROMINENTLY CLEARED RIDGE ON THE E SIDE OF THE GUAJATACA RIVER.  THE TOP AND SOME OF THE SLOPE OF THE RIDGE ARE CLEARED AND UNDER CULTIVATION, THE W SLOPE IS VERY STEEP AND FORMS THE E WALL OF THE GUAJATACA RIVER CANYON.  THE STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE RIDGE.  STATION IS MARKED UNDERGROUND BY A COPPER NAIL AND WASHER IN TOP OF A WOODEN STAKE, AND THE SURFACE BY A STANDARD TABLET, STAMPED SAN ANTONIO 1934, CEMENTED IN LIMESTONE SET IN GROUND.  REFERENCE MARKS ARE A 6-INCH STUMP OF AMASIGO, 3 FEET HIGH, 41.65 FEET FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 44 DEG 57 MIN.  A 5-INCH LONE AGUACATE TREE, 34.2 FEET FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 89 DEG 10 MIN.  A 3-INCH STUMP OF AMASIGO, 2.5 FEET HIGH, 25.7 FEET FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 143 DEG 18 MIN.  A 6-INCH STUMP OF AMASIGO, 3.5 FEET HIGH, 2.7 FEET FROM STATION IN TRUE AZIMUTH 241 DEG 34 MIN.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM QUEBRADILLAS, FOLLOW THE ROAD LEADING TO GUAJATACA RESERVOIR TO ANTONIO R. BARCELO SCHOOL, AT KILOMETER 3 H 2.5, TURN RIGHT (W) ON MUNICIPAL ROAD AND FOLLOW FOR 1.2 KILOMETERS TO T-ROAD S, TURN LEFT (S) ON THIS ROAD AND FOLLOW FOR 0.33 KILOMETERS TO SECOND T-ROAD S, TURN LEFT (S) ON THIS ROAD AND FOLLOW TO HOUSE OF SIMEON MERCADO, 0.5 KILOMETER AS FAR AS CAR CAN BE TAKEN, FROM HERE A WELL-TRAVELED TRAIL LEADS TO THE MOUNTAIN, ABOUT 0.75 KILOMETER.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION IS LOCATED 15 AIRLINE MILES EAST OF AGUADILLA, 8 AIRLINE MILES SOUTHWEST OF CAMUY, 3 AIRLINE MILES SOUTH OF QUEBRADILLAS AND ON THE TOP OF A BRUSH COVERED HILL.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE PLAZA IN QUEBRADILLAS, GO SOUTH ON HIGHWAY 113 FOR 2.2 MILES TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WESTERLY ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.85 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT AT KILOMETER POST 1.3.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO A POINT WHERE THE PAVED ROAD CURVES EAST.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD AND GO SOUTH ON A DIM TRACK ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO A FENCE LINE ON THE RIGHT AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE PACK SOUTH ON A TRAIL FOR 5 MINUTES TO A DRAW ON THE RIGHT. TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST UP THE DRAW FOR ABOUT 10 MINUTES TO THE TOP OF A HILL.  CONTINUE WEST ACROSS THE HILL FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO THE TOP OF THE BRUSH COVERED HILL AND THE STATION. A 20 MINUTE PACK.  THE STATION MARK IS A U.S. NAVY HYDROGRAPHIC BRONZE DISK STAMPED SAN ANTONIO 2 CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED SAN ANTONIO 2 NO 1 USN 1966, SET IN A MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED SAN ANTONIO 2 NO 2 USN 1966, SET IN A MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.

IT IS USED BY THE SAN JUAN HARBOR PILOTS FOR COMMUNICATING WITH SHIPS OFF SHORE.  THE COMPUTED POSITION OF THIS STATION CHECKS EXACTLY WITH SIGNAL STATION (MAST), 1939. PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1940 STATION FOUND AS DESCRIBED.  TOP OF PIPE BROKEN, CENTER NAIL GONE.  THIS STATION IS ON A LONG HILL WITH AN 80-METER TOP, RUNNING E AND W, THE MOST PROMINENT OF THE W END OF A LINE OF HILLS RUNNING W FROM CENTRAL CANOVANAS AND RIO LOIZA.  APPROACHED BY CAR FROM CAROLINA BY MUNICIPAL ROAD TO HAYO MULA, WHICH IS FOLLOWED TO THE W FOOT OF HILLS AT RR CROSSING.  TURN E ON DIRT ROAD THRU GROUP OF HOUSES TO A SMALL LAGOON E OF THE SMALL HILL SW OF STATION HILL.  CONTINUE E BY TRAIL TO THE W FOOT OF STATION HILL, TURN N AND THEN E TO CLIMB HILL FROM N BY TOP OF A LOW SADDLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (MLO) A BRONZE DISK OF THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR OF THE PUERTO RICAN GOVERNMENT WAS FOUND SET IN CONCRETE ON NATURAL ROCK ON TOP OF CERRO SAN JOSE.  THE MARK IS ABOUT ONE FOOT LOWER THAN THE HIGHEST PART OF THE ROCK.  SAN JOSE HILL IS PRINTED IN BIG LETTERS IN THE CONCRETE SURROUNDING THE DISK, WHICH IS STAMPED MAPA TOPOGRAFICO.  A CHECK WAS MADE WITH THE CHIEF, TOPOGRAPHIC SECTION, DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORKS.  HE SAID THAT IN 1956 AN IRON PIPE SET IN CONCRETE, IN POOR CONDITION, WAS RECOVERED AS ORIGINALLY DESCRIBED.  HE REMOVED THE PIPE MARKING THE STATION, SAN JOSE HILL, 1902, AND REPLACED IT WITH THE DISK STAMPED MAPA TOPOGRAFICO WHICH IS DESCRIBED IN THE ABOVE PARAGRAPH.  A PROMINENT TRAIL TO THE STATION BEGINS AT THE SOUTHERN BASE AND PROCEEDS UP THE HILL IN A NORTHEASTERLY DIRECTION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) IN 1964 TWO SEPARATE WRONG HILLS WERE CLIMBED.  STATION HILL HAS TO BE ON A THIRD HILL THAT WAS NOT CLIMBED IN 1964.  THERE IS NO EVIDENCE OF CONSTRUCTION SO THE STATION IS PROBABLY THERE.  A NEW TO REACH FOLLOWS--  FROM A POINT ON HIGHWAY 3 NEAR CAROLINA AT COLON AUTO SALES TURN LEFT N AND FOLLOW PAVED HIGHWAY THROUGH CAROLINA 0.4 MILE PASS CHURCH CONTINUE 0.1 MILE THEN JOG A BLOCK E AND CONTINUE N 0.2 MILE PASS SCHOOL, CONTINUE N 0.9 MILE PASS FLEXOCORE CONCRETE CONTINUE N 0.5 MILE TO ROAD INTERSECTION TURN LEFT (W) AND FOLLOW ROAD ALONG RR TRACKS 0.1 MILE, TURN RIGHT (N) AND FOLLOW DIRT ROAD 0.3 MILE TO END OF TRUCK TRAVEL AT TWO GATES.  WALK THROUGH RIGHT GATE AND GO AHEAD ON FOOT THROUGH OPEN FIELD PASSING CORNER OF CANE FIELD AND CONTINUE NE ALONG PATH TO THE FOOT OF SADDLE BETWEEN TWO PROMINENT HILLS.  THERE ARE TWO CAVES UNDER THE SADDLE.  ABOUT 100 FEET WEST OF WESTERLY CAVE IS A CLEARED PATH LEADING NE UP INTO THE SADDLE.  THERE IS A CLEARED PATH UP THE RIGHT (E) HILL.  CLIMB THE LEFT (W) HILL CUTTING PATH AS YOU GO.  THE EASTERLY HILL HAS A PROMINENT HUMP AT ITS WEST END.  THERE IS NO MARK UP THERE.  THE STATION HAS TO BE ON THE WESTERLY HILL.  FROM HIGHWAY 3 EAST OF CAROLINA ONE CAN SEE THE TWO PROMINENT HILLS.  THEY LOOK LIKE ANVILS.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1971 THE STATION IS LOCATED AT THE LUIS MUNOZ MARIN INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT AT THE EAST SIDE OF SAN JUAN.  THE STATION IS LOCATED AT THE WEST END OF THE NORTHERLY RUNWWAY. IT IS LOCATED IN THE GRASS AREA NORTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE END OF RUNWAY 8, 200 FT (61.0 M) NORTHWEST OF CENTERLINE END, 120.2 FT (36.6 M) WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE FIRST RUNWAY LIGHT EAST OF THE RUNWAY END, 53.8 FT (16.4 M) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHERN END OF THE THRESHOLD BAR, AND 49.1 FT (15.0 M) NORTH OF THE NORTHERN MOST THRESHOLD LIGHT. THE STATION IS A CGS TOPO DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE MONUMENT FLUSH WITH THE GROUND. ACCESS TO THE STATION AND THE AIRPORT MUST BE ARRANGED THROUGH THE DIRECTOR OF AVIATION, MR. JOSE MALDONADO, LUIS MUNOZ MARIN INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT, PUERTO RICO PORTS AUTHORITY, GPO BOX 2829, SAN JUAN, PR 00936. PHONE 809-791-4620.                            STATION RECOVERY (1993)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1993 (DRM) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE SOD AREA NORTHWEST OF RUNWAY END 8.  IT IS 200.0 FT (61.0 M) NORTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE, 120.2 FT (36.6 M) WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE FIRST RUNWAY LIGHT EAST OF THE RUNWAY END, 53.8 FT (16.4 M) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHERN END OF THE THRESHOLD BAR, AND 49.1 FT (15.0 M) NORTH OF THE NORTHERN-MOST THRESHOLD LIGHTS. THE STATION IS A STANDARD TOPOGRAPHIC STATION DISK, STAMPED AP 1971 STA A2 SJU, SET IN A CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1996)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1996 (AJL) NOTE--THIS IS A SAC STATION.  THE STATION IS LOCATED AT THE LUIS MUNOZ MARIN INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT, SAN JUAN, PUERTO RICO, ALONG THE NORTH SIDE OF RUNWAY 8-26, AND IN LINE WITH THE THRESHOLD BAR AT RUNWAY END 8.  OWNERSHIP--PUERTO RICO PORTS AUTHORITY, P.O.  BOX 362829, SAN JUAN, PUERTO RICO 00936-2829.  CHIEF OF OPERATIONS IS FELIX RIVERA DE JESUS.  PHONE 809-791-0067 OR 809-791-0314, FAX 809-791-4835. CONTACT HIM FOR PERMISSION TO OCCUPY THIS STATION AND TO ARRANGE FOR AN ESCORT.  OTHER CONTACTS ARE--HARRY NARVAEZ-MUNET, ASSISTANT AVIATION DIRECTOR, L.M.M.  INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT, P.O. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE CENTRAL PART OF SAN JUAN AND AT THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE INTERSECTION OF PONCE DE LEON AVENUE AND SAN JUAN BAUTISTA STREET.  THE MAST IS A FOUR-LEGGED SELF-SUPPORTING STEEL STRUCTURE, PAINTED ALTERNATELY RED AND WHITE AND HAS A LARGE ANTENNA ON TOP.  OVERALL HEIGHT OF THE STRUCTURE IS ABOUT 210 FEET.  POINT INTERSECTED IS THE RED OBSTRUCTION LIGHT ATOP AND CENTER OF THE ANTENNA.  NOTE--WHEN VIEWED FROM THE EAST, WEST OR SOUTH THE MAST APPEARS TO SIT ON TOP OF A GRAY BUILDING.
BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS CHURCH STEEPLE AT SAN LORENZO.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1902 (JN) THIS STATION IS A CROSS CUT NEARLY IN THE CENTER OF THE BRICK ROOF OF THE W TOWER OF SAN MATEO CATHOLIC CHURCH, SANTURCE.  DISTANCE FROM CENTER TO NW CORNER OF TOWER (INSIDE) 6.95 FEET.  FROM CENTER TO NE CORNER IS 6.21 FEET.  FROM CENTER TO SW CORNER IS 6.00 FEET.  AND FROM CENTER TO SE CORNER IS 5.18 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1927)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1927 (GCM) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  THE CROSS MARKING THE STATION WAS SOMEWHAT OBLITERATED, BUT WAS FOUND BY REFERENCE DISTANCE.  THE MARK WAS DEEPENED BEFORE LEAVING.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (GWM) THE CHURCH WAS FOUND AS DESCRIBED.  THE TOWER WAS NOT CLIMBED.
markers.setting: SET IN A MASSIVE STRUCTURE
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 POINT STATION IS ORNAMENT ON TOP OF LARGE DOME AT REAR OF CHURCH.
