markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1939 (HAC) STATION IS ON A LARGE CONSPICUOUS WAREHOUSE IN CATANO, LOCATED ON THE BAY FRONT AND IMMEDIATELY EASTWARD OF THE STREET FORMING THE EXTENSION OF THE HIGHWAY LEADING INTO THE TOWN.  THIS BUILDING HAS TWO GABLES ON THE N FRONT AND ONE GABLE ON THE E SIDE OF THE BUILDING.  THE STATION IS THE EASTERLY OF THE TWO GABLES IN THE N FRONT.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1922 THIS STATION IS 1.6 KILOMETERS E OF THE PUNTA BORINQUEN LIGHTHOUSE, AND S OF THE COAST, ON THE PROPERTY OF RAMON VEGA.  IT IS NE OF HIS RESIDENCE, ON A POINT OF A CORAL ROCK RIDGE RUNNING PARALLEL WITH THE COAST AT THE N EDGE OF A GROVE OF PALMETTO OR COOLLE.  IT IS ON THE SECOND KNOLL E OF CART ROAD, LEADING N FROM THE RESIDENCE OF RAMON VEGA, WHICH ROAD TURNS E AND RUNS ALONG THE N SIDE OF THE KNOLL.  THERE IS A SLIGHT DEPRESSION OR BASIN IN THE TOP OF THE KNOLL, AND THE STATION IS AT THE S EDGE OF THIS BASIN.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD U.S.G.S. BRONZE BENCH MARK TABLET CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN SOLID ROCK.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1, IS A DRILL HOLE IN SOLID ROCK NEAR THE W EDGE OF THE DEPRESSION, 3.83 METERS DISTANT ON A TRUE AZIMUTH OF 131 DEG 22 MIN 43 SEC.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2, IS A DRILL HOLE IN SOLID ROCK ON THE S SLOPE OF THE HILL, 5.87 METERS DISTANT ON A TRUE AZIMUTH OF 347 DEG 29 MIN 00 SEC.  ELEVATION ABOVE SEA LEVEL IS 74.1 METERS.  THE STATION IS BEST REACHED BY INQUIRING THE WAY TO PUNTA BERINQUEN LIGHTHOUSE, WHICH IS WELL KNOWN THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY, AND FROM THIS PLACE THE STATION CAN BE SEEN AND LOCATED VERY EASILY.
markers.setting: SET IN ROCK OUTCROP
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED 7 AIRLINE MILES NORTH-NORTHEAST OF SANTA ISABEL, 6 AIRLINE MILES NORTHWEST OF SALINAS AND 3 AIRLINE MILES SOUTH OF COAMO.  IT IS ON A HIGH ROCK COVERED HILL WHICH IS THE HIGHEST POINT IN THE VICINITY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE PLAZA IN SANTA ISABEL, GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 153 FOR 6.8 MILES TO HIGHWAY 154.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EASTERLY ON HIGHWAY 154 FOR 0.65 MILE TO THE TOP OF A LOW HILL AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL AT KILOMETER POST 1.2.  FROM HERE PACK NORTH UP A STEEP HILL FOR ABOUT 1/4 MILE TO A RIDGE, TURN LEFT AND PACK WESTERLY UP THE RIDGE FOR ABOUT 1/2 MILE TO THE TOP OF THE HIGH HILL AND THE STATION.  A 45 MINUTE PACK.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WINTER 1965, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3-INCH ROUND CAST IRON SOIL PIPE WHICH PROJECTS 10 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WINTER NO 1 1965, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3-INCH ROUND CAST IRON SOIL PIPE WHICH PROJECTS 1 FOOT.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WINTER NO 2 1965, BRAZED TO THE TOP OF A 3-INCH ROUND CAST IRON SOIL PIPE WHICH PROJECTS 10 INCHES.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 8-1/2 MILES SOUTHWEST OF JUANA DIAZ, 4-1/2 MILES SOUTHEAST OF PONCE, 3-1/2 MILES SOUTH OF THE PONCE AIRPORT AND ABOUT 0.3 MILE EAST OF POINT CABULLON.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 1, 2 AND 133 IN THE EAST EDGE OF PONCE, GO EAST ON HIGHWAY 1 FOR 1.95 MILES TO A CROSSROAD AT THE WEST END OF THE AIRPORT, TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH FOR 2.85 MILES TO A GATE AT THE ENTRANCE TO A PRIVATE BEACH AND SEVERAL HOUSES, PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND GO 0.05 MILE TO A CROSSROAD, TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON A SAND ROAD FOR 0.75 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  THE STATION MARK IS 55 FEET SOUTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF A SAND ROAD.  IT IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WIRSHING 1966, SET IN A 12 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING 1 INCH.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 191 FEET SOUTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE SAND ROAD.  IT IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WIRSHING NO 1 1966, SET IN A 12 INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 47 FEET SOUTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE SAND ROAD.  IT IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WIRSHING NO 2 1966, SET IN A 12 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING 2 INCHES.  NO SUITABLE PLACE WAS FOUND FOR AN AZIMUTH MARK.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 21.9 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (JKW) THE STATION MARK AND BOTH REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE.  THE STAMPINGS WERE VERIFIED.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS SET IN A 12 INCH ROUND MONUMENT NOT SQUARE.  THE STATION MARK IS 153 FT (46.6 M) NORTHWEST OF THE MHWL.

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 CHURCH CUPOLA IN YABUCOA.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (MLO) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS THE CUPOLA OF THE CATHOLIC CHURCH IN YABUCOA.  THE SMALL DOME ATOP THE CUPOLA IS YELLOW.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE FIRST HILL, ABOUT 3/4 MILE NORTH OF YAUCO AND ON TOP OF A CONCRETE WATER TANK.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAY 2 AND 128 AT THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE PLAZA IN YAUCO GO NORTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 128 FOR 1.7 MILES TO A DIRT ROAD ON THE RIGHT, TURN RIGHT AND GO EASTERLY UP THE HILL FOR 0.2 MILE TO A FORK, TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO NORTH UP THE STEEP HILL FOR 0.1 MILE TO THE TOP OF THE HILL AND THE STATION ON TOP OF THE CONCRETE WATER TANK.  THE STATION MARK IS 5.9 FEET SOUTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF THE ROOF, 5.5 FEET WEST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE ROOF AND 4.3 FEET NORTHEAST OF A METAL VENT PIPE.  IT IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED YAUCO 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE ROOF OF THE TANK.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 2.6 FEET SOUTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF THE ROOF AND 12.2 FEET WEST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE ROOF.  IT IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED YAUCO NO 1 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE ROOF OF THE TANK.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 16 FEET EAST OF THE METAL LADDER AND 3 FEET WEST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE ROOF.  IT IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED YAUCO NO 2 1966, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE ROOF OF THE TANK.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS SET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1992)  RECOVERY NOTE BY HARTMANN ASSOCIATES INCORPORATED 1992 (MM) THE TABLET HAS BEEN REMOVED FROM THE SHANK BY VANDALS.  THE SHANK REMAINS FIRMLY IN PLACE.  THE REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AND THE TIES CHECKED TO THE CENTER OF THE SHANK OF THE STATION.  HOW-TO-REACH DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING, GO NORTHERLY ON HWY 128 FOR 1.7 MILES (2.7 KM) TO A DIRT ROAD.  THE DIRT ROAD IS NOW PAVED.  ALL THE WAY TO THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 2004 (AAB) THE STATION WAS NOT FOUND, BUT ITS LOCATION AND THE NAIL WAS FOUND. BOTH REFERENCE MARK 1 AND 2 FOUND IN EXCELLENT CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO AT MAYAGUEZ 2004 (RCC) MARK NOT FOUND

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JWC) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1-1/2 MILES SOUTHWEST OF YAUCO AND 0.1 MILE SOUTHEAST OF HIGHWAY 2.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE PLAZA IN YAUCO, GO SOUTHWEST ON HIGHWAY 2 FOR 1.3 MILES TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT, SOUTHEAST, SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY.  THE MAST IS A STEEL-TRUSS STRUCTURE, PAINTED ALTERNATELY RED AND WHITE, SUPPORTED BY GUY WIRES AND IT IS ABOUT 160 FEET HIGH.  POINT INTERSECTED IS THE RED OBSTRUCTION LIGHT ATOP AND CENTER OF THE MAST.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1901 (JBB) ON THE EXTREME END OF PUNTA YEGUAS (MARES POINT) WHICH FORMS THE SOUTHEASTERN EXTREMITY OF THE ISLAND OF PUERTO RICO.  MARKED BY A BLOCK OF CEMENT 18 INCHES LONG BY 6 INCHES SQUARE.  NAIL IN CEMENT MARKS THE CENTER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1902)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1902 (RLF) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  A STONE WAS SET IN EARTH WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 3 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  IRON NAIL MARKING STATION WAS BENT.  TOP OF STONE MARKED U.S. STATION IS ABOUT 15 METERS FROM EDGE OF BLUFF AT SEASHORE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1927)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1927 (GCM) CONFORMATION OF POINT HAS CHANGED CONSIDERABLY DUE TO EROSION OF SANDSTONE.  TOP OF BLUFF WAS CLEARED AND A THOROUGH SEARCH MADE, BUT STATION MARK COULD NOT BE FOUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JJL) THE STATION MARK WAS NOT RECOVERED.  A NEW STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK 1 AND REFERENCE MARK 2 WERE ESTABLISHED.  SEE YEGUAS 2 FOR THE NEW DESCRIPTION.  OFFICE NOTE--STATION IS LOST.  (SEE G-16362)
markers.setting: OBJECT SURROUNDED BY MASS OF CONCRETE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JJL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE SOUTHEAST COAST OF PUERTO RICO, ABOUT 4 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF MAUNABO, 3-3/4 MILES SOUTHEAST OF YABUCOA AND ON A POINT OF LAND KNOWN AS POINT YEGUAS.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN YABUCOA, GO SOUTHEAST ON HIGHWAY 3 FOR 0.05 MILE TO A T-INTERSECTION.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH FOR ABOUT 50 FEET TO A SIDE STREET ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT ONTO THE SIDE STREET, HIGHWAY 901, AND GO EASTERLY FOR 4.4 MILES TO WHERE THE HIGHWAY -- TO THE RIGHT AND A TRACK ROAD CONTINUES STRAIGHT AHEAD.  CONTINUE AHEAD AND FOLLOW THE TRACK ROAD IN A SOUTHERLY DIRECTION FOR 0.15 MILE TO A Y-FORK.  KEEP THE LEFT FORK AND GO SOUTHWEST UPHILL FOR 0.2 MILE TO A WIRE GATE.  PASS THROUGH THE GATE, TURN RIGHT AND FOLLOW THE DIRT ROAD, WEST, FOR 0.05 MILE TO WHERE THE ROAD BEARS TO THE RIGHT AND A WIRE GATE ON THE LEFT AT A FENCE CORNER.  BEAR TO THE LEFT, PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND CONTINUE SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH ON THE TRACK ROAD, ACROSS PASTURE LAND, FOR 0.05 MILE THEN BEAR TO THE LEFT, PASS THROUGH AN OPENING IN THE FENCE AND CONTINUE SOUTHERLY ALONG THE EAST SIDE OF THE FENCE AND DOWN THE RIDGE FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE END OF THE GRASSEY POINT OF LAND AND THE STATION.  NOTE--A 4-WHEEL DRIVE VEHICLE IS REQUIRED IN WET WEATHER.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED YEAGUAS 2 1965, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED YEAGUAS 2 NO 1 1965, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED YEAGUAS 2 NO 2 1965, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  NO SUITABLE PLACE WAS FOUND FOR AN AZIMUTH MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1970 (JKW) STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK 1, AND REFERENCE MARK 2 ALL RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE AZIMUTHS TO THE REFERENCE MARKS WERE CHECKED FROM -- THE DISTANCES TO THE REFERENCE MARKS WERE ALSO CHECKED.  AN ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION BY JJL IS ADEQUATE FOR THE TO REACH.  ADDITIONAL MEASUREMENTS ARE AS FOLLOWS--STATION IS NEAR THE SOUTHEAST -- IT IS ABOUT 16 FEET NORTH WEST OF SOUTHEAST -- OF SOUTHWEST EDGE OF BRUSHS AND 15 -- EDGE OF BRUSH.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1934 STATION IS ON A HILL NAMED CERRO VISTA ON THE MOST NORTHERN PEAK AT EL YUNQUE AND SIERRA LUQUILLO HEIGHTS.  IT IS E OF THE MUCH FREQUENTED HIGH ROCK WHICH VISITORS CLIMB AS EL YUNQUE AND WHICH IS SOME 50 FEET LOWER THAN CERRO VISTA, WHERE THE STATION IS LOCATED.  STATION IS MARKED BY A REGULAR U.S.G.S. TABLET STAMPED 1934.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS CROSS MARK ON A STONE 9 FEET 6-1/2 INCHES FROM THE STATION CENTER, ON A TRUE AZIMUTH OF 57 DEG 08 MIN-- NO.2 IS CROSS MARK ON A STONE, 8 FEET 5 INCHES FROM THE STATION CENTER, ON A TRUE AZIMUTH OF 337 DEG 02 MIN.  SIGNAL--A WHITE QUADRIPOD WITH BLACK CROSS TARGETS.  TO REACH THIS STATION GET TO THE SMALL VILLAGE OF MAMEYES, BETWEEN THE TOWNS OF LUQUILLO AND RIO GRANDE.  HERE TAKE IMPROVED ROAD GOING S AND LEADING TO THE ROAD WORKERS CAMPS, WHICH AT THIS TIME ARE SOME 10 KILOMETERS DISTANT FROM THE MAIN HIGHWAY.  IT WILL TAKE YOU ABOUT 2-1/2 HOURS TO REACH THE STATION FROM THESE CAMPS.  THE ROAD IS NOW UNDER CONSTRUCTION AND WE HAVE BEEN TOLD THAT WITHIN A YEAR OR TWO THE STATION WILL BE ABOUT 25 OR 30 MINUTES WALK FROM THE HIGHWAY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1940)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1940 (GBG) STATION AND R.M.S DESTROYED IN BUILDING OF A CONCRETE LOOKOUT TOWER ON TOP OF PEAK.  A NEW STATION YUNQUE 2 WAS ESTABLISHED.
markers.setting: SET IN UNSPECIFIED ROCK OR BOULDER
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JJL) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  TWO NEW REFERENCE MARKS AND A NEW AZIMUTH MARK WERE ESTABLISHED.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 14 AIRLINE MILES NORTHWEST OF ROOSEVELT ROADS NAVAL STATION, 10 AIRLINE MILES WEST-SOUTHWEST OF FAJARDO, 5 AIRLINE MILES SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF NAMAYES AND ON A HIGH PEAK IN THE SIERRA DE LUQUILLO MOUNTAINS WHICH IS LOCALLY KNOWN AS EL YUNQUE PEAK.  THE STATION IS IN THE UPPER FLOOR OF A CONCRETE LOOKOUT TOWER WHICH IS ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THE PEAK.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF HIGHWAYS 3 AND 191 IN THE NORTH EDGE OF MAMAYES, GO SOUTH ON HIGHWAY 191 FOR 1.45 MILES TO A FORK, KEEP LEFT AND CONTINUE SOUTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 191 FOR 1.05 MILES TO A FORK.  KEEP LEFT AND CONTINUE SOUTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 191 FOR 5.05 MILES TO A FORK, KEEP RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWEST ON HIGHWAY 191 FOR 0.2 MILE TO A REVERSE Y-FORK.  KEEP LEFT AND GO SOUTH AND WEST ON HIGHWAY 191 FOR 0.25 MILE TO A FORK.  KEEP RIGHT AND GO WESTERLY ON HIGHWAY 191 FOR 0.25 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHERLY ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A LOCKED BAR ACROSS THE ROAD.  (FOREST SERVICE KEY REQUIRED) PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND CONTINUE NORTHERLY ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 1.85 MILES TO THE END OF THE ROAD AT THE LOOKOUT TOWER AND STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A USGS BENCH MARK STAMPED YUNQUE 2 1940, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE UPPER FLOOR OF THE LOOKOUT WHICH IS ABOUT 25 FEET HIGH.  IT IS 12 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF THE LOOKOUT.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED YUNQUE 2 USGS NO 3 1940, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE SOUTHWEST PART OF THE LOOKOUT FLOOR.  REFERENCE MARK 4 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED YUNQUE 2 USGS NO 4 1940, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE WEST CONCRETE RAIL OF THE LOOKOUT WHICH PROJECTS 3 FEET ABOVE THE FLOOR.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A USGS BENCH MARK STAMPED BRITTON, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE UPPER FLOOR OF A LOOKOUT TOWER WHICH IS ABOUT 50 FEET HIGH.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE STATION, GO SOUTHERLY ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 1.05 MILES TO A TRAIL ON THE LEFT AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE PACK EASTERLY UP A WELL DEFINED TRAIL AS PER SIGN MT. BRITTON FOR ABOUT 1/4 MILE TO THE LOOKOUT TOWER AND THE AZIMUTH MARK IN THE UPPER FLOOR OF THE LOOKOUT TOWER.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 5 MILES SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF MAMAYES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (JDB) STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS 3 AND 4 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1983)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1983 (WHT) YUNQUE 2 1940 USGS B M DISK - GOOD COND.  YUNQUE 2 USGS 1934 USC AND GS REFERENCE MARK DISK - GOOD NO 3.  YUNQUE 2 - REFERENCE MARK 4 - GOOD COND.  YUNQUE 2 ECC IS IN GOOD COND.                            STATION RECOVERY (2010)  RECOVERY NOTE BY INDIVIDUAL CONTRIBUTORS 2010 (JOE) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED REFERENCE MARKS ARE IN GOOD CONDITION

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1995 (CSM) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN CAROLINA NEAR THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE LUIS MUNOZ MARIN INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT ON THE GROUNDS OF THE FEDERAL AVIATION ADMINISTRATION (FAA) COMBINED CENTER RADAR APPROACH CONTROL (CERAP) FACILITY.  THE STATION IS INTENDED AS A WIDE AREA AUGMENTATION SYSTEM (WAAS) REFERENCE STATION.  SITE POINT OF CONTACT, MAYRA DIAZ, CARTOGRAPHER, FAA-AFS, 5000 CARR 190, CAROLINA, PR 00979, PHONE 809-253-8690 OR 809-253-8651.  THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE GRASSY LAWN ALONG THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE FAA PROPERTY JUST INSIDE THE SECURITY FENCE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE EASTBOUND LANES OF HIGHWAY 26 AT THE HWY 17 OVERPASS JUST WEST OF THE AIRPORT ENTRANCE, PROCEED EAST ON HWY 26 FOR 1.1 MI (1.8 KM) TO A STOP LIGHT AND A ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND TAKE AN IMMEDIATE LEFT ONTO A MARGINAL WHICH PARALLELS HWY 26, CONTINUE EAST ON THE MARGINAL FOR 0.9 MI (1.4 KM) TO A ROAD LEFT PASSING UNDER HWY 26.  TURN LEFT AND PROCEED TO A STOP SIGN, TURN LEFT AND PROCEED NORTH AND WEST ON A ROAD PARALELLING HWY 26 FOR 0.3 MI (0.5 KM) TO A ROAD RIGHT, TURN RIGHT AND PROCEED NORTH FOR 0.1 MI (0.2 KM) TO A GATE ON THE LEFT AT THE CERAP, THE STATION IS IN THE GRASS LAWN ABOUT 130 METERS (426.5 FT) WEST OF THE GATE, 97 FT (29.6 M) EAST OF A SECURITY LAMP POLE, 51.9 FT (15.8 M) NORTHWEST OF A SECURITY LAMP POLE, 32.9 FT (10.0 M) NORTH OF A CHAINLINK FENCE AND AN ORANGE CARSONITE WITNESS POST.  A STAINLESS STEEL ROD DRIVEN TO REFUSAL WITH GREASE SECURITY SLEEVE ENCASED IN 5 INCH PVC PIPE WITH AN ALUMINUM ALLOY ACCESS COVER.  THE SS ROD WAS ROUNDED AND CENTERPUNCHED AT THE TOP TO FACILITATE PRECISE LEVELING AND INSTRUMENT CENTERING.  THE ACCESS COVER IS FLUSH WITH GROUND LEVEL. DESCRIBED BY C.S.  MIDDLETON JR.
markers.setting: STAINLESS STEEL ROD IN SLEEVE (10 FT.+)
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1995 (CSM) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN CAROLINA NEAR THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE LUIS MUNOZ MARIN INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT ON THE GROUNDS OF THE NOAA, NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE OFFICE.  THE STATION IS INTENDED AS A WIDE AREA AUGMENTATION SYSTEM (WAAS) REFERENCE STATION.  SITE POINT OF CONTACT, MAYRA DIAZ, CARTOGRAPHER, FAA-AFS, 5000 CARR 190, CAROLINA, PR 00979, PHONE 809-253-8690 OR 809-253-8651.  THE STATION IS LOCATED IN A GRASSY MEDIAN IN THE PARKING LOT OF THE WEATHER SERVICE OFFICE. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE EASTBOUND LANES OF HIGHWAY 26 AT THE HWY 17 OVERPASS JUST WEST OF THE AIRPORT ENTRANCE, PROCEED EAST ON HWY 26 FOR 1.1 MI (1.8 KM) TO A STOP LIGHT AND A ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND TAKE AN IMMEDIATE LEFT ONTO A MARGINAL WHICH PARALLELS HWY 26, CONTINUE EAST ON THE MARGINAL FOR 0.9 MI (1.4 KM) TO A ROAD LEFT PASSING UNDER HWY 26.  TURN LEFT AND PROCEED TO A STOP SIGN, TURN LEFT AND PROCEED NORTH AND WEST ON A ROAD PARALELLING HWY 26 FOR 0.3 MI (0.5 KM) TO A ROAD RIGHT, TURN RIGHT AND PROCEED NORTH FOR 0.2 MI (0.3 KM) TO A GATE AT THE ENTRANCE TO THE WEATHER FACILITY THE STATION IS STRAIGHT THROUGH THE GATE AT THE WEST END OF THE GRASS MEDIAN IN THE PARKING LOT.  IT IS, 40.75 FT (12.42 M) EAST OF AN ORANGE CARSONITE WITNESS POST ALONG THE WESTERN FENCELINE OF THE WEATHER SERVICE FACILITY, 8.5 FT (2.6 M) SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF A SECURITY LIGHT POLE AND 6.25 FT (1.91 M) EAST OF THE WEST CURB OF THE MEDIAN.  A STAINLESS STEEL ROD DRIVEN TO REFUSAL WITH GREASE SECURITY SLEEVE ENCASED IN 5 INCH PVC WITH ALUMINUM ALLOY ACCESS COVER.  THE SS ROD WAS ROUNDED AND CENTERPUNCHED AT THE TOP TO FACILITATE PRECISE LEVELING AND INSTRUMENT CENTERING.  ACCESS COVER IS FLUSH WITH GROUND LEVEL.  DESCRIBED BY R.J.  HALL.                            STATION RECOVERY (2002)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2002 (JMW) 3.4 KM (2.1 MI) EASTERLY ALONG PR 26 FROM THE JUNCTION OF PR 17 IN CAROLINA, THENCE 0.2 KM (O.1 MI) EASTERLY ALONG BASE MUNIZ EXIT OFF-RAMP, THENCE 0.2 KM (0.1 MI) NORTHERLY ALONG MUNIZ ROAD PASSING UNDER THE HIGHWAY OVERPASS, THENCE 0.4 KM (0.2 MI) WESTERLY ALONG A MARGINAL ROAD, THENCE 0.2 KM (0.1 MI) NORTHERLY ALONG A ROAD LEADING TO A NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE FACILITY, NEAR THE WEST END OF A GRASS MEDIAN IN THE PARKING LOT, 30.6 M (100.4 FT) NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE GATE, 12.5 M (41.0 FT) SOUTHEAST OF A WITNESS POST AND FENCE, 5.8 M (19.0 FT) NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF A STORM DRAIN, 5.6 M (18.4 FT) NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD, 2.5 M (8.2 FT) SOUTHWEST OF A LIGHT POLE, 1.9 M (6.2 FT) EAST OF THE EAST CURB OF THE MEDIAM, 1.5 M (4.9 FT) NORTH OF A SPEED LIMIT AND ONE WAY SIGN AND 0.2 M (0.7 FT) ABOVE THE LEVEL OF THE ROAD.  NOTE-ACESS TO THE DATUM POINT IS THROUGH A 5-INCH (13 CM) LOGO CAP. THE SLEEVE DEPTH DOES NOT MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS FOR A CLASS A MARK. THE MARK IS ON PROPERTY OWNED BY THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE, 4000 CARR 190, CAROLINA, PR 00979, PHONE 787-253-4501.  THIS IS A FEDERAL BASE NETWORK CONTROL STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2002)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2002 (JMW) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (2010)  RECOVERY NOTE BY INDIVIDUAL CONTRIBUTORS 2010 (JOE) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED, DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE
